标题: 파일 분산 송수신 시스템
摘要: PURPOSE: A system for transmitting/receiving a file is provided to distribute a network load of a file storage computer by receiving transmission-objected files from not only the file storage computer but also other client computer. CONSTITUTION: A host computer(10) transmits data related to an application program execution to a client computer connected through a network and executes an application program through a client computer(40). An authentication computer(20) processes a connection authentication and transmits an authentication result to the host computer(10). If the authentication is confirmed, the client computer(40) receives the data related to an application program execution from the host computer(10) and a corresponding client computer executes the application program. A file storage computer(30) stores various kinds of files to be transmitted in executing an installed file and an update objected file of the application program. The client computer(40) is connected to the host computer(10) through a sub network(50).
摘要(译)(简体中文): 目的:提供一种用于传输/接收文件的系统,通过从文件存储计算机和其他客户端计算机接收传输目标文件来分配文件存储计算机的网络负载。 章程:主机(10)传输与应用程序执行相关的数据到通过网络连接的客户端计算机,并通过客户端计算机(40)执行应用程序。 认证计算机(20)处理连接认证并将认证结果发送到主计算机(10)。 如果验证被确认,则客户端计算机(40)从主计算机(10)接收与应用程序执行相关的数据并且对应的客户端计算机执行该应用程序。 文件存储计算机(30)存储在执行安装文件和应用程序的更新目标文件时要传输的各种文件。 客户端计算机(40)通过子网络(50)连接到主计算机(10)。
法律状态/事件: 期限届满 | 权利转移

标题: Einrichtung und Verfahren zur Kommunikation zwischen einer mobilen Datenverarbeitungsvorrichtung und einer stationären Datenverarbeitungsvorrichtung
摘要: Die Erfindung betrifft ein System zur Kommunikation zwischen einer mobilen Datenverarbeitungsvorrichtung (1), insbesondere eines Client im Bereich von Augmented-Reality-Techniken bei einem Automatisierungssystem und/oder einer Produktions- und/oder Werkzeugmaschine oder Teilen davon, mit einem auf der mobilen Datenverarbeitungsvorrichtung (1) installierten Browser (2) zur Kommunikation mit einer stationären Datenverarbeitungsvorrichtung (3), wobei die stationäre Datenverarbeitungsvorrichtung (3) folgende Komponenten (4, 5, 6, 7) aufweist: DOLLAR A È einen Server (8) zur Kommunikation mit dem Browser (2) der mobilen Datenverarbeitungsvorrichtung (1), DOLLAR A È einen InfoBroker (5) zur situationsgerechten Bereitstellung von Informationen, wobei der InfoBroker den aktuellen Kontext, insbesondere Ort, Arbeitssituation, verwendete EA-Geräte sowie das Infomodell (4) nutzt, DOLLAR A È ein Infomodell (4) als eine Repräsentation des Informationsraums und zur Sicherstellung einer Navigation innerhalb der Information sowie eines Zugriffs auf die Informationen unabhängig von nachgeschalteten Legacy-Systemen für den InfoBroker (5), DOLLAR A È Legacy-Systeme (7), die Informationen enthalten und speichern.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 本发明涉及一种用于在移动数据处理设备(1)、尤其是自动化系统中的增强现实技术领域中的客户端和/或生产机器和/或机床或其部件之间进行通信的系统,移动数据处理设备 (1) 安装了浏览器 (2) 用于与固定数据处理设备 (3) 进行通信,固定数据处理设备 (3) 具有以下组件 (4, 5, 6, 7):DOLLAR A È a服务器 (8) 用于与浏览器 (2) 移动数据处理设备 (1) 通信,DOLLAR A È InfoBroker (5) 用于提供适合情况的信息,InfoBroker 使用当前上下文,特别是位置, 工作情况, EA 使用的设备和信息模型 (4), DOLLAR AÈ 信息模型 (4) 作为信息空间的表示并确保内部导航 独立于 InfoBroker (5)、DOLLAR A È 遗留系统 (7) 的下游遗留系统获取信息和访问信息,这些遗留系统包含和存储信息。

标题: Method and system for calculating term-document importance
摘要: A weighting system for calculating the term-document importance for each term within each document that is part of a collection of documents (i.e., a corpus). The weighting system calculates the importance of a term within a document based on a computed normalized term frequency and a computed inverse document frequency. The computed normalized term frequency is a function, referred to as the "computed term frequency function" ("A"), of a normalized term frequency. The normalized term frequency is the term frequency, which is the number of times that the term occurs in the document, normalized by the total term frequency of the term within all documents, which is the total number of times that the term occurs in all the documents. The weighting system normalizes the term frequency by dividing the term frequency by a function, referred to as the "normalizing term frequency function" ("Γ"), of the total term frequency. The computed inverse document frequency is a function, referred to as the "computed inverse document frequency function" ("B") of the inverse document frequency. The weighting system identifies a computed normalized term frequency function A and a computed inverse document frequency function B so that on average the computed normalized term frequency and the computed inverse document frequency contribute equally to the weight of the terms.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种加权系统,用于计算作为文档集合(即语料库)一部分的每个文档中每个术语的术语-文档重要性。 加权系统基于计算的归一化词频和计算的逆文档频率来计算文档中词的重要性。 计算出的归一化词频是归一化词频的函数,称为“计算出的词频函数”(“A”)。 归一化词频是词频,即词条在文档中出现的次数,通过词条在所有文档中的总词条频率归一化,即词条在所有文档中出现的总次数 文件。 加权系统通过将词频除以总词频的函数(称为“归一化词频函数”(“Γ”))来归一化词频。 计算的逆文档频率是一个函数,称为逆文档频率的“计算的逆文档频率函数”(“B”)。 加权系统识别计算出的归一化词频函数 A 和计算出的逆文档频率函数 B,从而平均而言,计算出的归一化词频和计算出的逆文档频率对词的权重贡献相等。

标题: Method of identifying objects
摘要: A plurality of objects are identified by the steps of pre­paring a reference pattern B comprising picture image data of a predetermined number and representing the brightness relating to the configuration of the objects; extracting a brightness pattern A comprising a predetermined number of picture image data among picture image data in a predeter­mined field of view in which the objects presents; and determining the correlation between the reference pattern B and the brightness pattern A so as to judge as to whether the brightness pattern A is the brightness pattern related to the configuration of the objects. When determining the correlation, average values of respective patterns are subtracted respectively from the brightness pattern and the reference pattern to obtain patterns A′ and B′ obtained by converting then in connection with deviations from the average values. A pattern A˝ is obtained by normalizing pattern A′ and the inner products of patterns A˝ and B′ and of patterns A′ and B′ are determined. These two inner products are used as a reference value for identifying the objects.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 通过准备参考图案B的步骤来识别多个物体,该参考图案B包括预定数量的图片图像数据并表示与物体的配置相关的亮度; 在物体出现的预定视场中的图片图像数据中提取包括预定数量的图片图像数据的亮度模式A; 判断参考图案B与亮度图案A的相关性,以判断亮度图案A是否为与物体形态相关的亮度图案。 在确定相关性时,分别从亮度图案和参考图案中减去各个图案的平均值,以获得通过随后与平均值的偏差进行转换而获得的图案A和B。 通过对模式A进行归一化得到模式A˝,并确定模式A˝和B以及模式A和B的内积。 这两个内积用作识别对象的参考值。

标题: STEUERVORRICHTUNG FÜR MARKIERGERÄT
摘要(译)(简体中文): 本发明涉及一种用于缩短标记装置中的标记时间的控制装置。控制装置通过从原始图像中作为整体拾取在外部限定图案“ABCDE”的区域中的图像（20），将外接区域中的图像（20）分割为多个图像（19）来执行控制，预定尺寸，并且在掩模上逐个顺序地显示所述多个分割图像（21）。 <MATH>
发明人: ICHIHARA MASASHI | MATSUMURA YUKINORI | MORI AKIRA

标题: Method and device for numeric processing of video signals representative of a leaf-like product
摘要: Procédé et dispositif pour fournir une information numérique réprésentative du contour d'un produit en feuille et des défauts (trous) qu'il peut comporter, à partir d'un signal vidéo formé de lignes d'image. On code le signal vidéo par comparaison avec des seuils de façon à détecter les transitions; on compare à un seuil n1 le nombre n de points correspondant à un trou, d'abord à l'intérieur d'une ligne X, puis dans des lignes consécutives X, X + 1, et on modifie le code en un code "défaut" à partir du moment où n n,; on met en mémoire, dans le sens de l'analyse, uniquement les signaux codés qui précèdent une transition; on lit ces signaux dans le sens inverse grâce à quoi on peut rendre homogène le codage d'un défaut et supprimer les codes de défauts non significatifs. Application à l'analyse de la forme d'une feuille de tabac
摘要(译)(简体中文): 用于从由图像线形成的视频信号中提供表示片材产品轮廓和可能包含的缺陷(孔)的数字信息的方法和设备。 通过与阈值比较对视频信号进行编码,以检测过渡; 将孔对应的点数n与阈值n1进行比较,首先在行X内,然后在连续行X中,X + 1,并且从时刻n n 开始将代码修改为“默认”代码;; 就分析而言,仅存储过渡之前的编码信号; 这些信号以相反的方向读取,因此可以使缺陷的编码均匀,并且可以消除不重要的缺陷代码。 在烟叶形状分析中的应用
[标]当前申请(专利权)人: SERVICE DEXPL IND DES TABACS & DES ALLUMETTES
当前第一申请(专利权)人: SERVICE D'EXPLOITATION INDUSTRIELLE DES TABACS ET DES ALLUMETTES

标题: Method of storing elements in a database
摘要: The present invention relates to a method of storing elements in a database and of finding such stored elements. A reference to a storage space intended for the storage of a data element in the database is calculated by means of a mathematical function, wherein the function input data is an external key belonging to the element, and wherein the result obtained with the mathematical function points to an internal position of the element in the database. The result is divided into at least three parts (A, B, C). A first part (A) constitutes a reference to a fragment (A4) belonging to the database, a second part (B) constitutes a reference to a page (B4) within the fragment (A4), and a third part (C) constitutes a reference to a so-called bucket (C4) belonging to the page (B4). A bucket (C4) is comprised of at least one container in which the element can be stored, or is stored. The containers are given a size that corresponds to the size of a container header and the elements belonging to the container, said size varying with the amount of elements concerned. The size of a maximum container is limited so as to be at the most equal to the amount of data-information that can be read at one time into a cache memory belonging to a processor that operates within the database or that uses the database.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 本发明涉及一种在数据库中存储元素并找到这种存储元素的方法。 通过数学函数计算对数据库中用于存储数据元素的存储空间的引用,其中函数输入数据是属于该元素的外部键,并且其中使用数学函数点获得的结果 到数据库中元素的内部位置。 结果至少分为三个部分(A、B、C)。 第一部分 (A) 构成对属于数据库的片段 (A4) 的引用,第二部分 (B) 构成对片段 (A4) 内页面 (B4) 的引用,第三部分 (C) 构成 对属于页面 (B4) 的所谓存储桶 (C4) 的引用。 桶(C4)由至少一个容器组成,其中可以存储或存储元素。 容器的大小对应于容器标题和属于容器的元素的大小,所述大小随相关元素的数量而变化。 最大容器的大小被限制为至多等于可以一次读取到属于在数据库内操作或使用数据库的处理器的高速缓冲存储器中的数据信息量。

标题: Kontextsensitive Methode zum Auffinden von Informationen über ein Wort in einem elektronischen Wörterbuch
摘要: A technique of using an electronic dictionary in conjunction with electronically-encoded running text that gives the user the most relevant information rather than belaboring the user with all possible information about a selected word. The technique maps the selected word from its inflected form to its citation form, analyzes the selected word in the context of neighboring and surrounding words to resolve ambiguities, and displays the information that is determined to be the most likely to be relevant. The dictionary preferably has information about multi-word combinations that include the selected word, and the context determination typically entails checking whether the selected word is part of a predefined multi-word combination. <IMAGE>
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种将电子词典与电子编码的运行文本结合使用的技术,可为用户提供最相关的信息,而不是向用户提供有关所选单词的所有可能信息。 该技术将所选词从其变形形式映射到其引文形式,在相邻词和周围词的上下文中分析所选词以解决歧义,并显示被确定为最可能相关的信息。 字典优选地具有关于包括所选词的多词组合的信息,并且上下文确定通常需要检查所选词是否是预定义的多词组合的一部分。
发明人: ZAENEN ANNIE E. | KARTTUNEN LAURI J.

标题: Semantic user interface
摘要: A system and method that allows a user to use their everyday language or user defined words to operate a computer in a highly efficient way. In short, every word, letter, control character and symbol is potentially actionable. A computer user's productivity is dramatically increased by making available those functions that enable a user to produce most of his work through simple, language-based commands. The present invention provides an intuitive interface, referred to as a semantic user interface (SUI), that enhances the operation of the current standard window-based interface in a manner that is simple, richer and natural. By leveraging all of the richness and power inherent in a user's language, the present invention provides an important tool that allows the personal computer to operate in a manner that is much closer to our natural way of interacting. A user is allowed to enter "commands" in his everyday natural language in order to control the operations of the computer. All commands are language-based and user-defined. These commands can be entered from any context of the user's computer (e.g., any application or operating system workspace). The commands allows a user to launch applications and navigate within applications by using language rather than clicks from a pointing device such as a mouse. It also allows the replacement of keystrokes with stored words or keystrokes. The system also keeps a complete archive record of all the text content the user provides as input, regardless of which application program or operating system window the user is operating in at the time. The combined set of all user defined commands and the memory of all the input text that is stored in the archive constitutes the personality profile and is transportable from one computer to another.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种允许用户使用他们的日常语言或用户定义的词以高效方式操作计算机的系统和方法。 简而言之,每个单词、字母、控制字符和符号都可能是可操作的。 通过提供那些使用户能够通过简单的、基于语言的命令来完成大部分工作的功能,计算机用户的生产力会大大提高。 本发明提供了一种直观的界面,称为语义用户界面(SUI),它以简单、丰富和自然的方式增强了当前标准的基于窗口的界面的操作。 通过利用用户语言中固有的所有丰富性和强大功能,本发明提供了一种重要工具,该工具允许个人计算机以更接近于我们自然交互方式的方式进行操作。 允许用户以他的日常自然语言输入“命令”以控制计算机的操作。 所有命令都是基于语言和用户定义的。 这些命令可以从用户计算机的任何上下文(例如,任何应用程序或操作系统工作区)中输入。 这些命令允许用户通过使用语言而不是来自诸如鼠标的定点设备的点击来启动应用程序并在应用程序内导航。 它还允许用存储的单词或击键替换击键。 系统还保留用户作为输入提供的所有文本内容的完整存档记录,无论用户当时在哪个应用程序或操作系统窗口中操作。 所有用户定义的命令的组合集和存储在档案中的所有输入文本的内存构成了个性配置文件,并且可以从一台计算机传输到另一台计算机。
发明人: BEAUREGARD, SERGE PIERRE | ARMIJO-TAMEZ, JESUS ROBERTO
发明人地址: Winter Park, FL | Santa Teresa, NM

标题: Verfahren zur digitalen Farbkorrektur in einer Bildreproduziermaschine
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种用于在诸如彩色扫描仪，彩色传真机之类的图像再现机中以数字方式进行色彩校正的方法，该方法能够节省大量的存储器容量，其中获得的结果值 通过光电扫描彩色原始图片获得的分色信号的组合，在平面坐标系中表示出来，其中变换结果值的坐标，以便通过一起操作分色信号来校正色相和饱和度 利用预定的因子，从而获得色彩校正的分色信号的组合。
[标]当前申请(专利权)人: 大日本屏幕制造股份有限公司

标题: Inference processor using meta knowledge
摘要: An inference processor includes a production rule memory, a meta knowledge generator, a meta knowledge memory, a production system interpreter, and a working memory. The meta knowledge generator obtains production rules satisfying transition conditions between all the combinations of the states of the respective variables in the production rules as a directed-graph matrix. The meta knowledge generator then decomposes the directed-graph matrix into strongly connected components, and obtains, as meta knowledge, 1) variable-conditions of the respective strongly-connected components and 2) production rules satisfying transition conditions between the respective strongly-connected components. The interpreter generally determines an inference path from a given state to another state as a target on the basis of the meta knowledge, and efficiently executes production rules, thereby performing inference processing.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 推理处理器包括产生规则存储器、元知识生成器、元知识存储器、产生系统解释器和工作存储器。 元知识生成器将满足产生规则中各个变量的状态的所有组合之间的转移条件的产生规则作为有向图矩阵来获得。 然后元知识生成器将有向图矩阵分解为强连通分量,并获得1)各个强连通分量的变量条件和2)满足各个强连通分量之间转移条件的产生规则作为元知识 . 解释器一般基于元知识确定从给定状态到另一状态的推理路径作为目标,并有效地执行产生式规则,从而进行推理处理。
当前第一申请(专利权)人: KABUSHIKI KAISHA TOSHIBA, A CORPORATION OF JAPAN

标题: 全文インデックス作成装置および全文データベース検索装置
摘要:
【課題】 全文データベースの検索に用いる全文インデックスの容量と検索速度との間のトレードオフを細かく段階的に調整可能にし、様々な用途·応用にとってバランスのよい全文データベース検索装置を提供する。
【解決手段】 全文インデックス5は、全文データベース1に出現するN文字組の文字位置情報を、そのN文字組の種類と文脈の分類ごとに分けて格納する。検索条件解析手段7は、検索条件の文字列をN文字組に分割するとともに、そのN文字組の文脈を取り出す。文脈分類手段3は、検索条件の文字列におけるN文字組の文脈を分類する。インデックス検索手段8は、検索条件に対応するN文字組の種類と文脈の分類とをもとに全文インデックス5を検索して、該当するN文字組の文字位置情報を読み出す。位置判定手段9は、インデックス検索手段8の結果から検索条件文字列の出現位置を判定する。
摘要(译)(简体中文):
种类代码:A1 提供一种全文数据库搜索装置,可以在全文索引检索全文数据库的容量和检索速度之间进行权衡取舍,逐步精细调整,即平衡良好,适用于各种用途和应用。 
 SOLUTION:全文索引5存储全文数据库1中出现的N个字符集的字符位置信息,根据N个字符集的类型和上下文的分类进行分类。 搜索条件分析装置7将搜索条件的字符串分成N个字符集,并提取N个字符集的上下文。 上下文分类装置3对搜索条件字符串中的N个字符集的上下文进行分类。 索引搜索装置8根据搜索条件对应的N字符集的类型和上下文的分类,对全文索引5进行搜索,读取对应的N字符集的字符位置信息。 位置确定装置9根据索引搜索装置8的结果确定搜索条件字符串的出现位置。
发明人地址: 東京都港区芝五丁目7番1号  日本電気株式会社内

标题: Interrogation apparatus and method including a record carrier for storing images with addresses
摘要: A record carrier which is suitable for the storage of image information in the form of questions, and an interrogation apparatus in which the image information can be displayed in individual images. The record carrier comprises one an address location with an address for each image, so that the image is identified. The answers to questions are recorded on a recording medium in the interrogation apparatus, in combination with the address of the question image. This recording medium is used in a computer system, the combination of address and answer being a storage address of the computer store. The images of the record carrier can furthermore be provided with a type indication which indicates types of questions.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种适用于以问题形式存储图像信息的记录载体,以及一种可以在单个图像中显示图像信息的询问装置。 记录载体包括一个地址位置,每个图像都有一个地址,以便识别图像。 问题的答案与问题图像的地址一起记录在询问装置的记录介质上。 该记录介质用于计算机系统中,地址和应答的组合是计算机存储器的存储地址。 记录载体的图像还可以提供有指示问题类型的类型指示。

标题: Method and apparatus for inferring the topical content of a document based upon its lexical content without supervision
摘要: An iterative method of determining the topical content of a document using a computer. The processing unit of the computer determines the topical content of documents presented to it in machine readable form using information stored in computer memory. That information includes word-clusters, a lexicon, and association strength values. The processing unit beings by generating an observed feature vector for the document being characterized, which indicates which of the words of the lexicon appear in the document. Afterward, the processing unit makes an initial prediction of the topical content of the document in the form of a topic belief vector. The processing unit uses the topic belief vector and the association strength values to predict which words of the lexicon should appear in the document. This prediction is represented via a predicted feature vector. The predicted feature vector is then compared to the observed feature vector to measure how well the topic belief vector models the topical content of the document. If the topic belief vector adequately model the topical content of the document, then the processing unit's task is complete. On the other hand, if the topic belief vector does not adequately model the topical content of the document, then the processing unit determines how the topic belief vector should be modified to improve the prediction of modeling of the topical content.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种使用计算机确定文档主题内容的迭代方法。 计算机的处理单元使用存储在计算机存储器中的信息来确定以机器可读形式呈现给它的文档的主题内容。 该信息包括词簇、词典和关联强度值。 处理单元通过为被表征的文档生成观察到的特征向量,其指示词典中的哪些单词出现在文档中。 之后,处理单元以主题信念向量的形式对文档的主题内容进行初步预测。 处理单元使用主题信念向量和关联强度值来预测词典中的哪些词应该出现在文档中。 该预测通过预测特征向量表示。 然后将预测的特征向量与观察到的特征向量进行比较,以衡量主题信念向量对文档的主题内容建模的程度。 如果主题信念向量充分模拟了文档的主题内容,那么处理单元的任务就完成了。 另一方面,如果主题信念向量没有充分地对文档的主题内容进行建模,则处理单元确定应该如何修改主题信念向量以改进对主题内容建模的预测。
发明人地址: San Carlos, CA | San Francisco, CA

标题: 컬러 정보를 이용한 공간 기울기 검출 방법
摘要: 1. 청구범위에 기재된 발명이 속한 기술분야 본 발명은 컬러 정보를 이용한 공간 기울기 검출 방법에 관한 것임. 2. 발명이 해결하려고 하는 기술적 과제 본 발명은, 검출된 공간 기울기를 분수령 알고리즘에 이용하여 정확하게 영역 분할 및 경계 추출을 수행하기 위하여, 컬러 정보를 이용하여 시각적으로 의미있는 공간 기울기를 검출하는 공간 기울기 검출 방법을 제공하고자 함. 3. 발명의 해결방법의 요지 본 발명은, 영상의 영역 분할 및 경계 추출 시스템에 적용되는 공간 기울기 검출 방법에 있어서, 영상 신호의 각 컬러 정보를 단순화시키는 제 1 단계; 단순화된 각 컬러 정보에 대해 공간 기울기 정보를 검출하는 제 2 단계; 각 컬러 기울기 정보에 대해 임의의 가중치를 곱하는 제 3 단계; 및 가중된 각 컬러 기울기 정보에 대해 결합 공간 기울기를 구하는 제 4 단계를 포함한다. 4. 발명의 중요한 용도 본 발명은 분수령 알고리즘에 이용됨.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 1.权利要求中描述的发明所属的技术领域本发明涉及一种使用颜色信息的空间倾斜度检测方法。  2、本发明要解决的技术问题本发明是一种空间梯度,利用颜色信息检测具有视觉意义的空间梯度,以便在分水岭算法中利用检测到的空间梯度准确地进行区域分割和边界提取。提供检测方法。  3.发明内容本发明提供一种空间梯度检测方法,应用于图像区域分割和边界提取系统,包括:第一步,对图像信号的各颜色信息进行简化; 第二步,检测每个简化颜色信息的空间倾斜信息; 第三步,将每个颜色梯度信息乘以任意权重; 第四步,为每个加权颜色梯度信息得到组合空间梯度。  4.本发明的重要用途本发明用于分水岭算法。

标题: File backup file system
摘要: A backup file system which can be used without modification of application programs, the operating system, or the hardware. The backup file system is implemented by means of a dynamically-linkable replacement library and user-level processes on a primary computer system and a backup computer system. The dynamically-linkable replacement library has the same interfaces as a standard dynamically-linkable library of file operations. The functions in the replacement library perform the same file operations as their counterparts in the standard library; in addition, they send messages specifying the just-performed operation to a user-level process on the backup computer system. The user-level process executes the operation specified in the message on a backup file in the backup computer system. The files to be backed up are specified by identifying subtrees in the namespace of the primary file system; the subtrees make up a user-defined namespace. The backup file system is made fault tolerant by the use of monitor processes which monitor the backup computer system and the processes of the backup file system and deal with failures as required to keep the backup file system operating.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 无需修改应用程序、操作系统或硬件即可使用的备份文件系统。 备份文件系统通过可动态链接的替换库和主计算机系统和备份计算机系统上的用户级进程来实现。 动态可链接替换库与文件操作的标准动态可链接库具有相同的接口。 替换库中的函数与标准库中的函数执行相同的文件操作; 此外,它们将指定刚刚执行的操作的消息发送到备份计算机系统上的用户级进程。 用户级进程对备份计算机系统中的备份文件执行消息中指定的操作。 通过标识主文件系统命名空间中的子树来指定要备份的文件; 子树构成用户定义的命名空间。 通过使用监视备份计算机系统和备份文件系统进程并根据需要处理故障以保持备份文件系统运行的监视进程使备份文件系统具有容错性。
发明人: FOWLER, GLENN STEPHEN | HUANG, YENNUN | KORN, DAVID GERARD | RAO, CHUNG-HWA HERMAN
发明人地址: 2322 Lyde Place,Scotch Plains, New Jersey 07076,US | 33 Linberger Drive,Bridgewater, New Jersey 08807,US | 303 Mercer Street A107,New York, New York 10003,US | 4304 Springbrook Drive,Edison, New Jersey 08820,US

标题: Method of and apparatus for detecting voice separations
摘要: An arrangement for endpoint detection improves speech recognition accuracy and lowers rejection rates by developing an ordered list of endpoint candidates. A triple thresholding technique defines energy signal pulses. The energy pulses are combined according to predetermined criteria to form the endpoint candidates.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 端点检测的安排通过开发端点候选的有序列表来提高语音识别的准确性并降低拒绝率。 三重阈值技术定义了能量信号脉冲。 根据预定标准组合能量脉冲以形成候选端点。
[标]当前申请(专利权)人: 日本東京都港區芝自金三光町273

标题: Inrichting voor het lezen van een op een transportbaan geplaatst voorwerp aangebrachte optisch gecodeerde staafcode.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 光学代码阅读器采用飞点扫描器重复跟踪X扫描模式以读取打印在票证上的线性条形码,而与移动过程中票证的朝向无关,其中条形码的高度超出其长度一定量,具体取决于扫描 模式重复率和检票速度。
[标]当前申请(专利权)人: 皮特尼鲍斯股份有限公司

标题: Logic synthesis apparatus for incorporating additional rules to the knowledge base without causing competition
摘要: Disclosed is a logic synthesis apparatus for automatically composing and designing LSI logic circuits by converting a functional specification based on conversion rules given in advance to the apparatus, which is composed of means for inputting an additional transformation rule, means for executing logic composition of LSI by applying the additional transformation rule to the functional specification preferentially to the conversion rules, and means for revising the conversion rules so as to avoid competition between the conversion rules and the additional transformation rule by analyzing the additional conversion rule, and incorporating the additional transformation rule in the conversion rules, thereby obtaining a learning function to the additional transformation rule.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 公开了一种逻辑合成装置,用于通过基于预先给定的转换规则转换功能规范来自动组合和设计LSI逻辑电路,该装置由用于输入附加转换规则的装置、用于执行LSI的逻辑组合的装置组成。 将附加转换规则优先于转换规则应用于功能规范,以及通过分析附加转换规则来修改转换规则以避免转换规则与附加转换规则竞争的手段,并将附加转换规则合并到 转换规则,从而获得对附加转换规则的学习函数。

标题: 화상통신장치및방법,그방법을이용한팩시밀리장치및그팩시밀리장치를이용한팩시밀리통신방법
摘要: 팩시밀리 통신용 화상 데이터를, 컴퓨터·네트워크상에서, 특히 인터넷 상에서 송수신하는 것이가능하도록 할 의양으로, 화상 처리부(17)가 팩시밀리용 화상 데이터를 인터넷 상에서 송수신하는 것이가능한 화상 파일로 변환하고, 또한 포맷 변환부(3)가 그 화상 파일이나 목적지 어드레스(destinationaddress) 등을 이용하여, 전자 메일이나 등록 파일 등을 생성한다.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 图像处理部17以能够通过计算机/网络、特别是因特网等进行传真通信的图像数据的发送接收为目的,将传真通信用的图像数据转换为能够通过网络进行发送接收的图像文件。 Internet,格式转换单元(3)使用图像文件、目的地地址等生成电子邮件、注册文件等。
法律状态/事件: 期限届满 | 权利转移

标题: Word processing apparatus
摘要: A word processing apparatus capable of automatically handling characters of which use is inhibited at the head or end of a row. Such inhibited character processing can be verified on a cathode ray tube, and is applied only to the locations selected by the operator with a cursor. The character rows after such inhibited character processing can be made uniform by character pitch adjustment.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种能够自动处理在行首或行尾禁止使用的字符的文字处理设备。 这种被禁止的字符处理可以在阴极射线管上验证,并且只应用于操作者用光标选择的位置。 这种禁止字符处理后的字符行可以通过字符间距调整来统一。

标题: 촬영화상검색장치, 전자카메라장치 및 촬영화상검색방법
摘要: 본 발명은 촬영화상데이터와 함께 촬영위치데이터를 기록할 수 있는 전자스틸카메라에 이용하여 적당한 촬영화상검색장치, 전자카메라장치 및 촬영화상검색방법에 관한 것으로서, 촬영모드에 있어서 화상정보취득수단(1)에 의해 화상정보가 취득된 경우 해당 화상정보와 함께 측위수단(2)에 의해 취득된 위치정보를 기억수단(4)에 관련지워서 기억하고, 다음으로 재생모드에 있어서 키입력수단(11)의 스크롤키가 소정시간 이상 계속해서 눌려지면 화상정보에 관련지워서 기억수단(4)에 기억되어 있는 위치정보를 차례로 판독하면서 차례로 연산수단(6)에 의해 2점간의 거리를 산출하고, 이 산출거리가 조건취득수단(5)에 의해 취득된 소정거리 이상인지 아닌지가 검색수단(7)에 의해 판단되며, 그리고 검색수단(7)에 의해 소정거리 이상의 산출거리가 검색되면 표시제어수단(9)에 의해 검색화상, 즉 하나 전의 화상정보를 촬영한 장소로부터 소정거리 이상 거리가 떨어져 있는 장소에서 촬영된 화상정보가 표시수단(9)에 표시되는 것을 특징으로 한다.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 本发明涉及适用于能够与拍摄图像数据一起记录拍摄位置数据的电子静态照相机的拍摄图像检索装置、电子照相机装置和拍摄图像检索方法,以及图像信息获取装置(1)在拍摄模式下通过 )获取图像信息时,定位装置2获取的位置信息与图像信息一起关联存储在存储装置4中,然后,在回放模式下,键输入装置11当滚动键被连续按下预定时间或更长时间,计算装置6依次计算两点之间的距离,同时顺序读取存储在存储装置4中的与图像信息相关的位置信息,并且该计算的距离搜索装置7判断条件获取装置5获取的距离是否大于或等于预定距离,并且当搜索装置7搜索到等于或大于预定距离的计算距离时,显示控制装置9 其特征在于,在显示装置(9)上显示搜索图像,即在距先前图像信息拍摄位置超过预定距离的位置拍摄的图像信息。
[标]当前申请(专利权)人: 北京小米移动软件有限公司
当前第一申请(专利权)人: 베이징 시아오미 모바일 소프트웨어 컴퍼니 리미티드
法律状态/事件: 期限届满 | 权利转移

标题: Named bookmark sets
摘要: Access to the Internet is provided using a plurality of bookmark sets. A plurality of bookmark sets are stored in a computer system having a browser, each bookmark set including a respective set of Uniform Resource Locators (URLs). One of the bookmark sets is designated as an active bookmark set in the browser. Browser based access to the Internet is allowed according to the URLs in the active bookmark set. When a request to retrieve an Internet file from a designated URL is detected, e.g., by hyperlink, the designated URL is checked against the URLs in the active bookmark set. Only if there is a match between the designated URL and a respective URL in the active bookmark set is the request allowed to proceed. The creation of as well as other actions on a bookmark set is associated with one or more passwords.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 使用多个书签组提供对因特网的访问。 多个书签集存储在具有浏览器的计算机系统中,每个书签集包括各自的一组统一资源定位符(URL)。 其中一个书签集被指定为浏览器中的活动书签集。 根据活动书签集中的 URL,允许基于浏览器访问 Internet。 当检测到从指定 URL 检索 Internet 文件的请求时,例如通过超链接,将对照活动书签集中的 URL 检查指定 URL。 仅当指定 URL 与活动书签集中的相应 URL 匹配时,才允许继续进行请求。 书签集的创建以及其他操作与一个或多个密码相关联。

标题: A method of distributed file recovery and a system using the method
摘要: According to the present invention, a file recovery system is provided in which the commands for recovering files such as a historical file are unnecessitated and the recovery system configuration is independent of the host processing system. That is, since the equipment (12) for achieving a file recovery does not have an information about the location of the recovery data, an information about the content of a file to be recovered is transmitted to a transmission line (1). The other equipments (12) asynchronously receive the information and judges whether or not a file containing the same file exists in the own system. If the file exists, the content of the file is transmitted to the transmission line (1). The equipment (12) achieving the file recovery asynchronously receives from the transmission line (1) the file data of files such as a historical file and establishes data consistency by use of the buffered current data (504) and the event number (1004), thereby recovering files such as a historical file.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 根据本发明,提供了一种文件恢复系统,其中用于恢复诸如历史文件的文件的命令是不必要的,并且恢复系统配置独立于主机处理系统。 也就是说,由于用于实现文件恢复的设备(12)不具有关于恢复数据的位置的信息,所以关于要恢复的文件的内容的信息被传送到传输线(1)。 其他设备(12)异步接收信息,判断本系统中是否存在包含相同文件的文件。 如果文件存在,则将文件内容传输到传输线(1)。 实现文件恢复的设备(12)从传输线(1)异步接收历史文件等文件的文件数据,并利用缓存的当前数据(504)和事件号(1004)建立数据一致性, 从而恢复文件,例如历史文件。
发明人: KAWAKAMI, SETSUO | KOIZUMI, MINORU | MORI, KINJI | NAKAI, KOZO | KASASHIMA, HIROKAZU | SUZUKI, YASUO | KAWANO, KATSUMI | ORIMO, MASAYUKI
发明人地址: Chishinryo 214 33-2, Nishinarusawacho-1-chome,Hitachi-shi,JP | Pasutoraru Azamino 505 9-22, Azamino-1-chome,Midori-ku Yokohama,JP | 569-1-7-408, Kamoshidacho,Midori-ku Yokohama,JP | 2920-59, Mukaino,Mawatari Katsuta-shi,JP | 16-9, Kanesawacho-2-chome,Hitachi-shi,JP | 352-13, Imazato,Ebina-shi,JP | 15-61, Harumicho-1-chome,Fuchu-shi,JP | Sky Rejidensu 203,256-1, Miwamachi Machida-shi,JP

标题: Method for identifying documents having a particular attribute using a vector relational characteristical object
摘要: This invention relates to a method of identifying attributes when documents are grouped to form document relationships within a document management system. Document groupings frequently require the identification of all documents within the relationship with a particular attribute. However, when individual documents store attributes along with document contents, individual querying of each document is required when the information is sought later. This invention provides a Vector Relational Characteristical Object, available to access mechanisms, and containing fields to identify a particular attribute. Each field in the Vector Relational Characteristical Object is followed by an identifier which uniquely identifies the document which possess the particular attribute.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 本发明涉及一种在文档被分组以在文档管理系统内形成文档关系时识别属性的方法。 文档分组经常需要识别具有特定属性的关系中的所有文档。 然而,当单个文档与文档内容一起存储属性时,在以后查找信息时需要对每个文档进行单独查询。 本发明提供了一种向量关系特征对象,可用于访问机制,并包含用于识别特定属性的字段。 向量关系特征对象中的每个字段后跟一个标识符,该标识符唯一地标识具有特定属性的文档。

标题: Process and circuit for block matching in two-dimensional picture signals
摘要: For processing data signals representative of pixels, each of the pictures is scanned, column per column in successive horizontal bands each having a height equal to an entire fraction of the height of the picture, whereby a representation of the picture as pixels distributed in rows and columns is obtained, each band having a common predetermined number of rows. The picture is fractionated into mutually adjacent blocks of pixels each having M pixels in each of N mutually adjacent columns, M and N being predetermined integers and M being a simple multiple of the number of pixels in one column of a band and N being a whole fraction of the number of colums per image. For each of the blocks of the current picture in turn, the block is compared with each of a plurality of blocks of the same size in a search window of L columns of H pixels in the preceding image, L and H being predetermined integers greater than M and respectively the window containing the block of the current picture and the computaton being carried out in M*M cycles, namely in the time required for scanning the block of the current image, by parallel computation, during each cycle of all partial distortions between each pixel of the current block and each of the pixels corresponding thereto upon each possible offset of the block in the search window of the preceding picture. Then the best match is determined as the correspondence having the least distortion.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 为了处理代表像素的数据信号,扫描每个图片,在连续水平带中每列的列,每个水平带的高度等于图片高度的整个部分,从而将图片表示为分布在行中的像素,并且 获得列,每个带具有共同的预定行数。 图片被分割成相互相邻的像素块,每个像素块在N个相互相邻的列的每一列中都有M个像素,M和N是预定整数,M是一个带的一列中像素数的简单倍数,N是一个整数 每个图像的列数的分数。 对于当前图片的每个块,依次将该块与前一图像中H个像素的L列的搜索窗口中的多个相同大小的块中的每个块进行比较,L和H为大于等于的预定整数 M 和分别包含当前图像块的窗口和计算在 M*M 个周期内进行,即在扫描当前图像块所需的时间,通过并行计算,在每个周期内的所有部分失真之间 当前块的每个像素以及在前一图片的搜索窗口中块的每个可能的偏移处对应的每个像素。 然后将最佳匹配确定为具有最小失真的对应关系。

标题: Data processing method in recognition system
摘要: A recognition system including a data carrier which is attached to a moving article and which has a memory storing identification data of the article and a control system communicating with the data carrier without any contact therebetween. The control system includes a higher-level controller, a plurality of lower-level controllers connected thereto, and read/write heads connected to the lower-level controllers. The higher-level controller sequentially sends an auto read/write command to the lower-level controllers. In response thereto, when the data carrier approaches one of the lower-level controllers, the lower-level controller communicates with the data carrier so as to access the memory thereof. The lower-level controller temporarily keeps a result of the memory access (the response from the data carrier) such that on receiving a command from the higher-level controller, the lower-level controller transmits the memory access result thus temporarily kept therein to the higher-level controller.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种识别系统,包括附在移动物品上并具有存储物品识别数据的存储器的数据载体和与数据载体通信而其间没有任何接触的控制系统。 该控制系统包括一个上位控制器、与其相连的多个下位控制器以及与下位控制器相连的读/写头。 上级控制器依次向下级控制器发送自动读/写命令。 响应于此,当数据载体接近下级控制器之一时,下级控制器与数据载体通信以访问其存储器。 下级控制器暂时保存存储器访问的结果(来自数据载体的响应),以便在接收到来自上级控制器的命令时,下级控制器将暂时保存的存储器访问结果发送给下级控制器。 更高级别的控制器。
发明人: IGARASHI, KIMIO | UCHIDA, YASUO | MATSUI, KENJI
发明人地址: Gozen, JP | Takatsuki, JP | Nagaokakyo, JP

标题: 정보 처리 장치 및 그 제어 방법
摘要: 본 발명은 필적을 인식할 수 있는 입력 펜이 있는 핸드 헬드 컴퓨터이다. 문자는 화면의 앞에서 투명한좌표 입력 판 상에 입력펜으로 유저의 손에 의해 입력된다. 컴퓨터는 유저의 펜 입력 특징을 판별하여판별 결과에 따라 문자 인식 딕셔너리를 선택한다.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 本发明是一种具有可识别手写输入笔的掌上电脑。 字符由用户用手在屏幕前的透明坐标输入面板上用输入笔输入。 计算机判断用户笔输入的特征,并根据判别结果选择字符识别词典。

标题: Information retrieval control system with input and output buffers
摘要: An information retrieval system for retrieving and processing data from a large-capacity, rotating recording medium at a high speed includes an RAM storing attribute data, address registers specifying RAM addresses, an attribute data operation unit, and an FIFO device enqueuing and sequentially outputting length information of the attribute data. By providing the FIFO device for obtaining the length information from the data read from the recording medium, the need to obtain this data by accessing the RAM is avoided and high speed retrieval becomes possible.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种用于从大容量、高速旋转的记录介质中检索和处理数据的信息检索系统,包括存储属性数据的RAM、指定RAM地址的地址寄存器、属性数据操作单元以及排队和顺序输出长度的FIFO设备 属性数据的信息。 通过提供用于从从记录介质读取的数据中获取长度信息的FIFO设备,避免了通过访问RAM来获取该数据的需要,并且高速检索成为可能。
[标]当前申请(专利权)人: 株式会社日立制作所 | 日本电信电话株式会社

标题: Binary reference matrixes
摘要: 1499734 Multi-character word verifier INTERNATIONAL BUSINESS MACHINES CORP 30 April 1975 [2 Aug 1974] 17908/75 Heading G4R Letters of the alphabet are alloted values, with higher values being allotted to unreliable characters, i.e. those that are easily misread, and to characters which in, for instance an OCR output, have a high probability of being misread from other characters. The values are held in a Read Only Store 10 addressed by the characters. Words on line 2 from, e.g. an OCR reader, a keyboard or a speech analyser, are fed to a Word Separation Detector determining the start and finish positions of the word, ot a numeric detector 6 deciding whether letters or numbers are received and to a gate 8 disabled if numbers are detected. The characters are serially fed to ROS 10 which produces the allotted values L N . The characters are also fed to a counter 18 which determines the position N of the character in the word. The values L E are fed to a multiplier 12 and adder 14 to produce a sum Y = #L2 N which is held in register 16. The values L N and the character position N are fed to multiplier 20 and adder 22 to produce a sum #L N N which is held in register 24. The character position values are fed to multiplier 30 and adder 32 to produce a sum R2 = #N2 which is held in register 34 and fed to a square root circuit to produce value R. The values R and Y are multiplied and are divided by the value #L N N and the result is fed to an Arcsecant table. The value Y and the angle produced from the Table 29 are then used as the two address to a two dimensional ROS to address a one bit location which contains '1' if the word supplied on line 2 is correct and a '0' if the wordis incorrect. If the allotted values are suitably chosen the area of ROS 38 addressed by words having a large probability of being incorrect contains many more zeros than ones and the probability of an incorrect word addressing a '1' location is reduced.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 1499734 多字符文字验证器 INTERNATIONAL BUSINESS MACHINES CORP 1975 年 4 月 30 日 [1974 年 8 月 2 日] 17908/75 标题 G4R 字母表中的字母被分配值,较高的值分配给不可靠的字符,即容易被误读的字符和字符 例如,在 OCR 输出中,很有可能被其他字符误读。 这些值保存在由字符寻址的只读存储区 10 中。 第 2 行的单词来自,例如 OCR阅读器、键盘或语音分析器被馈送到确定单词的开始和结束位置的单词分离检测器,或者确定是否接收到字母或数字的数字检测器6,并且如果检测到数字,则被禁用的门8  . 字符被串行馈送到产生分配值 L N 的 ROS 10。 字符还被馈送到计数器18,计数器18确定字符在单词中的位置N。 值 L E 被馈送到乘法器 12 和加法器 14 以产生和 Y = #L  2  N 保存在寄存器 16 中。值 L N 和字符位置 N 被馈送到乘法器 20 和加法器 22 以产生一个和 #L N N 保存在寄存器 24 中。字符位置值被馈送到乘法器 30 和加法器 32 到 产生总和 R  2  = #N  2  它保存在寄存器 34 中并馈送到平方根电路以产生值 R。值 R 和 Y 相乘并除以值#L N N,并将结果馈送到 Arcsecant 表。 然后,从表 29 中产生的值 Y 和角度用作二维 ROS 的两个地址,以寻址一个位位置,如果第 2 行提供的字正确,则该位置包含“1”,如果第 2 行提供的字正确,则使用“0” 词不正确。 如果分配的值被适当地选择,ROS 38 的由具有很大不正确概率的字寻址的区域包含比一多得多的零,并且寻址“1”位置的不正确字的概率降低。

标题: Image information signal transmitting system
摘要: An image information signal transmitting system for transmitting an image information signals which continuously forms a temporally correlated group of image planes is arranged to divide each image plane portions of the image information signal into a plurality of blocks; and, in determining for every divided block included in each of the image planes the adoption of one of a plurality of information transmitting modes provided for different information transmitting density values, the information transmitting modes for the plurality of blocks of a presently transmitting image plane portion of the signal are determined at least according to the information transmitting modes which hae been used for the plurality of blocks of a previously transmitted image plane portion of the signal.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种图像信息信号传输系统,用于传输连续形成时间相关的图像平面组的图像信息信号,将图像信息信号的每个图像平面部分划分为多个块; 并且,在为每个图像平面中包括的每个分割块确定采用为不同的信息传输密度值提供的多个信息传输模式中的一种时,当前传输的图像平面部分的多个块的信息传输模式 至少根据已用于信号的先前传输的图像平面部分的多个块的信息传输模式来确定信号的传输模式。
发明人: NAKAYAMA, TADAYOSHI | SATO, CHIKARA | NAGASAWA, KENICHI | SASATANI, TOMOHIKO | TAKAHASHI, KOJI | KOZUKI, SUSUMU | YOSHIMURA, KATSUJI
发明人地址: Yokohama, JP | Kawasaki, JP | Tokyo, JP

标题: Image recognition system using light-section method
摘要: An image recognition system using a light-section method which has versality and does not shorten the service life of light projector means. Projection of light from a light source onto a workpiece is continued between the time when a measuring command is issued and the time just after light has been converged by the automatic aperture control mechanism of a television camera. An image processing unit processes an image picked up by the television camera just after the convergence of light by the automatic aperture control mechanism so as to obtain three dimensional configuration data on the workpiece.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种具有通用性且不缩短投光装置使用寿命的光切法图像识别系统。 从发出测量命令的时间到刚好在电视摄像机的自动光圈控制机构会聚光之后的时间之间,继续将光源的光投射到工件上。 图像处理单元对自动光圈控制机构收光后电视摄像机拍摄的图像进行处理,得到工件的三维形貌数据。

标题: Method for the location-independent exchange of process data using process-computer-independent data structures
摘要: The method relates to the location-independent exchange of process data between application programs (5) and process management systems (4). The process management systems (4) and the application programs (5) are provided in a number of different process computers systems (2.1 to 2.7) which are interconnected via a network (1). The data exchange takes place by using a software system (3) which is called Process Information Broker PIB (3) and has three types of component, namely PIB server (3.1), PIB client (3.2) and PIB services (3.3). The PIB services (3.3) contain a switching service (3.31) and a user administrator (3.32). During the start-up of the system and for the purpose of updating, in the respective computer system (2.1 to 2.7), process data are converted from process-computer-specific data structures into process-computer-independent data structures, typified and provided as stored data in an interface. All the computer systems (2.1 to 2.7) register the process data types provided by them, including the storage location thereof, with the switching service (3.31). The stored process data are accessed by the application programs (5) by involving the switching service (3.31) in order to ask for the offered process data types and their storage location. On this basis, process data types are retrieved and operations executed.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 该方法涉及应用程序(5)和过程管理系统(4)之间的过程数据的位置无关交换。 过程管理系统(4)和应用程序(5)在通过网络(1)互连的多个不同过程计算机系统(2.1至2.7)中提供。 数据交换通过使用称为过程信息代理 PIB (3) 的软件系统 (3) 进行,它具有三种类型的组件,即 PIB 服务器 (3.1)、PIB 客户端 (3.2) 和 PIB 服务 (3.3)。  PIB 服务 (3.3) 包含交换服务 (3.31) 和用户管理员 (3.32)。 在系统启动期间和为了更新的目的,在相应的计算机系统(2.1 到 2.7)中,过程数据从过程计算机特定的数据结构转换为与过程计算机无关的数据结构,典型和提供 作为存储在接口中的数据。 所有的计算机系统(2.1 到 2.7)将它们提供的过程数据类型,包括其存储位置,注册到交换服务(3.31)中。 应用程序 (5) 通过涉及交换服务 (3.31) 来访问存储的过程数据,以询问所提供的过程数据类型及其存储位置。 在此基础上,检索流程数据类型并执行操作。
法律状态/事件: 期限届满 | 权利转移

标题: Binary tree parallel processor
摘要: A plurality of parallel processing elements are connected in a binary tree configuration, with each processing element except those in the highest and lowest levels being in communication with a single parent processing element as well as first and second (or left and right) child processing elements. Each processing element comprises a processor, a read/write or random access memory, and an input/output (I/O) device. The I/O device provides interfacing between each processing element and its parent and children processing elements so as to provide significant improvements in propagation speeds through the binary tree. The I/O device allows the presently preferred embodiment of the invention to be clocked at 12 megahertz, producing in the case of a tree of 1023 processors, each having an average instruction cycle time of 1.8 mu s, a system with a raw computational throughput of approximately 570 million instructions per second. The I/O device communicates data and queries from the root processing element to all other N processing elements in the array in one processor instruction cycle instead of in O(log2N) processor instruction cycles as in prior art binary tree arrays. Primitive queries are executed in parallel by each processing element and the results made available for reporting back to the root processing element. In several important cases, these results can be combined and reported back to the root processing element in a single processor instruction cycle instead of in O(log2N) processor instruction cycles as in prior art binary tree arrays. Thus, the elapsed time for a broadcast and report operation is in effect a constant time regardless of the number of processors in the array.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 多个并行处理元件以二叉树结构连接,除了最高和最低级别的处理元件之外,每个处理元件都与单个父处理元件以及第一和第二(或左和右)子处理元件通信 . 每个处理元件包括处理器、读/写或随机存取存储器和输入/输出(I/O)设备。  I/O 设备提供每个处理元件与其父处理元件和子处理元件之间的接口,以便显着提高通过二叉树的传播速度。  I/O 设备允许本发明的当前优选实施例以 12 兆赫兹计时,在 1023 个处理器树的情况下产生,每个处理器的平均指令周期时间为 1.8 微秒,具有原始计算吞吐量的系统 每秒约 5.7 亿条指令。  I/O设备在一个处理器指令周期内而不是像在现有技术二叉树阵列中那样在O(log2N)个处理器指令周期内将数据和查询从根处理元件传送到阵列中的所有其他N个处理元件。 原始查询由每个处理元素并行执行,结果可用于向根处理元素报告。 在几个重要的情况下,这些结果可以在单个处理器指令周期而不是像在现有技术二叉树阵列中那样在O(log2N)处理器指令周期中被组合并报告回根处理元件。 因此,无论阵列中处理器的数量如何,广播和报告操作所用的时间实际上是一个恒定时间。
当前第一申请(专利权)人: COLUMBIA UNIVERSITY OF THE CITY OF NEW YORK
发明人: MIRANKER, DANIEL P. | STOLFO, SALVATORE J.

标题: オーディオ帯域信号の音声/音楽判別装置
摘要:
【目的】 音声/音楽判別装置はオーディオ帯域の信号を受信して、受信されたオーディオ信号が音楽であるか、又は音声であるかを自動に判断する。
【構成】 前置処理部は受信されるオーディオ信号を音声帯域の信号と音楽帯域の信号に各々分離抽出する。多数個の判断ユニットとから構成される判断部は前記音声及び音楽帯域の信号を受信して各々音声又は音楽判断信号を出力する。このとき前記判断ユニットはオーディオ信号のステレオ成分の有無、高域、中域及び低域の音圧レベル、オーディオ信号のエンベロープに対する断続性及び帯域幅のピーク周波数の変動分を検出して、該当特性による判断信号を出力する。以後に、綜合判断部は前記判断部の各出力を受信して音楽及び音声判断信号の構成比により綜合的に受信オーディオ信号が音声であるか、又は音楽であるかを判断出力する。
摘要(译)(简体中文):
语音/音乐鉴别器接收音频信号并自动确定接收到的音频信号是音乐还是语音。 
 预处理器将接收到的音频信号分离并提取为语音频带信号和音乐频带信号。 由多个判断单元组成的判断部分接收语音和音乐频带信号,并分别输出语音或音乐判断信号。 此时判断单元检测音频信号有无立体声分量、高、中、低频的声压级,音频信号包络的不连续性,以及音频信号的波动。带宽的峰值频率,并检测相应的特性,输出判断信号。 之后,综合判断单元接收判断单元的各个输出,根据音乐和语音判断信号的组成比例,综合判断接收到的音频信号是语音还是音乐。
发明人地址: 大韓民国  キョンギ-ド  スウォン-シティー  コンスン-グ  マエタン-2-ドン  セオンジルアパート203-403  (番地なし)

标题: 文字入力装置及び方法
摘要: PURPOSE:To easily input handwritten characters. CONSTITUTION:When a character is handwritten and inputted to a display character frame 82, the pattern of the character is recognized, and the pattern- recognized character is displayed in the display character frame 82. The four display character frames 82 are cyclically and successively used. The characters written in the display character frames 82 are displayed in the order of inputs to a display part 83a of a logic character frame 83. When a forward button 83b or a backward button 83c are operated, the characters displayed at the display part 83a are normalized and displayed in the display character frames 82.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 用途:轻松输入手写字符。 组成:当一个字符被手写并输入到显示字符框 82 时,字符的模式被识别,模式识别字符显示在显示字符框 82 中。四个显示字符框 82 循环并连续使用 . 显示文字框82中记载的文字按照逻辑文字框83的显示部83a的输入顺序显示。当前进按钮83b或后退按钮83c被操作时,显示部83a中显示的文字变为 归一化并显示在显示字符框 82 中。
发明人地址: 東京都品川区北品川6丁目7番35号  ソニー株式会社内

标题: 入れ子型トークン列の検索装置
摘要: PURPOSE:To improve the retrieving speed of a token train by decoding the attributes of a nest level NL, an ID code, etc., of the token train stored in a main storage for each token and retrieving the token train with use of those attributes. CONSTITUTION:The collation of attributes is carried out via a retrieving condi tion memory 106 including a request ID register and a request NL register, a header holding means 120, and an attribute comparator 115 connected to an NL output register 175. At the same time, the mismatched tokens can be skipped. When a mismatched state is detected, a length code B and 1 are added to a length code reading position A and a header address of the next token is decided by an internal address generating circuit 135. Meanwhile the code B is set at 0 when no mismatched state is detected. As a result, the body parts of mismatched tokens can be skipped at a header part. Thus the main storage access frequency for reading out the tokens matched to the retrieving conditions can be reduced down to just one to several access frequencies for reading out all token trains. Then the retrieving time of a token train is shortened.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 目的:通过为每个令牌解码存储在主存储器中的令牌序列的嵌套级别 NL、ID 代码等属性,并使用这些属性检索令牌序列,从而提高令牌序列的检索速度 . 组成:属性的校对是通过检索条件存储器 106 进行的,包括请求 ID 寄存器和请求 NL 寄存器、标头保存装置 120 和连接到 NL 输出寄存器 175 的属性比较器 115。同时 ,可以跳过不匹配的标记。 当检测到不匹配状态时,将长度码B和1添加到长度码读取位置A,并且下一个令牌的标题地址由内部地址生成电路135决定。同时,当没有时,将代码B设置为0。 检测到不匹配的状态。 因此,可以在标头部分跳过不匹配令牌的主体部分。 因此,用于读出与检索条件匹配的令牌的主存储器访问频率可以降低到仅用于读取所有令牌串的一个或多个访问频率。 然后令牌列车的检索时间被缩短。

标题: System zur Steuerung von Zugriffsprivilegien
摘要(译)(简体中文): 本发明的系统和方法提供跨越面向对象的数据库中的对象边界的访问控制列表。除了提供读取和写入访问权限之外，访问控制列表提供应用于面向对象的数据库中的方法的执行的执行语义。在访问控制列表的条目中，用于读，写和执行的每个权限可以分别分配给表示用户ID或组ID的多个ID中的每一个。在请求用户访问数据时，在条目内搜索用户的用户ID和用户所属的组ID，以确定用户是否具有执行针对对象所请求的操作的特权。此外，访问控制策略从对象的超级对象继承;导致对象的最小特权。
法律状态/事件: 期限届满 | 权利转移

标题: 画像処理方法
摘要: PURPOSE:To perform image processing with few erroneous recognition and high accuracy by extracting plural feature quantity from input image data, performing first evaluation based on fuzzy clustering, and performing second evaluation with another method. CONSTITUTION:When the images of red R, green G, and blue B are inputted from a CCD camera 101, they are digitized, and are uniformalized, and furthermore, noises are eliminated from them, then, areas for the extraction of the feature quantity are extracted. A feature quantity extraction part 112 extracts the feature quantity with respect to the information of a position, brightness, and shape, etc., from the extraction area. The matching of the feature quantity of position information with a reference pattern from a reference pattern generating part 115 is performed at an arithmetic part 113 with a reverse truth value limiting method. Meanwhile, the matching of the feature quantity with respect to brightness and shape information with the reference pattern is performed at an arithmetic part 114 with the fuzzy clustering. Those two computed results are coupled and synthesized at a coupling part 116 with the rule of Dempster- Shafer and a judged result with high assurance can be outputted from an output part 117.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 目的:通过从输入图像数据中提取多个特征量,进行基于模糊聚类的第一次评价,并用另一种方法进行第二次评价,进行图像处理,识别错误少,精度高。 组成:当红色 R、绿色 G 和蓝色 B 的图像从 CCD 摄像机 101 输入时,它们会被数字化,并被统一化,此外,从它们中消除噪声,然后,用于提取特征量的区域 被提取。 特征量提取部112从提取区域中提取与位置、亮度、形状等信息相关的特征量。 位置信息的特征量与来自参考图案生成部分115的参考图案的匹配在算术部分113处以反向真值限制方法执行。 同时,关于亮度和形状信息的特征量与参考图案的匹配在算术部分114处通过模糊聚类执行。 这两个计算结果在耦合部分116按照Dempster-Shafer规则耦合和合成,并且可以从输出部分117输出具有高可靠性的判断结果。
发明人: 西守 英二 | 信宮 利昭
发明人地址: 東京都大田区下丸子3丁目30番2号  キヤノン株式会社内

标题: PATAANSHORISHISUTEMUNOADORESUSHIIKENSA
摘要: An address sequencer produces an address stream which includes a plurality of interleaved sequences of addresses. Each sequence is a function of input data which is received when an input pattern is sampled by that sequence, so that a repetitive address loop is generated which characterizes the pattern. The address sequencer includes a shift register with a programmable feedback circuit which provides a feedback bit to the first stage of the shift register based upon bits from selected stages of the shift register. During each operating cycle of the address sequencer, a counter provides a sequence identification number which identifies a particular sequence. A stored address selected by the sequence identification number is provided as the present address for that sequence (and the output of the address sequencer). In addition, the shift register is loaded with a multibit word derived from that stored address. The shift register is then shifted a predetermined number of times, and the feedback bit is derived from stages of the shift register which are selected based upon the sequence identification number. The next address of the sequence is derived from the contents of the shift register after the shifting and is selected based upon a comparison of the input data (which was received in response to the present address) with a reference value.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 地址定序器产生包括多个交错的地址序列的地址流。 每个序列都是输入数据的函数,当输入模式被该序列采样时接收到输入数据,从而生成表征该模式的重复地址循环。 地址定序器包括具有可编程反馈电路的移位寄存器,其基于来自移位寄存器的选定级的位向移位寄存器的第一级提供反馈位。 在地址定序器的每个操作周期期间,计数器提供识别特定序列的序列识别号。 由序列标识号选择的存储地址被提供作为该序列的当前地址(和地址定序器的输出)。 此外,移位寄存器加载了从该存储地址派生的多位字。 然后移位寄存器被移位预定次数,并且反馈位从基于序列标识号选择的移位寄存器的级导出。 该序列的下一个地址在移位后从移位寄存器的内容中导出,并根据输入数据(响应当前地址而接收)与参考值的比较来选择。
发明人: RARII JEI WAASU | RARII JII HOORUSON

标题: Speech recognition system for natural language translation
摘要: A speech recognition system displays a source text of one or more words in a source language. The system has an acoustic processor for generating a sequence of coded representations of an utterance to be recognized. The utterance comprises a series of one or more words in a target language different from the source language. A set of one or more speech hypotheses, each comprising one or more words from the target language, are produced. Each speech hypothesis is modeled with an acoustic model. An acoustic match score for each speech hypothesis comprises an estimate of the closeness of a match between the acoustic model of the speech hypothesis and the sequence of coded representations of the utterance. A translation match score for each speech hypothesis comprises an estimate of the probability of occurrence of the speech hypothesis given the occurrence of the source text. A hypothesis score for each hypothesis comprises a combination of the acoustic match score and the translation match score. At least one word of one or more speech hypotheses having the best hypothesis scores is output as a recognition result.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 语音识别系统显示源语言中一个或多个单词的源文本。 该系统有一个声学处理器,用于生成要识别的话语的一系列编码表示。 话语包括一系列一个或多个用不同于源语言的目标语言的单词。 产生一组一个或多个语音假设,每个语音假设包括来自目标语言的一个或多个单词。 每个语音假设都用一个声学模型建模。 每个语音假设的声学匹配分数包括语音假设的声学模型与话语的编码表示序列之间的匹配接近程度的估计。 每个语音假设的翻译匹配分数包括在给定源文本出现的情况下对语音假设出现概率的估计。 每个假设的假设分数包括声学匹配分数和翻译匹配分数的组合。 具有最佳假设分数的一个或多个语音假设中的至少一个词被输出作为识别结果。
发明人: BROWN PETER F. | DELLA PIETRA STEPHEN A. | DELLA PIETRA VINCENT J. | JELINEK FREDERICK | MERCER ROBERT L.

标题: SYSTEM ZUR METALLSCHROTTSORTIERUNG
摘要: A scrap particle sorting system and attendant sorting process employs a conveyor for conveying the randomly shaped particles in a random orientation, a position sensor for determining the advancement of the scrap particles in the direction of conveyance by determining the position of the conveyor belt, an image detector for periodically recording the image of a predefined viewing area through which the scrap particles are conveyed, and an image processor for periodic acquisition and processing of the images. The image processor includes logic for defining each image of the viewing area into a matrix of cells, and for each acquired image, analyzing the digital data corresponding to the image to determine for each cell in the matrix whether the pixels in that cell satisfy a predetermined criteria, and establishing a discriminator signal for each cell in the matrix as a function of that analysis. The system employs an image detector controller for receiving a signal from the conveyor position sensor and sending an activation signal to the image processor at timed intervals to acquire sequential image frames which include each of the scrap particles as they are conveyed past the viewing area, and a separator controller for receiving the discriminator signals from the image processor and for sending a control signal to selectively activate the appropriate portion of the separator to eject desired from undesired particles.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 废料颗粒分选系统和伴随的分选过程采用用于以随机方向输送随机形状的颗粒的输送机、用于通过确定输送带的位置来确定废料颗粒在输送方向上的前进的位置传感器、图像 检测器用于周期性地记录通过其传送废料颗粒的预定观察区域的图像,以及图像处理器用于周期性地获取和处理图像。 图像处理器包括用于将观看区域的每个图像定义为单元矩阵的逻辑,并且对于每个获取的图像,分析与该图像相对应的数字数据以确定对于矩阵中的每个单元,该单元中的像素是否满足预定值。 标准,并根据该分析为矩阵中的每个单元建立鉴别器信号。 该系统采用图像检测器控制器,用于接收来自传送带位置传感器的信号,并以一定的时间间隔向图像处理器发送激活信号,以获取连续的图像帧,该图像帧包括当废料颗粒被传送通过观察区域时的每一个,并且 分离器控制器,用于接收来自图像处理器的鉴别器信号并用于发送控制信号以选择性地激活分离器的适当部分以从不期望的颗粒中排出期望的颗粒。

标题: Speech recognition with speaker adaptation by learning
摘要: A speech recognition apparatus of the speaker adaptation type operates to recognize inputted speech pattern produced by a particular speaker according to reference pattern produced by a standard speaker. The speech recognition apparatus is adapted to the particular speaker by converting the reference pattern to normalized pattern through learning operation using training pattern prodused provisionally by the particular speaker. In the alternative, the speech recognition apparatus is trained through conversion of the training pattern with reference to the reference pattern. The speech recognition apparatus operates to convert inputted speech pattern into normalized speech pattern in real time basis according to the result of learning operation and to recognize the normalized speech pattern according to the reference pattern.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 说话人自适应类型的语音识别设备用于根据标准说话人产生的参考模式来识别由特定说话人产生的输入语音模式。 通过使用特定说话人临时产生的训练模式通过学习操作将参考模式转换为归一化模式,语音识别装置适用于特定说话人。 或者,通过参照参考模式转换训练模式来训练语音识别装置。 语音识别装置操作以根据学习操作的结果实时地将输入的语音模式转换为归一化的语音模式,并根据参考模式识别归一化的语音模式。
发明人: YOSHIDA, KAZUNAGA C/O NEC CORPORATION | WATANABE, TAKAO C/O NEC CORPORATION

标题: Anzeigevorrichtung HINTERGRUND DER ERFINDUNG1. Gebiet der Erfindung
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种显示装置,其提供用作显示介质的液晶(41),用于驱动液晶的多个像素电极,布置在该行或行中的多个下部电极(x1至x128)和上部电极(y1至y100)。 列方向,多个光电导元件(S <X> 1,1至S <X> 128、100和S <Y> 1,1至S <Y> 在这些像素电极中的每一个上设置有用于与像素电极电连接或断开信号线的像素电极128、100)和沿像素电极的列和行方向设置的多个线性发光体(X1至X128和Y1至Y100)。 一种将光选择性地施加到光电导元件并控制光电导元件的连接或断开的方式。 <图像>

标题: Method and device for extracting a connected component of image data
摘要: An image processing device for extracting connected components of image data includes a first image memory for storing image data that contains connected components (e.g., object image data). A processor searches the image data stored in the first image memory to detect a part of the object image data and determines a watching area of the image data in the main rasterizing scan direction on the basis of the detected part of the object image data. The processor then searches the image data to detect a line segment of continuous pixels that is coupled to and includes the watching area. Once, the line segment is detected, the processor cancels the detected line segment from the image data stored in the first image memory and outputs data corresponding to the cancelled line segment. The device also includes a second image memory for storing the detected and cancelled line segment outputted by the processor as a connected component of the image data.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种用于提取图像数据的连接分量的图像处理设备包括用于存储包含连接分量的图像数据(例如,对象图像数据)的第一图像存储器。 处理器搜索存储在第一图像存储器中的图像数据以检测部分对象图像数据,并基于检测到的部分对象图像数据确定图像数据在主光栅化扫描方向上的观看区域。 处理器然后搜索图像数据以检测耦合到并包括观看区域的连续像素的线段。 一旦检测到线段,处理器从存储在第一图像存储器中的图像数据中消去检测到的线段,并输出与消去的线段对应的数据。 该装置还包括第二图像存储器,用于存储由处理器输出的检测和消除的线段作为图像数据的连通分量。

标题: Verfahren zur Bestimmung und Überwachung der Glanzeigenschaften von Fasern
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种利用细丝横截面形状和模拟撞击光的数学模型确定纤维丝的光泽特性的方法，以确定与纤维相互作用后的光分布，从而确定光泽性质。该方法还包括一种方法，用于导出一束接触长丝中的纤维的单个长丝横截面形状，并由此得到其它纤维性质并控制影响这些性能以及光泽性质的制造参数。 <IMAGE>

标题: Data processing system and method for selecting customized character recognition processes and coded data repair processes for scanned images of document forms
摘要: A data processing method, system and computer program repairs character recognition errors for digital images of document forms. A document form processing template is provided which specifies the identity and preferred sequence for selected, customized character recognition processes and selected, customized coded data error correction processes which are reasonably likely to be needed to automatically process a selected batch of document forms whose fields have certain, anticipated, uniform characteristics.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种数据处理方法、系统和计算机程序,用于修复文档形式的数字图像的字符识别错误。 提供了一个文档表单处理模板,该模板为选定的、定制的字符识别过程和选定的、定制的编码数据纠错过程指定了身份和首选顺序,这些过程很可能需要自动处理选定的一批文档表单,这些过程具有一定的字段 ,预期的,统一的特征。

标题: Method and apparatus for improving the performance of a generated code cache search operation through the use of static key values
摘要: A cache manager of a relational database management system (RDBMS) is able to bypass time consuming search operations through the use of a key memory structure and locate generated code segments within an SQL cache within a minimum of time. The SQL cache contains the generated code segments used to execute SQL statements as well as the structures and program logic used for maintaining the cache. The key memory structure is located in an area of memory utilized by the SQL runtime routines in executing applications. The runtime routines provide an interface between the application and the RDBMS.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 关系数据库管理系统 (RDBMS) 的缓存管理器能够通过使用关键内存结构绕过耗时的搜索操作,并在最短的时间内在 SQL 缓存中定位生成的代码段。  SQL 缓存包含生成的用于执行 SQL 语句的代码段以及用于维护缓存的结构和程序逻辑。 关键内存结构位于 SQL 运行时例程在执行应用程序时使用的内存区域中。 运行时例程提供应用程序和 RDBMS 之间的接口。

标题: Fingerprint image optical input apparatus
摘要: A fingerprint optical input apparatus comprises a contact image sensor for viewing a moving finger and providing a high contrast image. A narrow strip of the fingerprint touching a transparent platen is illuminated by sheet of collimated light normal to or at an oblique angle to the surface. The fingerprint image is viewed at an oblique angle by partially scattered light or by frustrated total internal reflection by a GRIN rod lens array and projected onto a linear array sensor. Various embodiments of the platen provide a compact design by using TIR or mirror reflections of the fingerprint image.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 指纹光学输入设备包括用于查看移动手指并提供高对比度图像的接触式图像传感器。 与透明压板接触的指纹窄条被垂直于表面或与表面成斜角的平行光照亮。 指纹图像通过部分散射光或通过 GRIN 棒状透镜阵列的受抑全内反射以斜角观察,并投射到线性阵列传感器上。 压板的各种实施例通过使用指纹图像的 TIR 或镜面反射来提供紧凑的设计。

标题: 表面特别是钟表表面上书写的字符的识别系统和识别方法
摘要: 本发明的字符识别系统有：多个传感器(21；A-S)；装置(23，24)用以周期地检测传感器输出信号的状态；装置(25)用以确定处于高态的输出信号。识别系统还有：比较装置(25，26)用以将处于高态的每一个输出信号；在检测上一个状态过程中产生的输出信号相比较；存储装置(26，28)用以存储经检测状态发生变化的传感器相应的标志；比较装置(27，29)则用以将所存储的一系列标志与起码一系列基准标志相比较，以便识别所写的所述字符。
摘要(译)(简体中文): 本发明的字符识别系统有：多个传感器(21；A-S)；装置(23，24)用以周期地检测传感器输出信号的状态；装置(25)用以确定处于高态的输出信号。识别系统还有：比较装置(25，26)用以将处于高态的每一个输出信号；在检测上一个状态过程中产生的输出信号相比较；存储装置(26，28)用以存储经检测状态发生变化的传感器相应的标志；比较装置(27，29)则用以将所存储的一系列标志与起码一系列基准标志相比较，以便识别所写的所述字符。

标题: Methods and apparatus for controlling X-ray angiographic image acquisition
摘要: Controlling the stepping of an x-ray angiography imaging device (and/or table), and/or providing a visualization aid for stepping an x-ray angiography imaging device (and/or table), to maximize the diagnostic usefulness of images acquired by the x-ray angiography imaging device. The stepping and visualization aid use features, extracted from captured images, of the state of contrast media injected into a patient.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 控制 X 射线血管造影成像设备(和/或工作台)的步进,和/或提供用于步进 X 射线血管造影成像设备(和/或工作台)的可视化辅助,以最大限度地提高通过以下方式获取的图像的诊断有用性 X射线血管造影成像设备。 步进和可视化辅助使用从捕获的图像中提取的注射到患者体内的造影剂状态的特征。

标题: Förfarande för datorstyrd distribution av information via ett antal olika kommunikationssystem samt system för tillämpning av förfarandet
摘要: Method and system for computer-controlled distribution of information via a number of different communication systems from a computer-based sender system (1) within a correspondence system arranged for the production of electronic data for the control of a number of printers (8). A control unit (9) is arranged in the respective transmission line for the above-mentioned electronic data to the printer (8). Upon activation the control unit receives this data intended for the printer and transfers it to a database (2) arranged for the purpose during a break in the transmission to the printer (8). The database is provided with a comprehensive directory (16) of addresses including electronic addresses where available and on the basis of the relevant recipient identification transmitted from the sender system (1) via the control unit (9) obtains an adequate electronic address in the directory if such address is available, after which the information is transmitted to the address in question via electronic distribution. For recipient identification transmitted to the database for which an electronic address cannot be obtained, the above-mentioned data is transmitted to the respective printer (8) for the printing out of documents which can be sent by post.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 方法和系统,用于通过多个不同的通信系统从通信系统内的基于计算机的发送器系统 (1) 进行信息的计算机控制分发,该通信系统被安排用于产生用于控制多个打印机 (8) 的电子数据。 控制单元(9)布置在用于上述电子数据到打印机(8)的相应传输线上。 在启动时,控制单元接收该用于打印机的数据,并将其传输到数据库(2),该数据库在向打印机(8)的传输中断期间为此目的而设置。 为数据库提供地址的综合目录 (16),包括可用的电子地址,并且基于从发送者系统 (1) 通过控制单元 (9) 传输的相关收件人标识,在目录中获得适当的电子地址 如果该地址可用,则信息将通过电子分发传送到相关地址。 对于传输到数据库而无法获得电子地址的收件人标识,将上述数据传输到相应的打印机(8),以打印出可以邮寄的文件。

标题: Data processing systems and methods
摘要: A multiprocessor system intercouples the processors with an active logic network having a plurality of priority determining nodes. Messages applied concurrently to the network in groups are sorted, using the data content of the messages, to a single or common priority message which is distributed to all the processors with a predetermined total network delay time. Losing messages are again retried concurrently in groups at a later time. Message routing is determined by local acceptance or rejection of messages at the processors, based upon destination data in the messages. All messages occupy places in a coherent priority scheme and are transferred in contending groups with prioritization on the network. Using data, status, control and response messages, and different multiprocessor modes, the system is particularly suited for configuration in a relational data base machine having capability for maintaining an extended data base and handling complex queries.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 多处理器系统将处理器与具有多个优先级确定节点的活动逻辑网络相互耦合。 使用消息的数据内容将分组并发应用于网络的消息分类为单个或公共优先级消息,该消息以预定的总网络延迟时间分发给所有处理器。 丢失的消息将在稍后以组的形式再次同时重试。 基于消息中的目标数据,消息路由由处理器在本地接受或拒绝消息来确定。 所有消息都在一致的优先级方案中占据位置,并在网络上按优先级在竞争组中传输。 使用数据、状态、控制和响应消息以及不同的多处理器模式,该系统特别适合在具有维护扩展数据库和处理复杂查询能力的关系数据库机器中进行配置。
法律状态/事件: 期限届满 | 权利转移

标题: 光学式測定装置における画像処理方法
摘要:
【目的】 光切断画像の曲線部分の曲線方程式を簡単に精度良く算定できるようにする。
【構成】 マスタワークを用いて予め光切断画像の曲線部分の曲率半径Rを計測しておく。ワークの光切断画像Sの曲線部分に2箇所のウインドW1、W3を設定し、両ウインドの夫々における画像重心G1、G3を計測する。G1とG3を通る半径Rの円弧として曲線部分の曲線S1の方程式を算出する。画像Sの直線部分の2箇所に設定したウインドS4、S5によって計測される画像重心G4、G5を結ぶ直線S2の方程式を算出し、両方程式から交点Qを求める。交点Qを基準にしてワークの計測を行う。
摘要(译)(简体中文):
[目的] 简单、准确地计算光切图像弯曲部分的曲线方程。 
 [构造] 光截面图像的弯曲部分的曲率半径R是使用标准件预先测量的。 在工件光切图像S的弯曲部分设置两个窗口W1和W3,测量两个窗口中的图像重心G1和G3。 弯曲部分的曲线 S 为通过 G1 和 G3 的半径为 R 的圆弧 1 计算方程式 连接图像质心G4和G5的直线S由设置在图像S的直线部分的两个位置处的窗口S4和S5测量 2 计算 的方程 并从两个方程中获得交点 Q。 以交点Q为基准测量工件。

标题: Character recognizing system
摘要: A plurality of recognition candidates are obtained through continuing a segmentation to a numeral recognition realized by segments, and an optimum one is selected from among the candidates by means of connection information, thereby preventing continuous numerals from being recognized erroneously. A method of correctly recognizing the handwritten characters, especially numerals written in checks includes the steps of: performing a line drawing analysis is of the character set to be recognized in order to extract a characteristic of the arrangement of blocks, proposing a hypothesis about the monetary unit type, and finally verifying the above hypothesis to display the result of the character recognition. Further, this method can surely distinguish handwritten characters from a bar which is either printed for entry of characters or handwritten, and eliminate the bar from the object of character recognition to extract the characters alone. In detecting the bar, six formulas for under-bar, middle-bar, upper-bar, inclined bar, inclined under-bar and inclined upper-bar relative to the characters are used to determine certainty factor of a bar, and the bar having the highest linearity is extracted.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 通过对分段实现的数字识别继续切分得到多个识别候选,并通过连接信息从候选中选出最佳识别候选,从而避免连续数字被错误识别。 一种正确识别手写字符尤其是支票中数字的方法包括以下步骤:对待识别字符集进行画线分析,提取块排列特征,提出货币假设 单位类型,最后验证上述假设,显示字符识别结果。 此外,该方法可以可靠地将手写字符与为输入字符而打印的条或手写的条区分开来,并且将条条从字符识别的对象中消除以单独提取字符。 在检测柱线时,利用下柱线、中柱线、上柱线、倾斜柱线、倾斜下柱线和倾斜上柱线六种公式来确定柱线的确定性因子,具有 提取最高的线性度。
发明人: KAMEYAMA, HIROFUMI | MIKI, SHOJI | TSUBOTA, HIROKI

标题: Bonding apparatus
摘要: A bonding apparatus with an optical detecting device that detects any positional discrepancy between first and second parts which are to be bonded together, the optical detecting device including an optical probe that comprises: first and second image acquisition prisms which respectively reflect, in different directions, first and second images of the first and second parts respectively; a first optical system introduction prism (or mirrors) which causes the first image of the first part that passes through the first image acquisition prism to be reflected an even number of times and then sends this first image to a first image pick-up device through a first focusing device; and a second optical system introduction prism which causes the second image of the second part that passes through the second image acquisition prism to be reflected an odd number of times and then sends this second image to a second image pick-up device through a second focusing device.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种具有光学检测装置的结合设备,该光学检测装置检测要结合在一起的第一和第二部分之间的任何位置差异,该光学检测装置包括光学探头,该光学探头包括:第一和第二图像采集棱镜,它们分别在不同的方向上反射, 分别是第一部分和第二部分的第一图像和第二图像; 第一光学系统引入棱镜(或反射镜),使通过第一图像采集棱镜的第一部分的第一图像被反射偶数次,然后将此第一图像通过 第一聚焦装置; 第二光学系统引入棱镜,使通过第二图像采集棱镜的第二部分的第二图像被反射奇数次,然后通过第二聚焦将该第二图像发送到第二图像拾取装置 设备。

标题: Method and apparatus for detecting a lane on a road
摘要: The invention is directed to a method and apparatus for detecting a lane on a road, the latter of which includes an edge sensor (ED) for detecting edges indicative of boundaries of opposite sides of each lane, an edge memory (EM) for storing the edges to form a couple of continuous lines of edge groups indicative of the opposite boundaries of the lane, and an image processor (DP) for defining the opposite boundaries of the lane on a plane in a three-dimensional geometry. A center of curvature defining device (RC) defines a center of curvature to the opposite boundaries of the lane. An edge line extracting device (ES) divides the edge groups stored in the edge memory into a plurality of continuous regions each having a predetermined length along a concentric circle arc having the same center as the center of curvature, and extracts a pair of edge lines from each region. A tangent defining device (TL) defines a couple of tangents to the edge lines, and a normal defining device (NL) defines a normal to the tangents. Then, a segment setting device (SD) defines a couple of intersections of the normal with the tangents, and sets a line segment between the intersections as a segment of the lane. The image processor (DP) renews the opposite boundaries of the lane on the basis of the segment of the lane.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 本发明涉及一种用于检测道路上的车道的方法和装置,后者包括用于检测表示每条车道相对侧的边界的边缘的边缘传感器(ED)、用于存储所述车道的边缘存储器(EM)。 边缘以形成一对表示车道相对边界的边缘组的连续线,以及用于在三维几何平面上定义车道相对边界的图像处理器(DP)。 曲率中心限定装置 (RC) 将曲率中心限定到车道的相对边界。 边缘线提取装置(ES)将存储在边缘存储器中的边缘组沿着与曲率中心相同的同心圆弧划分为具有预定长度的多个连续区域,并提取一对边缘线 从每个地区。 切线定义装置 (TL) 定义了两条边线的切线,法线定义装置 (NL) 定义了切线的法线。 然后,线段设置设备(SD)定义法线与切线的一对交点,并将交点之间的线段设置为车道段。 图像处理器(DP)根据车道的分段更新车道的相对边界。
发明人: KAKINAMI, TOSHIAKI | KIMURA, YOSHIKATSU | INOUE, RYO

标题: An object monitoring system
摘要: An object monitoring system includes a camera node (2) for monitoring movement of an object (18) to determine an acquisition time when an image of the object (18) is to be acquired and acquiring the image at the predetermined time. The system includes a camera (6) which is able to monitor moving objects (18), and image processing circuitry (10), responsive to the camera (6), which is able to detect a predetermined moving object (18) from other moving and static objects. From the image acquired, information identifying the object (18) can be automatically extracted. The system is particularly suited to monitoring and discriminating large vehicles (18) from other vehicles over a multi-lane roadway, and acquiring high resolution images of the large vehicles (18) at a predetermined acquisition point (22). Image data acquired by a plurality of camera nodes (2) can be sent over a digital telecommunications network (45) to a central image processing system (42) which can extract vehicle identifying data, such as licence plate details, and obtain information on vehicle travel between nodes(2).
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种对象监视系统,包括摄像机节点(2),用于监视对象(18)的移动以确定要获取对象(18)的图像的获取时间并在预定时间获取图像。 该系统包括能够监视移动物体(18)的摄像机(6)和响应于摄像机(6)的图像处理电路(10),图像处理电路能够从其他移动物体中检测预定的移动物体(18)。 和静态物体。 从所获取的图像中,可以自动提取识别对象(18)的信息。 该系统特别适合于在多车道道路上监视和区分大型车辆(18)与其他车辆,并在预定采集点(22)处采集大型车辆(18)的高分辨率图像。 由多个摄像机节点(2)获取的图像数据可以通过数字电信网络(45)发送到中央图像处理系统(42),中央图像处理系统(42)可以提取车辆识别数据,例如车牌详细信息,并获得关于车辆的信息 在节点之间旅行(2)。

标题: System zum Feststellen einer Bewegung im !berwachungsbereich mehrerer Fernsehkameras
DISPOSITIF DE RECONNAISSANCE VOCALE METTANT EN OEUVRE UNE REGLE SYNTAXIQUE DE PERMUTATION
摘要: L'invention a pour objet un dispositif de reconnaissance vocale comportant un processeur audio (2) pour l'acquisition d'un signal audio et un décodeur linguistique (6) pour déterminer une séquence de mots correspondant au signal audio.Le dispositif est caractérisé en ce que le décodeur linguistique comporte un modèle de langage (8) défini à l'aide d'une grammaire comprenant une règle syntaxique de permutation sans répétition de symboles.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 处理器 (2) 将信号采集电路 (4) 提供的来自麦克风 (3) 的音频信号数字化,并将数字样本转换为从预定字母表中选择的声学符号,而语言解码器 (6) 使用声学模型 (7)  ) 和由基于假设的搜索算法 (9) 实现的语言模型 (8)。 语言模型用于向搜索算法提交假设,确定最可能的单词序列,然后在句子末尾确定最可能的解决方案。
发明人地址: CO THOMSON MULTIMEDIA 46 QUAI ALPHONSE LE GALLO, 92648 BOULOGNE CEDEX, FR | CO THOMSON 46 QUAI ALPHONSE LE GALLO, 92648 BOULOGNE CEDEX, FR

标题: Datarammedannelse for kodningssystem med adaptiv bloklængde
摘要: An audio encoder applies an adaptive block-encoding process to segments of audio information to generate frames of encoded information that are aligned with a reference signal conveying the alignement of a sequence of video information frames. The audio information is analized to determine various characteristics of the audio signal such as the occurence and location of a transient, and a control signal is generated that causes the adaptive block-encoding process to encode segments of varying length. A complementary decoder applies an adaptive block-decoding process to recover the segments of audio information from the frames of encoded information. In embodiments that apply time-domain aliasing cancellation (TDAC) transforms, window functions and transforms are applied according to one of a plurality of segment patterns that define window functions and transform parameters for each segment in a sequence of segments. The segments in each frame of a sequence of overlapping frames may be recovered without aliasing artifacts independently from the recovery of segments in other frames. Window functions are adapted to provide preferred frequency-domain responses and time-domain gain profiles.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 音频编码器将自适应块编码过程应用于音频信息段以生成与传达视频信息帧序列对齐的参考信号对齐的编码信息帧。 分析音频信息以确定音频信号的各种特性,例如瞬变的发生和位置,并且生成控制信号,该控制信号导致自适应块编码过程对可变长度的片段进行编码。 互补解码器应用自适应块解码过程以从编码信息帧中恢复音频信息段。 在应用时域混叠消除(TDAC)变换的实施例中,窗函数和变换是根据多个片段模式中的一个应用的,这些片段模式为片段序列中的每个片段定义窗函数和变换参数。 重叠帧序列的每个帧中的段可以独立于其他帧中的段的恢复而在没有混叠伪像的情况下被恢复。 窗函数适用于提供首选的频域响应和时域增益分布。
发明人: FIELDER, LOUIS, DUNN | TRUMAN, MICHAEL, MEAD
发明人地址: 100 Potrero Avenue San Francisco, CA 94103, US

标题: Method and apparatus for synchronizing, displaying and manipulating text and image documents
发明人: AHN, DON | FLORIO, MICHAEL P | JACKSON, ADAM | KURATA, DEBORAH | RAPPAPORT, IRVING S | RIVETTE, KEVIN G

标题: 放射線画像再生法
摘要:
【課題】 新旧の画像の比較を容易に行う。
【解決手段】 書庫から同定された画像を検索し、モザイク型の画像をつくり、1枚の写真フィルム上に該モザイク型の画像を再生する工程から成る記録媒体上に複数の放射線画像を再生する。
摘要(译)(简体中文):
本发明的一个目的是容易地比较旧图像和新图像。 
 在记录介质上再现多个射线照相图像,包括以下步骤:从档案中检索识别的图像,创建马赛克图像,以及在一张摄影胶片上再现马赛克图像。

标题: Methodology for the efficient management of hierarchically organized information
摘要: A methodology ensures the efficient management of large amounts of hierarchically organized information. The methodology encompasses the efficient copying and sharing of large amounts of hierarchically organized information through an unsharing operation. The efficient comparison of two or more hierarchies of items of files and directories is provided as well by adding the root directories of hierarchies to be compared to a difference list, merging and then eliminating appropriate items in the difference list, and finally expansively recursing upon items left in the difference list. The efficiency of virtually copied, hierarchically organized information is maintained by resharing appropriate items of the hierarchy when appropriate. Finally, the methodology allows a target version of a hierarchy to be automatically updated by default action with changes made in a source version of the hierarchy as a function of identifying the common ancestor revision of a particular item change.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种方法可确保有效管理大量分层组织的信息。 该方法包括通过取消共享操作有效复制和共享大量分层组织的信息。 通过将要比较的层次结构的根目录添加到差异列表,合并然后删除差异列表中的适当项目,最后扩展地递归项目,还提供了文件和目录项目的两个或多个层次结构的有效比较 留在差异列表中。 虚拟复制的、分层组织的信息的效率通过在适当的时候重新共享层次结构的适当项目来保持。 最后,该方法允许层次结构的目标版本通过默认操作自动更新层次结构的源版本中所做的更改,作为识别特定项目更改的共同祖先修订版的功能。
