标题: Digital image processing apparatus
摘要: Digital image processing apparatus (10) for correlating a reference image with an input image at a plurality of correlation positions and for determining a position of best registration thereof includes image data input means (12) for receiving digital data representing the pixel values of said input image, a series of processing cells (40) connected one to another and to said image input means (12) for receiving data there substantially in parallel. Each processing cell (40) includes means (50, 52) for storing a respective reference value representing the value of an associated pixel in the reference image, means for performing a correlation operation on the reference value stored in the processing cell (40) and the input image data supplied to the processing cell to determine partial correlation data, and partial correlation data output means for outputting partial correlation data, wherein each processing cell downstream of the first cell in the series includes partial correlation data input means for receiving the partial correlation data from the previous cell (40), and the last processing cell in the series has correlation data output means for outputting a stream of digital correlation data indicating the degree of correlation at each of the correlation positions.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 用于在多个相关位置将参考图像与输入图像相关并用于确定其最佳配准位置的数字图像处理设备(10)包括用于接收表示所述输入的像素值的数字数据的图像数据输入装置(12) 图像,一系列处理单元(40)彼此连接并连接到所述图像输入装置(12),用于在那里基本上并行地接收数据。 每个处理单元(40)包括用于存储表示参考图像中相关像素的值的相应参考值的装置(50、52)、用于对存储在处理单元(40)中的参考值执行相关运算的装置以及 提供给处理单元以确定部分相关数据的输入图像数据,以及用于输出部分相关数据的部分相关数据输出装置,其中该系列中第一单元下游的每个处理单元包括用于接收部分相关的部分相关数据输入装置 来自前一个单元(40)的数据,并且该系列中的最后一个处理单元具有相关数据输出装置,用于输出指示每个相关位置的相关程度的数字相关数据流。

标题: Control means and method for optical inspection system
摘要: CONTROL MEANS AND METHOD FOR OPTICAL INSPECTION SYSTEM Abstract of the Disclosure Operation of system components is automatically monitored, controlled and coordinated. The presence at an inspection station of each successive one of the objects to be inspected is automatically detected. Inspection of each such object commences in response to its detection when the monitoring of other system components indicates that they are ready for commencement of the new inspection cycle. The inspection system includes a rotatable disk having mask apertures that move into the line of sight of a light detector. Signals produced by scanning of timing marks upon the disk reflect which one of the plurality of masks is present in the optical path, and determine the intensity of the transform image sampled by said mask means.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 光学检查系统的控制手段和方法 公开内容摘要 系统组件的操作是自动监控、控制和协调的。 自动检测每个连续的要检查的对象在检查站的存在。 当对其他系统组件的监测表明它们已准备好开始新的检查周期时,响应于其检测开始对每个此类对象的检查。 该检查系统包括一个可旋转的圆盘,该圆盘具有移动到光检测器的视线中的掩模孔。 通过扫描盘上的定时标记产生的信号反映多个掩模中的哪一个存在于光路中,并确定由所述掩模装置采样的变换图像的强度。

标题: 辞書検索方式
摘要: PURPOSE:To attain the high speed of the retrieving processing of a dictionary by reducing the number of times of operating both a reading operation and an coincidence detecting operation, and operating a reading means, detecting means, and decision means independently. CONSTITUTION:Candidate elements obtained after adding one character of a character bank to which a reference number is applied, which is different with each other, as an escape character, are divided into plural groups based on the escape character. And also, both the reference number which is applied to one of the candidate elements that belong to each group, and identification information corresponding to this candidate element, are stored in an index 111, according to information concerning the reference number and the escape character. Then, the reference number which is applied to one of the other candidate elements that belong to the same group with the candidate element to which this reference number is applied, and the information corresponding to this candidate element, are stored in a list 112, according to the reference number. Thus, the identification information corresponding to the candidate elements connected by a pointer, for example, the escape characters, are successively read out from the list 112, following the index 111.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 目的:通过减少读取操作和重合检测操作的操作次数,以及独立操作读取装置、检测装置和判定装置来实现字典检索处理的高速化。 组成:在添加一个字符库的一个字符后获得的候选元素,其中一个字符库应用了一个参考号,这是相互不同的,作为一个转义字符,根据转义字符分为多个组。 而且,根据与参考号和转义字符有关的信息,应用于属于每个组的候选元素之一的参考号和对应于该候选元素的标识信息都存储在索引111中。 然后,应用到与应用了该参考号的候选元素属于同一组的其他候选元素之一的参考号,以及对应于该候选元素的信息,被存储在列表112中,根据 到参考号。 这样,在索引111之后,依次从列表112中读出由指针连接的候选元素所对应的标识信息,例如转义字符。

标题: 音声認識方法
摘要:
【目的】 1名から数名の少数話者が発声した認識対象音声を用いて不特定話者の音声の認識を可能にし、容易に認識対象音声が変更でき、しかも高い認識率を得ることができる音声認識方法を提供することを目的とする。
【構成】 まず認識対象音声を1名または数名の少数話者が発声し、音響分析部1で分析し特徴パラメータを求め、あらかじめ標準パターン格納部3に格納されている多数の話者で作成した汎用の標準パターンとの類似度を分析時間毎に求め、強調関数に通してフレーム毎に正規化を行い、各類似度について時間方向の回帰係数を求めてフレーム毎に正規化し、類似度と回帰係数の時系列をパラメータとして、DP重み計算部10で求めたDPの重みと共に辞書格納部11に登録しておく。認識時には不特定話者の入力音声から辞書登録時と同様にしてパラメータ時系列を求め、辞書格納部に格納されているDP重みにしたがってパターンマッチング部12で辞書とのDPマッチングを行い認識する。
摘要(译)(简体中文):
[目的] 可以通过使用一个或几个少数民族说话者的语音来识别未指定说话者的语音,容易改变要识别的语音,并获得高识别率。本发明的目的是提供一种语音识别方法 
 【结构】首先由一个或少数几个说话人发出要识别的语音,然后由声学分析单元1分析得到特征参数,再由预先存储在识别系统中的大量说话人创建。标准模式存储单元 3. 每一分析时间得到与通用标准模式的相似度,通过增强函数对每一帧进行归一化,对每一相似度得到时间方向的回归系数,对每一帧进行归一化,并且回归系数的相似度和时间序列与DP权重计算单元10获得的DP权重作为参数一起登记在字典存储单元11中。 在识别时,与登记字典时相同的方式从未指定说话者的输入语音中获得参数时间序列,并且模式匹配单元12根据DP权重与字典进行DP匹配存储在字典存储单元中以供识别。

标题: Process and device for detecting print registration marks on a web from a multi-color printing press
摘要: A process consists of detecting a printed registration mark composed of recognition signals and of a color pilot mark, comparing the image of the signs of the printed registration mark to the signs of a virtual reference registration mark, then defining a basic area for each sign, calculating a geometric center of every basic area, detecting any color pilot mark in these basic areas, calculating and memorizing the geometric center for the detected pilot mark, measuring an offset position between the geometric center of the basic area and the geometric center of the detected color pilot mark and utiliziing the measured offset position for controlling a misregistration correction appliance of a printing press. The device for accomplishing the process includes an arrangement for performing each of the above-mentioned steps.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一个过程包括检测由识别信号和颜色引导标记组成的打印注册标记,将打印注册标记的符号图像与虚拟参考注册标记的符号进行比较,然后为每个标记定义一个基本区域, 计算每个基本区域的几何中心, 检测这些基本区域中的任意颜色引导标记, 计算并存储检测到的引导标记的几何中心, 测量基本区域的几何中心与被检测的几何中心的偏移位置 颜色引导标记并利用测量的偏移位置来控制印刷机的套准错误校正装置。 完成该过程的装置包括用于执行上述每个步骤的装置。

标题: Motion-compensated picture signal interpolation
摘要: In a motion-compensated picture signal interpolation apparatus comprising switched memories (SMX,LM) for furnishing motion-compensated pixel values corresponding to at least two motion vectors (±d, 0), the motion-compensated pixel values are processed by an ordered statistical filter (MED).

标题: System, method and article of manufacture for increasing the user value of recommendations
摘要: The invention includes a system, method and article of manufacture for generating a serendipity-weighted recommendation output set to a user based, at least in part, on a serendipity function. The system includes a processing system of one or more processors configured to receive applicable data that includes item recommendation data and community item popularity data. The processing system is also configured to produce a set of item serendipity control values in response to the serendipity function and the community item popularity data, and to combine the item recommendation data with the set of item serendipity control values to produce a serendipity-weighted and filtered recommendation output set. The method includes receiving applicable data by the processing system, including inputting item recommendation data and community item popularity data. The method further includes generating a set of item serendipity control values in response to the community item popularity data and a serendipity function, using the processing system, and combining the item recommendation data and the set of item serendipity control values to produce a serendipity-weighted and filtered item recommendation output set, also using the processing system. The invention also includes a computer readable medium having a having a set of program instructions physically embodied thereon, executable by a computer, to perform a method similar to the method described above.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 本发明包括用于至少部分地基于偶然性函数为用户生成偶然性加权推荐输出集的系统、方法和制品。 该系统包括一个或多个处理器的处理系统,该处理器被配置为接收适用数据,该数据包括项目推荐数据和社区项目流行度数据。 处理系统还被配置为响应偶然性函数和社区项目流行度数据产生一组项目偶然性控制值,并将项目推荐数据与该组项目偶然性控制值组合以产生偶然性加权和 过滤后的推荐输出集。 该方法包括由处理系统接收适用数据,包括输入项目推荐数据和社区项目流行度数据。 该方法还包括响应于社区项目流行度数据和偶然性函数生成一组项目偶然性控制值,使用处理系统,以及组合项目推荐数据和该组项目偶然性控制值以产生偶然性加权 和过滤项目推荐输出集,也使用处理系统。 本发明还包括具有一组程序指令的计算机可读介质,该程序指令物理地体现在其上,可由计算机执行,以执行类似于上述方法的方法。

标题: Method and apparatus of automatically identifying faults in a machine vision measuring system
摘要: An apparatus and method for automatically identifying faults in the operation of a machine vision measuring systems provides an improved self-diagnostic capability for machine vision based metrology and tracking systems. The method and apparatus validate performance of tracking operations, and detect deterioration that may be caused by electronic noise, environmental contamination, etc. A mathematical model of the target visualized by the system is created and stored. A target is imaged in the field and fiducials of the target are identified. Centroid positions of detected fiducials of the imaged target are compared to the centroid positions of fiducials in the mathematical model. When a fiducial is obscured or dirty, its geometric characteristics (such as centroid, brightness, edge smoothness, area, or shape) differ from the true or idealized values of the characteristics. Values representing detected fiducials are discarded when the offset exceeds predetermined criteria, or when its properties vary from ideal. If the remaining number of detected fiducials is below a predetermined threshold, a warning message is displayed or an error is generated. Thus, when a fault is detected that degrades performance beyond a preset tolerance, the fault is flagged for attention and a suggested corrective action is displayed.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种用于自动识别机器视觉测量系统操作中的故障的设备和方法为基于机器视觉的计量和跟踪系统提供了改进的自诊断能力。 该方法和装置验证跟踪操作的性能,并检测可能由电子噪声、环境污染等引起的劣化。创建并存储由系统可视化的目标的数学模型。 目标在场中成像并识别目标的基准点。 将检测到的成像目标基准的质心位置与数学模型中基准的质心位置进行比较。 当基准被遮挡或弄脏时,其几何特征(例如质心、亮度、边缘平滑度、面积或形状)与特征的真实值或理想化值不同。 当偏移量超过预定标准或当其属性与理想值不同时,代表检测到的基准点的值将被丢弃。 如果检测到的基准点的剩余数量低于预定阈值,则显示警告消息或生成错误。 因此,当检测到性能下降超过预设容差的故障时,会标记该故障以引起注意并显示建议的纠正措施。
发明人: JACKSON, DAVID A. | SHROFF, HOSHANG | CHRISTIAN, DONALD J. | GLICKMAN, STEPHEN

标题: Systems and methods for identifying images
摘要: Systems and methods are disclosed that employ facial recognition to create, maintain and use databases that store data records of individuals. In particular, systems and methods are disclosed that employ facial recognition to control the production of identification cards that include an image of a person's face and demographic data. Preferrably, the systems and methods include lensing modules adapted for efficiently identifying within a picture image the location of a person's face.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 公开了采用面部识别来创建、维护和使用存储个人数据记录的数据库的系统和方法。 特别地,公开了采用面部识别来控制包括人的面部图像和人口统计数据的身份证的生产的系统和方法。 优选地,所述系统和方法包括透镜模块,所述透镜模块适于在图片图像内有效地识别人脸的位置。

标题: Method and device for detecting voice activity
摘要: The invention relates to a device intended for detecting in successive frames containing voice signals mixed with noise from various sources the periods of speech and those of only noise. By calculating for each frame its energy and the zero-crossing rate of its centered noise signal and by comparing these magnitudes with adaptive threshold values, the real state of the device is detected, which leads to specific controls adapted for each state.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 本发明涉及一种装置,用于在包含语音信号的连续帧中检测与来自各种源的噪声混合的语音周期和仅噪声的周期。 通过为每一帧计算其能量和其中心噪声信号的过零率,并将这些幅度与自适应阈值进行比较,检测设备的真实状态,从而针对每个状态进行特定控制。

标题: Metod att detektera en talsignal i närvaro av brus samt anordning för att genomföra metoden
摘要: A method and apparatus for detecting the polarity of successive samples of voice signals and generating a pulse in response to a predetermined polarity sequence of successive samples occurring for a minimum duration of time. The sequence of polarity is either one positive sample followed by one negative sample for a minimum duration of 2 milliseconds or 16 samples of one sign followed by x samples of the opposite sign, wherein x may vary between 4 and 8, for a minimum duration of 3 milliseconds. Also, since the invention is amplitude insensitive, it is incorporated with and acts complementary to, an amplitude sensitive speech detection device.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种方法和装置,用于检测语音信号的连续样本的极性,并响应于出现最短持续时间的连续样本的预定极性序列而生成脉冲。 极性序列是一个正样本后跟一个负样本,持续时间最短为 2 毫秒,或者一个符号的 16 个样本后跟相反符号的 x 个样本,其中 x 可以在 4 到 8 之间变化,持续时间最短为 3 毫秒。 此外,由于本发明对幅度不敏感,因此它与幅度敏感语音检测设备结合并与之互补。

标题: Unüberwachte Anpassung eines Spracherkenners unter Verwendung zuverlässiger Informationen aus den besten N Rechenhypothesen
摘要(译)(简体中文): 系统使用识别器执行无监督语音模型适配，以产生用于输入话语的N最佳解决方案。这些N-best解决方案中的每一个都通过可靠的信息提取过程进行测试。通过基于由识别器生成的似然分数的加权技术或通过非线性阈值函数来提取可靠信息。该系统可以在单次通过实现中使用，或者在多次通过实现中迭代地使用。<IMAGE>

标题: Motion vector calculation method using sequential minimum distortion calculations at different densities
摘要: The present invention improves a digital signal processor, more particularly, calculation methods for motion compensation in reduceing a required amount of calculations when an amount of distortion between a last frame block and a current frame block; in processing a direct memory access at a higher efficiency; in processing a subdivided data calculation at a higher speed; in processing a branch instruction occurring in the pipeline process at a higher efficiency; and in processing an interruption occurring in a repeat process operation at greater convenience, and furthermore in reducing a required amount of calculations through minimum distortion searching processes hierarchized.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 本发明改进了数字信号处理器,更具体地,改进了运动补偿的计算方法,以减少在最后帧块和当前帧块之间的失真量时所需的计算量。 以更高的效率处理直接内存访问; 以更高的速度处理细分数据计算; 以更高的效率处理流水线过程中出现的分支指令; 并且在处理重复处理操作中发生的中断时更加方便,并且通过分层的最小失真搜索处理减少了所需的计算量。

标题: System and method for performing defined actions when grafting the name space of one storage medium into the name space of another storage medium
摘要: The present invention allows arbitrary actions to be performed when grafting the name space of one device into the name space of the same or another device. Grafting of the name space of one device into the name space of the same or another device creates a logical name space that can be presented to the user to allow the user to access information in a logically consistent manner. Active mount points are created by adding an active mount point attribute to a file or directory. When an I/O request processed by an I/O system encounters an active mount point, it turns control for processing the active mount point over to an active mount point driver. The active mount point driver assumes responsibility for processing the I/O request. In processing the I/O request, the active mount point driver decides what action should be taken to further processing of the I/O request. To further processing of the I/O request, the active mount point driver may utilize information from a variety of sources as well as make requests to other processes, drivers, systems, subsystems, devices, and so forth. Such actions may include those normally associated with an I/O request such as retrieving and mounting appropriate media as well as actions not normally associated with an I/O request.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 本发明允许在将一个设备的名称空间移植到相同或另一设备的名称空间时执行任意动作。 将一个设备的名称空间移植到同一设备或另一个设备的名称空间中会创建一个逻辑名称空间,该名称空间可以呈现给用户以允许用户以逻辑上一致的方式访问信息。 活动挂载点是通过将活动挂载点属性添加到文件或目录来创建的。 当 I/O 系统处理的 I/O 请求遇到活动挂载点时,它将处理活动挂载点的控制权交给活动挂载点驱动程序。 活动安装点驱动程序承担处理 I/O 请求的责任。 在处理 I/O 请求时,活动安装点驱动程序决定应该采取什么操作来进一步处理 I/O 请求。 为了进一步处理 I/O 请求,活动安装点驱动程序可以利用来自各种来源的信息以及向其他进程、驱动程序、系统、子系统、设备等发出请求。 这样的动作可以包括那些通常与 I/O 请求相关联的动作,例如检索和安装适当的媒体以及通常不与 I/O 请求相关联的动作。

标题: Verfahren und Vorrichtung zur Ausrichtung eines Satzes von Bildern
摘要(译)(简体中文): 为了确定一组记录图像的方向，扫描记录的图像。扫描操作获得关于在分开的记录图像中不对称分布的至少一个场景特征的信息。获得至少一个场景特征的每个记录图像的方向的概率估计被确定为场景特征的分布不对称的函数。根据该组中每个记录图像的方向的概率估计来确定该组记录图像的方向概率。 <IMAGE>

标题: Fuzzy controller for selecting an input signal
摘要: In a fuzzy controller comprising a fuzzy inference device for subjecting one or a plurality of input signals to fuzzy inference operations using membership functions in accordance with a predetermined rule and outputting a non-fuzzy value determined on the basis of the results of the inferences, there are provided an input signal level converter for converting signal levels of the input signals on the input side of the fuzzy inference device and an output signal level converter for converting a signal level of the output signal on the output side of the fuzzy inference device.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 在一个模糊控制器中,包括模糊的推理设备,用于对一个或多个输入信号进行多个输入信号,使用成员函数根据预定规则进行模糊推理操作,并根据推论结果确定的非模糊值,并输出一个非模糊值提供了一个输入信号级转换器,用于转换模糊推理设备输入侧的输入信号的信号级别和输出信号级别转换器,用于转换模糊推理设备输出端的输出信号的信号级别。

标题: Übertragungssystem für verteilte Datenbanken.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 分布式数据库通信网络系统包括多个终端站（12a，12b，12c），它们分别包含数据库设备（15）并且通过数据通信线路（14）相互关联。在这些站中的每一个中提供数据库管理装置（16），并且包括用于监视内部站（12a）的内部数据库设备（15）的访问负载的内部负载监视器设备（20）和外部负载监视器设备（24），用于监视外部终端站（12b，12c）的数据库设备的访问负载。数据库负载分配管理设备（28）连接到监控设备（20,24），并自动地将内部数据库设备的至少一部分数据库信息传送到所选择的一个（12c）当内部数据库访问负载超过最大允许级别时，外部终端站，从而增强了通信网络系统的数据库负载的分布均匀性。
发明人: MORIMOTO YOJIRO INTELLECTUAL P,JP | MURANAGA MIHO INTELLECTUAL PRO,JP | SEKIGUCHI KOUICHI INTELLECTUAL,JP | YAMASHITA YOSHIKAZU INTELLECTU,JP

标题: Method and system for the detection of lesions in medical images
摘要: A method and system for the automated detection of lesions in the medical images. Medical images, such as mammograms are segmented and optionally processing with peripheral enhancement and/or modified median filtering. A modified morphological open operation (104-106) and filtering with a modified mass filter (107-109) are performed for the initial detection of circumscribed lesions. Then, the lesions are matched using a deformable shape template with Fourier descriptors (110-112). Characterization of the match is done using simulated annealing, and measuring the circularity and density characteristics of the suspected lesion. The procedure is performed iteratively at different spatial resolution in which at each resolution step a specific lesion size is detected. The detection of the lesion leads to a localization of a suspicious region and thus the likelyhood of cancer.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种用于自动检测医学图像中的病变的方法和系统。 诸如乳房X线照片的医学图像被分割并且可选地使用外围增强和/或修改的中值滤波进行处理。 执行修改的形态学打开操作 (104-106) 和使用修改的质量过滤器 (107-109) 的过滤,以对限定的病变进行初始检测。 然后,使用具有傅里叶描述符的可变形形状模板匹配病变 (110-112)。 匹配的表征是使用模拟退火完成的,并测量可疑病变的圆形度和密度特征。 该过程以不同的空间分辨率迭代地执行,其中在每个分辨率步骤中检测到特定的病变大小。 病变的检测导致可疑区域的定位,从而导致癌症的可能性。

标题: PROCEDE DE DETECTION DE SATURATION D'UN CHAMP DE VECTEURS MOUVEMENT
摘要: Le procédé est caractérisé en ce qu'il effectue :- un comptage du nombre de vecteurs mouvement dont au moins une composante est supérieure à une valeur prédéterminée inférieure à la valeur maximale,- une comparaison de ce nombre à au moins un seuil prédéterminé,et en ce que le champ de vecteurs mouvement est déclaré saturant si ce nombre est supérieur au seuil prédéterminé. Les applications concernent l'interpolation d'images.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 矢量场饱和检测方法具有计数器(1),其对高于预定值和低于最大数量的矢量移动的次数进行计数。 估计器将该数字与预定水平进行比较,并且当矢量运动场高于预定水平时宣布饱和。

标题: 数据库系统和访问数据库的方法
摘要: 在一个数据库系统中，有关访问数据库系统的访问信息使用包含用户至用户信息的呼叫控制信息在控制过程内发送，该控制过程限定信号信道上的呼叫的连接。这使得这种数据库的访问方法提供改进的通信线路的使用率和数据库系统的提高的运行率，并使用户享受到减少的通信费用。
摘要(译)(简体中文): 在一个数据库系统中，有关访问数据库系统的访问信息使用包含用户至用户信息的呼叫控制信息在控制过程内发送，该控制过程限定信号信道上的呼叫的连接。这使得这种数据库的访问方法提供改进的通信线路的使用率和数据库系统的提高的运行率，并使用户享受到减少的通信费用。

标题: Automated method and system for the segmentation of medical images
摘要: A method for the automated segmentation of medical images, including generating image data from radiographic images of the breast. The method is applicable to breast mammograms including the extraction of the skinline as well as correction for non-uniform exposure conditions, hand radiographs, and chest radiographs. Techniques for the segmentation include noise filtering, local gray value range determination, modified global histogram analysis, region growing and determination of object contour. The method also is applicable to skin detection and analysis of skin thickening in medical images, where image segmentation, local optimization of external skinline, creation of a gradient image, identification of the internal skinline and then skin thickness determination are carried out. The method for enhancement of medical images includes, after image segmentation and identification of the skinline, calculation of pixel distances from the skinline, determination of the enhancement parameter fit and then selective enhancement of the periphery.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种用于自动分割医学图像的方法,包括从乳房的放射线图像生成图像数据。 该方法适用于乳房 X 线照片,包括皮肤线的提取以及对非均匀曝光条件的校正、手部 X 线片和胸部 X 线片。 分割技术包括噪声过滤、局部灰度值范围确定、改进的全局直方图分析、区域增长和对象轮廓的确定。 该方法也适用于医学图像中的皮肤检测和皮肤增厚分析,其中进行图像分割、外部皮肤线的局部优化、梯度图像的创建、内部皮肤线的识别以及皮肤厚度的确定。 医学图像的增强方法包括在图像分割和皮肤线识别后,计算距皮肤线的像素距离,确定增强参数拟合度,然后对周边进行选择性增强。

标题: Method of binarization in an optical character recognition system
摘要: A method of binarization used in an OCR system involves in determining text pixels by checking, for each pixel, that the difference between its value and the values of a plurality of pixels located at a predetermined distance therefrom is greater than a relative threshold corresponding to the difference in intensities between the text and the background of the image, subsampling the image at a rate corresponding to at least two pixels in order to detect kernels of text, and then binarizing the image pixels only in tiles of several stroke width sides containing text kernels by using in each tile, an absolute threshold estimated in that tile. The determining of text pixels includes, for each analyzed pixel, checking that either one of the differences between the value of the analyzed pixel and the value of the two pixels located at each intersection of a circle with each one of the row line, column line and both lines at the angle of 45 degrees, is greater than the relative threshold where that circle is centered at the location of the analyzed pixel and has a radius equal to the stroke width.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 在 OCR 系统中使用的二值化方法涉及通过检查每个像素的值与位于距其预定距离处的多个像素的值之间的差值是否大于对应于该像素的相对阈值来确定文本像素。 文本和图像背景之间的强度差异,以对应于至少两个像素的速率对图像进行二次采样以检测文本内核,然后仅在包含文本内核的几个笔画宽度边的平铺中对图像像素进行二值化 通过在每个图块中使用,在该图块中估计的绝对阈值。 文本像素的确定包括,对于每个分析像素,检查分析像素的值与位于与行线、列线中的每一个的圆的每个交点处的两个像素的值之间的差值中的任何一个 并且两条线都呈 45 度角,大于相对阈值,其中该圆以所分析像素的位置为中心并且半径等于笔划宽度。
发明人: HEILPER, ANDREI | NAVON, YAAKOV | WALACH, EUGENE

标题: DISPOSITIF DE RECONNAISSANCE DE LA FORME D'UN OBJET
摘要: Device for recognising the shape of an object. This device comprises means 7, 8, 9, 10 for rotationally driving the optical beam 5 so that, during passage of an object to be recognised, the beam is interrupted on each rotation, on at least a part of the trajectory of the optical beam 51, means 11, 13 for producing a signal S1 referencing an origin of the rotation of this beam, an electronic assembly 42, 43, 44, 45 receiving the reference signal S1 and a signal S2 which is a function of the duration of interruption of the beam 51 by the object, this assembly producing a value pair indicating the object to be recognised, a memory 45 for initially receiving a set of these value pairs of an object to be recognised and serving as reference,; a comparator included in the electronic assembly 44 and comparing the value pairs initially placed in memory with the value pairs measured on an object to be recognised.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 识别物体形状的装置。 该装置包括用于旋转驱动光束5的装置7、8、9、10,使得在待识别物体通过期间,光束在每次旋转时在光束轨迹的至少一部分上被中断 在图51中,用于产生参考该光束的旋转原点的信号S1的装置11、13,接收参考信号S1和信号S2的电子组件42、43、44、45,信号S2是中断持续时间的函数。 光束51由对象,该组件产生指示要识别的对象的值对,存储器45用于初始接收要识别的对象的一组这些值对并用作参考; 比较器包括在电子组件44中,并将最初放置在存储器中的值对与在要识别的物体上测量的值对进行比较。

标题: Medical image filing system enabling registration and retrieval of a plurality of medical images
摘要: In an image filing system in accordance with the present invention, image files containing images that should be displayed on a viewing monitor in a conference unit are selected from among retrieved image files using a mouse. A CPU determines how many image files are selected using the mouse and identifies management information contained in the selected image files. Under the control of the CPU, images in a work memory are temporarily stored in an image processor. The images in the image processor are displayed on a retrieval monitor. Management information contained in the selected image files and the number of selected image files are supplied from the CPU to a controller over a bus. Reduced images provided in the form of digital data and contained in the selected image files in the image processor are supplied to a D/A converter under the control of the controller. The D/A converter de-quantizes the digital data into analog data so as to display the reduced images on the viewing monitor.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 在根据本发明的图像归档系统中,使用鼠标从检索到的图像文件中选择包含应该在会议单元的观看监视器上显示的图像的图像文件。  CPU 确定使用鼠标选择了多少个图像文件,并识别包含在所选图像文件中的管理信息。 在CPU的控制下,工作存储器中的图像被临时存储在图像处理器中。 图像处理器中的图像显示在检索监视器上。 选择的图像文件中包含的管理信息和选择的图像文件的数量通过总线从CPU提供给控制器。 以数字数据的形式提供并包含在图像处理器中的选定图像文件中的缩小图像在控制器的控制下被提供给D/A转换器。  D/A转换器将数字数据反量化为模拟数据,以便在观看监视器上显示缩小的图像。
发明人: HIYAMA, KEIICHI | SASAGAWA, KATSUYOSHI | KAZAWA, ATSUSHI
发明人地址: Akishima, JP | Shirakawa, JP | Hachioji, JP

标题: Self-controlled vision system
摘要: Apparatus is disclosed for viewing a target volume by two spaced apart viewing means (3) which create respective two dimensional video picture frame signals. The picture frame signals are divided into discrete areas. It there is an image change in one of the discrete areas then analysing means (7,9,11,13,14,15,17,21,31) provides control signals which feed a reaction providing means (19,5), which in turn is then responsive to a change of an object within the target volume.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 公开了一种通过两个间隔开的观察装置 (3) 观察目标体积的设备,这两个观察装置分别创建二维视频图像帧信号。 图像帧信号被分成离散的区域。 如果在一个离散区域中存在图像变化,则分析装置 (7、9、11、13、14、15、17、21、31) 提供控制信号,该信号馈送到反应提供装置 (19,5),该装置 然后反过来响应目标体积内对象的变化。
法律状态/事件: 权利终止 | 权利转移

标题: Method of identifying objects
摘要: A plurality of objects are identified by the steps of preparing a reference pattern B comprising picture image data of a predetermined number and representing the brightness relating to the configuration of the objects; extracting a brightness pattern A comprising a predetermined number of picture image data among picture image data in a predetermined field of view in which the objects presents; and determining the correlation between the reference pattern B and the brightness pattern A so as to judge as to whether the brightness pattern A is the brightness pattern related to the configuration of the objects. When determining the correlation, average values of respective patterns are subtracted respe- tively from the brightness pattern and the reference pattern to obtain patterns A' and B' obtained by converting then in connection with deviations from the average values. A pattern A" is obtained by normalizing pattern A' and the inner products of patterns A" and B' and of patterns A' and B' are determined. These two inner products are used as a reference value for identifying the objects.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 通过准备参考图案B的步骤来识别多个物体,该参考图案B包括预定数量的图片图像数据并表示与物体的配置相关的亮度; 在物体出现的预定视场中的图片图像数据中提取包括预定数量的图片图像数据的亮度模式A; 判断参考图案B与亮度图案A的相关性,以判断亮度图案A是否为与物体形态相关的亮度图案。 在确定相关性时,分别从亮度图案和参考图案中减去各个图案的平均值,以获得通过随后与平均值的偏差进行转换而获得的图案A和B。 通过对模式A进行归一化得到模式A”,并确定模式A”和B的内积以及模式A和B的内积。 这两个内积用作识别对象的参考值。

标题: Vorrichtung zum detektieren von schnitten in einer videosequenz
摘要: Apparatus for detecting a cut in a video comprises arrangements for acquiring video images from a source, for deriving from the video images a pixel-based difference metric, for deriving from the video images a distribution-based difference metric, and for measuring video content of the video images to provide up-to-date test criteria. Arrangements are included for combining the pixel-based difference metric and the distribution-based difference metric, taking into account the up-to-date test criteria provided so as to derive a scene change candidate signal and for filtering the scene change candidate signal so as to generate a scene change frame list.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 用于检测视频中的剪辑的装置包括用于从源获取视频图像、用于从视频图像导出基于像素的差异度量、用于从视频图像导出基于分布的差异度量以及用于测量视频内容的装置。 视频图像以提供最新的测试标准。 包括用于组合基于像素的差异度量和基于分布的差异度量的布置,考虑到提供的最新测试标准以便导出场景改变候选信号和用于过滤场景改变候选信号以便 生成场景变化帧列表。
[标]当前申请(专利权)人: 西门斯集团研究股份有限公司
发明人: LIOU, SHIH-PING | LOCHING, DAVID L. | ARMAN, FARSHID
发明人地址: 3 ORLY COURT, ROBBINSVILLE, NJ 08691 (US) | 3131 MAPLE ROAD, HUNTINGDON VALLEY, PA 19006 (US) | 5 KIERNAN WAY, HAMILTON, NJ 08690 (US)

标题: Reusable heat-sensitive transfer element
摘要: A reusable heat-sensitive transfer recording element which comprises a foundation and an ink-containing layer provided on the foundation, said ink-containing layer comprising porous particles impregnated with a heat-meltable ink and a binder material for bonding the particles to each other, said binder material being substantially incompatible with the heat-meltable ink. With the present transfer elements, printed images having a high optical density can be obtained from the initial use thereof and printed images having such high optical density can be obtained at every repeated use.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种可重复使用的热敏转印记录元件,包括基底和设置在基底上的含墨层,所述含墨层包含浸渍有可热熔墨的多孔颗粒和用于将颗粒彼此粘合的粘合剂材料, 所述粘合剂材料与可热熔油墨基本上不相容。 使用本转印元件,可以从其初始使用获得具有高光密度的印刷图像,并且每次重复使用都可以获得具有这种高光密度的印刷图像。
[标]当前申请(专利权)人: 富士可比安股份有限公司
发明人: SHIMAZAKI, YOSHIKAZU | SHIMIZU, SUEKICHI | NAKAJIMA, NOBUYUKI

标题: Wireless voice-activated device for control of a processor-based host system
摘要: A hand-held wireless voice-activated device (10) for controlling a host system (11), such as a computer connected to the World Wide Web. The device (10) has a display (10a), a microphone (10b), and a wireless transmitter (10g) and receiver (10h). It may also have a processor (10e) and memory (10f) for performing voice recognition. A device (20) can be specifically designed for Web browsing, by having a processor (20e) and memory (20f) that perform both voice recognition and interpretation of results of the voice recognition.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种手持无线语音激活设备(10),用于控制主机系统(11),例如连接到万维网的计算机。 设备(10)具有显示器(10a)、麦克风(10b)以及无线发射器(10g)和接收器(10h)。 它还可以具有用于执行语音识别的处理器(10e)和存储器(10f)。 通过具有执行语音识别和语音识别结果解释的处理器(20e)和存储器(20f),设备(20)可以专门设计用于Web浏览。
发明人: THRIFT, PHILIP R. | HEMPHILL, CHARLES T.

标题: Dynamische Selektion eines logischen Elementdatenformats HINTERGRUND DER EREINDUNGFachgebiet der Erfindung
摘要: The data portion of a logical element in a document is dynamically modified as the data is created or edited. A decision as to what data format will be used is based on logical element characteristics such as the parent of the logical element, for example section, and the sequence of the logical element among the other children of the parent, for example first or subsequent paragraph within a section.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 文档中逻辑元素的数据部分随着数据的创建或编辑而动态修改。 关于将使用什么数据格式的决定是基于逻辑元素的特征,例如逻辑元素的父元素,例如部分,以及逻辑元素在父元素的其他子元素中的顺序,例如第一段或后续段落 一个部分内。
发明人: BARKER BARBARA ANN,US | EDEL THOMAS R,US | STARK JEFFREY A,US

标题: An improved method of character recognitionand apparatus therefor
摘要: This invention relates to an improved method of recognizing a character on a sheet of paper (3). By utilizing the method according to the present invention, characters or figures which have been unrecognizable by ordinary ways of distinction becomes much more automatically readable, due to the incorporation of an additional method of character-frame discrimination followed by synthesizing both of the results of distinctions in terms of features and frame- construction of the character.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 本发明涉及一种改进的识别一张纸(3)上的字符的方法。 通过使用根据本发明的方法,由于结合了一种附加的字符框识别方法,然后综合了两种识别结果,因此通过普通的区分方式无法识别的字符或图形变得更加自动可读 在角色的特征和框架结构方面。
[标]当前申请(专利权)人: 住友电气工业株式会社
发明人地址: c/o Sumitomo Electric Ind., Ltd. Osaka Works,1-3, Shimaya 1-chome Konohana-ku Osaka,JP

标题: Auto-scaling controller and method of use therefor
摘要: An auto-scaling controller and a method for use therefor is provided. The control inputs and the control coefficients are multiplied by scaling values. The scaling values are then tuned using a descent-based optimization method in order to optimize system performance.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 提供了一种自动缩放控制器及其使用方法。 控制输入​​和控制系数乘以缩放值。 然后使用基于下降的优化方法调整缩放值,以优化系统性能。
[标]当前申请(专利权)人: 摩托罗拉解决方案公司

标题: Image processing method and apparatus
摘要: An image processing apparatus reads a document image, detects a specific character region of the read document image, and performs character recognition on the detected specific character region. A predetermined number of characters in a character string is extracted and recognized. An extracted character string is registered as an index of the read document image.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 图像处理装置读取文档图像,检测读取的文档图像的特定字符区域,并对检测到的特定字符区域执行字符识别。 提取并识别字符串中预定数量的字符。 提取的字符串被登记为读取的文档图像的索引。

标题: PROCEDE ET DISPOSITIF DE RECONNAISSANCE DE MODULATIONS.
摘要: Le procédé consiste à calculer (3) les paramètres suivants pour chaque raie de spectre d'émission relevé dans la bande de fréquence déterminée, une amplitude moyenne de toutes les raies k des spectres contenus dans la bande de fréquence déterminée, d'un rapport signal à bruit RSBk, un écart type ETk en amplitude de chaque raie du spectre et un coefficient de corrélation COR(k, k') d'amplitude de chaque raie k avec les raies homologues des spectres des émissions contenues dans la bande de fréquence déterminée.; Il consiste également à comparer au travers d'un réseau de neurones les paramètres de chaque spectre d'émission à des paramètres d'émission attendue, et à déclarer qu'une émission correspond à une émission attendue lorsque l'écart détecté par la comparaison entre les paramètres de l'émission et ceux attendus est minimum. Application: reconnaissance modulation.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 该方法包括计算(3)在确定的频带中记录的每条发射谱线的以下参数,包括在确定的频带中的光谱的所有谱线k的平均幅度,与噪声RSBk的信号比,标准频谱的每条线的幅度偏差ETk 和每条线k的幅度的相关系数COR(k,k)与包含在确定频带中的发射频谱的同源线。 它还包括通过神经网络将每个发射光谱的参数与预期发射参数进行比较,并且当通过比较发射参数和预期参数之间的比较检测到的差异最小时,声明发射对应于预期发射。 应用:调制识别。
[标]当前申请(专利权)人: 汤姆森无线电报总公司

标题: Object sorting process
摘要: In an object sorting process, an electric signal sensor is used for scanning the objects to be sorted and for supplying M scanning values corresponding to each object to an evaluation unit. In order to learn to recognize individual objects from the M scanning values of j objects or patterns belonging to one among i classes, a N-dimensional potential function in which N < M is calculated then minimized. Each potential function minimum corresponds to a prototype for one of the i classes, and each prototype contains the information of all i*j sequences of the M scanning values which were used for learning. In order to sort objects in one of the i classes, the sequence of M scanning values for each object is unambiguously associated to a minimum by a synergic process.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 在物体分拣过程中,电信号传感器用于扫描待分拣的物体并将每个物体对应的M个扫描值提供给评估单元。 为了学习从属于 i 个类中的一个的 j 个对象或模式的 M 个扫描值中识别单个对象,然后将计算 N < M 的 N 维势函数最小化。 每个势函数最小值对应第 i 个类之一的原型,每个原型包含用于学习的 M 个扫描值的所有 i*j 个序列的信息。 为了对 i 类中的一个对象进行排序,每个对象的 M 个扫描值序列通过协同过程明确关联到最小值。
[标]当前申请(专利权)人: 弗朗霍夫应用研究促进学会
当前第一申请(专利权)人: FRAUNHOFER-GESELLSCHAFT ZUR FÖRDERUNG DER ANGEWANDTEN FORSCHUNG E.V.
发明人: WAGNER, THOMAS | BÖBEL, FRIEDRICH | BAUER, NORBERT | HAKEN, HERMANN
发明人地址: Spinnereistrasse 20,D-91052 Erlangen,DE | Langenbrucker Weg 11,D-91080 Uttenreuth,DE | Volckamerstrasse 14,D-91058 Erlangen,DE | Pfaffenwaldring 57/4,D-70569 Stuttgart,DE

标题: Programmable computer with automatic translation between source and object code with version control
摘要: A programmable computer which operates by executing rules, each including a rule name, and optionally: input parameters, a set of conditions, a set of actions associated with each condition, and a set of exception handlers. A condition is a logical expression which evaluates to a true or false boolean value, while an action is an executable statement. An exception handler contains executable statements. The computer includes text entry and display means for programming of rules. A rule is displayed with each condition and each action having a row of text. The computer generates a yes/no quadrant into which a programmer may enter sequence numbers, to associate ordered sets of actions with individual conditions. Sequence numbers may be entered not associated with any condition, to define a set of default actions. Upon entering a rule, the computer sequentially evaluates the rule's conditions. Upon a condition evaluating to true, the computer executes the set of actions associated with that condition, then exits the rule. If the rule contains no conditions or none evaluates to true, the set of default actions will be executed, and the rule exited. If, during execution of the rule, the computer detects an exception event, such as a missing datum or other execution error, the computer passes to the rule the name of the detected exception event. If the rule contains an exception handler bearing the same name, the computer will execute the statements within that exception handler.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种可编程计算机,通过执行规则来操作,每个规则包括规则名称,并且可选地:输入参数、一组条件、与每个条件关联的一组动作以及一组异常处理程序。 条件是一个逻辑表达式,其计算结果为真或假布尔值,而操作是可执行语句。 异常处理程序包含可执行语句。 计算机包括用于规则编程的文本输入和显示装置。 显示的规则中的每个条件和每个操作都有一行文本。 计算机生成是/否象限,程序员可以在其中输入序列号,以将有序的动作集与各个条件相关联。 可以输入与任何条件无关的序列号,以定义一组默认操作。 输入规则后,计算机会依次评估该规则的条件。 当条件评估为真时,计算机执行与该条件关联的一组操作,然后退出规则。 如果规则不包含条件或没有条件评估为 true,则将执行默认操作集,并退出规则。 如果在规则执行期间计算机检测到异常事件,例如丢失数据或其他执行错误,则计算机将检测到的异常事件的名称传递给规则。 如果规则包含同名的异常处理程序,计算机将执行该异常处理程序中的语句。
发明人: CHONG, DANIEL T. | KNUDSEN, HELGE | PLAZAK, ZBIGNIEW | ROBERTSON, MICHAEL | TAUGHER, JAMES E. | YAFFE, JOHN
法律状态/事件: 权利终止 | 权利转移

标题: Multimedia computer system
摘要: Full-motion video data with a sub-picture and sound is recorded in a DVD-ROM drive. The DVD-ROM drive is connected to an ATAPI interface. Using a data buffer of the ATAPI interface, an MPEG stream is transferred to an MPEG2 decoder on the system board at a variable rate, and video data, audio data, and a sub-picture included in the MPEG stream are decoded by the MPEG2 decoder incorporated in the system. The decoded sub-picture is drawn in a VRAM as in normal VGA graphics. The sub-picture image drawn in the VRAM is synthesized with the video from the MPEG2 decoder by a multimedia display controller and displayed on a screen.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 带有子画面和声音的全动态视频数据记录在 DVD-ROM 驱动器中。  DVD-ROM 驱动器连接到 ATAPI 接口。 使用ATAPI接口的数据缓冲器,将MPEG流以可变速率传输到系统板上的MPEG2解码器,MPEG流中包含的视频数据、音频数据和子画面由MPEG2解码器解码 纳入系统。 解码后的子图像与普通 VGA 图形一样在 VRAM 中绘制。 在 VRAM 中绘制的子画面图像通过多媒体显示控制器与来自 MPEG2 解码器的视频合成并显示在屏幕上。

标题: Dictionary creation supporting system
摘要: A dictionary creation supporting system capable of improving the efficiency of the dictionary creation process for the dictionary such as the user dictionary. In the system, a first language document and a corresponding second language document are entered, and each first language character string to be registered in the dictionary is extracted from the first language document. Then, each corresponding second language character string with respect to each first language character string is selectively extracted from the corresponding second language document according to a level of correspondence between a section of the first language document from which each first language character string is extracted and a section of the corresponding second language document to which each corresponding second language character string belongs, and each first language character string and each corresponding second language character string are selectively outputted as a candidate for a registration knowledge to be registered in the dictionary according to the level of correspondence.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种能够提高用户词典等词典的词典制作处理的效率的词典制作支援系统。 在该系统中,输入第一语言文档和对应的第二语言文档,并从第一语言文档中提取要登记在词典中的每个第一语言字符串。 然后,根据第一语言文档中提取每个第一语言字符串的部分与对应的第二语言文档的对应程度,选择性地从对应的第二语言文档中提取每个第一语言字符串对应的第二语言字符串。 每个对应的第二语言字符串所属的对应的第二语言文档的部分,根据级别选择性地输出每个第一语言字符串和每个对应的第二语言字符串作为注册知识的候选在词典中注册 的信件。
发明人地址: 1-18-24, Katida-Minami, Kohoku-ku,Yokohama-shi, Kanagawa-ken,JP | 7-4-401, Nakadai, Higashiterao, Tsurumi-ku,Yokohama-shi, Kanagawa-ken,JP

标题: Source follower using NMOS and PMOS transistors
摘要: The NMOS and PMOS transistor both have a source and a floating gate. The source of the NMOS transistor is connected to both the source of the PMOS transistor and to an output termina. The floating gate of the NMOS transistor is connected to the floating gate of the PMOS transistor. A plurality of input gates are respectively capacitively coupled to the respective floating gates of the NMOS transistor and the PMOS transistor and are also respectively connected to a plurality of input terminals.
摘要(译)(简体中文): NMOS 和 PMOS 晶体管都有源极和浮栅。  NMOS晶体管的源极连接到PMOS晶体管的源极和输出端。  NMOS晶体管的浮栅连接到PMOS晶体管的浮栅。 多个输入栅极分别电容耦合到NMOS晶体管和PMOS晶体管各自的浮栅,并且还分别连接到多个输入端。
[标]当前申请(专利权)人: SHIBATA TADASHI | 公益财団法人国际科学振兴财団
发明人地址: Nagamachi, Taihaku-ku, Sendai-shi, Miyagi-ken 980, JP | Aoba-ku, Sendai-shi, Miyagi-ken 980, JP

标题: 降低語音信號之雜訊的方法和裝置
摘要: 降低語音信號之雜訊的方法和裝置可抑制輸入信號的雜訊並簡化處理。裝置包含將輸入語音信號轉變成頻域信號的快速傅立葉轉換單元３，和控制濾波特性以從輸入語音信號除去雜訊的Ｈｎ值計算單元７。裝置也包含由符合Ｈｎ值計算單元７所產生之濾波特性的濾波來降低輸入語音信號的頻譜校正單元１０。回應於求自快速傅立葉轉換單元３所得之輸入信號頻譜與值計雜訊位準之框基最大ＳＮ比的值，Ｈｎ值計算單元７計算Ｈｎ值，回應於Ｈｎ值，控制除去頻譜校正單元１０之雜訊的處理。
摘要(译)(简体中文): 降低语音信号之杂讯的方法和装置可抑制输入信号的杂讯并简化处理。 装置包含将输入语音信号转变成频域信号的快速傅立叶转换单元3,和控制滤波特性以从输入语音信号除去杂讯的Hn值计算单元7。 装置也包含由符合Hn值计算单元7所产生之滤波特性的滤波来降低输入语音信号的频谱校正单元10。 回应于求自快速傅立叶转换单元3所得之输入信号频谱与值计杂讯位准之框基最大SN比的值,Hn值计算单元7计算Hn值,回应于Hn值,控制除去频谱校正单元10 之杂讯的处理。
发明人: 西口正之 | 陳.約瑟芬

标题: Pattern recognition apparatus
摘要: In the particular embodiment of the invention described in the specification, a pattern recognition apparatus converts the signals received from a video pattern detector into a bit matrix comprising columns and rows of character elements. The matrix is divided into a series of blocks and the pressence of horizontal or vertical strings of bits is compared with corresponding bit information relating to a set of known characters. An unknown character is identified by a minimum deviation of the compared block information from that of a corresponding known character.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 在说明书中描述的本发明的特定实施例中,模式识别装置将从视频模式检测器接收的信号转换为包括字符元素的列和行的位矩阵。 矩阵被分成一系列块,水平或垂直位串的出现与与一组已知字符相关的相应位信息进行比较。 未知字符由所比较的块信息与相应已知字符的信息的最小偏差来识别。

标题: Method and apparatus for supporting electronic text search
摘要: A document (3-2) to be published electronically is complemented with a complementary part (3-24) comprising at least the words appearing in the text part of the document (3-2), the words being given in their basic form and in their original order, and, furthermore, for each compound, the basic forms of the parts of the compound being given as separate words. The adding (2-20) of the complementary part allows the search service (1-A, 2-C) to find a document (3-20, 3-40) complemented according to the invention, after it has been indexed (2-24) the next time after the complementing, even if a word did not appear in the original document in its basic form.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 将以电子方式发布的文档 (3-2) 由补充部分 (3-24) 补充,该部分至少包含文档 (3-2) 文本部分中出现的词,这些词以其基本形式给出,并且 按照它们的原始顺序,此外,对于每个复合词,复合词各部分的基本形式作为单独的词给出。 补充部分的添加 (2-20) 允许搜索服务 (1-A, 2-C) 在索引 (2) 之后找到根据本发明补充的文档 (3-20, 3-40)  -24) 下一次补充后,即使一个词没有以其基本形式出现在原始文档中。
[标]当前申请(专利权)人: 阿尔玛梅迪亚有限公司

标题: High frequency heating apparatus for providing a uniform heating of an object
摘要: PCT No. PCT/JP95/02145 Sec. 371 Date Apr. 18, 1997 Sec. 102(e) Date Apr. 18, 1997 PCT Filed Oct. 19, 1995 PCT Pub. No. WO96/13140 PCT Pub. Date May 2, 1996A high frequency heating apparatus for heating an object to be heated is provided with an electromagnetic wave emission means for emitting electromagnetic waves, a local heating means capable of heating an optional portion of the object by the electromagnetic waves emitted from the emission means, and a control means for controlling the local heating means. The high frequency heating apparatus is further provided with a stage on which the object is placed, a protecting means for protecting the local heating means, a setting means and a detection means, so that the local heating means, the electromagnetic wave emission means or the stage is controlled in accordance with the setting means or the detection means.
摘要(译)(简体中文): PCT 号 PCT/JP95/02145 秒。  371 日期 1997 年 4 月 18 日 102(e) 日期 1997 年 4 月 18 日 PCT 1995 年 10 月 19 日提交 PCT Pub. 编号 WO96/13140 PCT 公布。 日期 1996 年 5 月 2 日 一种用于加热待加热物体的高频加热装置,具有用于发射电磁波的电磁波发射装置,该局部加热装置能够通过发射所发射的电磁波加热物体的可选部分 装置,以及用于控制局部加热装置的控制装置。 高频加热装置还设有放置物体的平台、保护局部加热装置的保护装置、设置装置和检测装置,使得局部加热装置、电磁波发射装置或 根据设置装置或检测装置控制载物台。

标题: Autonomous prioritized image transmission
摘要: An image transmission system and method automatically to reduce the size of digital data signals transmitted from visual sensors. The system and method are completely automated and (a) use a plurality of sensors to detect targets in an area of interest, (b) direct a camera to place a 5 target in the camera's field of view, (c) provide a digitized visual image in which the target is identified in a target box, and (d) automatically compress (or otherwise reduce the size of) a digital signal for nontarget portions of the visual image.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种自动减小从视觉传感器传输的数字数据信号大小的图像传输系统和方法。 该系统和方法是完全自动化的,并且 (a) 使用多个传感器来检测感兴趣区域中的目标,(b) 引导摄像机将 5 个目标放置在摄像机的视野中,(c) 提供数字化视觉 在目标框中识别出目标的图像,以及 (d) 自动压缩(或以其他方式缩小)可视图像非目标部分的数字信号。

标题: Verfahren und Vorrichtung zur automatischen Spracherkennung, Sprechridentifizierung und Sprachausgabe
摘要: The aim of the invention is to provide a method and/or a device that allows a reliable automatic speech recognition that is efficient and robust even if there are background noises, that can be simply and easily integrated into embedded systems (embedded microprocessor controls) and devices; that facilitates a reliable identification of the speaker and that permits an output by voice synthesis. To this end, the invention provides a method and a device according to the characteristics of claim 1. According to the inventive method, a) an audio signal is digitized at a defined clock rate; b) the digitized values of the voice signal are subjected to a genetic programming (GP) process in such a manner that a classification result is produced by repeatedly calling the GP with the values of the digitized voice signal; c) the values are classified into determined and/or fixed intervals on the basis of the classification result by taking into account the value and/or the change of the value; d) processing the classification result in such a manner that phonemes and/or words are identified on the basis of neuronal networks (NN) and/or on the basis of genetic programs (GP) and/or on the basis of fuzzy logic (FL); e) a processor unit contains a voice recognition, speaker identification, speech synthesis entity that consists of a clock generator, a central processing unit (CPU), a command memory and/or a data memory, an analog input and/or analog output circuit.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 本发明的目的是提供一种允许可靠的自动语音识别的方法和/或设备,即使存在背景噪声,该自动语音识别也是高效且稳健的,其可以简单且容易地集成到嵌入式系统(嵌入式微处理器控制)中,并且 设备; 这有助于可靠地识别说话者并允许通过语音合成进行输出。 为此,本发明提供了根据权利要求1的特征的方法和设备。根据本发明的方法, a)音频信号以定义的时钟速率被数字化;  b) 对语音信号的数字化值进行遗传编程(GP)处理,通过用数字化语音信号的值重复调用GP产生分类结果;  c) 考虑值和/或值的变化,根据分类结果将值分类为确定的和/或固定的区间;  d) 以这样一种方式处理分类结果,即音素和/或单词基于神经网络 (NN) 和/或基于遗传程序 (GP) 和/或基于模糊逻辑 (FL) 进行识别 );  e) 处理器单元包含语音识别、说话人识别、语音合成实体,由时钟发生器、中央处理单元(CPU)、命令存储器和/或数据存储器、模拟输入和/或模拟输出电路组成 .
发明人: BUELTEMANN CHRISTOPH | LEISSNER HERIBERT | SCHLUMBERGER TILO | ZUENDORF DETLEF

标题: Beschleunigte konvolutionsrauschunterdrückung
摘要: A method and apparatus for removing convolution noise from a signal such as one carrying speech information. The signal is transformed into a log-spectral domain where a smoothed model is fitted to the log-spectrum subject to constraints of concavity and an overall bandpass shape. The smoothed model has quadratic segments of negative curvature and linear segments, the segments being smoothly joined at breakpoints. The model, which may be recursively updated, is substracted from each log-spectral data vector.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种用于从诸如携带语音信息的信号中去除卷积噪声的方法和装置。 信号被转换到一个对数谱域,其中一个平滑的模型被拟合到对数谱,受到凹度和整体带通形状的约束。 平滑模型具有负曲率的二次段和线性段,这些段在断点处平滑连接。 从每个对数谱数据向量中减去可以递归更新的模型。

标题: Hypermedia document authoring using a goals outline and a presentation outline
摘要: A hypermedia authoring system enables an author to generate a document using a goals outline and a presentation outline. The goals outline is generated by instantiating document prototypes. A display of the goals outline permits the author to select a prototype document from a directory of prototype documents and instantiate the selected prototype document that corresponds to a node of the goals outline. The instantiated document prototype is linked to cards in a card database. The presentation outline is displayed as Bento-boxes. Each Bento-box includes spacer objects which are defined spatially and temporally. The spacer objects may be linked to cards. The goals outline is related to the presentation outline based on commonly linked cards. The Bento-boxes may be linked to each other in a stack or hyperlinked to other Bento-boxes v a anchors. A display of all the Bento-boxes of a hypermedia document shows a linkage path established by the hyperlinks between Bento-boxes/Bento-box stacks. If both the presentation outline and the goals outline are displayed, selecting a Bento-box or a node of the goals outline causes related nodes or Bento-boxes, respectively, to be highlighted. If a complete goals/presentation outline is selected, the highlighting shows a measure of completeness between the presentation outline and the goals outline. A navigation facility is also provided such as a kitchen, an office or a studio.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 超媒体创作系统使作者能够使用目标大纲和演示文稿大纲生成文档。 目标大纲是通过实例化文档原型生成的。 目标大纲的显示允许作者从原型文档目录中选择一个原型文档,并实例化与目标大纲的节点相对应的所选原型文档。 实例化文档原型链接到卡片数据库中的卡片。 演示文稿大纲显示为便当盒。 每个便当盒都包含在空间和时间上定义的间隔对象。 间隔对象可以链接到卡片。 目标大纲与基于常用链接卡片的演示文稿大纲相关。  Bento-boxes 可以在堆栈中相互链接或通过锚点超链接到其他 Bento-boxes。 超媒体文档的所有 Bento-boxes 的显示显示了由 Bento-boxes/Bento-box 堆栈之间的超链接建立的链接路径。 如果同时显示演示大纲和目标大纲,则选择便当盒或目标大纲的节点会分别导致相关节点或便当盒突出显示。 如果选择了完整的目标/演示大纲,则突出显示演示大纲和目标大纲之间的完整性度量。 还提供导航设施,例如厨房、办公室或工作室。

标题: Combination counting and weighing system
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种组合称重系统，用于称量批量物品并选择满足预定总重量和物品数量的条件的批次组合。在该系统中，每批的测量重量除以物品的参考单位重量，并转换成物品的数量，然后将其四舍五入为整数。该整数乘以参考单位重量，以给出物品的修正重量。根据本发明的第一方面，通过加权操作根据相应的测量重量修改修正的重量。然后对修改后的修正权重进行传统的组合选择操作。在本发明的第二方面，整数不转换为修正的重量，而是通过加权操作根据所测量的物品数量进行修改。然后，对于目标编号，对修改的整数进行传统的组合选择操作。

标题: Fingerprint image processing system capable of simply processing minutiae
摘要(译)(简体中文): 在用于在识别指纹之前处理指纹图像的指纹图像处理系统中，通过添加真实的细节和/或从输出设备上显示的指纹图像中消除错误的细节来进行编辑或校正，从而仅留下真实的细节和 制定一个细节清单，记录每个细节的位置，一个细节方向以及代表相邻细节对的细节关系。 可以通过将细节作为图像来进行细节的编辑，而可以通过将细节识别为数据来进行校正。 在细节关系中包括两个相邻的细节之间的脊线号，并且可以从指纹图像中手动或自动提取这些脊线号。
发明人: HOSHINO, YUKIO | KIJI, KAZUO | OMORI, RITSUKO | SHIBUYA, TATSUO | SUZUKI, ISAMU | TATSUO SHIBUYA | ISAMU SUZUKI | RITSUKO OMORI | KAZUO KIJI | YUKIO HOSHINO

标题: Individual identification apparatus
摘要: The image pick up portion (50) picks up a pattern of a predetermined body portion of a specific individual a plurality of times and outputs a plurality of reference image signals for being stored. The image pick up portion (50) also picks up a pattern of the predetermined body portion of an arbitrary individual desired to be identified with the specific individual and outputs a target image signal. The calculation processing portion (60) electronically performs a Fourier transform on the plurality of reference image signals and the target image signal. The calculation processing portion (60) superimposes the Fourier transformed results of the plurality of reference image signals. The calculation processing portion (60) electronically multiplies the thus superimposed reference image signals with the Fourier transformed target image signal. The calculation processing portion (60) electronically performs an inverse Fourier transform on the multiplied results to thereby obtain a similarity degree between the reference image signals and the target image signal, thereby judging whether or not the arbitrary individual is the specific individual.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 图像拾取部分(50)多次拾取特定个体的预定身体部分的图案并输出用于存储的多个参考图像信号。 图像拾取部分(50)还拾取希望与特定个体识别的任意个体的预定身体部分的图案并输出目标图像信号。 计算处理部分(60)对多个参考图像信号和目标图像信号电子地执行傅里叶变换。 计算处理部分(60)叠加多个参考图像信号的傅里叶变换结果。 计算处理部分(60)将这样叠加的参考图像信号与傅里叶变换的目标图像信号电子相乘。 计算处理部分(60)对相乘结果进行电子傅里叶逆变换,从而获得参考图像信号和目标图像信号之间的相似度,从而判断任意个体是否是特定个体。
发明人地址: c/o Hamamatsu Photonics K.K., 1126-1, Ichino-cho,Hamamatsu-shi, Shizuoka-ken,JP

标题: Object information processing apparatus
摘要: An object information processing apparatus includes a focussing unit for focussing light information from an object point; a light transmission unit for transmitting the light information from the object point to the focussing unit via first and second optical passages; and mask units provided respectively in the first and second optical passages in the light transmission unit and formed respectively with predetermined patternings which are in negative and positive relation to each other. By virture of the mask units, the light information from the object point is blocked into a plurality of distance informations from which distance patterns are obtained. The apparatus can recognize an object in three dimensions using the distance patterns. Since the apparatus has no mechanically movable parts and the light passed through the first and second optical passages is focussed side by side on a photosensor, a high resolution is obtained and mutual references of corresponding points of the object are readily obtained.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 对象信息处理装置包括用于聚焦来自对象点的光信息的聚焦单元; 光传输单元,用于将来自物点的光信息通过第一和第二光通道传输到聚焦单元; 掩膜单元分别设置在透光单元中的第一和第二光通道中,并分别形成有预定图案,所述图案相互成正负关系。 通过掩模单元的作用,将来自物点的光信息阻挡为多个距离信息,从中获得距离图案。 该设备可以使用距离模式在三个维度上识别对象。 由于该装置没有可机械移动的部件,并且通过第一和第二光通道的光并排聚焦在光电传感器上,因此可以获得高分辨率并且容易获得对象对应点的相互参考。

标题: PROCEDE D'ENTREE EN MEMOIRE DE GRANDEURS ETALONS
摘要: A. PROCEDE D'ENTREE EN MEMOIRE DE GRANDEURS ETALONS.
摘要(译)(简体中文): A. 标准量的记忆输入程序。

标题: System and method for improved parametric geometric modeling
摘要: A system and method for generating a parametric profile of an object to be modelled is shown which receives input from a user in the form of equations, generates further equations inherent to a profile definition, prioritizes the equations into ranked classes, sorts the prioritized equations to thereby create an ordered solved equation list, solves the sorted equations in the order they appear on the solved equation list and generates a profile of geometry entities constructed from the solutions of the solved equations. The system and method automatically constrain unknown variables within any under-populated equation sets based on heuristics and employ any redundant equations to determine and resolve conflicts among the equations to be used for generating the profile.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 显示了用于生成要建模的对象的参数化轮廓的系统和方法,其以方程的形式接收来自用户的输入,生成轮廓定义固有的进一步方程,将方程按优先级排列到等级类别中,将优先方程排序为 从而创建一个有序的已求解方程列表,按照它们在已求解方程列表中出现的顺序求解已排序的方程,并生成由已求解方程的解构造的几何实体的轮廓。 该系统和方法基于试探法自动将未知变量限制在任何人口不足的方程组内,并采用任何冗余方程来确定和解决方程之间的冲突以用于生成轮廓。

标题: Memory reclamation method
摘要: A method of reclaiming memory space allocated to a data structure comprising data objects (910-960) linked by identifying pointers, in which the memory allocated to data objects is reclaimed using two systems: a first system (980), by which a selected part of the data structure is traversed by following the pointers, one of at least two identifiers being allocated to the data objects, a first identifier which indicates that the data object has been traversed so that the data objects referenced by the pointers of that data object have been identified, and a second identifier which indicates that the data object is referenced by a pointer, but the data object has not yet been traversed; and a second system (990), by which an individual data object is selected for deletion to enable the associated memory space to be reclaimed. The second system (990) reads the first system identifier for the individual data object, and if the first identifier is present deletes the data object thereby reclaiming the associated memory space. If the second identifier is present, it allocates a third identifier, where the first system (980) operates to reclaim the memory space allocated to data objects having the third identifier.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种回收分配给包括通过标识指针链接的数据对象(910-960)的数据结构的存储器空间的方法,其中使用两个系统回收分配给数据对象的存储器:第一系统(980),通过该第一系统(980),选定部分 通过跟随指针遍历数据结构,至少两个标识符中的一个被分配给数据对象,第一个标识符指示数据对象已经被遍历,使得该数据对象的指针所引用的数据对象具有 已标识,以及第二标识,表示该数据对象被指针引用,但该数据对象尚未被遍历; 第二系统(990),通过该系统选择单个数据对象进行删除,以使相关联的存储空间能够被回收。 第二系统(990)读取个体数据对象的第一系统标识符,并且如果存在第一标识符,则删除数据对象,从而回收相关联的存储空间。 如果存在第二标识符,则它分配第三标识符,其中第一系统(980)操作以回收分配给具有第三标识符的数据对象的存储器空间。

法律状态/事件: 未缴年费 | 权利转移

标题: Method of recognizing handwritten symbols
摘要: An unknown handwritten symbol written on a digitizing tablet is compared with symbols in a predefined "alphabet" or library of model symbols andthe closest match chosen. Recognition is independent of the size, position or orientation of the symbols. The alphabet can be any collection of symbols, such as alphanumeric characters, ideograms or words in cursive script and is created by writing at least one example of each symbol on the tablet. A sequence of samples of the pen position is recorded while a symbol is being written. The samples form a vector, which is then translated so that the centroid of the symbol lies at an origin. The comparison, which can easily be done in real time, involves calculating a correlation factor from scalar products of the vector for the unknown symbol andtwo versions of the vector for each model symbol and choosing the model symbol having the highest correlation factor. If needed to distinguish between model symbols with similar correlation factors, the comparison can also include calculating a rotation factor from such vectors for use in making such choice. Embodiments of the invention can be configured that are user-independent, user-dependent or that evolve from one to the other.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 将书写在数字化板上的未知手写符号与预定义的“字母”或模型符号库中的符号进行比较,并选择最接近的匹配项。 识别与符号的大小、位置或方向无关。 字母表可以是任何符号的集合,例如字母数字字符、表意文字或草书文字,并通过在数位板上写下每个符号的至少一个示例来创建。 在书写符号时记录笔位置的一系列样本。 样本形成一个向量,然后将其平移,使符号的质心位于原点。 该比较可以很容易地实时完成,包括从未知符号的向量的标量积和每个模型符号的向量的两个版本计算相关因子,并选择具有最高相关因子的模型符号。 如果需要区分具有相似相关因子的模型符号,则比较还可以包括从这些向量计算旋转因子以用于做出这样的选择。 本发明的实施例可以被配置为独立于用户、依赖于用户或从一个发展到另一个。
发明人: SINDEN FRANK WILLIAM | WILFONG GORDON THOMAS

标题: Apparatus for analyzing image texture and method therefor
摘要: An apparatus for analyzing image texture information and a method therefor are provided. The apparatus for analyzing the image texture information includes a filtering unit for filtering a still image including a plurality of pixels of M rowsxN columns with filters having different filtering coefficients, an X axis projector for calculating a gray level mean value of a row of N pixels, for each row, with respect to the filtered plurality of images, and a Y axis projector for calculating a gray level mean value of a column of M pixels, for each column, with respect to the filtered plurality of images. It is possible to describe the orientation and the periodicity of the texture in extracting the texture information.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 提供了一种图像纹理信息分析装置及其方法。 用于分析图像纹理信息的装置包括:过滤单元,用于使用具有不同过滤系数的过滤器过滤包括M行×N列的多个像素的静止图像;X轴投影仪,用于计算一行N像素的灰度级平均值。  ,对于每一行,对于过滤后的多个图像,以及Y轴投影仪,用于计算对于每一列,对于过滤后的多个图像的M个像素的列的灰度级平均值。 在提取纹理信息时可以描述纹理的方向和周期性。

标题: Optical character recognition system
摘要: An optical character recognition system for identifying typewritten characters and converting such to standard code for transmission. To achieve recognition of a character, the character, as it is scanned, is recorded in a corresponding array in memory and the memory address for each scan coordinate is then modified to correspond with the virtual character center. This coordinate center of the character is derived by inspection of the scanning array in parallel with the memory storing pass to determine the two adjacent all white rows and columns bounding the character. The coordinate center is then calculated by dividing the bounded row and column increment by two. The recognition of the character pattern is then performed by a set of Boolean discriminants selected to achieve the highest probability of in - character hits against a lowest probability of misses. Print fidelity, quantum misregistration and other character edge noise are filtered by selective OR-ing of test points along an axis having the highest incidence of noise.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种光学字符识别系统,用于识别打字字符并将其转换为标准代码以进行传输。 为了实现字符的识别,当字符被扫描时,它被记录在内存中的相应数组中,然后修改每个扫描坐标的内存地址以与虚拟字符中心相对应。 字符的这个坐标中心是通过与内存存储通道并行检查扫描阵列来确定字符边界的两个相邻的全白行和列而得出的。 然后通过将有界的行和列增量除以 2 来计算坐标中心。 然后通过一组布尔判别式执行字符模式的识别,以实现最高的字符内命中概率和最低的未命中概率。 通过沿具有最高噪声发生率的轴对测试点进行选择性 OR-ing 过滤打印保真度、量子失准和其他字符边缘噪声。

标题: 改良されたベクトル励起源を有するデジタル音声コーダ
摘要:
【課題】励起コードベクトルからなるコードブックを用いたコード励起線形予測(CELP)音声コーダのための改良された励起ベクトル生成および検索技術を提供する。
【解決手段】M基底ベクトルVm(n)の組が励起信号コードワード(i)とともに用いられて、励起ベクトルUi(n)のコードブックを生成する。2M個の可能な励起ベクトルからなるコードブック全体は、M基底ベクトルとともにベクトル和生成技術を用いて効率的に検索される。従来のように、2Mコードベクトルそれ自体の各々を生成し、評価する必要はない。さらに、M基底ベクトルのみをメモリに記憶すればよく、2Mコードベクトル全体を記憶する必要はない。
摘要(译)(简体中文):
一种改进的激励向量生成和检索技术,用于使用激励代码向量的代码本的代码激励线性预测 (CELP) 语音编码器。 
 解:M个基向量V m (n)集合与激励信号码字(i)一起使用,生成激励向量U i 为 (n) 生成一个密码本。  2个 M 使用具有 M 个基向量的向量和生成技术可以有效地搜索可能的激励向量的整个码本。 和以前一样,2 M 无需自己生成和评估每个代码向量。 此外,只有 M 个基向量需要存储在内存中,而 2 M 没有必要存储整个代码向量。

标题: Image compression system using block transforms and tree-type coefficient truncation
摘要: An data compression technique combines the benefits of block-wise processing, such as allows reduced buffer memory usage and improved speed through parallel techniques, with tree-type compression normally associated with wavelet-type compression techniques. Block artifacts in the reconstructed data at the partitions between blocks are minimized by use of lapping transformations.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 数据压缩技术结合了块式处理的优点,例如允许减少缓冲存储器使用和通过并行技术提高速度,以及通常与小波型压缩技术相关联的树型压缩。 通过使用重叠变换,可以最大限度地减少块之间分区处重建数据中的块伪影。

标题: Information processing system for compaction and replacement of phrases
摘要: MA9-84-007 INFORMATION PROCESSING SYSTEM FOR COMPACTION AND REPLACEMENT OF PHRASES Abstract An information processing system is disclosed which provides a writer with acceptable replacement phrases to substitute for trite phrases in a manuscript text. The replacement phrases are grammatically equivalent to the trite phrases and can be immediately inserted into the text without further alteration. The system compacts and replaces phrases with grammatically equivalent phrases conforming to conventional grammatical constraints of the original phrase. Reference lists of words corresponding with each other are built for enabling the replacement of a phrase with a grammatically equivalent phrase. The text to be analyzed is scanned to match a source phrase with a family of target phrases. A bit map created by hashing a word pair consisting of the least frequent word and a proximate less frequent word in the source phrase and the target phrase is used. The scanning is continued until a match is obtained in the bit map to indicate that a suitable target phrase has been found. The target phrase is then displayed.
摘要(译)(简体中文): MA9-84-007 用于压缩和替换短语的信息处理系统 摘要 公开了一种信息处理系统,它为作者提供可接受的替换短语来替换手稿文本中的陈腐短语。 替换短语在语法上等同于陈词滥调,可以立即插入文本中而无需进一步更改。 该系统用符合原始短语的常规语法约束的语法等效短语压缩和替换短语。 建立彼此对应的单词的参考列表,以便能够用语法上等效的短语替换短语。 扫描要分析的文本以将源短语与一系列目标短语相匹配。 使用通过对由源短语和目标短语中最不频繁的单词和最接近的不太频繁的单词组成的单词对进行散列而创建的位图。 继续扫描直到在位图中获得匹配以指示已找到合适的目标短语。 然后显示目标短语。

标题: Minutiae recognition system
摘要: MINUTIAE RECOGNITION SYSTEM Abstract of the Disclosure A system for detecting bifurcations and ridge endings (minutiae) in a fingerprint or on similar patterns in which two lines merge into one. The print is optically scanned, converted into electrical signals and entered into a novel continuity logic network. The presence of a bifurcation in the network results in three distinct outputs on the periphery of the network from at least two sides. The split in the bifurcation may also be detected by reversing the polarity of the electrical signals and detecting a single output. Means are also provided for ensuring that a single bifurcation is detected only once. Ridge endings are treated as reverse-polarity bifurcations and can be detected by the same system elements.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 细节识别系统公开的摘要一种用于检测指纹或两条线合并为一条的类似图案中的分叉和脊末端(细节)的系统。 印刷品经过光学扫描、转换成电信号并输入到一个新颖的连续性逻辑网络中。 网络中存在分叉会导致网络外围至少从两侧产生三个不同的输出。 也可以通过反转电信号的极性并检测单个输出来检测分叉中的分裂。 还提供了用于确保单个分叉仅被检测一次的装置。 脊末端被视为反极性分叉,并且可以被相同的系统元素检测到。

标题: Training method for a speech recognizer
摘要: The method involves taking signals from a microphone (10) and performing analysis in order to extract values for characteristic parameters. These values are compared with values stored in a dictionary (16) during an earlier learning stage to allow identification of speech patterns despite the presence of background noise. The parameter values are obtained in the learning and recognition phases by forming digital frames (S(n)) of predetermined length. Each frame is transformed from the time domain to the frequency domain to obtain a spectrum X(i). The inverse transform is then performed from the frequency domain to the time domain, with the amplitude of the spectral components scaled by a value which can vary during processing. A Napier logarithm can be used.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 该方法涉及从麦克风 (10) 获取信号并执行分析以提取特征参数的值。 在较早的学习阶段,将这些值与存储在字典 (16) 中的值进行比较,以允许在存在背景噪声的情况下识别语音模式。 通过形成预定长度的数字帧(S(n)),在学习和识别阶段获得参数值。 每一帧从时域变换到频域,得到频谱X(i)。 然后从频域到时域执行逆变换,其中频谱分量的振幅按处理期间可能变化的值缩放。 可以使用 Napier 对数。

标题: データベースアクセス方法およびシステム
摘要:
【目的】 効率的にデータベースにアクセスする。
【構成】 DASD指向外部記憶装置サブシステムに全て記憶することができるデータベースか、あるいは、一部はDASDに記憶され、一部は高速電子ストアに記憶されたデータベースの現データにアクセスする時間を最小限にし、その上、複数ユーザシステムに関してデータのコヒーレンシを保持する、コンピュータインプリメントした方法である。
摘要(译)(简体中文):
[目的] 高效访问数据库。 
 可以完全存储在面向 DASD 的外部存储子系统上的数据库,或部分存储在 DASD 上并部分存储在高速电子存储中的数据库,以最大限度地减少访问当前数据的时间。实施的方法,限制并维护多用户系统的数据一致性。

标题: Speech pattern matching in non-white noise
摘要: PCT No. PCT/US92/06351 Sec. 371 Date Jun. 13, 1994 Sec. 102(e) Date Jun. 13, 1994 PCT Filed Jul. 30, 1992 PCT Pub. No. WO93/03480 PCT Pub. Date Feb. 18, 1993.A system for matching an input signal, comprising non-white noise and a patterned signal corrupted by said non-white noise, to a plurality of reference signals, the system including an estimator estimating noise features of said non-white noise and producing from the noise features at least one noise whitening filter; a filter generally simultaneously filtering the input signal and the plurality of reference signals using the noise whitening filter and producing a filtered input signal, having a white noise component, and a plurality of filtered reference signals; and a pattern matcher generally robust to white noise for matching the filtered input signal to one of the filtered reference signals.
摘要(译)(简体中文): PCT 号 PCT/US92/06351 秒。  371 日期 1994 年 6 月 13 日 102(e) 日期 1994 年 6 月 13 日 PCT 1992 年 7 月 30 日提交 PCT Pub. 编号 WO93/03480 PCT 公开。 日期 1993 年 2 月 18 日 -白噪声并从噪声中产生至少一个噪声白化滤波器; 滤波器通常使用噪声白化滤波器同时对输入信号和多个参考信号进行滤波,并产生具有白噪声分量的滤波输入信号和多个滤波参考信号; 以及通常对白噪声具有鲁棒性的模式匹配器,用于将滤波后的输入信号与滤波后的参考信号之一匹配。

标题: Method for optimizing processing of join queries by determining optimal processing order and assigning optimal join methods to each of the join operations
摘要: A join optimization method is provided for use with a data processor for optimizing the processing of a query for retrieval of data from a relational computer database. The database is organized by relations and data is retrieved by preforming join operations on the relations. The join operations are optimized by randomly selecting an initial order for the join operations, assigning optimal join methods based on the initial order, finding an optimal order based on the assigned methods and repeating a polynomial number of times. The Krishanmurthy, Boral and Zaniolo (KBZ) Algorithm is used to determine a join optimization sequence and further refinement is provided by determining costs for alternate join order sequences using alternate join methods.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 提供了一种与数据处理器一起使用的连接优化方法,用于优化查询的处理以从关系计算机数据库中检索数据。 数据库由关系组织,并通过对关系执行连接操作来检索数据。 通过随机选择连接操作的初始顺序、基于初始顺序分配最佳连接方法、根据分配的方法找到最佳顺序并重复多项式次数来优化连接操作。  Krishanmurthy、Boral 和 Zaniolo (KBZ) 算法用于确定连接优化序列,并通过使用替代连接方法确定替代连接顺序序列的成本来提供进一步的细化。
发明人: IYER, BALAKRISHNA R. | SWAMI, ARUN N.
发明人地址: Mt. View, CA | San Jose, CA

标题: System and method for exchanging data in a network
摘要: The invention concerns a system and method for exchanging data in a network, in particular for automatically obtaining offers. The system comprises at least one central server (10) with a data memory which is provided with an input-connection unit and an output-connection unit, and at least one client and one data provider (20, 30) which are used to input and/or fetch data into and/or from the data memory of the central server (10) and can be connected to an input- and/or output-connection unit via a network (40) with terminals. The system is characterized in that the server comprises modules for automatically selecting data providers as a function of a client enquiry, and for automatically forwarding the enquiry to the data providers.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 本发明涉及一种用于在网络中交换数据,特别是用于自动获得报价的系统和方法。 该系统包括至少一个具有数据存储器的中央服务器(10),该数据存储器设有输入连接单元和输出连接单元,以及用于输入的至少一个客户端和一个数据提供者(20、30)。 和/或从中央服务器(10)的数据存储器中获取数据和/或从中央服务器(10)的数据存储器中获取数据,并且可以通过具有终端的网络(40)连接到输入和/或输出连接单元。 该系统的特征在于,服务器包括用于根据客户查询自动选择数据提供者以及用于将查询自动转发给数据提供者的模块。

标题: Integrated authoring and translation system
摘要: The present invention is a system of integrated, computer-based processes for monolingual information development and multilingual translation. An interactive text editor (140) enforces lexical and grammatical constraints on a natural language subset used by the authors (160) to create their text, which they help disambiguate to ensure translatability. The resulting translatable source language text undergoes machine translation into any one of a set of target languages, without the translated text requiring any postediting.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 本发明是用于单语信息开发和多语翻译的集成的、基于计算机的过程的系统。 交互式文本编辑器 (140) 对作者 (160) 用来创建文本的自然语言子集实施词汇和语法约束,他们帮助消除歧义以确保可译性。 生成的可翻译源语言文本经过机器翻译成一组目标语言中的任何一种,翻译后的文本不需要任何后期编辑。
发明人: KATHRYN L BAKER | LINDA M SCHMANDT | JOHN F SWEET | IRENE NIRENBURG | ERIC H RIEBLING | ALISON K HUETTNER | BRUCE M MCLAREN | ROY F. 标题: Geometric figure position and orientation detection method and device
摘要: The position and orientation of a geometric figure are detected by sequentially producing the coordinates with respect to an orthogonal coordinate system of pixels which make up an image of the geometric figure, by singling out from these sequentially produced coordinates of these pixels the coordinates of certain characteristic pixels of these pixels which make up an image of the geometric figure, and by comparing these coordinates of these certain characteristic pixels with stored information. Preferably, the certain characteristic pixels are: that pixel, of those which have the least value of one coordinate, which has the least value of the other coordinate; that pixel, of those which have the greatest value of the one coordinate, which has the least value of the other coordinate; that pixel, of those which have the least value of the other coordinate, which has the least value of the one coordinate; and that pixel, of those which have the greatest value of the other coordinate, which has the least value of the one coordinate. A device is also disclosed for performing this method.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 几何图形的位置和方向是通过顺序产生相对于构成几何图形图像的像素的正交坐标系的坐标,通过从这些顺序产生的这些像素的坐标中挑选出特定特征的坐标来检测的。 构成几何图形图像的这些像素的像素,并通过将这些特定特征像素的这些坐标与存储的信息进行比较。 优选地,所述某些特征像素是: 一个坐标值最小的那个像素,另一个坐标值最小的那个像素。 像素中,一个坐标的最大值,另一个坐标的最小值; 具有另一个坐标最小值的像素中的那个像素,该像素具有一个坐标的最小值; 和那个像素,在那些具有另一个坐标最大值的像素中,它具有一个坐标的最小值。 还公开了一种用于执行该方法的设备。
发明人: HISANO, ATUSHI | SAKA, KAZUHIKO | MASAKI, TOSHIMICHI | YAMASHITA, TSUKASA
发明人地址: Nagaokakyo, JP | Joyo, JP | Takatsuki, JP | Nara, JP

标题: Coherence detector
摘要: Kohärenzdetektor mit einer Vielzahl von n Signaleingängen (ESTi (1 <= i <= n); E1, E2, E3, E4), an denen ein jeweiliger Eingangssignalwert anliegt, einer ersten Sortiereinrichtung (S1) zum Sortieren der n zugeführten Eingangssignalwerte (E1,..., E4) entsprechend ihrem Wert (A, B, C, D) und zur parallelen Ausgabe der n sortierten Werte, einer Vielzahl von n-1 Subtrahiereinrichtungen ("-") zur Subtraktion von jeweils zwei benachbarten sortierten Werten ((D-C), (C-B), (B-A)), einer zweiten Sortiereinrichtung (S2) zum Sortieren der erhaltenen n-1 Differenzen ((D-C), (C-B), (B-A)) hinsichtlich ihres Betrages und zur Ausgabe des kleinsten Differenzbetrags ("<<"), einer Auswahleinrichtung ("=", MUX1), die anhand des ermittelten kleinsten Differenzbetrags ("<<") das diesem zugehörige Wertepaar der Eingangssignalwerte ausgibt, und einer Ausgabeeinrichtung ("Σ/2"), der das ausgegebene Wertepaar zugeführt wird und die dessen Mittelwert (KE) ausgibt.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 具有多个 n 信号输入 (ESTi (1 <= i <= n); E1, E2, E3, E4) 的相干检测器,其中存在相应的输入信号值,用于对 n 进行排序的第一排序设备 (S1)提供的输入信号值(E1,...,E4)根据它们的值(A,B,C,D)和n个排序值的并行输出,多个n-1减法器(“-”)用于减去两个相邻的排序值(((D-C),(C-B),(B-A)),第二个排序器(S2)用于排序得到的n-1个差值((D-C),(C-B),(B-A))关于它们的数量和输出最小差异量(“<<”),选择设备(“=”,MUX1),它使用确定的最小差异量(“<<”)输出相关的输入对信号值和输出设备(“Σ/2”),输出一对值被提供给该设备,并输出其平均值(KE)。
[标]当前申请(专利权)人: WEIGLHOFER GERHARD | PAUKER FRITZ | HENKEL ROLF DR

标题: Hand-written graphic form inputting apparatus
摘要: A hand-written graphic form inputting apparatus by which a plurality of hand-written graphic forms can be inputted efficiently is disclosed. When a hand-written graphic form inputted from a graphic form inputting device is recognized so as to produce graphic form candidates and the graphic form candidates thus produced are stored into a graphic form candidate buffer, a graphic form relation determination device determines the correlation between the inputted graphic form inputted and the graphic form candidates. The graphic form determination device determines a most likely graphic form candidate from among the graphic form candidates in accordance with a result of a determination from the graphic form relation determination device. A graphic form position determination device determines the size of the graphic form to be displayed on a display device in accordance with a result of the determination from the graphic form relation determination device and a graphic form position determination device determines the orientation of the graphic form to be displayed on a display device in accordance with a result of the determination from the graphic form relation determination device.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 公开了一种可以有效地输入多个手写图形的手写图形输入装置。 当从图形形式输入设备输入的手写图形形式被识别以产生候选图形形式并且由此产生的候选图形形式被存储到候选图形形式缓冲器中时,图形形式关系确定装置确定图形形式之间的相关性。  inputed graphic form input 和候选图形形式。 图形形式确定装置根据图形形式关系确定装置的确定结果,从图形形式候选中确定最可能的图形形式候选者。 图形位置确定装置根据图形关系确定装置的确定结果确定要在显示设备上显示的图形的尺寸,图形位置确定装置确定图形的方向以 根据图形形式关系确定装置的确定结果显示在显示装置上。

标题: Apparatus and method for language translation between patient and caregiver, and for communication with speech deficient patients
摘要: An apparatus and method for communication between patients and caregivers who speak different languages, or with speech deficient persons. A touch sensitive screen is provided to allow a patient to select responses to questions posed by care givers. A simple graphical user interface is provided which assists patients on respirators or otherwise unable to speak to communicate with hospital staff and family members. Combining thin profile LCD monitors with touch screen technology provides the user interface. In a preferred embodiment, a battery powered portable general purpose computer features a patient monitor on an adjustable articulated arm, and a second monitor for the care giver to view the patient's inputs and responses. Ideally, a roll-around hardware mounting configuration, with battery pack power, allows the system to be quickly moved and used in virtually any location. The software features a large vocabulary of typical words and phrases which are grouped into sets which can be selected for display. Also, an image of the human body can be used to identify the location of pain. Word buttons can be replaced with pictures to assist children who cannot read. Additionally, words and phrases can be selected from by language pairs, such as English-English, English-Spanish, so that the common phrases assist in two way communication between patients and staff of differing languages.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种用于在说不同语言的患者和护理人员之间或与有语言障碍的人之间进行交流的设备和方法。 提供触摸屏以允许患者选择对护理人员提出的问题的回答。 提供了一个简单的图形用户界面,可帮助佩戴呼吸器或无法说话的患者与医院工作人员和家庭成员进行交流。 将薄型液晶显示器与触摸屏技术相结合,提供了用户界面。 在优选实施例中,电池供电的便携式通用计算机的特点是在可调节关节臂上的患者监视器和供护理人员查看患者输入和响应的第二监视器。 理想情况下,带有电池组电源的滚动式硬件安装配置允许系统在几乎任何位置快速移动和使用。 该软件具有大量典型单词和短语的词汇,这些词汇和短语被分组到可以选择显示的集合中。 此外,人体的图像可用于识别疼痛的位置。  Word按钮可以用图片代替,以帮助无法阅读的孩子。 此外,可以通过语言对来选择单词和短语,例如英语-英语、英语-西班牙语,从而使常用短语有助于不同语言的患者和工作人员之间的双向交流。
发明人: MILNER, JOHN A. | MAYFIELD, ADDIS E. | MAYFIELD, LAWRENCE E.

标题: Data embedding
摘要: A method of embedding auxiliary information into a set of host data, such as a photograph, television signal, facsimile transmission, or identification card. All such host data contain intrinsic noise, allowing pixels in the host data which are nearly identical and which have values differing by less than the noise value to be manipulated and replaced with auxiliary data. As the embedding method does not change the elemental values of the host data, the auxiliary data do not noticeably affect the appearance or interpretation of the host data. By a substantially reverse process, the embedded auxiliary data can be retrieved easily by an authorized user.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种将辅助信息嵌入到一组主机数据中的方法,例如照片、电视信号、传真传输或身份证。 所有此类主机数据都包含固有噪声,从而允许主机数据中几​​乎相同且值相差小于噪声值的像素被操纵并用辅助数据替换。 由于嵌入方法不会改变宿主数据的元素值,辅助数据不会显着影响宿主数据的外观或解释。 通过基本上相反的过程,授权用户可以容易地检索嵌入的辅助数据。
