标题: Optical identification and monitoring system using pattern recognition for use with vehicles
摘要: A vehicle interior monitoring system to identify, locate and monitor occupants, including their parts, and other objects in the passenger compartment and objects outside of a motor vehicle, such as an automobile or truck, by illuminating the contents of the vehicle and objects outside of the vehicle with electromagnetic, and specifically infrared, radiation and using one or more lenses to focus images of the contents onto one or more arrays of charge coupled devices (CCD arrays). Outputs from the CCD arrays, are analyzed by appropriate computational means employing trained pattern recognition technologies, to classify, identify or locate the contents or external objects. In general, the information obtained by the identification and monitoring system is used to affect the operation of some other system in the vehicle. When system is installed in the passenger compartment of an automotive vehicle equipped with an airbag, the system determines the position of the vehicle occupant relative to the airbag and disables deployment of the airbag if the occupant is positioned so that he/she is likely to be injured by the deployment of the airbag.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种车辆内部监控系统,通过照亮车辆内容物和外部物体来识别、定位和监控乘员,包括他们的零件、乘客舱内的其他物体和机动车辆外部的物体,例如汽车或卡车 车辆具有电磁辐射,特别是红外辐射,并使用一个或多个镜头将内容物的图像聚焦到一个或多个电荷耦合器件阵列(CCD 阵列)上。  CCD 阵列的输出通过适当的计算方法进行分析,采用经过训练的模式识别技术,对内容或外部对象进行分类、识别或定位。 通常,识别和监控系统获得的信息用于影响车辆中其他一些系统的运行。 当系统安装在配备安全气囊的机动车辆的乘客舱中时,系统会确定车辆乘员相对于安全气囊的位置,如果乘员的位置可能使他/她可能被 因安全气囊展开而受伤。
发明人: DAVID, S, BREED | WENDELL, CLAYTON, JOHNSON | WILLIAM, EDWARD, DUVALL | DAVID, SCRANTON, BREED | WILBUR, E, DUVALL

标题: Program product for facilitating use of a neural network
摘要: A neural network development utility assists a developer in generating one or more filters for data to be input to or output from a neural network. A filter is a device which translates data in accordance with a data transformation definition contained in a translate template. Source data for the neural network may be expressed in any arbitrary combination of symbolic or numeric fields in a data base. The developer selects those fields to be used from an interactive menu. The utility scans the selected field entries in the source data base to identify the logical type of each field, and creates a default translate template based on this scan. Numeric data is automatically scaled. The developer may use the default template, or edit it from an interactive editor. When editing the template, the developer may select from a menu of commonly used neural network data formats, and from a menu of commonly used primitive mathematical operations. The developer may interactively define additional filters to perform data transformations in series, thus achieving more complex mathematical operations on the data. Templates may be edited at any time during the development process. If a network does not appear to be giving satisfactory results, the developer may easily alter the template to present inputs in some other format.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 神经网络开发实用程序帮助开发人员生成一个或多个过滤器,用于输入到神经网络或从神经网络输出的数据。 过滤器是根据包含在翻译模板中的数据转换定义来翻译数据的设备。 神经网络的源数据可以用数据库中符号或数字字段的任意组合来表示。 开发人员从交互式菜单中选择要使用的那些字段。 该实用程序扫描源数据库中选定的字段条目以识别每个字段的逻辑类型,并基于此扫描创建默认翻译模板。 数值数据会自动缩放。 开发人员可以使用默认模板,也可以从交互式编辑器中对其进行编辑。 在编辑模板时,开发者可以从常用的神经网络数据格式菜单中选择,也可以从常用的原始数学运算菜单中进行选择。 开发人员可以交互地定义额外的过滤器来执行串行数据转换,从而实现对数据的更复杂的数学运算。 在开发过程中可以随时编辑模板。 如果网络似乎没有给出令人满意的结果,开发人员可以轻松地更改模板以其他格式呈现输入。
发明人: AUSTVOLD, SHAWN M. | BIGUS, JOSEPH P. | HENCKEL, JONATHAN D. | HOSPERS, PAUL A.

标题: System and method for customizing an operating system
摘要: A system and method for customizing and/or tuning an operating system for a computer. In accordance with the inventive method, a plurality of input values are mapped to membership functions (or fuzzy sets). The input values relate to the status of the operating system, any tasks to be performed thereby, or any other parameter. A set of resource management rules are applied to generate an output corresponding to each input value in accordance with the membership function with which the input values are associated. In the illustrative embodiment, each rule is an 'if-then' statement having a membership function as an antecedent and an output corresponding to the input value as a consequent. The rules are applied and the output defuzzified by an inference engine implemented in hardware or software. For each task to be customized or tuned, the resource management rules are developed by consulting with experts or an expert database to ascertain which resources should be managed and how so as to optimize the performance of the task. The input values may be parameters that are set at installation or boot time that remain fixed until the system is re-installed or re-booted, respectively. In the alternative, the input values may be parameters that are tuned on demand, at predetermined times, or continuously.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种用于定制和/或调整计算机操作系统的系统和方法。 根据本发明的方法,多个输入值被映射到隶属函数(或模糊集)。 输入值与操作系统的状态、由此要执行的任何任务或任何其他参数有关。 根据与输入值相关联的隶属函数,应用一组资源管理规则来生成对应于每个输入值的输出。 在说明性实施例中,每个规则都是“如果-那么”语句,其具有作为前提的隶属函数和作为结果的对应于输入值的输出。 规则被应用,输出由在硬件或软件中实现的推理引擎去模糊化。 对于每个要定制或调整的任务,通过咨询专家或专家数据库来制定资源管理规则,以确定应该管理哪些资源以及如何管理,以优化任务的性能。 输入值可以是在安装或启动时设置的参数,这些参数在分别重新安装或重新启动系统之前保持固定。 或者,输入值可以是按需、在预定时间或连续调整的参数。

标题: Apparatus and method for bookmarking system
摘要: A bookmarking system is provided that includes a user input device and a network server. A person who is viewing a program, e.g., watching a network news program on television, can bookmark an archived version of that program for future reference. The viewer utilizes the user input device to communicate to the network server the identity of the program of interest. The network server uses the identification information for the program of interest to identify a URL for the archived version of the program. The network server transmits the URL for the archived program to the personal computer of the viewer.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 提供了一种包括用户输入设备和网络服务器的书签系统。 正在观看节目的人,例如,在电视上观看网络新闻节目,可以为该节目的存档版本添加书签以供将来参考。 观众利用用户输入设备向网络服务器传送感兴趣节目的标识。 网络服务器使用感兴趣节目的识别信息来识别该节目的存档版本的URL。 网络服务器将存档节目的 URL 传送到观众的个人计算机。
发明人: MILEWSKI, ALLEN E. | SMITH, THOMAS M.
法律状态/事件: 未缴年费 | 权利转移

标题: Method and apparatus for collecting and processing visual and spatial position information from a moving platform
摘要: Visual and spatial position information is collected and processed for the formation of a geographic information database. In addition, the information collected and processed can be used to update the United States Census Bureau TIGER/Line files to improve the accuracy of the files. Information collected and processed can also be used to accurately determine the spatial position of an object seen in the collected visual information. The method includes the high speed collection and correlation of video images and spatial position information.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 收集和处理视觉和空间位置信息,形成地理信息数据库。 此外,收集和处理的信息可用于更新美国人口普查局 TIGER/Line 文件,以提高文件的准确性。 收集和处理的信息还可用于准确确定在收集的视觉信息中看到的对象的空间位置。 该方法包括视频图像和空间位置信息的高速采集和关联。
发明人: LACHINSKI, THEODORE M. | PTACEK, LOUIS S. | BLAIS, PAUL M. | BOGGS, STEPHEN | LONGFELLOW, JOHN W. | SETTERHOLM, JEFFREY M.
发明人地址: Andover, MN | Mound, MN | St. Paul, MN | Fridley, MN | Lakeville, MN
法律状态/事件: 期限届满 | 诉讼 | 质押 | 复审

标题: UN METODO Y APARATO PERFECCIONADOS PARA AJUSTAR LA POSICION DE ESPECIMENES EN LAS DIAPOSITIVAS ANALITICAS PARA ANALISIS MICROSCOPICO.
摘要: Un método y aparato perfeccionados para ajustar la posición de especímenes en las diapositivas analíticas para análisis microscópico, caracterizados por que siendo convertidas en el aparato las características ópticas del especímen en señales eléctricas, comprende un medio de proyección de la imagen óptica de la diapositiva análitica sobre un medio de conversión para convertirla en señales eléctricas y sobre un espejo rotativo, que refleja una porción de la imagen óptica sobre un detector de luz (medio sensor de la luz), la salida del cual es suministrada a un medio de formación del impulso para producir un impulso de adquisición cuando el área de la diapositiva que se está explorando contiene un espécimen de interés, produciendo entonces otro medio detector de la luz (medio sensor de la luz) un impulso sincronizador cuando el espejo se encuentra en una posición de haz determinada de antemano, y un circuito lógico responde al impulso sincronizador y al impulso de adquisición para producir señales de control que controlan un mecanismo de posicionamiento, para la diapositiva, de forma que la imagen de un espécimen de interés quede centrada sobre el medio de conversión.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种用于寻找定位白细胞的闭环扫描定位系统,包括多面旋转镜、光学系统、两个光电传感器、两个光源和逻辑电路。 逻辑电路产生用于在 x 和 y 方向驱动显微镜载物台的信号,以使血细胞定位在小孔径内。

标题: Histogram chip for line summing, line grabbing and histogramming in a thermal imaging system
摘要: A time shared histogram chip (80) implemented in a system for manipulating video signal data. The system includes a processor (82) for controlling system operation and for processing a video signal input into the system. The time shared histogram chip (80) accumulates video signal data in a format readable by the processor (82). The histogram chip (80) is operative to perform histogramming, video line summing and video line grabbing functions. Control means (100) is operatively connected to the processor and enables the processor (82) to selectively control the mode of operation of the histogram chip (80).
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种在用于处理视频信号数据的系统中实现的时间共享直方图芯片(80)。 该系统包括用于控制系统操作和用于处理输入到系统中的视频信号的处理器(82)。 时间共享直方图芯片(80)以处理器(82)可读的格式累积视频信号数据。 直方图芯片(80)用于执行直方图、视频行求和和视频行抓取功能。 控制装置(100)可操作地连接到处理器并且使处理器(82)能够选择性地控制直方图芯片(80)的操作模式。
发明人: NISHIKUBO, SAM S. | NAGAREDA, JON J. | JONES, CHRISTOPHER S.
发明人地址: Gardena, CA | Palo Alto, CA | Los Angeles, CA

标题: Methods and apparatus for sharing stored data objects in a computer system
摘要: A method, in a computer system having a first plurality of stored data objects and capable of running multiple threads concurrently, for preventing access conflicts. The method includes the step of providing a dynamic lock structure having a plurality of dynamic lock structure members. There is also the step of mapping a second plurality of stored data objects of the first plurality of stored data objects into a first dynamic lock structure member of the plurality of dynamic lock structure members in accordance with a mapping function. Due to the mapping function, the plurality of dynamic lock structure members become fewer in number than the number of the first plurality of stored data objects. The first dynamic lock structure member is configured to store identities of a third plurality of stored data objects. The third plurality of stored data objects represent a subset of the second plurality of stored data objects that are accessed, whereby a stored data object having its identity stored in the dynamic lock structure cannot be accessed by any thread other than a thread currently accessing the stored data object.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种在具有第一多个存储数据对象并且能够同时运行多个线程的计算机系统中用于防止访问冲突的方法。 该方法包括提供具有多个动态锁结构构件的动态锁结构的步骤。 还有根据映射函数将第一多个存储数据对象的第二多个存储数据对象映射到多个动态锁结构成员的第一动态锁结构成员的步骤。 由于映射功能,多个动态锁结构成员的数量变得少于第一多个存储的数据对象的数量。 第一动态锁定结构构件被配置为存储第三多个存储的数据对象的身份。 第三多个存储的数据对象表示被访问的第二多个存储的数据对象的子集,由此其身份存储在动态锁结构中的存储的数据对象不能被除了当前访问存储的线程的线程之外的任何线程访问。 数据对象。
发明人: HAGERSTEN, ERIK E. | HILL, MARK DONALD

标题: 画像処理方法
摘要:
【目的】 1原稿に対して多色のマーカー指定を行って色編集処理を行い、複雑な図形に対しても精度よくマーカー検出を行う。
【構成】 マーカー色を色表示座標変換を行って、濃度、色相、彩度の形式にして検出し、密度変換処理によりデータ圧縮してプレーンメモリに記憶させると同時にゴースト除去を行う。プレーンメモリへはマーカー色データを各色毎にビットマップに展開し、マーカー領域内および領域外について塗りつぶし処理によりゴースト除去を行う。その結果マーカーの検出精度が上がるとともに、プレーンメモリ上での処理により複雑な図形に対しても対応することができる。
摘要(译)(简体中文):
[目的] 通过为一个文档指定多色标记来执行颜色编辑处理,即使对于复杂的图形也可以准确地检测标记。 
 【结构】通过颜色显示坐标转换以密度、色调、饱和度的形式检测标记颜色,并通过密度转换过程压缩数据并存储在普通内存中,同时去除鬼影被执行。 标记颜色数据被扩展为普通内存中每种颜色的位图,并通过填充标记区域的内部和外部来消除重影。 结果,提高了标记检测精度,并且可以通过在普通存储器上处理来处理复杂的图形。

标题: DATENVERWALTUNGSGERAET.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种数据管理装置,包括用于读取多条图像信息的扫描仪、用于存储由扫描仪读取的多条图像信息的光盘、用于输入特征名称的键盘,该属性名称具有存储在该扫描仪中的各条图像信息的特征。 光盘、用于存储与属性名称具有较高相关性的分类名称的磁盘、以及显示器。 在键盘上输入的属性名称作为参数访问磁盘以检索具有最高相似度的分类名称。 该分类名称显示在显示屏上。

标题: Method and apparatus for currency discrimination and counting
摘要: An improved method and apparatus for discriminating between currency bills of different denomination uses an optical sensing (18) and correlation technique based on the sensing of bill reflectance characteristic obtained by illuminating and scanning a bill along its narrow dimension. A series of detected reflectance signals are obtained by sampling and digitally processing, under microprocessor control, the reflected light at a plurality of predefined sample points as a currency bill (17) is moved across an illuminated strip (24) with its narrow dimension parallel to the direction of transport of the bill. The sample data is subjected to digital processing, including a normalizing process, whereby the reflectance data represents a characteristic pattern that is unique for a given bill denomination and incorporates sufficient distingishing features between characteristic patterns for discriminating between different currency denominations.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种用于区分不同面额的钞票的改进方法和设备使用光学传感 (18) 和相关技术,该技术基于通过沿钞票的窄尺寸照明和扫描钞票而获得的钞票反射特性的传感。 一系列检测到的反射率信号是通过采样和数字处理获得的,在微处理器的控制下,随着钞票(17)在窄尺寸平行于 票据的运输方向。 样本数据经过数字处理,包括归一化过程,由此反射数据表示对于给定纸币面额唯一的特征图案,并在特征图案之间包含足够的区分特征以区分不同的货币面额。
发明人: RATERMAN, DONALD, R. | GRAVES, BRADFORD, T. | STROMME, LARS, L. | BAUCH, AARON, M.

法律状态/事件: 全部撤销 | 复审 | 异议

标题: Character compression technique
摘要: The present invention is concerned with compression encoding and, in particular, the encoding of the second difference of the position of the boundary of a character on consecutive scanlines. Special code sequences represent the starting location for two new character boundaries relative to the last position in the scanline generated, the next two character boundaries that do not extend into the next scanline, and the end of a line when the preceeding scanline had no intersections with a character boundary. Also included are code sequences representing the first item on the last scanline of the character to terminate the code and at the right of all other boundaries on the current scanline.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 本发明涉及压缩编码,尤其涉及连续扫描线上字符边界位置的二阶差分编码。 特殊代码序列表示相对于生成的扫描线中最后位置的两个新字符边界的起始位置,不延伸到下一个扫描线的下两个字符边界,以及前一个扫描线与 字符边界。 还包括代码序列,表示终止代码的字符的最后扫描线上的第一项,以及当前扫描线上所有其他边界的右侧。

标题: Motion-based command generation technology
摘要: A command system optically monitors the movement of a subject and provides command signals to a computer system to control a graphic of a graphical user interface displayed on a monitor such as an animated character in a video game. The command system has an optical detector unit which continuously scans a subject frame in which the subject is positioned. The subject frame is divided into sub-regions around the subject in which movement of the subject is detected, for example, an arm moving. A command unit receives and processes frame data from the optical detector unit. The command unit determines the velocity of any movement detected in any of the sub-regions and generates an appropriate command signal based on the velocity of the movement. The command unit may also use the direction of the movement in generating command signals. The command signals are then provided to the computer system to move and control the graphical user interface accordingly.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 命令系统以光学方式监视对象的移动并向计算机系统提供命令信号以控制显示器上显示的图形用户界面的图形,例如视频游戏中的动画角色。 命令系统具有光学检测器单元,该光学检测器单元连续扫描其中放置对象的对象框。 对象框被划分为对象周围的子区域,其中检测到对象的移动,例如,手臂移动。 命令单元接收并处理来自光学检测器单元的帧数据。 命令单元确定在任何子区域中检测到的任何运动的速度并且基于运动的速度生成适当的命令信号。 命令单元也可以使用运动的方向来生成命令信号。 命令信号然后被提供给计算机系统以相应地移动和控制图形用户界面。
发明人: NORTON, JOHN MARK | BROZSEK, BELA LASZLO

标题: Method for finding cause of abnormal event in support of plant operation
摘要: The accuracy of finding a cause from factors cited by means of a MYCIN method by narrowing down such factors is improved. With respect to deriving events which would not possibly occur if a particular factor 10C among a plurality of factors is a cause of abnormal event 100C, negative deriving events 12C and 1MC negating these deriving events of the other factors which would not occur with factor 10C being the cause are added to a fault tree chart as deriving events of factor 10C.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 通过缩小这些因素,提高了从通过MYCIN方法引用的因素中查找原因的准确性。 对于如果多个因素中的特定因素10C是异常事件100C的原因则不可能发生的派生事件,否定派生事件12C和1MC否定在因素10C为时不会发生的其他因素的这些派生事件 原因被添加到故障树图中,作为因子 10C 的派生事件。

标题: Method and device for assisting the piloting of an aircraft from a voluminous set of memory-stored documents
摘要: A method for assisting the piloting of an aircraft from a voluminous set of memory-stored documents which uses a processor associated with a terminal comprising a screen and control and data entry keys and with memories containing useful information for operating a flight, the processor being connected to other items of equipment of the aerodyne. The method comprises storing of information in a data base and supplying first exploitation functions of this information, real-time acquisition by the processor of an event relative to the current situation of the aerodyne and analyzing the new situation generated by the occurrence of this event, preselecting the information in the data base best adapted to the new situation, and classifying same by order of relevance, supplying second exploitation functions of the preselected information, selection and exploitation, by the operator, of one of the exploitation functions. The method applies in particular to the civil and commercial aviation.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种从大量存储器存储的文档中协助驾驶飞机的方法,该方法使用与终端相关联的处理器,该终端包括屏幕和控制和数据输入键,存储器包含用于操作航班的有用信息,处理器被连接 到航空器的其他设备。 该方法包括将信息存储在数据库中并提供该信息的第一利用功能,由处理器实时获取与飞机当前状况相关的事件并分析由该事件的发生产生的新状况, 在数据库中预选最适合新情况的信息,并按相关性顺序对其进行分类,提供预选信息的第二开发功能,由操作员选择和开发其中一个开发功能。 该方法特别适用于民用和商业航空。

发明人: ODER, ENGIN | PIERRE, FRANCINE | RENOUARD, JEAN-MARIE
发明人地址: Voisins Le Bretonneux, FR | Paris, FR | Saint Cloud, FR

标题: Einrichtung zur digitalen Analyse von Bild- oder Zeichenmustern
摘要(译)(简体中文): 利用一系列基本相同的串行邻域变换模块来分析由表示点矩阵的数字电信号的串行流表示的模式。每个模块包括用于从前一模块接收串行数字输出信号流的输入。利用多个串联连接的数字存储设备来顺序访问矩阵中的所有邻域。每个模块中的控制部分通过将每个邻域与存储的模式进行比较来分析每个邻域，并将变换后的输出提供给后续模块。提供耦合到每个模块的控制部分的中央可编程设备，用于通过将比较邻域模式提供给模块的控制部分来选择性地改变每个模块中的邻域点的分析。

标题: Vektorisationsverfahren.

法律状态/事件: 期限届满 | 权利转移

标题: Image processing method and apparatus which replace horizontal and vertical vectors with an inclined vector
摘要: At step 1 in the flowchart of FIG. 1, multi-valued image data representing an image are read. After the image data are sliced at luminance values of 0 through 255 at step 2, boundary contours are extracted from the image data at step 3. Each boundary contour is converted to an inclined vector contour through an inclined vector process, which is executed according to predetermined conditions at step 4. The inclined vector contour undergoes a desired transformation of coordinates at step 5 before an orthogonal process, which is executed at step 6 to re-convert the inclined vector contours having transformed coordinates to outer and inner boundary contours. At step 7, the CPU (110) fills between the outer boundary contour and the inner boundary contour to generate image data of a closed figure, and combines a plurality of image data in the order of luminance values to generate multi-valued image data. A resulting image is then recorded at step 8 based on the multi-valued image data. The image processing method of the invention allows the resolution of a processed image after transformation of coordinates to be independent of the resolution of an input device and to be maintained at substantially the same level as the resolution of an original image.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 在图1的流程图的步骤1,读取表示图像的多值图像数据。 在步骤 2 中以 0 到 255 的亮度值对图像数据进行切片后,在步骤 3 中从图像数据中提取边界轮廓。每个边界轮廓通过倾斜矢量过程转换为倾斜矢量轮廓,该过程根据 在步骤4预定条件。倾斜矢量轮廓在步骤5在正交过程之前经历期望的坐标变换,正交过程在步骤6执行以将具有变换坐标的倾斜矢量轮廓重新转换为外边界轮廓和内边界轮廓。 在步骤7,CPU(110)在外边界轮廓和内边界轮廓之间填充以生成闭合图形的图像数据,并且按照亮度值的顺序组合多个图像数据以生成多值图像数据。 然后在步骤8基于多值图像数据记录所得图像。 本发明的图像处理方法使得经过坐标变换后的处理图像的分辨率与输入设备的分辨率无关,并保持与原始图像的分辨率基本相同的水平。
[标]当前申请(专利权)人: 大日本屏幕制造股份有限公司
当前第一申请(专利权)人: DAINIPPON SCREEN MFG. CO., LTD., A CORP. OF JAPAN

标题: System and method for selective and continuous index generation
摘要: To improve access to documents in a large database, such as the World Wide Web of the Internet or a group intranet, a continuously updated computer organization and display system, and a method for such an organization and display system, is provided to quickly locate desired documents without generating references to undesired documents, and to quickly allow a user to determine if any documents of interest are available. In one embodiment, such organization and display system includes data structures for storing and processing information extracted from the header lines of web pages in file systems chosen by a user. Linked lists are created in such data structures to allow rapid construction and display of an alphabetical index of keywords from such header lines, each keyword having associated with it a title extracted from the same web-page header. The alphabetical index by keywords may be displayed on a file that permits the user readily to jump to a desired location in the alphabetical index. Alternatively, the user may search the alphabetical index to find titles or keywords that correspond with an entered character string. A user may select a title in the index and view the file from which the title was extracted.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 为了提高对大型数据库中文档的访问,例如Internet的万维网或集团内网,提供了一种不断更新的计算机组织和显示系统,以及这种组织和显示系统的方法,以快速定位所需的 文档而不生成对不想要的文档的引用,并快速允许用户确定是否有任何感兴趣的文档可用。 在一个实施例中,这样的组织和显示系统包括用于存储和处理从用户选择的文件系统中的网页的标题行中提取的信息的数据结构。 在这样的数据结构中创建链接列表以允许从这样的标题行快速构建和显示关键字的字母索引,每个关键字具有与其相关联的从同一网页标题中提取的标题。 按关键字的字母索引可以显示在允许用户容易地跳到字母索引中的期望位置的文件上。 或者,用户可以搜索字母索引以找到与输入的字符串对应的标题或关键字。 用户可以选择索引中的标题并查看从中提取标题的文件。

标题: Motion compensated interframe prediction method based on adaptive motion vector interpolation
摘要: In a method of interpolating the motion vectors at all pixel positions in a frame on the basis of the motion vectors at plural predetermined representative points to perform motion compensated prediction of moving pictures, there is adaptively selected one of a method for dividing the frame into plural areas and interpolating the motion vector every area is selected from a conventional method of linearly interpolating a motion vector by using all the surrounding representative points, a method of separately detecting motion vectors for an area, a method of further dividing an area into plural subareas, a method of temporarily converting the values of the motion vectors at the representative points into values to be used for the motion vector interpolation, and a method of setting a fixed value as a prediction value.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 在基于多个预定代表点处的运动矢量对帧中所有像素位置处的运动矢量进行插值以执行运动图像的运动补偿预测的方法中,自适应地选择用于将帧划分为多个的方法中的一种。 从通过使用所有周围的代表点对运动矢量进行线性内插的传统方法、对一个区域单独检测运动矢量的方法、将一个区域进一步划分为多个子区域的方法中选择区域和对每个区域内插运动矢量, 将代表点处的运动矢量的值临时转换为用于运动矢量插值的值的方法,以及将固定值设置为预测值的方法。
当前第一申请(专利权)人: NEC CORPORATION, A CORPORATION OF JAPAN

标题: Knowledge-based information retrieval system
摘要: A method and system for assisting a user in solving a new problem case within a selected domain, such as a complex apparatus. The method comprises the steps of providing a case database comprising domain knowledge for the selected domain and previously solved case, each previously solved case including a plurality of case attributes, said case attributes comprising case attribute names and associated values, prompting the user to select from the case attributes a set of new problem case attributes considered to be relevant to the new problem case and to provide current values for each of the new problem case attributes,; searching the database of solved cases for candidate solved cases that have one or more of the new problem case attributes selected by the user and generating a list of said candidate solved cases and matching the candidate solved cases to the new problem case by comparing the value for each of the case attributes in the new problem case to the value for the same case attribute in each of the candidate solved cases.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种用于帮助用户解决选定领域(例如复杂设备)内的新问题案例的方法和系统。 该方法包括以下步骤:提供包括所选领域和先前解决的案例的领域知识的案例数据库,每个先前解决的案例包括多个案例属性,所述案例属性包括案例属性名称和相关值,提示用户从 案例属性 一组被认为与新问题案例相关的新问题案例属性,并为每个新问题案例属性提供当前值; 在已解决案例的数据库中搜索具有用户选择的一个或多个新问题案例属性的候选已解决案例,并生成所述候选已解决案例的列表,并通过比较的值将候选已解决案例与新问题案例匹配 新问题案例中的每个案例属性与每个候选已解决案例中相同案例属性的值。

标题: APARELHO E PROCESSO PARA O PROCESSAMENTO DE SINAIS
摘要: An input signal SV has components representing aspects of a physical entity which are in a known state and other components which are unknown. The apparatus processes the signal in accordance with stored data representing rules which indicate which combinations of the components are possible. Rules are identified which involve the known components and all of the combinations consistent with the known states are identified. If all of these combnations have the same value for a particular component, the component is determined to have that value in the output signal. The rules are stored as binary representations of the possible combinations, and the components of the input and output signals may represent two allowable states, tautology (undefined state) and inconsistency (inallowable state).
摘要(译)(简体中文): 输入信号SV具有表示处于已知状态的物理实体的各方面的分量和未知的其他分量。 该装置根据表示规则的存储数据处理信号,该规则指示哪些成分的组合是可能的。 识别涉及已知组件的规则,并识别与已知状态一致的所有组合。 如果所有这些组合对于特定分量具有相同的值,则确定该分量在输出信号中具有该值。 规则被存储为可能组合的二进制表示,并且输入和输出信号的分量可以表示两种允许的状态:同义反复(未定义的状态)和不一致(不允许的状态)。

标题: Anordnung zur automatischen Erfassung der Augenzahl der Oberseite eines Spielwürfels und eine eine derartige Anordnung aufweisende Spielanlage zur professionellen Ausübung von Tischspielen mit Spielwürfeln und Jetons, insbesondere des Spiels "Craps"
摘要: Die Erfindung bezweckt, zur professionellen Ausübung von Tischspielen mit Spielwürfeln und Jetons, insbesondere des Spieles "Craps", eine automatisch überwachte und sämtliche Spielabläufe selbsttätig registrierende und auswertende Spielanlage zur Verfügung zu stellen. Dies wird erreicht durch eine erfindungsgemäße Anordnung zur automatischen Erfassung des Bewegungszustandes und der Augenzahl von Spielwürfeln; diese Anordnung umfaßt wenigstens eine Kamera mit nachgeschaltetem digitalen Bildprozessor und einen Rechner mit EDV-Programm zur Identifizierung der Würfeloberfläche und der Augenzahl und wirkt mit Einrichtungen des Spieltisches zur automatischen Erkennung des Ortes und der Höhe der mittels Jetons, insbesondere Transponder-Jetons, gesetzten Wetten zusammen.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 本发明的目的是提供一种自动注册和评估所有游戏序列的自动监控游戏设施,由此所述设施可用于桌上游戏,尤其是在专业基础上被称为掷骰子的游戏。 因此,本发明的装置用于自动检测骰子上的运动状态和点数,包括至少一台带有下游数字图像处理器的相机和一台带有电子数据处理程序的计算机,用于识别装置的表面和点数 点,由此所述设备与游戏桌设备协作以自动识别借助于筹码,尤其是转发器筹码所下的赌注的位置和数量。

标题: Instant response broadcast board system and method
摘要: An interactive instant response broadcast board comprises a microcomputer and a plurality of display broadcast boards and a plurality of detecting elements arranged thereon that detect the movement of objects detected in front of the broadcast boards, and transmits information to the microcomputer. A host server transmits and receives information to and from broadcast boards and extracts the information read from the microcomputer and detected by the detecting elements, and downloads the image messages and programs to at least one broadcast board for displaying. The broadcast board may be used in public place without being connected to a network.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种交互式即时响应广播板,包括微型计算机和多个显示广播板以及设置在其上的多个检测元件,这些检测元件检测在广播板前面检测到的物体的移动,并将信息传输到微型计算机。 主机服务器向广播板发送和从广播板接收信息,并提取从微型计算机读取并由检测元件检测的信息,并将图像消息和程序下载到至少一个广播板进行显示。 广播板可以在公共场所使用而无需连接到网络。
法律状态/事件: 未缴年费 | 权利转移

标题: 単語分類処理方法、単語分類処理装置及び音声認識装置
摘要:
【課題】 単語分類処理によりバランスのとれた階層構造を有しかつ全体的に最適化された単語分類結果を得ることができる単語分類処理方法、単語分類処理装置、及びその単語分類処理装置を備えた音声認識装置を提供する。
【解決手段】 複数の単語を含むテキストデータに対して、互いに異なるすべての複数v個の単語の出現頻度を調べ、出現頻度の高い単語から順に並べて、複数v個のクラスに割り当て、上記複数v個のクラスの単語のうち出現頻度が高いv個未満の(c+1)個のクラスの単語を1つのウィンドウ内のクラスの単語として第1のメモリに記憶し、当該クラスの単語に基づいて、所定の平均相互情報量が最大となるように、複数の単語を二分木の形式で複数c個のクラスに分類して単語分類結果を表わす全体のツリー図の中間層を求め、当該中間層を中心として、上側層と、中間層の各クラス毎の複数の下側層とを求めて、全体のツリー図を求める。
摘要(译)(简体中文):
Kind Code: A1 一种词分类处理方法、词分类处理装置和词分类处理装置,能够获得层次结构均衡且词分类处理整体优化的词分类结果。 
 SOLUTION:对于包含多个单词的文本数据,检查所有多个v个互不相同的单词的出现频率,将单词按照出现频率的降序排列,分配给多个v类,并分配上述多个v个类。将类词中出现频率小于v的(c+1)个类词作为一个窗口中的类词存储在第一存储器中,并基于类words, ,将多个词以二叉树的形式分类为多个c类,使得预定的平均互信息最大化,得到表示词分类结果的整个树形图的中间层。得到中间层的每一类的上层和多个下层,得到整个树状图。

标题: Process for encrypting a fingerprint onto an i.d. card
摘要: The invention and process utilizes any number of biological parts to provide a proof of legitimacy and from them generate and verify a personal identification card (ID). This rendition of the invention deals mainly with fingerprints, but does not preclude the use of other biological parts. The invention is unique in being able to render complex forms into unique biological characteristic codes of the unique biological parts, especially the fingerprint, and then to be able to encode that code onto the magnetic strip of an ID card or credit card. The invention renders complex biological forms into numeric representations of the unique biological parts and especially the fingerprint. The number generated thereby is encoded onto the magnetic strip of an ID card or credit card. A comparison is made of the live biological part to the number on the card to identify that the person using the card is the legal owner of the card, thus either automatically identifying the person as the legal card holder. This makes it possible to use the card safely without the need for personal attendants to ensure that the transaction is carried out by the legal owner of the card.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 本发明和过程利用任意数量的生物部分来提供合法性证明,并从它们生成和验证个人身份证(ID)。 本发明的这种演绎主要涉及指纹,但不排除使用其他生物部分。 本发明的独特之处在于能够将复杂的形式呈现为独特生​​物部分,尤其是指纹的独特生物特征代码,然后能够将该代码编码到身份证或信用卡的磁条上。 本发明将复杂的生物形式呈现为独特的生物部分,尤其是指纹的数字表示。 由此产生的数字被编码到身份证或信用卡的磁条上。 将活的生物部分与卡上的号码进行比较,以识别使用该卡的人是该卡的合法所有者,从而自动将该人识别为合法持卡人。 这使得可以安全地使用该卡,而无需个人服务员来确保交易是由卡的合法所有者进行的。

标题: Method and apparatus for character recognition, and computer-readable recording medium with a program making a computer execute the method recorded therein
摘要: A character recognition apparatus, in which a type of each of accounts, a type of each of marks, and characteristic data indicating a string of characters recognized when any of the marks is written in each account are previously registered for each group of the types of accounts in correlation to each other in an account-type database; a mark is estimated according to a result of verification between the account-type database and a result of ordinary character recognition according to a character recognizing program; and a type of account having the estimated mark is determined as a selected account name according to a result of recognizing characters in accounts other than the account having the mark.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种字符识别设备,其中每个帐户的类型、每个标记的类型、以及指示在每个帐户中写入任何标记时识别的字符串的特征数据针对每个帐户类型组预先注册。 账户类型数据库中相互关联的账户; 根据账户类型数据库的验证结果和通过字符识别程序进行普通字符识别的结果来估计一个标记; 根据对除具有该标记的帐户以外的帐户中的字符进行识别的结果,确定具有该估计标记的帐户类型为选定帐户名称。
发明人: MATSUNO, HIDEKI | EGUCHI, SHINICHI | NAGANO, YOSHIHIRO | CHIBA, KOICHI | KOBARA, KATSUTOSHI

标题: Abnormal pattern detecting apparatus
摘要: An abnormal pattern detecting apparatus comprises an image operating device which generates a soft tissue image signal representing a soft tissue image, a bone image signal representing a bone image, and an original image signal representing an original image from several image signals representing radiation images of an object, which radiation images have been recorded by exposing the object to at least two kinds of radiation having different energy distributions. A prospective abnormal pattern finding device finds prospective abnormal patterns, which appear in the soft tissue, bone, and original images, by processing the corresponding image signals with an abnormal pattern finding filter. A bone pattern finding device finds information about the positions of bone patterns appearing in the radiation image. From information about the positions of the prospective abnormal patterns and the information about the positions of the bone patterns, a judgment device judges whether the prospective abnormal patterns thus found are or are not true abnormal patterns.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种异常模式检测装置,包括图像操作装置,该图像操作装置生成表示软组织图像的软组织图像信号、表示骨图像的骨图像信号、以及从表示关节的放射线图像的多个图像信号中表示原始图像的原始图像信号。 对象,通过将对象暴露于至少两种具有不同能量分布的辐射来记录这些辐射图像。 预期异常模式发现设备通过用异常模式发现滤波器处理相应的图像信号来发现出现在软组织、骨骼和原始图像中的预期异常模式。 骨骼图案查找设备可查找关于出现在辐射图像中的骨骼图案位置的信息。 判断装置根据关于预期异常模式的位置信息和关于骨骼模式的位置信息,判断由此发现的预期异常模式是否是真正的异常模式。

标题: Hypertext document retrieving apparatus for retrieving hypertext documents relating to each other
摘要: A hypertext document and anchor sentences of parent documents for the hypertext document are registered with an hypertext document identifier as document information for each of hypertext documents having reference relationships with each other. A user can refer to one hypertext document according to an anchor sentence of another hypertext document functioning as a parent document. Also, occurrence positions of one word in hypertext documents and parent documents are registered as word information for each of words. When a keyword is input, a plurality of particular hypertext documents and particular parent documents in which the keyword appears are specified according to the word information, one particular hypertext document and corresponding particular parent documents are unified to a unified hypertext document for each particular hypertext document, an occurrence frequency of the keyword in each unified hypertext document is calculated according to the document information, importance degrees of the unified hypertext documents are calculated as those of the particular hypertext documents according to the occurrence frequencies, and ranking of the particular hypertext documents are determined according to those importance degrees. Because the occurrence frequency is calculated by considering the parent documents, the particular hypertext documents can be appropriately ranked.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 超文本文档和用于该超文本文档的父文档的锚句与超文本文档标识符一起注册,作为彼此具有参考关系的每个超文本文档的文档信息。 用户可以根据另一个作为父文档的超文本文档的锚句来引用一个超文本文档。 此外,一个词在超文本文档和父文档中的出现位置被登记为每个词的词信息。 输入关键词时,根据词信息指定多个特定超文本文档和出现该关键词的特定父文档,将一个特定超文本文档和对应的特定父文档统一为每个特定超文本文档的统一超文本文档 ,根据文档信息计算关键词在每个统一超文本文档中的出现频率,根据出现频率将统一超文本文档的重要度计算为特定超文本文档的重要度,特定超文本文档的排序为 根据这些重要程度确定。 因为出现频率是通过考虑父文档来计算的,所以可以对特定的超文本文档进行适当的排序。
[标]当前申请(专利权)人: 松下电器产业株式会社
发明人: ISHIKAWA, MASATO | SATO, MITSUHIRO | HOSHIDA, MASAKI | NOGUCHI, YOSHIHIRO | YASUKAWA, HIDEKI
发明人地址: Tokyo, JP | Yokohama, JP | Ichikawa, JP

标题: 画像処理方法およびその装置
摘要: In each of two images obtained by a digital radiography system, for example, a mask image and a live image, two regions of interest are set by a cutout position setting section (11). Images within corresponding regions of interest are subjected to subtraction in a subtraction processing section (16). By calculating the entropy of one of two subtraction images in an entropy calculating section (18), amounts of shift to make the entropy local minimum is searched for. By using the amounts of shift to make the entropy local minimum, an amount of rotation is searched for, which makes the entropy of the other subtraction image local minimum. The amounts of shift and rotation are set by a parameter setting section (14) in accordance with the calculated entropy.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 在由数字射线照相系统获得的两个图像中的每一个中,例如掩模图像和实时图像,两个关注区域由剪切位置设置部分(11)设置。 在减法处理部分(16)中对相应感兴趣区域内的图像进行减法处理。 通过在熵计算部分(18)中计算两个相减图像之一的熵,搜索使熵局部最小的偏移量。 通过使用偏移量使熵局部最小,搜索旋转量,使另一幅相减图像的熵局部最小。 偏移量和旋转量由参数设置部分(14)根据计算的熵来设置。

标题: Image processing device for continuously extracting features of small regions of an image
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种图像处理装置，其处理二维扫描图像中预定数量（m×n）的图像元素的小区域，并且每次新图像连续获得包含新图像元素的新小区域的图像元素数据的累积输出读出元素数据。获得（M×N）个图像元素阵列中每行的n个连续图像元素的数据总和，并在每次读取相应行的新图像元素时更新。获得具有（m×n）个图像元素的小区域的像素数据的累加和，并且每当读取新的图像元素数据时更新，从而获得新的（m×n）像素数据的累加和。
法律状态/事件: 未缴年费 | 权利转移

标题: Sequence generation using a constraint satisfaction problem formulation
摘要: A method and system for automatic generation of sequences (notably temporal or spatial sequences) from items in a database involves the organisation of the data in a generic format, and the formulation of the problem as a Constraint Satisfaction Problem using special constraint classes. The database format includes attribute values referring to a predetermined taxonomy allowing similarity and difference between the respective values to be evaluated. The special constraint classes include the classes of cardinality constraints (which allow it to be specified that the number of items whose attribute belongs to a given set is within a particular range, and/or that the number of values of an attribute is within a specified range), similarity or dissimilarity constraints (which allow it to be specified that successive items must be similar or different from each other) and global difference constraints (which allow it to be specified that the respective values of a given attribute for all items in a range must be different from each other).
摘要(译)(简体中文): 从数据库中的项目自动生成序列(特别是时间或空间序列)的方法和系统涉及以通用格式组织数据,以及使用特殊约束类将问题表述为约束满足问题。 数据库格式包括参考预定分类法的属性值,允许评估各个值之间的相似性和差异。 特殊约束类包括基数约束类(允许指定其属性属于给定集合的项目数在特定范围内,和/或属性值的数量在指定范围内 范围)、相似性或相异性约束(允许指定连续的项目必须彼此相似或不同)和全局差异约束(允许指定给定属性的各个值在一个 范围必须彼此不同)。
[标]当前申请(专利权)人: 索尼法国股份有限公司

标题: DISPOSITIF DE GENERATION D'INTERFACES ORIENTEES OBJET POUR DES BASES DE DONNEES RELATIONNELLES ET PROCEDE MIS EN OEUVRE PAR LEDIT DISPOSITIF
摘要: The generation method involves creating an object schema from an object orientated interface generation method and schema, constituting an object oriented view of the existing relational database. This view, forms the object orientated interface and is composed of class groups representing the stored entities in the database. The input of the interface generation system shows how to apply the description of the database in a standard definition language for manipulation of data.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 生成方法涉及从面向对象的接口生成方法和模式创建对象模式,构成现有关系数据库的面向对象视图。 该视图形成了面向对象的接口,并由表示数据库中存储的实体的类组组成。 接口生成系统的输入显示了如何应用标准定义语言中的数据库描述来操作数据。

标题: Sätt att adaptivt estimera icke önskade globala bildinstabiliteter i bildsekvenser i digitala videosignaler
摘要: A method for estimation of global error motion vectors, which represent unwanted global picture instabilities in a picture sequence in digital video signals. The method uses a motion vector estimator with an adaptively variable measuring time distance, as well as spatial processing and temporal processing, in order to estimate a sequence of global motion vectors, from which a sequence of global error motion vectors is separated in order to allow stabilization of a picture sequence in digital video signals.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种用于估计全局误差运动矢量的方法,它表示数字视频信号中图像序列中不需要的全局图像不稳定性。 该方法使用具有自适应可变测量时间距离的运动矢量估计器以及空间处理和时间处理来估计全局运动矢量序列,从中分离出全局误差运动矢量序列以便允许 稳定数字视频信号中的图像序列。

标题: Person identification apparatus and method using concentric templates and feature point candidates
摘要: In a person identification apparatus, a normalized face image is used to identify a person. When the face image of the person is input, a face area extraction section extracts the face area from the face image. A feature point extraction section extracts a plurality of candidates of feature points from the face area using a separation filter. A feature point set selection section selects sets of the candidates from the plurality of candidates of feature points according to face structure information. A feature point decision section extracts neighboring patterns of each candidate from the face area for the set of candidates, calculates a similarity value between the neighboring patterns of each candidate and the template pattern, and selects a subset of the candidates having the highest similarity values. A normalization section generates a normalized face image of the face area according to the selected subset of the candidates. A recognition section compares the normalized face image with the registered image to identify the person.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 在人识别装置中,标准化的人脸图像用于识别人。 当人的面部图像被输入时,面部区域提取部分从面部图像中提取面部区域。 特征点提取部分使用分离滤波器从面部区域提取多个候选特征点。 特征点集选择部分根据面部结构信息从多个候选特征点中选择候选集。 特征点决定部分从候选集的面部区域中提取每个候选的相邻模式,计算每个候选的相邻模式与模板模式之间的相似度值,并选择具有最高相似度值的候选子集​​。 归一化部分根据所选择的候选子集​​生成面部区域的归一化面部图像。 识别部分将归一化的面部图像与登记的图像进行比较以识别人。

标题: Method of processing an image such as a still image
摘要: A method of processing an image comprises the steps of: supplying a photographing condition and/or a conversion process condition, e.g., at the time of photographing; using the supplied photographing condition and the supplied conversion process condition as parameters; and performing a processing, such as a conversion process, for an image signal of an image by using the parameters.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种处理图像的方法包括以下步骤:提供拍摄条件和/或转换处理条件,例如,在拍摄时; 以提供的拍摄条件和提供的转换过程条件为参数; 使用所述参数对图像的图像信号进行转换处理等处理。
发明人: KIMURA, HIROYUKI | TAKAHASHI, KOJI | URUSHIHARA, KAZUNOBU | MATSUMURA, SUSUMU | KATSUMA, MAKOTO | OHMURA, HIROSHI
发明人地址: Yokohama, JP | Inagi, JP | Wako, JP

标题: Virtual retinal display with eye tracking
摘要: Light emitted from a virtual retinal display light source passes through a beamsplitter to a scanning subsystem and on to an eyepiece and the viewer's eye. Some of the light is reflected from the viewer's eye passing back along the same path. Such light however is deflected at the beamsplitter toward a photodetector. The reflected light is detected and correlated to the display scanner's position. The content of the reflected light and the scanner position for such sample is used to generate a map of the viewer's retina. Such map includes "landmarks' such as the viewer's optic nerve, fovea, and blood vessels. The map of the viewer's retina is stored and used for purposes of viewer identification. The viewer's fovea position is monitored to track where the viewer is looking
摘要(译)(简体中文): 从虚拟视网膜显示光源发出的光通过分束器到达扫描子系统,然后到达目镜和观察者的眼睛。 一些光线从观察者的眼睛反射回来,沿着相同的路径返回。 然而,这种光在分束器处偏转到光电探测器。 反射光被检测并与显示扫描仪的位置相关联。 此类样本的反射光内容和扫描仪位置用于生成观察者视网膜的地图。 这种地图包括“地标”,例如观看者的视神经、中央凹和血管。观看者视网膜的地图被存储并用于观看者识别。监视观看者的中央凹位置以跟踪观看者正在看的地方
发明人: MELVILLE, CHARLES D. | JOHNSTON, RICHARD S.

标题: Methods for surveying dissemination of proprietary empirical data
摘要: An automated system checks networked computers, such as computers on the internet, for watermarked audio, video, or image data. A report listing the location of such audio, video or image data is generated, and provided to the proprietor(s) thereof identified by the watermark information.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 自动化系统会检查联网计算机(例如 Internet 上的计算机)是否有带水印的音频、视频或图像数据。 生成列出此类音频、视频或图像数据的位置的报告,并将其提供给由水印信息标识的所有者。

标题: Keypad-assisted speech recognition for text or command input to concurrently-running computer application
摘要: A method for recognizing a spoken audio signal as input data to a computer includes receiving the spoken audio signal at an input device of the computer, receiving a typed first letter of the spoken audio signal at the input device of the computer and searching through entries that begin with the typed first letter in a dictionary in the computer for a best match with the spoken audio signal.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种用于将口语音频信号识别为计算机的输入数据的方法,包括在计算机的输入设备处接收口语音频信号,在计算机的输入设备处接收口语音频信号的键入的第一个字母,并搜索符合以下条件的条目。 从计算机字典中键入的第一个字母开始,以便与口语音频信号进行最佳匹配。
法律状态/事件: 未缴年费 | 权利转移

标题: Device for electroconductive connection and reading
摘要: 1438685 Card and electroconductive reader; recognizing character forms N SAMREUS 20 July 1973 [21 July 1972] 34672/73 Headings G4M and G4R A card such as a flight or hotel reservation card carries conductive strips 12 selected ones of which may be electrically connected by conductive writing material 14. A reader 16 has sets of contacts 15 engaging the strips under pressure to connect the strips to reading circuitry. The strips may be in pairs (Fig. 1b aligned with printed information, may be in the form of strips on a card which is pressed against a card carrying conductive markings. (Figs. 2a-2c, not shown) or may be in the form of alpha numeric conductive marks arranged on a grid of conductive strips (Fig. 3a). Separate substrates may each carry a strip such that when placed face to face a conductive marking on one substrate will connect both strips (Figs. 5a-5c not shown). The strips may be at different levels in a substrate with spurs of each strip emerging at the substrate surface to allow connection of separate strips and the strips may form alpha numeric characters (Figs. 7a-7c, not shown). The strips may be on paper-like material and a reader for such sheets has a base 128 (Fig. 8a) with pillars 127 received in holes in the sheets for alignment. A pivotal lid 129 holds one end of the sheets and presses contacts 125 against the strips. Boards 132 carry reading circuitry.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 1438685 卡和导电读卡器; 识别字符形式 N SAMREUS 1973 年 7 月 20 日 [1972 年 7 月 21 日] 34672/73 标题 G4M 和 G4R 诸如航班卡或旅馆预订卡之类的卡片带有导电条 12 选定的导电条可以通过导电书写材料进行电气连接 14. 阅读器 16具有在压力下接合条以将条连接至读取电路的触点组15。 条带可以成对(图 1b 与印刷信息对齐,可以是卡上的条带形式,压在带有导电标记的卡上。(图 2a-2c,未显示)或者可以在 排列在导电条网格上的字母数字导电标记的形式(图 3a)。单独的基板可以各自携带一条条,这样当面对面放置时,一个基板上的导电标记将连接两个条(图 5a-5c 不是 条带可能位于基板中的不同高度,每个条带的支线出现在基板表面以允许连接单独的条带,并且条带可以形成字母数字字符(图 7a-7c,未显示)。 可以在类似纸的材料上,并且此类纸张的阅读器具有底座 128(图 8a),支柱 127 接收在纸张中的孔中以进行对齐。枢轴盖 129 固定纸张的一端并将触点 125 压在纸张上 板 132 带有读取电路。

标题: Method of defining hole position of punch mounting part
摘要: The method defines the position of component holes (PH1-PH3) such as bolts for fitting a punch to a plate (PLT), stores the positions of the component holes (PH1-PH3) in association with the shapes of the punches (DF1-DF3) and moves the component hole positions in conjunction with the movement of the punch shapes.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 该方法定义组件孔 (PH1-PH3) 的位置,例如用于将冲头安装到板 (PLT) 的螺栓,将组件孔 (PH1-PH3) 的位置与冲头的形状 (DF1-  DF3) 并随着冲头形状的移动移动元件孔位置。

标题: SYSTEM ZUM ORDNEN VON DOKUMENTEN.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 临时存储在缓冲存储器中的图像信息通过大小转换电路缩小到一定比例,并存储在接口设备中的刷新存储器中以进行显示。 针对刷新存储器中的图片信息设置预定大小的光标。 在CRT显示单元的屏幕上显示由光标包围的添加光标的图像信息或部分图像信息。

标题: System and method for managing dynamic web page generation requests
摘要: The present invention teaches a method and apparatus for creating and managing custom Web sites. Specifically, one embodiment of the present invention claims a computer-implemented method for managing a dynamic Web page generation request to a Web server, the computer-implemented method comprising the steps of routing the request from the Web server to a page server, the page server receiving the request and releasing the Web server to process other requests, processing the request, the processing being performed by the page server concurrently with the Web server, as the Web server processes the other requests, and dynamically generating a Web page in response to the request, the Web page including data dynamically retrieved from one or more data sources.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 本发明教导了一种用于创建和管理定制网站的方法和装置。 具体而言,本发明的一个实施例要求保护一种用于管理对 Web 服务器的动态网页生成请求的计算机实现的方法,该计算机实现的方法包括将请求从 Web 服务器路由到页面服务器的步骤,该页面 服务器接收请求并释放 Web 服务器处理其他请求,处理请求,页面服务器与 Web 服务器同时执行处理,当 Web 服务器处理其他请求时,动态生成网页以响应 根据请求,网页包括从一个或多个数据源动态检索的数据。

标题: Evaluation entry and data retrieval apparatus
摘要: The invention provides a data retrieval apparatus which includes a sensibility database 2 for storing a plurality of title names, evaluation points on a plurality of evaluation items, and identifiers assigned to evaluators responsible for the evaluation points; an evaluation point input block 1 for accepting an evaluation on each of the plurality of evaluation items; an evaluation point correction process block 5 for correcting each of the evaluations accepted by the evaluation point input block 1 by using a plurality of evaluator difference data for each of the plurality of evaluators; a retrieval criteria generating process block 6 for selecting a title name from the sensibility database 2 on the basis of each corrected evaluation; and a data retrieval process block 7. With this data retrieval apparatus, flexible data retrieval can be conducted by just entering subjective evaluation points even for objects from which objective numeric values related to subjective evaluation criteria are difficult to extract.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 本发明提供了一种数据检索装置,包括感性数据库2,用于存储多个标题名称、多个评价项目的评价点、以及分配给负责评价点的评价者的标识符。 评价点输入块1,用于接受对多个评价项目中的每一个的评价; 评价点修正处理部5,对评价点输入部1接受的评价分别使用多个评价者的多个评价者差分数据进行修正。 检索标准生成过程块6,用于根据每个校正评价从感性数据库2中选择标题名称; 以及数据检索处理块7。利用该数据检索装置,即使对于难以提取与主观评价标准相关的客观数值的对象,也可以通过仅输入主观评价点来进行灵活的数据检索。

标题: Gespeicherter, kompakt kodierter Zeichenreihensatz und dessen Anwendung
摘要: A product includes a storage medium and string set data stored by the storage medium. The string set data can be accessed in a search to determine whether a string of characters is one of a set of strings. The string set data includes items of data (ADDRESSES 1-6) ordered in a sequence. Some of the items of data include label information (LABEL), next information (EOB), and alternative information (ALT). The label information (LABEL) indicates a character type. The next information (EOB) indicates whether the item of data has a next data item to which search continues if a current character in the string is an instance of the character type indicated by the label information (LABEL). The alternative information (ALT) indicates whether the item of data has an alternative data item to which search can continue if the current character in the string is not an instance of the character type indicated by the label information (LABEL). The item of data is positioned so that, if the next information (EOB) indicates that the first data item has a next data item, the next data item can be accessed (258;Fig. 11) based on the positions in the sequence of the first and next (EOB) data items. The item of data also is positioned in the sequence so that, if the alternative information (ALT) indicates that the first data item has an alternative data item, the alternative data item can be accessed (266;Fig. 11) based on the positions in the sequence of the first and alternative data items. The item of data can also include final information (FINAL) indicating whether a string of characters being matched is in the set of strings if its last character matches the label information. The item of data can be encoded in a byte (88;Fig. 5) and the string set data can also include a pointer (234;Fig. 9) to the item of data to reduce redundancy. <IMAGE>
摘要(译)(简体中文): 产品包括存储介质和存储介质存储的字符串集合数据。 可以在搜索中访问字符串集数据以确定字符串是否是一组字符串中的一个。 字符串集数据包括按顺序排列的数据项(ADDRESSES 1-6)。 一些数据项包括标签信息(LABEL)、下一个信息(EOB)和替代信息(ALT)。 标签信息(LABEL)表示字符类型。 如果字符串中的当前字符是标签信息(LABEL)指示的字符类型的实例,则下一个信息(EOB)指示该数据项是否具有继续搜索的下一个数据项。 替代信息 (ALT) 指示如果字符串中的当前字符不是标签信息 (LABEL) 指示的字符类型的实例,则数据项是否具有可以继续搜索的替代数据项。 数据项的位置使得,如果下一个信息(EOB)指示第一个数据项有下一个数据项,则可以基于以下顺序中的位置访问(258;图11)下一个数据项 第一个和下一个 (EOB) 数据项。 该数据项也在序列中定位,以便如果替代信息(ALT)指示第一个数据项具有替代数据项,则可以基于位置访问(266;图11)替代数据项 按照第一个和替代数据项的顺序。 数据项还可以包括最终信息(FINAL),该最终信息指示被匹配的字符串是否在字符串集合中,如果它的最后一个字符与标签信息匹配的话。 数据项可以编码为字节(88;图 5),并且字符串集数据还可以包括指向数据项的指针(234;图 9)以减少冗余。
发明人: KAPLAN,RONALD M. | KAY,MARTIN | MAXWELL III,JOHN T.

标题: Multi-view approach to motion and stereo
摘要: A system and process for computing motion or depth estimates from multiple images. In general terms this is accomplished by associating a depth or motion map with each input image (or some subset of the images equal or greater than two), rather that computing a single map for all the images. In addition, consistency between the estimates associated with different images is ensured. More particularly, this involves minimizing a three-part cost function, which consists of an intensity (or color) compatibility constraint, a motion/depth compatibility constraint, and a flow smoothness constraint. In addition, a visibility term is added to the intensity (or color) compatibility and motion/depth compatibility constraints to prevent the matching of pixels into areas that are occluded. In operation, the cost function is computed in two phases. During an initializing phase, the motion or depth for each image being examined are estimated independently. Since there are not yet any estimates for other frames to employ in the calculation, the motion or depth compatibility term is ignored. In addition, no visibilities are computed and it is assumed all pixels are visible. Once an initial set of motion estimates have been computed, the visibilities are computed and the motion or depth estimates recalculated using the visibility terms and the motion or depth compatibility constraint. The foregoing process can then be repeated several times using the revised estimates from the previous iteration as the initializing estimates for the new iteration, to obtain better estimates of motion/depth values and visibility.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 用于从多个图像计算运动或深度估计的系统和过程。 一般而言,这是通过将深度或运动图与每个输入图像(或图像的某个子集等于或大于两个)相关联来实现的,而不是为所有图像计算单个图。 此外,确保了与不同图像相关的估计之间的一致性。 更具体地说,这涉及最小化由强度(或颜色)兼容性约束、运动/深度兼容性约束和流动平滑度约束组成的三部分成本函数。 此外,在强度(或颜色)兼容性和运动/深度兼容性约束中添加了可见性项,以防止像素匹配到被遮挡的区域。 在操作中,成本函数分两个阶段计算。 在初始化阶段,每个被检查的图像的运动或深度都是独立估计的。 由于在计算中还没有任何其他帧的估计,因此忽略了运动或深度兼容性项。 此外,不计算可见性,并假设所有像素都是可见的。 一旦已经计算出一组初始运动估计,则计算能见度并使用能见度项和运动或深度兼容性约束重新计算运动或深度估计。 然后可以使用来自先前迭代的修正估计作为新迭代的初始化估计重复上述过程几次,以获得运动/深度值和可见性的更好估计。

标题: Processing method in radiographic image recording systems
摘要: In the digital processing of radiographic images, interpretation of the image is aided by converting the pixels of an original radiographic image into electrical signals generally corresponding to the densities of the individual pixels and adjusting the electrical signals for the pixels constituting a diagnostically non-relevant image zone, selectively of the pixels constituting a diagnostically relevant image zone, as determined by observation of a visualization of the original radiographic images, e.g. by a radiologist viewing such image on the screen of a viewing monitor, to a density level such that when the electrical signals including the adjusted signals are visualized into an image for interpretation, the pixels of the diagnostically non-relevant zone are effectively masked out and light from the non-relevant zone is prevented from interfering with viewing of the relevant zone. Various predetermined configurations, e.g. a rectangle, circle or polygon, can be selected for the relevant zone for generation by identifying a few selected points on the original. image being viewed, e.g., opposite corner points for a rectangular, a center point and perimeter point for a circle, etc. The visualized image with the blanked out non-relevant regions can be recorded electronically as a soft copy or photographically as a hard copy on a photographic recording medium. Border regions around the image can be made of maximum density, e.g. black, while the density of the non-relevant zone is adjusted to a lesser but still masking density.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 在射线照相图像的数字处理中,通过将原始射线照相图像的像素转换为通常对应于各个像素的密度的电信号并调整构成诊断无关图像的像素的电信号来帮助图像的解释 区域,选择性地构成诊断相关图像区域的像素,如通过观察原始射线照相图像的可视化所确定的,例如 由放射科医师在观察监视器的屏幕上观察这样的图像,达到这样的密度水平,使得当包括经调整的信号的电信号被可视化为用于解释的图像时,诊断上不相关区域的像素被有效地掩盖并且 防止来自非相关区域的光干扰相关区域的观察。 各种预定配置,例如 通过识别原件上的几个选定点,可以为相关区域选择矩形、圆形或多边形以进行生成。 正在查看的图像,例如,矩形的对角点,圆形的中心点和周边点等。具有消隐非相关区域的可视化图像可以电子记录为软拷贝或照相记录为硬拷贝 在照相记录介质上。 图像周围的边界区域可以由最大密度组成,例如 黑色,而非相关区域的密度被调整为较小但仍然掩蔽的密度。
发明人: SCHOETERS, EMILE PAUL | HAYEN, LUCIEN ALFRED
法律状态/事件: 期限届满 | 权利转移

标题: Method and apparatus for identifying classifying or quantifying DNA sequences in a sample without sequencing
摘要: This invention provides methods by which biologically derived DNA sequences in a mixed sample or in an arrayed single sequence clone can be determined and classified without sequencing. The methods make use of information on the presence of carefully chosen target subsequences, typically of length from 4 to 8 base pairs, and preferably the length between target subsequences in a sample DNA sequence together with DNA sequence databases containing lists of sequences likely to be present in the sample to determine a sample sequence. The preferred method uses restriction endonucleases to recognize target subsequences and cut the sample sequence. Then carefully chosen recognition moieties are ligated to the cut fragments, the fragments amplified, and the experimental observation made. Polymerase chain reaction (PCR) is the preferred method of amplification. Another embodiment of the invention uses information on the presence or absence of carefully chosen target subsequences in a single sequence clone together with DNA sequence databases to determine the clone sequence. Computer implemented methods are provided to analyze the experimental results and to determine the sample sequences in question and to carefully choose target subsequences in order that experiments yield a maximum amount of information.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 本发明提供了无需测序即可确定和分类混合样品或排列的单序列克隆中的生物学衍生DNA序列的方法。 该方法利用关于存在精心选择的目标子序列的信息,通常长度为 4 到 8 个碱基对,优选地是样本 DNA 序列中目标子序列之间的长度,以及包含可能存在的序列列表的 DNA 序列数据库 在样品中确定样品序列。 优选的方法使用限制性内切酶来识别目标亚序列并切割样品序列。 然后将精心挑选的识别部分连接到切割的片段上,放大片段,并进行实验观察。 聚合酶链式反应 (PCR) 是首选的扩增方法。 本发明的另一个实施方案使用关于在单个序列克隆中是否存在仔细选择的靶子序列的信息以及DNA序列数据库来确定克隆序列。 提供了计算机实现的方法来分析实验结果并确定有问题的样本序列并仔细选择目标子序列,以便实验产生最大量的信息。
发明人: ROTHBERG, JONATHAN MARC | DEEM, MICHAEL W. | SIMPSON, JOHN W.
发明人地址: Branford, CT | Cambridge, MA | Madison, CT

标题: System for creating transposed image data from a run end or run length representation of an image
摘要: A system for formatting electronic binary image data, which may be in compressed raster form, into transposed or rotated raster form for storage or output, such as on a printing device, is disclosed wherein the image data is first assembled in a buffer in the form of vectors of run ends representing successive raster scan lines of an original image to be reproduced. The elements of an intermediate buffer are initialized to zero and the data is entered into the intermediate buffer by using each run end to set a bit in the intermediate buffer, with the bits being set in the buffer elements in correspondence with the respective raster positions of the run ends. The elements of the intermediate buffer containing the entered electronic data are then combined, such as by EXCLUSIVE-ORing, to create transposed or rotated raster data, which may stored or input to a suitable output device, such as a printer or display. The raster data may be compressed in the process and other processes, such as image reversal, may be carried out with facility.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 公开了一种用于将可以是压缩光栅形式的电子二进制图像数据格式化为转置或旋转光栅形式以便存储或输出的系统,例如在打印设备上,其中图像数据首先以如下形式组装在缓冲器中 代表要再现的原始图像的连续光栅扫描线的运行结束向量的向量。 中间缓冲区的元素被初始化为零,并且通过使用每个运行端在中间缓冲区中设置一个位来将数据输入到中间缓冲区中,这些位在缓冲区元素中设置对应于相应的光栅位置 运行结束。 然后,包含输入的电子数据的中间缓冲区的元素被组合,例如通过异或,以创建转置或旋转的光栅数据,这些数据可以存储或输入到合适的输出设备,例如打印机或显示器。 光栅数据可以在该过程中被压缩,并且可以方便地执行其他过程,例如图像反转。

标题: Information processing system for consulting centralized information originating in operational applications
摘要: An information processing system for consulting centralized information originating in operational applications including a server and a plurality of microcomputers that issue requests to the server. The server includes data stored in the form of files and a metadictionary developed around a plurality of tables specific to the documentation and the administration of the system. Notably, the data is organized in domains, subdomains and functions, and are analyzed by a logical process contained in the metadictionary, which includes axes and indicators that describe the applications. The logical process makes it possible, at the moment the data to be imported into the server is defined, to create tables that contain the data of complementary tables, called consolidation tables, to authorize a generic response to all the requests made of the data and to optimize access performance.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种用于查询源自操作应用程序的集中信息的信息处理系统,包括服务器和向服务器发出请求的多个微型计算机。 该服务器包括以文件形式存储的数据和围绕特定于文档和系统管理的多个表开发的元字典。 值得注意的是,数据按域、子域和功能进行组织,并通过元字典中包含的逻辑过程进行分析,其中包括描述应用程序的轴和指标。 在定义要导入服务器的数据时,逻辑过程可以创建包含补充表数据的表,称为合并表,以授权对所有数据请求的通用响应和 优化访问性能。
发明人: ENTRESSANGLE, GABRIEL | PAOLI, CLAUDE | DALLE RIVE, JEAN
发明人地址: Brie et Argonnes, FR | Villard Bonnot, FR | Meylan, FR

标题: SISTEMA DE TELECOMUNICACIONES Y DE TRADUCCION AUTOMATICA.
摘要: UN SISTEMA DE TRADUCCION AUTOMATICA Y DE TELECOMUNICACIONES QUE TRADUCE AUTOMATICAMENTE UN TEXTO DE ENTRADA ESCRITO EN UN LENGUAJE FUENTE A UN TEXTO DE SALIDA EN EL LENGUAJE OBJETIVO UTILIZANDO UNA BASE DE DATOS DE DICCIONARIOS (22) QUE INCLUYE UNOS DICCIONARIOS PRINCIPALES PARA LAS PALABRAS GENERALES, UNA PLURALIDAD DE SUBDICCIONARIOS PARA PALABRAS ESPECIALIZADAS REFERENTES A DISTINTAS MATERIAS O GRUPOS DE USUARIOS Y UNA PLURALIDAD DE DICCIONARIOS DE USUARIO PARA LAS PALABRAS INDIVIDUALIZADAS UTILIZADAS POR LOS DISTINTOS USUARIOS. EL SISTEMA INCLUYE UNA INTERFAZ DE RECEPCION (11) PARA RECIBIR LAS ENTRADAS DE UN EMISOR, A MODO DE TEXTO ELECTRONICO, ENTRADA DE FACSIMILES (GRAFICOS) O DATOS DE IMAGEN DE PAGINA Y UN MODULO DE SALIDA (30) PARA ENVIAR EL TEXTO DE SALIDA TRADUCIDO A CUALQUIER RECEPTOR O RECEPTORES DESIGNADOS. EL TEXTO DE ENTRADA VA ACOMPAÑADO POR UNA CUBIERTA O ENCABEZAMIENTO (50) EN LA QUE SE IDENTIFICA EL EMISOR, UNO O MAS RECEPTORES, SUS DIRECCIONES, LAS LENGUAS FUENTE Y DESTINO DEL TEXTO, CUALQUIER SUBLENGUA O SUBLENGUAS APLICABLES AL TEXTO DE ENTRADA Y CUALQUIER REQUISITO DE FORMATEO PARA EL TEXTO DE SALIDA. EL SISTEMA UTILIZA LOS DATOS DE LA CUBIERTA O DEL ENCABEZAMIENTO PARA SELECCIONAR LOS DICCIONARIOS PRINCIPALES DE LENGUA PRINCIPAL, LOS SUBDICCIONARIOS Y/O LOS DICCIONARIOS DEL USUARIO A UTILIZAR PARA EL PROCESO DE TRADUCCION, PARA FORMATEAR EL TEXTO DE SALIDA TRADUCIDO Y PARA ENVIAR LA SALIDA AL RECEPTOR O RECEPTORES A LA DIRECCION O DIRECCIONES DESIGNADAS. LA BASE DE DATOS DE DICCIONARIOS (22) PUEDE ACUMULAR UN DESARROLLO A LO LARGO DEL TIEMPO A BASE DE AÑADIR NUEVAS PALABRAS A MODO DE ENTRADAS DE TRABAJO EN LOS DICCIONARIOS DE USUARIO Y, MEDIANTE EL USO DE UTILIDADES DE MANTENIMIENTO DE LOS DICCIONARIOS, A BASE DE ACTUALIZAR Y/O TRASLADAR LAS ENTRADAS DE TRABAJO A UNOS SUBDOMINOS DE MAYOR NIVEL, A DOMINIOS E INCLUSO A DICCIONARIOS PRINCIPALES A MEDIDA QUE SU USO SE HACE MAS CORRIENTE.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 机器翻译和电信系统使用字典数据库(22)自动将源语言的输入文本翻译成目标语言的输出文本,该字典数据库(22)包含通用词的核心语言词典、不同领域或用户组的专业词的多个子语言词典 ,以及多个用户词典,用于不同用户使用的个性化单词。 该系统包括接收接口(11),用于接收来自发送者的输入,其形式为电子文本、传真(图形)输入或页面图像数据,以及输出模块(30),用于将翻译后的输出文本发送到任何指定的接收者 (s)。 输入文本附有封面或标题 (50),标识发件人、一个或多个收件人、他们的地址、文本的源/目标语言、适用于输入文本的任何子语言以及任何格式要求 用于输出文本。 系统使用封面或标题数据来选择用于翻译处理的核心语言、子语言和/或用户词典,格式化翻译的输出文本,并将输出发送给指定的接收者 地址。 字典数据库 (22) 可以通过将新词作为草稿条目添加到用户字典,并通过使用字典维护实用程序,通过更新和/或移动草稿条目到更高级别的子域、域、 甚至核心词典,因为它们的使用获得了货币。

发明人: CHONG, LEIGHTON, K. | KAMPRATH, CHRISTINE, K.

标题: Outline-driven database editing and retrieval system
摘要(译)(简体中文): 通过使用大纲样式文本编辑器创建和查询关系数据库，该编辑器允许自动生成用于创建记录的数据输入表单。简化了数据输入和编辑，并最大限度地减少了错误，因为轮廓中的更改会自动反映在数据输入表单中，从而自动更新记录。通过大纲的操作来驱动数据检索，以允许简单和复杂的查询，而无需使用数据库编程语言。使用专门的全局字段，其中相同的字段名称可以重复地插入到若干数据库中。在数据输入模式中，可以设置全局值，并且该值会自动插入到包含该全局字段的每个数据库记录中，以便在各种数据库中自动建立关系。在数据检索模式中，全局字段可用于控制轮廓的显示以截断轮廓仅包含特定全局字段值的数据的那些类别和字段，从而仅显示相关的轮廓部分。字段映射器允许操作员立即查看大纲中的更改并将旧字段指向新名称或位置，并指示要插入到现有记录中的新字段，所有这些都是在数据输入方面执行更改的大纲之前。查询模式在“大纲”窗口中以连续显示的轮廓为特征。条件在条件窗口中指定，其中为一个或多个字段分配特定搜索值。符合条件的记录显示在响应窗口中。对于轮廓宽度的单词出现搜索，突出显示包括单词出现的轮廓区域。
发明人: BARROW, MICHAEL D. | DAVIS, MARY LYNN | ROSE, DAVID | MICHAEL D. BARROW | DAVID ROSE | MARY LYNN DAVIS

标题: Method and mechanism for freeing disk space in a file system
摘要: A method and mechanism for rapidly freeing storage space allocated to any logical portion of a file. An application program provides the file system with information indicating a block of logical data to free. The file system converts the information to the physical allocation units such as the clusters corresponding to the logical block of data, and manipulates the file's meta data to indicate that the physical space is no longer allocated to the file. The file system then adds the space to disk free space. Applications such as merge applications and those managing FIFO queues may use the method and mechanism to shrink a file from the start of the file toward the end thereof without copying the logical data or adjusting internal pointers relative to the logical file data.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种用于快速释放分配给文件的任何逻辑部分的存储空间的方法和机制。 应用程序向文件系统提供指示要释放的逻辑数据块的信息。 文件系统将信息转换为物理分配单元,如数据逻辑块对应的簇,并操作文件的元数据以指示物理空间不再分配给文件。 然后文件系统将空间添加到磁盘可用空间。 诸如合并应用程序和管理 FIFO 队列的应用程序可以使用该方法和机制来从文件的开头向其结尾收缩文件,而无需复制逻辑数据或调整相对于逻辑文件数据的内部指针。

标题: ラベル上にコード化された光学的に認識可能な文字を見つけ出す方法、視覚システムおよびロボット視覚システム
摘要:
(修正有)
【目的】 ラベル上に印刷された読み取るべき文字を迅速に見つける。
【構成】 第1探索ウィンドウ内と第2探索ウィンドウ内で、それぞれ第1識別可能オブジェクトと第2識別可能オブジェクトを探索することによって、それぞれの上でラベル上の基準点が決定される。ラベル上の所定の位置に印刷された文字又はバー·コード等を読み取るにあたって、これら2つの基準点から正確な文字又はバー·コード等の位置を予測することができる。各文字上にその推定位置で重ね合わされた文字探索ウィンドウを探索して、そこにある文字を読み取る。例えば、ラベルが裂けていたために第1オブジェクト及び第2オブジェクトを見つけることができない場合は、代替オブジェクトを探索し、その上に基準点の位置を設定することができる。
摘要(译)(简体中文):
(有更正) 
 [对象] 快速查找打印在标签上的待读字符。 
 分别在第一搜索窗口和第二搜索窗口中搜索第一可识别对象和第二可识别对象,以确定每个上的标签上的参考点。 当读取打印在标签上预定位置的字符、条形码等时,可以从这两个参考点预测字符、条形码等的准确位置。 在每个字符的估计位置上搜索叠加在每个字符上的字符搜索窗口,然后读取那里的字符。 例如,如果因为标签被撕破而无法找到第一个和第二个对象,则可以搜索替代对象并将参考点的位置设置在它们上面。

标题: Arrangement of data cells and neural network system utilizing such an arrangement
摘要: An arrangement of data cells which stores at least one matrix of data words which are arranged in rows and columns, the matrix being distributed in the arrangement in order to deliver/receive, via a single bus, permuted data words which correspond either to a row or to a column of the matrix. Each data cell is connected to the single bus via series-connected switches which are associated with a respective addressing mode, the switches which address a same word of a same mode being directly controlled by a same selection signal. Circulation members enable the original order of the data on the bus to be restored. An arrangement of this kind is used in a layered neural network system for executing the error backpropagation algorithm. Application: Calculator, microprocessors, processor, neural network system. Reference: FIG. 4.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种数据单元的排列,它存储至少一个排列成行和列的数据字矩阵,该矩阵分布在排列中,以便通过单个总线传送/接收与行相对应的置换数据字 或矩阵的一列。 每个数据单元通过与相应寻址模式相关联的串联开关连接到单个总线,寻址相同模式的相同字的开关直接由相同选择信号控制。 循环成员使总线上数据的原始顺序得以恢复。 这种布置用于分层神经网络系统中以执行误差反向传播算法。 应用:计算器、微处理器、处理器、神经网络系统。 参考:图 4。

标题: データ処理システムにおいてファジー論理操作を行う方法
摘要:
【目的】 単一のソフトウェア命令により帰属度を高速度でかつ少量のハードウェアの付加によって計算できるようにする。
【構成】 ファジー論理操作の間に、あるメンバシップ集合における入力の帰属度を決定する回路(14)および方法である。該帰属度は単一の“MEM”命令により計算される。MEM命令はシステム入力がゼロ、飽和レベル、或いはその間の値の帰属度を有するか否かを決定する。オペランド割り当て回路(50)およびALU(56)は回路(14)に帰属度をより迅速に決定させる。割り当て回路(50)は乗算されるべき値の有意ビットの数に基づき乗算操作のための乗数を決定する。乗数が被乗数より小さければ、より短い乗算操作を行うことができる。更に、ALU(56)はスプリットモードで動作し、2つの8ビット減算または乗算操作を同時に行うことがで上記操作をより効率的に行なう。
摘要(译)(简体中文):
单个软件指令允许以高速和少量硬件添加来计算隶属度。 
 一种电路(14)和方法,用于在模糊逻辑操作期间确定成员集中的输入的成员。 隶属度由单个“MEM”指令计算。  MEM 指令确定系统输入的隶属度是否为零、饱和度或介于两者之间的值。 操作数分配电路(50)和ALU(56)允许电路(14)更快地确定隶属度。 分配电路(50)根据要相乘的值的有效位数确定乘法运算的乘数。 如果乘数小于被乘数,则可以执行更短的乘法运算。 此外,ALU 56 以拆分模式运行,同时执行两个 8 位减法或乘法运算,以使上述运算更加高效。

标题: Motion dependent video signal processing
摘要: In, for example, a motion compensated video standards converter (Figure 1) wherein blocks in a first field or frame of a video signal are each compared with a plurality of blocks in the following succeeding field or frame of the video signal for deriving motion vectors representing the motion of the content of respective blocks between the first field or frame and the following field or frame, and wherein a correlation surface is generated for each block in the first field or frame, the correlation surface representing the difference between the content of the block in the first field or frame and the content of each block in the following field or frame with which it has been compared, the magnitudes of the differences represented by the correlation surface are weighted (21, 22, 23) if a preliminary determination of the correlation surface fails to reveal a clear minimum difference.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 例如,在运动补偿视频标准转换器(图 1)中,视频信号的第一场或帧中的每个块都与视频信号的后续场或帧中的多个块进行比较,以导出运动矢量 表示各个块的内容在第一场或帧与随后的场或帧之间的运动,并且其中为第一场或帧中的每个块生成相关面,该相关面表示内容之间的差异 第一个场或帧中的块和随后的场或帧中每个块的内容与其进行比较,如果初步确定 相关曲面无法显示明显的最小差异。
发明人: RICHARD, JOSEPH, ANDREW, AVIS | CLIVE, HENRY, GILLARD

标题: Automated detection of lesions in computed tomography
摘要: A method and system for the automated detection of lesions in computed tomographic images, including generating image data from at least one selected portion of an object, for example, from CT images of the thorax. The image data are then analyzed in order to produce the boundary of the thorax. The image data within the thoracic boundary is then further analyzed to produce boundaries of the lung regions using predetermined criteria. Features within the lung regions are then extracted using multi-gray-level thresholding and correlation between resulting multi-level threshold images and between at least adjacent sections. Classification of the features as abnormal lesions or normal anatomic features is then performed using geometric features yielding a likelihood of being an abnormal lesion along with its location in either the 2-D image section or in the 3-D space of the object.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种用于自动检测计算机断层扫描图像中的损伤的方法和系统,包括从对象的至少一个选定部分生成图像数据,例如,从胸部的CT图像生成图像数据。 然后分析图像数据以产生胸部边界。 然后进一步分析胸部边界内的图像数据以使用预定标准产生肺区域的边界。 然后使用多灰度阈值和所得多级阈值图像之间以及至少相邻部分之间的相关性来提取肺区域内的特征。 然后使用几何特征将特征分类为异常病变或正常解剖特征,从而产生异常病变的可能性以及其在对象的 2-D 图像部分或 3-D 空间中的位置。
发明人: GIGER, MARYELLEN, L. | BAE, KYONGTAE (TY) | DOI, KUNIO

标题: Reconstruction of images from cone beam data
摘要: A computed tomography x-ray imaging system acquires a three-dimensional array of x-ray attenuation values using a cone beam x-ray source [(13)] and a curved two-dimensional array of detector elements [(16)]. Two-dimensional image slices [(55)] are reconstructed using a filtered back projection method, and corrections are made to the images to account for inaccuracies in the reconstruction method and for incomplete data due to the cone beam geometry.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 计算机断层摄影 x 射线成像系统使用锥形束 x 射线源 [(13)] 和探测器元件的弯曲二维阵列 [(16)] 获取 x 射线衰减值的三维阵列。 二维图像切片 [(55)] 使用滤波反投影方法重建,并对图像进行校正以解决重建方法中的不准确性和由于锥形束几何形状导致的不完整数据。

标题: Image processing system
摘要: A method and apparatus for processing forms and organizing data taken from the forms, including optical scanning of a sheet and obtaining image data from selected portions of the sheet, and formatting of the selected image data and storing and displaying the formatted image data for subsequent use.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种处理表格和组织从表格中获取的数据的方法和设备,包括纸张的光学扫描和从纸张的选定部分获取图像数据,以及对选定的图像数据进行格式化以及存储和显示格式化的图像数据以供后续使用 .

标题: Method and apparatus for automatically recognizing license plate characters
摘要: An apparatus and method for automatically recognizing the characters on a license plate which is fixed on a vehicle. A sensor/controller device is utilized to detect whether the vehicle has reached a predetermined position for image sampling, and to release a trigger signal when the vehicle has reached the predetermined position. An image processing unit is coupled to the sensor/controller device to receive the trigger signal and then to send an image-sampling instruction to an image-sampling device. The image-sampling device is coupled to the image processing unit, and samples a vehicle image including the image of the license plate in response to the image-sampling instruction. The vehicle image is converted into an electric signal by the image-sampling device, which in turn is sent back to the image processing unit. The image processing unit digitizes the electric signal, and process the digitized electric signal to estimate the position of the license plate, to determine the bounding edges of the characters on the license plate, to separate each character on the license plate, and to recognize each separated character.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种自动识别固定在车辆上的车牌上的字符的装置和方法。 传感器/控制器装置用于检测车辆是否到达预定位置进行图像采样,并在车辆到达预定位置时释放触发信号。 图像处理单元耦合到传感器/控制器设备以接收触发信号然后发送图像采样指令到图像采样设备。 影像撷取装置耦接影像处理单元,用以响应影像撷取指令,撷取包含车牌影像的车辆影像。 车辆图像通过图像采集装置转换成电信号,再传回图像处理单元。 图像处理单元将电信号数字化,对数字化后的电信号进行处理,估计车牌的位置,确定车牌上字符的边界,分离车牌上的每个字符,识别每个 分离的字符。
[标]当前申请(专利权)人: 财团法人工业技术研究院

标题: Method for identifying the language of individual words
摘要: The method of recognizing the language of a single word as to spelling and grammar correction (e.g., identifying the appropriate language resources on a document, paragraph, sentence or even individual word basis), the automatic invocation of transliteration software based on the language of the words (e.g., automatic ASCII to Kanji substitution without requiring the user to explicitly switch into a Kanji mode), the automatic invocation of appropriate machine translation tools when the document's language is different from the user's native tongue(s), the use of document language identification to eliminate from database or web search results any documents which are not written in the user's native language and the automatic identification of user-appropriate languages for the user interface.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 识别单个词的语言并进行拼写和语法纠正的方法(例如,在文档、段落、句子甚至单个词的基础上识别适当的语言资源),根据语言自动调用音译软件 单词(例如,自动将 ASCII 替换为汉字而不需要用户明确切换到汉字模式),当文档语言与用户的母语不同时自动调用适当的机器翻译工具,使用文档语言 识别以从数据库或网络搜索结果中消除任何不是用用户母语编写的文档,并自动识别用户界面的用户适当语言。
法律状态/事件: 未缴年费 | 权利转移

标题: Two dimensional generating system for the geometry of a model using artificial vision
摘要: A matrix camera 1 views a model m and provides a signal which is digitised and stored at 3 and then processed by a microprocessor 13 which extracts the perimeter of the image and then the lines and curves thereof eg to control an electroerosion machine tool. A keyboard 14 is provided - as described to allow the operator, viewing the image on a monitor 9, to modify the variables used in the image analysis.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 矩阵照相机1观察模型m并提供信号,该信号被数字化并存储在3处,然后由微处理器13处理,微处理器13提取图像的周边,然后提取图像的线和曲线,例如以控制电腐蚀机床。 提供了键盘14——如所描述的,以允许操作员在监视器9上查看图像,以修改在图像分析中使用的变量。

标题: Method of and system for generating images of object transforms

标题: System and method for implementing a hierarchical policy for computer system administration
摘要: A system and method for implementing a hierarchical policy for computer system administration which is extremely flexible in assigning policies to managed objects. Policies are defined to be rules for the values of the attributes of managed objects. Policy groups comprise the basic building blocks and they associate a set of policies with a set of managed objects. Policy groups can also be members of other policy groups and a policy group inherits the policies of its parent policy groups supporting the hierarchical specification of policy. A given policy group may have multiple parents which allows the "mix-in" of policies from the parents. Cloning and templates in conjunction with validation policies and policy groups provide standardization and a concomitant reduction in system administration complexity.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种用于实现用于计算机系统管理的分层策略的系统和方法,其在将策略分配给被管理对象方面非常灵活。 策略被定义为管理对象属性值的规则。 策略组包含基本构建块,它们将一组策略与一组托管对象相关联。 策略组也可以是其他策略组的成员,并且策略组继承其父策略组的策略,支持策略的分层规范。 一个给定的策略组可能有多个父级,允许“混合”来自父级的策略。 克隆和模板与验证策略和策略组一起提供标准化并随之降低系统管理的复杂性。

标题: Indexierung einer Datenbank durch einen endlichen Automaten
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种使用非循环有限状态传感器的路径号作为索引数据库的方法的技术。数据库中的每个条目都与一个或多个密钥相关联。索引数据库的方法包括：提供定义数据库密钥的有限状态传感器;对于每个密钥，确定与该密钥相关联的路径号，所述路径号定义该密钥与数据库中的或每个相应条目之间的映射。

标题: SYSTEM UND VERFAHREN ZUM SCHAFFEN EINER SPRACHGRAMMATIK
摘要: The present invention is a computer software system that allows the developer of a speech-enabled system to create a grammar and corpus for use in the system. A table interface is used, and phrases in the grammar are entered into cells in the table. The table also includes token data which corresponds to each valid utterance. When the grammar is defined, the computer software system automatically traverses the table to enumerate all possible valid utterances in the grammar. This traversal generates a listing (corpus) of valid utterances and their respective tokens. This listing can then be used to interpret spoken utterances for a speech-enabled system. The computer software system also transcribes the grammar rules found in the table to a format compatible with a variety of supported commercially-available speech recognizers.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 本发明是一种计算机软件系统,其允许语音启用系统的开发者创建在该系统中使用的语法和语料库。 使用表格界面,并将语法中的短语输入到表格的单元格中。 该表还包括与每个有效话语相对应的标记数据。 当语法被定义后,计算机软件系统自动遍历该表以枚举语法中所有可能的有效话语。 此遍历生成有效话语及其各自标记的列表(语料库)。 然后,该列表可用于解释支持语音的系统的口语表达。 计算机软件系统还将表中找到的语法规则转录为与各种受支持的商用语音识别器兼容的格式。
发明人: KENDALL LEE | WADSWORTH LEE | BOUZID TWEFIK | DAHL ANNA | HUA HUA

标题: Placement optimizing method/apparatus for designing semiconductor devices
摘要: A method of finding the optimal placement of circuit elements is disclosed in which the optimal position of each circuit element is determined from the results of arithmetic operations performed by a processor network (12) where a plurality of processors are inter­connected so as to form a neural network, and each processor takes in its own output and the outputs of all other processors to solve a problem.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 公开了一种寻找电路元件的最佳位置的方法,其中每个电路元件的最佳位置由处理器网络(12)执行的算术运算的结果确定,其中多个处理器互连以形成神经网络。 网络,每个处理器接收自己的输出和所有其他处理器的输出来解决问题。

标题: Background recovery in monocular vision
摘要: A process for background information recovery in an image including an image of a moving object, comprises the steps of identifying regions of moving objects relative to the background; deriving a moving constellation containing moving objects in a minimum circumscribing polygon; deriving partial background images associated with respective positions of the moving constellation; and combining ones of the partial background images.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种用于在包括运动物体的图像的图像中恢复背景信息的过程,包括识别运动物体相对于背景的区域的步骤; 在最小外接多边形中导出包含移动物体的移动星座; 导出与移动星座的各个位置相关联的部分背景图像; 并组合部分背景图像。

标题: 消費者電子器具用之波道儲存方法
摘要:
在消費者電子器具中，例如以電視機而言，已知在遙控器上有一鍵，可供使用者切換到原先選擇的波道。然而，此項習知解決方式之缺點是，使用者一旦從一波道跳到次一波道，稱為換台，電視機只認得跳台順序中的最後波道為各種情況的最後波道。
本發明根據之目的，在於提供波道儲存改進方法。
本發明在消費者電子器具中之波道儲存方法，可在不同波道間切換，其特點是可決定現用波道的接收期間，而一旦接收期間超出預定時距ZE，波道即儲存為想看的波道。
第1圖。
摘要(译)(简体中文):
在消费者电子器具中,例如以电视机而言,已知在遥控器上有一键,可供使用者切换到原先选择的波道。 然而,此项习知解决方式之缺点是,使用者一旦从一波道跳到次一波道,称为换台,电视机只认得跳台顺序中的最后波道为各种情况的最后波道。 
 本发明根据之目的,在于提供波道储存改进方法。 
 本发明在消费者电子器具中之波道储存方法,可在不同波道间切换,其特点是可决定现用波道的接收期间,而一旦接收期间超出预定时距ZE,波道即储存为想 看的波道。 
 第1图。

标题: System and method of obtaining information from a price look-up file
摘要: A system and method of obtaining information from a price look-up (PLU) file which employ an application programming interface which isolates application programs from each other. The system preferably includes a storage medium containing the PLU file, a computer coupled to the storage medium, control software executed by the computer, an application programming interface (API) having hooks into the control software, and a program executed by the computer which attaches into the API via interprocess communications for obtaining information for an item from the PLU file.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种从价格查询 (PLU) 文件中获取信息的系统和方法,该系统和方法采用将应用程序彼此隔离的应用程序接口。 该系统优选地包括包含PLU文件的存储介质、耦合到存储介质的计算机、由计算机执行的控制软件、具有与控制软件挂钩的应用程序编程接口(API)、以及由计算机执行的程序, 通过进程间通信进入 API,以从 PLU 文件中获取项目的信息。

标题: データ分析方法
摘要:
【目的】 データベースのデータからユーザの指示で生成される複数のルールを、適合するデータの共通性が高いルール群に分類できるデータ分析方法の提供。
【構成】 データベースのレコードから、予め定められた特徴を持つレコードの出現領域を抽出するルールをユーザの指示に基づき1以上のレコード項目を含む条件部と1つのレコード項目を含む結論部からなるルール形式でルールの適合度と共にユーザの指示した数だけ生成、表示し(11)、ユーザの指定した指定ルールと他のルールとのルールの類似度を求め(20)、指定ルールと、最低類似度以上のルールの類似度を有する他のルールとを組にして表示し、ユーザの指示に基づき登録する(30)。さらに、登録されたルールからルールを選択し、あるいは新たなルールを生成し、これらルールにおける各1対のルール間の類似度を求め、表示し、ユーザの指定する1対のルールの包含関係を求め表示する(40)。
摘要(译)(简体中文):
[目的] 提供一种数据分析方法,能够将根据用户的指令从数据库中的数据生成的多个规则分类为在匹配数据中具有高度共性的规则组。 
 【结构】从数据库记录中提取具有预定特征的记录的出现区域的规则,该规则由包含一个或多个记录项的条件部分和根据用户指令包含一个记录项的结论部分组成。并以格式(11)显示用户指定规则的数量以及规则的符合程度,获取用户指定的指定规则与其他规则的相似度(20),并计算指定规则和最小相似度上述规则与另一个具有相似度的规则结合显示,并根据用户的指令进行注册(30)。 进而从已注册的规则中选择规则或生成新规则,获取并显示这些规则中每对规则之间的相似度,并显示用户指定的一对规则的包含关系。 40)。
发明人: 谷口 洋司 | 川嶋 一宏 | 石橋 昭憲 | 矢島 敬士
