标题: Method and system for creating multi-lingual computer programs by dynamically loading messages
摘要: A method and system for creating multi-lingual computer programs by dynamically loading messages is provided. In a preferred embodiment, a user specifies a preferred language in which the computer program will communicate. The computer program has one or more associated message sets, each set in a unique natural language. At least some of the message sets are preferably stored in a message file on the computer system. After the computer program is invoked, a Localizer searches the message file for a message set in the preferred language. After selecting the message set, the Localizer makes a memory allocation request, loads the selected message set into the allocated memory, passes the address of the allocated memory to the computer program, and returns control to the computer program.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 提供了一种通过动态加载消息来创建多语言计算机程序的方法和系统。 在优选实施例中,用户指定计算机程序将使用的优选语言进行通信。 该计算机程序具有一个或多个相关联的消息集,每个消息集都以一种独特的自然语言进行。 至少一些消息集优选地存储在计算机系统上的消息文件中。 在调用计算机程序之后,本地化程序在消息文件中搜索以首选语言设置的消息。 选择消息集后,Localizer 发出内存分配请求,将选择的消息集加载到分配的内存中,将分配的内存地址传递给计算机程序,并将控制权返回给计算机程序。

标题: Verfahren und Gerät zur Spracherkennung
摘要(译)(简体中文): 处理器包括将输入语音信号（A）频率线性增加2倍或3倍的装置。从语音信号中提取表示单词声音和振动的激励信号（E）。语音信号频谱包络允许确定语音信号系数特性。内插装置（10）根据激励计算内插激励信号。内插激励信号具有与激励信号的时序图相同的时序图信号。内插信号中的值密度是激励信号中的值密度的两倍或三倍。从内插激励信号和特征系数合成更易理解的语音信号。

标题: DRUCKER FUER DEKORATIONSBUCHSTABEN.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 在能够为每行设置打印输出格式的文字处理器中，装饰字符打印机，其中包括各种格式数据位的格式数据包括装饰字符字体识别位。
发明人: YANARU HIROFUMI IKOMA-SHI NARA-KEN JP | MARUIDO HIROKI TENRI-SHI NARA-KEN JP

标题: Method of recognizing overlapped graphics in each degree of overlapping thereof
摘要: Segments forming respective graphics and relations of connection therebetween are recognized by vector type list structure. Sweep lines are provided at the apices and crosspoints of the graphics in order, and the segments are divided at the crosspoints. The divided segments are reconnected with each other while switching the connecting relation therebetween, whereby the graphics are reconstructed into those classified according to the degrees of overlapping thereof. A reconstructed graphic having a designated degree of overlapping is extracted and outputted.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 形成各个图形的段和它们之间的连接关系由向量类型的列表结构来识别。 在图形的顶点和交叉点依次设置扫描线,并在交叉点处划分线段。 分割的线段在切换其连接关系的同时彼此重新连接,从而将图形重构为根据其重叠程度分类的图形。 提取并输出具有指定重叠度的重构图形。
[标]当前申请(专利权)人: 大日本屏幕制造股份有限公司

标题: Bilderkennungsgerät und -verfahren
摘要(译)(简体中文): 图像识别装置包括用于输入图像的输入部分;图案提取部分，用于从输入图像中提取多个预定图案;第一特征提取部分，用于提取第一特征，该第一特征指示所提取的预定图案的第一图案相对于所提取的预定图案的第二图案上的点存在的方向;第二特征提取部分，用于基于第一特征提取指示相对于第二图案的方向上存在的第一图案的量的第二特征;以及识别部分，用于基于第二特征识别输入图像。 <IMAGE>
[标]当前申请(专利权)人: 松下电器产业株式会社

标题: Revenue sharing system with data filtering using history, periodic, and exclusion databases
摘要: A method and system for extracting revenue information from a point-of-sale (POS) terminal for purposes of revenue sharing including the step of periodically selecting and extracting predetermined portions of revenue transaction data in a proprietary database. This system allows extrapolation of select data relating to revenue traffic in a rental system. Revenue stored in a proprietary database (40) by a proprietary point-of-sale operating program is periodically selected, extracted and stored in a periodic database (42). This data is compared to a history database (38) comprising the periodic database as it existed prior to a given time. The data is output from the periodic database that is not present in the history database at the given time. This data can be transmitted to a remote location. The proprietary point-of-sale operating program can be used to create a history report database from the revenue transaction data and the portions of the revenue transaction data can be selected and extracted from the history report database.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种用于从销售点(POS)终端提取收入信息以实现收入共享的方法和系统,包括在专有数据库中定期选择和提取收入交易数据的预定部分的步骤。 该系统允许外推与租赁系统中的收入流量有关的选定数据。 由专有销售点操作程序存储在专有数据库(40)中的收入被周期性地选择、提取并存储在周期性数据库(42)中。 将该数据与包括在给定时间之前存在的周期性数据库的历史数据库(38)进行比较。 数据是从周期性数据库中输出的,在给定时间历史数据库中不存在该数据。 该数据可以传输到远程位置。 专有的销售点操作程序可用于根据收入交易数据创建历史报告数据库,并且可以从历史报告数据库中选择和提取收入交易数据的部分。
法律状态/事件: 期限届满 | 权利转移

标题: A search system and method for retrieval of data, and the use thereof in a search engine
摘要: A search system for information retrieval comprises a data structure for storing a text T, a combined metric M which includes an edit distance metric for approximate degree of matching between words and/or symbols or sequences thereof in the text T and words and/or symbols in a sequence P, weighting cost functions for edit operations which transform a sequence S of words or symbols into the sequence P, and a search algorithm for determining the degree of matching between words or word sequences in a suffix tree representation of respectively the text T and a query Q. The algorithm searches the data structure with the query Q, retrieving information with specified match to the query. A method in a search system for information retrieval generates a word-spaced sparse suffix tree for storing suffixes of words in a text T as word sequence information, and a word size-dependent edit distance metric for word sequences S, P and including word-weighted cost functions for edit operations, and determines matches between word sequences S?R? or retrieved information R and word sequences P?Q? of a query Q by calculating the edit distance for all matches. Use in an approximate search engine.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 用于信息检索的搜索系统包括用于存储文本T的数据结构、组合度量M,该组合度量M包括用于文本T中的单词和/或符号或其序列与单词和/或符号之间的近似匹配程度的编辑距离度量 在序列 P 中,用于将单词或符号序列 S 转换为序列 P 的编辑操作的加权成本函数,以及用于确定文本 T 的后缀树表示中单词或单词序列之间的匹配程度的搜索算法 和查询 Q。算法用查询 Q 搜索数据结构,检索与查询指定匹配的信息。 一种用于信息检索的搜索系统中的方法生成用于将文本 T 中的词的后缀存储为词序列信息的词间隔稀疏后缀树,以及用于词序列 S、P 的词大小相关的编辑距离度量,包括词- 编辑操作的加权成本函数,并确定单词序列 S?R? 之间的匹配。 或检索到的信息 R 和单词序列 P?Q? 通过计算所有匹配项的编辑距离来计算查询 Q 的值。 在近似搜索引擎中使用。

标题: Image processor with image data compression capability
摘要: In an image processor, image data of red, green and blue are converted to image data of lightness and chromaticities, and they are divided into pixel blocks. Then, image data of each block are compressed to data having 4 gradation levels smaller than 256 levels of the image data by generalized block truncation coding. Then, a capacity of image memory can be decreased. An attribute of the image data is decided for each block according to the compressed data. The attribute can be corrected by taking attributes of adjacent blocks into account.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 在图像处理器中,红色、绿色和蓝色的图像数据被转换为亮度和色度的图像数据,并且它们被划分为像素块。 然后,每个块的图像数据通过广义块截断编码被压缩成具有比图像数据的256级小的4个灰度级的数据。 于是,可以减小图像存储器的容量。 根据压缩数据为每个块决定图像数据的属性。 可以通过考虑相邻块的属性来校正该属性。
发明人: IMAIZUMI, SHOJI | MORIYA, SHIGERU | NISHIGAKI, JUNJI
发明人地址: Shinshiro, JP | Toyokawa, JP | Aichi-Ken, JP

标题: 用于蜂窝无线电话的网络号码簿方法与系统
摘要: 在将号码簿信息存储于蜂窝无线电话的方法中，蜂窝无线电话系统中设置有包含多个电话号码的网络号码簿数据库。提示用户输入搜索判别标准，并且搜索判别标准被接收。根据输入的搜索判别标准产生搜索请求数据信号，此信号发送至蜂窝系统。用搜索判别标准来搜索网络号码簿数据库中的匹配者，从而使一个或多个电话号码能够识别。将这些电话号码返回给无线电话并且存储于无线电话存储器中。此方法消除了需要同查号辅助话务员交互操作以及减少了无线电话与蜂窝系统间的连接时间。
摘要(译)(简体中文): 在将号码簿信息存储于蜂窝无线电话的方法中，蜂窝无线电话系统中设置有包含多个电话号码的网络号码簿数据库。提示用户输入搜索判别标准，并且搜索判别标准被接收。根据输入的搜索判别标准产生搜索请求数据信号，此信号发送至蜂窝系统。用搜索判别标准来搜索网络号码簿数据库中的匹配者，从而使一个或多个电话号码能够识别。将这些电话号码返回给无线电话并且存储于无线电话存储器中。此方法消除了需要同查号辅助话务员交互操作以及减少了无线电话与蜂窝系统间的连接时间。

标题: Method of signature verification and device for carrying out the method
摘要: PCT No. PCT/SE87/00217 Sec. 371 Date Jan. 14, 1988 Sec. 102(e) Date Jan. 14, 1988 PCT Filed Apr. 27, 1987 PCT Pub. No. WO87/06744 PCT Pub. Date Nov. 5, 1987.A method and a device for signature verification, where an electric pulse train individual for every person in question is caused to be generated in that said person is allowed to move a pen comprising at its nib a light-emitting member and a light-sensitive member over a background, whereby an electric pulse train is caused to be emitted from the light-sensitive member in response to patterns on said background, and where said pulse train generated at a certain occasion is caused by means of a computer, processor or corresponding device to be compared with pulse trains generated earlier. The invention is characterized in that said pen at its nib comprises a writing pen or a ballpoint pen capable to bring about a line when the pen is moved on a support capable to write on, such as a paper document, and said pulse train is generated when the person at the writing of his/her signature with the pen nib crosses lines written earlier during the writing with the pen, and that the signature being in writing constitutes said background.
摘要(译)(简体中文): PCT 号 PCT/SE87/00217 秒。  371 日期 1988 年 1 月 14 日 102(e) 日期 1988 年 1 月 14 日 PCT 1987 年 4 月 27 日提交 PCT Pub. 编号 WO87/06744 PCT 公开。 日期 1987 年 11 月 5 日。一种用于签名验证的方法和设备,其中,通过允许所述人移动笔尖处包括发光的笔,从而为每个相关人员生成电脉冲序列。 元件和光敏元件在背景上,从而响应于所述背景上的图案从光敏元件发射电脉冲串,并且其中在特定场合产生的所述脉冲串是通过以下方式引起的 与早先产生的脉冲串进行比较的计算机、处理器或相应设备。 本发明的特征在于,所述笔尖包括书写笔或圆珠笔,当笔在纸质文件等可书写的支撑物上移动时产生线条,产生所述脉冲串。 当用笔尖书写他/她签名的人在用笔书写时越过之前写的线,并且正在书写的签名构成所述背景。

标题: 放射線画像読取条件及び/又は画像処理条件決定方法および装置
摘要: PURPOSE:To efficiently determine radiation image reading conditions and/or image processing conditions with high accuracy by using a neural network in the method and device for determining the radiation image reading conditions and/or image processing conditions. CONSTITUTION:A histogram 2 of the image signals 1 indicating radiation images is calculated. This histogram is independently inputted to the previously learned neural network 4 or is inputted thereto after the additional information 3 on the above-mentioned radiation images is added thereto. The reading conditions and/or image processing conditions are outputted from the network 4. The input of the histogram normalized in such a manner that the prescribed image signal value between the max. value and the min. value is inputted always to a specified input unit by determining the value of the image signal exhibiting the max. light emission quantity obtd. by removing the drop-out part corresponding to the straight radiation part from the histogram as the max. value and normalizing the histogram between the max. value and the min. value of the image signal to the neural network is equally well.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 目的:通过在确定辐射图像读取条件和/或图像处理条件的方法和装置中使用神经网络,有效地确定辐射图像读取条件和/或图像处理条件。 组成:计算图像信号 1 指示辐射图像的直方图 2。 该直方图独立地输入到先前学习的神经网络4,或者在向其添加关于上述放射线图像的附加信息3之后输入到其中。 读取条件和/或图像处理条件从网络4输出。直方图的输入以这样的方式归一化,即规定的图像信号值在最大值之间。 值和最小值。 通过确定呈现最大值的图像信号的值,总是将值输入到指定的输入单元。 发光量 obtd. 通过从直方图中去除对应于直辐射部分的辍学部分作为最大值。 值和标准化最大值之间的直方图。 值和最小值。 图像信号对神经网络的价值同样好。

标题: OCR matrix extractor
摘要: ABSTRACT OF THE DISCLOSURE A matrix extractor is described which is particularly useful for extracting data from a memory which contains re- presentations of optically scanned characters. The method and apparatus of the present invention permits the isolation of packets of data in the memory and the determination of the location of these packets. Data representing the packets is then extracted from the memory for character recognition. The isolation of packets in memory greatly reduces the amount of data which must be processed by the recognition processor and provides much more reliable recognition.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 公开内容的摘要描述了一种矩阵提取器,其对于从包含光学扫描字符的表示的存储器中提取数据特别有用。 本发明的方法和装置允许隔离存储器中的数据包并确定这些包的位置。 然后从存储器中提取代表数据包的数据以进行字符识别。 内存中数据包的隔离大大减少了识别处理器必须处理的数据量,并提供了更可靠的识别。
发明人: SMITH, WILLIAM R. | KUMPF, RICHARD E.

标题: Adaptive-learning type product-sum operation neuron circuit
摘要: The present invention relates to a product-sum operation circuit element and a circuit for addition by weighting a number of signals input in one neuron circuit (N₁, N₂, ... Nn) in a neural network, and can provide an adaptive-learning neuron circuit (N₁, N₂, ... Nn) for changing an interval of output pulses by learning by connecting a simple pulse generating circuit consisting of at least capacitance, resistance, unijunction transistor UJT and MISFET. A product-sum operation circuit element according to the present invention, comprises an insulator substrate (35), a single crystal semiconductor thin film (36, 37) having a p-n-p or n-p-n structure in a lateral direction formed in the shape of stripes on the insulator substrate (35), a ferroelectric thin film (38) deposited thereon for covering at least the semiconductor stripe structure (36, 37), and a stripe-like gate electrode 39 consisting of a metal or a polycrystalline semiconductor formed thereon for intersecting said semiconductor stripes at a right angle or suitable angle.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 本发明涉及乘积和运算电路元件和用于通过加权在神经网络中的一个神经元电路(N 1 、N 2 、...Nn)中输入的多个信号的加法电路,并且可以提供自适应学习 神经元电路(N1,N2,...Nn)通过连接一个简单的脉冲产生电路来学习改变输出脉冲的间隔,该电路至少由电容、电阻、单结晶体管UJT和MISFET组成。 根据本发明的积和运算电路元件包括绝缘衬底(35)、在横向上形成为条形的具有p-n-p或n-p-n结构的单晶半导体薄膜(36、37)。 绝缘体衬底(35)、沉积在其上用于至少覆盖半导体条状结构(36、37)的铁电薄膜(38),以及形成在其上的由金属或多晶半导体构成的条状栅电极39,用于与所述绝缘衬底相交。 半导体条纹成直角或合适的角度。
[标]当前申请(专利权)人: 国立大学法人东京工业大学

标题: Method and a system for selection of time series data
摘要: Method and system of selecting desirable time series data pieces from many time series data pieces. Characteristics extracted from time series data pieces are applied to neurons and neuron state fluctuations are supervised and evaluated through execution of neurocomputing to select desirable time series data.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种从众多时序数据中选择想要的时序数据的方法及系统。 从时间序列数据片段中提取的特征应用于神经元,并通过执行神经计算来监督和评估神经元状态波动,以选择所需的时间序列数据。

标题: 信号処理装置
摘要: PURPOSE:To make improvement in the efficiency of recognition processing by classifying the processing the analysis sections corresponding to the cepstrum peak indicating the characteristics of voices, storing the same into a memory and storing the analogous voice inputs among the registered voice inputs in correspondence to the analysis sections to be synthesized and the other voice inputs in correspondence to the independent analysis sections. CONSTITUTION:An analysis section processing section 10 sets the analysis sections corresponding to the peaks of the cepstrum supplied from a peak detecting section 9, supplies the same to an analysis section classifying section 11 and supplies the data on the analogous analysis section data supplied from an analysis section memory 12 to the peak detecting section 9. The analysis section classifying section 11 compares the optimum analysis section data supplied from the analysis section processing section 10 and the analysis section data supplied from the analysis section memory 12, classifies and processes the data and stores the data into the setting section memory 12 according to the mode setting input. Or the analysis section memory 12 is read out and the analysis section is controlled. The results of the classification are simultaneously supplied as the 2nd control signal to a matching section 15 by which a recognition output is obtd. The efficient recognition processing is obtd. in this way.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 目的:通过对表示语音特征的倒谱峰值对应的分析部分进行分类处理,将其存储到存储器中,并将已注册语音输入中的类似语音输入存储在对应于 要合成的分析部分和对应于独立分析部分的其他语音输入。 组成:分析部分处理部分 10 设置分析部分对应于从峰值检测部分提供的倒谱峰值,提供相同的分析部分分类部分 11,并提供关于类似分析部分数据的数据 分析部分存储器12到峰值检测部分9。分析部分分类部分11比较从分析部分处理部分10提供的最佳分析部分数据和从分析部分存储器12提供的分析部分数据,分类和处理数据,并且 根据模式设置输入,将数据存储到设置部分存储器12中。 或者读取分析部存储器12并控制分析部。 分类结果作为第二控制信号同时提供给匹配部分15,通过该匹配部分15获得识别输出。 高效的识别处理是obtd。 这样。

标题: General purpose distributed operating room control system
摘要: A medical system that can be used to perform a surgical procedure. The system includes a network gateway that can retrieve remotely located patient data and display the data on a monitor at the surgical site.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 可用于执行外科手术的医疗系统。 该系统包括一个网络网关,可以检索远程定位的患者数据并将数据显示在手术现场的监视器上。

标题: Method and device for producing panoramic images, and a method and device for consulting panoramic images
摘要: PCT No. PCT/EP93/03318 Sec. 371 Date Sep. 28, 1994 Sec. 102(e) Date Sep. 28, 1994 PCT Filed Nov. 24, 1993 PCT Pub. No. WO94/13100 PCT Pub. Date Jun. 9, 1994A method for producing panoramic images whereby a shot is made from a desired shooting position, with the use of a camera having fish eye optics whereby the image is scanned and then digitized, images are transformed into a panoramic image with the use of a computer and software. The digital image is scanned by dividing the image into narrow radial segments, each of which is divided into a number of parts of equal length whereafter each segment part is depicted as a point on a straight line, whereby the grey tint of each segment part is corrected for the modified surface on which it is depicted. Apparatus comprises a camera with fish eye optics and a CCD matrix imager upon which the image to be obtained is projected, obtaining immediately an image in digital form.
摘要(译)(简体中文): PCT 号 PCT/EP93/03318 Sec.  371 日期 1994 年 9 月 28 日 102(e) 日期 1994 年 9 月 28 日 PCT 申请 1993 年 11 月 24 日 PCT Pub. 编号 WO94/13100 PCT Pub. 日期 1994 年 6 月 9 日一种制作全景图像的方法,即从所需的拍摄位置进行拍摄,使用具有鱼眼光学系统的相机扫描图像,然后将图像数字化,将图像转换为全景图像 使用计算机和软件。 通过将图像分成窄的径向段来扫描数字图像,每个径向段被分成许多等长的部分,然后每个段部分被描绘为直线上的一个点,由此每个段部分的灰色调是 针对它所描绘的修改后的表面进行了校正。 设备包括具有鱼眼光学器件的照相机和CCD矩阵成像器,待获得的图像投射在其上,立即获得数字形式的图像。
法律状态/事件: 期限届满 | 权利转移

标题: Apparatus based on n-variable unlimited recurrent adjustable network
摘要: An apparatus based on an n-variable unlimited recurrent adjustable network (URANn) comprises: two layers, each layer having the same number (n) of neuron elements; linear neuron elements xi constituting a first layer; nonlinear artificial neuron elements yj having respective temperature-dependent parameters Tj and constituting a second layer. Each linear and nonlinear neuron element of the first and second layers is connected using a feedforward connection part, a recurrent connection part, and an auto connection part. A nonlinear oscillation apparatus having the recurrent neural network is generally operated in accordance with the equation (1) described below:= g1(x1, x2, . . . xn) . . .= gi(x1, x2, . . . xn) . . .
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种基于n变量无限循环可调网络(URANn)的装置包括:两层,每层具有相同数量(n)的神经元; 构成第一层的线性神经元元素xi; 非线性人工神经元元件 yj 具有各自的温度相关参数 Tj 并构成第二层。 第一层和第二层的每个线性和非线性神经元元素使用前馈连接部分、循环连接部分和自动连接部分连接。 具有循环神经网络的非线性振荡装置通常根据下述等式(1)操作:=g1(x1,x2,...xn)。  .  .= gi(x1, x2, . . . xn) 。  .  .

标题: Run time dependency management facility for controlling change propagation utilizing relationship graph
摘要: A method and apparatus for controlling the propagation of changes made to a data file in a system of interrelated data files is described. In one embodiment of the method of the invention, a run-time dependency management facility is provided on the computer system which is effective to generate under computer control a graph indicating relationships among the data files and software tools present on the system. A change is made to at least one of the data files and a determination is made as to whether that change is significant. If a significant change is made, then at least one propagation barrier is provided which is effective to prevent computer-implemented propagation of the change in said data file through at least one data file which is interdependent with the changed data file. In another embodiment, a computer readable medium containing program instructions for providing a run-time dependency management facility on a computer in which the run-time dependency facility is effective to generate under computer control a graph indicating relationships among the data files and the software tools residing on the system. The computer readable medium further includes program instructions for determining under computer control that the change to data in at least one of the data files is not a significant change. Finally the computer readable medium includes program instructions for generating at least one propagation barrier in response to the determination which is effective to prevent propagation of the changes in the data file through at least one data file which is interrelated with the changed data file. The above-described computer readable medium may also include program instructions for a clever tool which can determine whether changes made to the changed data file are significant.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 描述了一种用于控制对相互关联的数据文件系统中的数据文件所做的更改的传播的方法和装置。 在本发明的方法的一个实施例中,在计算机系统上提供运行时依赖性管理工具,其有效地在计算机控制下生成指示系统上存在的数据文件和软件工具之间的关系的图形。 对至少一个数据文件进行更改,并确定该更改是否重要。 如果进行了重大改变,则提供至少一个传播屏障,其有效地防止计算机实现的所述数据文件中的改变通过至少一个与改变的数据文件相互依赖的数据文件传播。 在另一个实施例中,包含程序指令的计算机可读介质用于在计算机上提供运行时依赖性管理设施,其中运行时依赖性设施有效地在计算机控制下生成指示数据文件和软件工具之间的关系的图形 驻留在系统上。 计算机可读介质还包括用于在计算机控制下确定对至少一个数据文件中的数据的改变不是显着改变的程序指令。 最后,计算机可读介质包括程序指令,用于响应于确定有效地防止数据文件中的改变通过与改变的数据文件相关的至少一个数据文件传播的确定而生成至少一个传播屏障。 上述计算机可读介质还可以包括用于智能工具的程序指令,该智能工具可以确定对改变的数据文件所做的改变是否重要。
法律状态/事件: 期限届满 | 质押 | 权利转移

标题: Computer system with data residency transparency and data access transparency
摘要: COMPUTER SYSTEM WITH DATA RESIDENCY TRANSPARENCY AND DATA ACCESS TRANSPARENCY ABSTRACT A data management system used by a digital computer system comprises a plurality of individual file systems which are connected together in a logical ring configuration around which file requests travel. File requests may be transmitted by the user to the "next" file system in the ring relative to the user. File requests optionally may or may not specify a file system name. If a file system name is specified, then the request is forwarded unidirectionally around the logical ring until either that file system name is found or the request returns to its starting point. If no file system name is specified, then an attempt is made to satisfy the request on each file system in turn until either the request is satisfied or the request returns to its starting point.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 具有数据驻留透明性和数据访问透明性的计算机系统 摘要 数字计算机系统使用的数据管理系统包括多个单独的文件系统,这些文件系统以逻辑环配置连接在一起,文件请求围绕该逻辑环配置。 文件请求可以由用户传送到环中相对于用户的“下一个”文件系统。 文件请求可以选择也可以不指定文件系统名称。 如果指定了文件系统名称,则请求将围绕逻辑环单向转发,直到找到该文件系统名称或请求返回到其起点。 如果未指定文件系统名称,则依次尝试在每个文件系统上满足请求,直到满足请求或请求返回到其起点。
发明人: KUN ANDREW IGOR | KOLNICK FRANK CHARLES | MANSFIELD BRUCE MARR

标题: 話者認識装置
摘要:
【課題】 登録話者が増えた場合でも実時間性を保ち、かつ、精度の高い話者認識装置を実現することである。
【解決手段】 音声分析部102によって音声を一定時刻ごとに特徴パラメータへ変換する。木構造化話者標準パターン記憶部103には各話者の標準パターンを葉に持つ木構造をした複数話者の標準パターンが蓄えられている。類似話者類似度計算部104は入力特徴パラメータと各登録話者の標準パターンとの類似度を根から順次葉に向かって類似している節とのみ類似度計算を行なう。順位計算部106は入力ターンと指定された話者の標準パターンとの類似度が全話者との類似度中第何位であるかの順位を求める。判定部107は順位計算部106で求められた順位があらかじめ定められた順位内であれば本人と判定、そうでなければ他人と判定し、結果を端子107へ出力する。
摘要(译)(简体中文):
发明内容本发明的目的在于,实现即使在登记的说话者的数量增加的情况下也能够维持实时性并且具有高精度的说话者识别装置。 
 解决方案:语音分析单元102以规则的时间间隔将语音转换为特征参数。 树状结构的说话者标准模式存储单元103将多个说话者的标准模式存储在以每个说话者的标准模式作为叶子的树状结构中。 相似说话人相似度计算单元104仅针对从根到叶相似的节点计算输入特征参数与每个登记说话人的标准模式之间的相似度。 排名计算单元106获得在与所有说话者的相似度中输入轮次与指定说话者的标准模式之间的相似度的排名。 如果等级计算单元106计算的等级在预定等级内,则判断单元107判断该人是该人他/她自己。
发明人地址: 東京都港区芝五丁目7番1号  日本電気株式会社内

标题: Bildverarbeitungsverfahren zur Ermittlung von Gesichtsmerkmalen
摘要(译)(简体中文): 接收的面部图像信号被转换为H，S，V格式。最初检测面部区域（3103,3107-8）并将其用于口腔（3102,3110-3114）和眼睛（3104-6,3115-3118）的位置。只有H和S组件用于检测面部区域;并且只有面部区域内嘴部的S和V分量。可以使用跟踪信号生成（50）面部矢量。 <IMAGE>
法律状态/事件: 未缴年费 | 权利转移

标题: Method and apparatus for a touch sensing device having a thin film insulation layer about the periphery of each sensing element
摘要: A touch sensing device comprising a plurality of individually operable touch sensing elements having first and second overlapping and spaced conductive layers (12, 15) with the second conductive layer being displaceable towards the first conductive layer in response to a touch input. The device is fabricated by forming on a support a thin film multi-layer structure comprising the first and second conductive layers with an insulating layer (16) therebetween and in which the second conductive layer is provided with apertures at predetermined regions, and subjecting the structure to an etching process which removes insulating material between the conductive layers at the apertured regions via the apertures to form gaps (19). This leaves the second conductive layer (15) at each region supported in spaced relationship to the first conductive layer by the insulating layer around the periphery of the region. The device may be used, for example, as a keypad or, with larger numbers of elements arranged in a row and column matrix, as a graphics tablet or display overlay and operated with a stylus. The device can conveniently be integrated with a liquid crystal display panel using a substsrate of the panel as the support.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种触摸感测装置,包括多个可单独操作的触摸感测元件,所述触摸感测元件具有第一和第二重叠且间隔的导电层(12、15),其中第二导电层可响应于触摸输入而朝向第一导电层移位。 该器件是通过在支撑件上形成薄膜多层结构来制造的,该薄膜多层结构包括第一和第二导电层,其间具有绝缘层(16),并且其中第二导电层在预定区域处设置有孔,并且对该结构进行处理。 本发明涉及一种蚀刻工艺,其通过孔去除开孔区域处的导电层之间的绝缘材料以形成间隙(19)。 这使得在每个区域处的第二导电层(15)由围绕该区域外围的绝缘层以与第一导电层间隔开的关系支撑。 例如,该设备可以用作小键盘,或者在具有以行和列矩阵排列的大量元素的情况下,可以用作图形输入板或显示器覆盖层,并使用触笔进行操作。 该装置可以方便地与以面板基板为支撑的液晶显示面板集成。

标题: Software for self-programming
摘要: In self-programming, an iteration uses data indicating parameters. Some parameters can be used to obtain an input value. Another parameter can be a match value that can be used with an input value to obtain control data indicating whether to perform a learning response. Another parameter could include a stack that temporarily stores a generated value from each of a number of preceding iterations in which a learning response was not performed. Another parameter could include learned values stored from the stack during a learning response. Some parameters can be numbers: a number of iterations from which generated values are stored during a learning response; a number of unsuccessful iterations after which values are generated randomly; or a number of iterations during which values are generated randomly. A parameter can indicate whether learned values are cleared before a self-programming session. Some parameters can indicate how images are presented to a user. A software product can include a storage medium with instruction data indicating instructions a processor can execute to perform self-programming. The storage medium can also have default parameter data. The processor can provide a graphical user interface allowing a user to provide or modify parameters, so that a user can experiment to obtain optimal parameters.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 在自编程中,迭代使用指示参数的数据。 一些参数可用于获取输入值。 另一个参数可以是可以与输入值一起使用以获得指示是否执行学习响应的控制数据的匹配值。 另一个参数可以包括临时存储从没有执行学习响应的多个先前迭代中的每个迭代中生成的值的堆栈。 另一个参数可以包括在学习响应期间从堆栈存储的学习值。 一些参数可以是数字:在学习响应期间存储生成的值的迭代次数; 多次不成功的迭代,之后随机生成值; 或随机生成值的多次迭代。 参数可以指示学习值是否在自编程会话之前被清除。 一些参数可以指示图像如何呈现给用户。 软件产品可以包括具有指示处理器可以执行以执行自编程的指令的指令数据的存储介质。 存储介质还可以具有默认参数数据。 处理器可以提供允许用户提供或修改参数的图形用户界面,以便用户可以试验以获得最佳参数。

标题: Method of, and system for, processing medical information
摘要: This invention relates to a processing method of medical information and a system therefor which input medical information obtained from a patient in letters or images in a computer (11), records them in an optical memory card (17a, 17b) in accordance with a predetermined format, outputs thus recorded medical information from the optical memory card (17b) whenever necessary, produces them on a monitor screen and in the form of film. All the image information obtained from a patient is input in the computer as digital images. The optical memory card (17) stores the medical information in the form of letters or images as well as the content of the ID card (15) of a particular patient, if necessary. A large volume of medical information can be processed and managed compactly by storing them in optical memory cards (17) to thereby remarkably simplify storage of medical data. The stored data may be effectively and quickly output as accurate medical information to thereby enhance medical data management.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 本发明涉及一种医疗信息处理方法及其系统,其将从患者获得的医疗信息以文字或图像的形式输入计算机(11)中,并按照预定的规定将它们记录在光学存储卡(17a、17b)中。 格式,在必要时从光学存储卡(17b)输出如此记录的医疗信息,在监视器屏幕上以胶片的形式产生它们。 从患者获得的所有图像信息都以数字图像的形式输入计算机。 光学存储卡(17)以字母或图像的形式存储医学信息以及特定患者的ID卡(15)的内容,如果需要的话。 通过将大量医疗信息存储在光学存储卡(17)中,可以紧凑地处理和管理大量医疗信息,从而显着简化医疗数据的存储。 存储的数据可以作为准确的医疗信息有效、快速地输出,从而加强医疗数据管理。
[标]当前申请(专利权)人: 日本功勒克斯股份有限公司 | HAYAKAWA TAKENORI

标题: Field tester gaze tracking using content addressable memories to improve image data analysis speed
摘要: A field test apparatus and method is disclosed in which gradual movement of the head supporting chin cup is used to maintain a centered relation between the eye being tested and the trial lens frame holding the required prescription for optimum vision of the patient. During the test, alternating illumination is provided in the infrared between a central corneal reflection and an iris illuminating source which imparts a high contrast bright circular iris image surrounding a central dark pupil. Content addressable memories are used to delineate areas of contrast change for rapid and abbreviated microprocessor analysis of conventional RAM images. Both the corneal reflection image-which is a brightly illuminated spot on an otherwise dark background-and the pupillary image-which is a dark pupil surrounded by a brightly illuminated high contrast image of the iris are approximately located at their boundaries using content addressable memory. Thereafter, conventionally stored video data is processed at locations restricted to the high contrast boundaries. For location of the pupil center, special techniques are disclosed for examining the image's first and second derivatives to establish the pupil center within sub-pixel limits. These methods include sufficient data processing speed improvements to enable a time shared use of a microprocessor having gaze angle measurement as a peripheral event to instrument control, and data collection required in such field testing.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 公开了一种现场测试设备和方法,其中头部支撑下巴杯的逐渐移动用于保持被测眼睛和试验镜片框架之间的中心关系,该镜片框架保持患者最佳视力所需的处方。 在测试期间,在中央角膜反射和虹膜照明源之间提供红外线交替照明,该虹膜照明源提供围绕中央暗瞳孔的高对比度明亮圆形虹膜图像。 内容可寻址存储器用于描绘对比度变化的区域,以便对常规 RAM 图像进行快速和简略的微处理器分析。 使用内容可寻址存储器,角膜反射图像(在其他情况下为暗背景上的明亮照明点)和瞳孔图像(被明亮照明的虹膜高对比度图像包围的暗瞳孔)都大致位于它们的边界处。 此后,常规存储的视频数据在限于高对比度边界的位置处被处理。 对于瞳孔中心的定位,公开了用于检查图像的一阶和二阶导数以在子像素范围内建立瞳孔中心的特殊技术。 这些方法包括足够的数据处理速度改进,以实现微处理器的时间共享使用,该微处理器具有注视角测量作为仪器控制的外围事件,以及此类现场测试中所需的数据收集。
发明人: LEHMER, DONALD E. | KIRSCHBAUM, ALAN R.

标题: Voice-operated device for entertainment electronic, especially for video recorder
摘要: In the course of time, the operation of modern devices for entertainment electronics has become more and more difficult for the user, especially since many new device functions have been added compared with previous devices. Voice-controlled devices for entertainment electronics are also known, in which individual device functions can be controlled by acoustic input of command words, by means of a microprocessor and a voice analyser connected to it. To increase further the operational reliability and avoid device control errors if possible, a first microprocessor is arranged in the new device, which microprocessor carries out a logic operation on acoustically entered command words and function commands entered via a key or alphanumeric keyboard during a learning process. In the subsequent operating phase, the voice command is analysed and, when a voice command is recognised, the first microprocessor supplies the associated function command to a second microprocessor which controls the various device functions. A wide field of applications is given for the new voice-controlled device, in which context task-specific matching of the two microprocessors can be effected by applying the principle of distributed control. <IMAGE>
摘要(译)(简体中文): 随着时间的推移,现代娱乐电子设备的操作对用户来说变得越来越困难,特别是因为与以前的设备相比增加了许多新的设备功能。 用于娱乐电子设备的语音控制设备也是已知的,其中可以通过微处理器和连接到它的语音分析器通过命令词的声学输入来控制各个设备功能。 为了进一步提高操作可靠性并尽可能避免设备控制错误,在新设备中设置了第一微处理器,该微处理器在学习过程中对通过按键或字母数字键盘输入的声学输入命令词和功能命令进行逻辑运算 . 在随后的操作阶段,语音命令被分析,并且当语音命令被识别时,第一微处理器将相关联的功能命令提供给控制各种设备功能的第二微处理器。 为新的语音控制设备提供了广泛的应用领域,其中两个微处理器的上下文任务特定匹配可以通过应用分布式控制原理来实现。
发明人: MAGER, GERHARD, GRUNDIG E.M.V., MAX GRUNDIG
发明人地址: holländ. Stiftung & Co KG, Kurtgartenstrasse 37,D-8510 Fuerth,DE
法律状态/事件: 权利终止 | 权利转移

标题: System and methods for synchronizing two or more datasets
摘要: Synchronization system and associated methods provide synchronization of an arbitrary number of datasets, including more than two datasets. To achieve this, a reference dataset is used to store a super-set of the latest or most-recent data from all user datasets to provide a repository of information that is available at all times. Therefore, if the user later wishes to synchronize a new user dataset, such as one in a server computer that stores user information, the system already has all the information necessary for synchronizing the new dataset, regardless of whether any of the other datasets are then available. Further, to simplify use, a unified user interface is provided that allows the user to easily determine which of his or her datasets are currently set to be synchronized and allows the user to conveniently alter the current settings to select one, two, or even more than two clients for synchronization. Various "conflict" or "duplicate" resolution strategies are described for intelligently handling complexities resulting from allowing synchronization for an arbitrary number of datasets and allowing synchronization using even data from datasets that are not available. Architectural support for "plug-in" client accessors and type modules is also provided. This allows support to be added for new datasets or new types of data merely by developing and plugging in new, compact client accessors or type modules, without updating or replacing the core synchronization engine.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 同步系统和相关方法提供任意数量的数据集的同步,包括两个以上的数据集。 为了实现这一点,参考数据集用于存储来自所有用户数据集的最新或最新数据的超集,以提供随时可用的信息存储库。 因此,如果用户稍后希望同步一个新的用户数据集,例如存储用户信息的服务器计算机中的一个,则系统已经拥有同步新数据集所需的所有信息,无论当时是否有任何其他数据集 可用的。 此外,为了简化使用,提供了统一的用户界面,允许用户轻松确定他或她的哪些数据集当前设置为同步,并允许用户方便地更改当前设置以选择一个、两个甚至更多 比两个客户端同步。 描述了各种“冲突”或“重复”解决策略,用于智能地处理由于允许对任意数量的数据集进行同步以及允许使用来自不可用数据集的数据进行同步而导致的复杂性。 还提供了对“插件”客户端访问器和类型模块的架构支持。 这允许仅通过开发和插入新的、紧凑的客户端访问器或类型模块来添加对新数据集或新类型数据的支持,而无需更新或替换核心同步引擎。
[标]当前申请(专利权)人: 英特利辛克股份有限公司
发明人: BODNAR, ERIC O. | LARUE, CHRIS | DUBE, BRYAN | KIRANI, SHEKHAR | SURESH, SETHURAMAN
发明人地址: Capitola, CA | Santa Cruz, CA | San Jose, CA
法律状态/事件: 期限届满 | 权利转移

标题: Multiple display file directory and file navigation system for a personal computer
摘要: The parallel virtual directory system can extend the native file system to provide a superior method for organizing a computer system's physical storage devices or locations. These can include hard disks and removable media or remote storage locations such as on the Internet. Interceptor modules can monitor all file or memory changes such as creations, writes and deletes to the native file system and can pass this information to the parallel virtual directory system. The parallel virtual directory system may be accessed through the native fie system methods allowing users to view their file system as it existed at any point in time, including removable media that is no longer present in the system. Further, via the parallel virtual directory system and the Interceptor modules, users can access any file in any of the monitored file systems. The parallel virtual directory system may be implemented using database technology thereby allowing multiple views of the parallel virtual directory system to be offered to the user based on their needs and can thus be used to ease navigation through the file system. Further, a set of information management processes can run at the application level providing data management services such as backup, archiving, recording of digital video programming, or even controlled playback or utilization of that information. The information management processes can configure the parallel virtual directory system to capture the information they require and use the gathered information to efficiently complete their data management functions.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 并行虚拟目录系统可以扩展本机文件系统以提供用于组织计算机系统的物理存储设备或位置的高级方法。 这些可以包括硬盘和可移动媒体或远程存储位置,例如 Internet 上的位置。 拦截器模块可以监视所有文件或内存更改,例如对本机文件系统的创建、写入和删除,并且可以将此信息传递给并行虚拟目录系统。 并行虚拟目录系统可以通过本地文件系统方法访问,允许用户查看他们的文件系统,因为它在任何时间点都存在,包括系统中不再存在的可移动媒体。 此外,通过并行虚拟目录系统和拦截器模块,用户可以访问任何受监控文件系统中的任何文件。 并行虚拟目录系统可以使用数据库技术来实现,从而允许基于用户的需要向用户提供并行虚拟目录系统的多个视图,并且因此可以用于简化通过文件系统的导航。 此外,一组信息管理进程可以在应用程序级别运行,提供数据管理服务,例如数字视频节目的备份、存档、记录,甚至是该信息的受控回放或利用。 信息管理进程可以配置并行虚拟目录系统来捕获它们需要的信息,并使用收集到的信息来有效地完成它们的数据管理功能。
发明人: HOWARD, DAVID E. | GANDEE, JOHN J. | GODWIN, KURT E.
法律状态/事件: 未缴年费 | 质押 | 权利转移

标题: Vector computation device and vector computation method
摘要: A method of determining which search target vector from a plurality of search target vectors is closest to an input vector. A device to perform the method is also disclosed. Rather then perform a distance calculation for each and every search target vector, the disclosed method narrows the field of the search through a simple process. The input vector is compared to each search target vector, and a mask is used to evaluate the result of the comparison. Then, the actual distance is calculated for those search target vectors within a search range of the input vector.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种从多个搜索目标向量中确定哪个搜索目标向量最接近输入向量的方法。 还公开了一种执行该方法的设备。 所公开的方法不是对每个搜索目标向量执行距离计算,而是通过简单的过程来缩小搜索范围。 将输入向量与每个搜索目标向量进行比较,并使用掩码来评估比较的结果。 然后,针对输入向量的搜索范围内的那些搜索目标向量计算实际距离。

标题: 空間光変調素子および神経ネットワーク回路

 [结构] 光电导层103和夹在透明导电电极102和104之间的调制部分107电连接的结构,并且光电导率(σ ph ) 和入射光强度 (I ph )由(式1)表示,a的值为0.95以上1以下。

标题: Methods and apparatus for storage and retrieval of name space information in a distributed computing system
摘要: A distributed computing environment is disclosed which allows a user at one location to access resources at other locations. Each resource in the distributed computing environment is represented as a hierarchical file system. A user or process has a name space comprised of at least one hierarchical file system provided by a connected resource. The distributed computing environment allows a first processor to invoke execution of a processing task by a remote processor. The first processor transmits a representation of its current name space to the remote processor. The remote processor will execute the processing task on a name space modified in accordance with the name space representation received from the first processor. The transmitted representation of the name space associated with the first processor includes at least one dynamic name space modification command, such as those executed by a user after logging into the distributed computing system. A plurality of data structures are provided for storing path information which allows the pathname of a given channel, which represents a file, to be determined. The stored path information allows the hierarchical file tree of a connected file system to be generated.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 公开了一种分布式计算环境,其允许一个位置的用户访问其他位置的资源。 分布式计算环境中的每个资源都表示为一个分层文件系统。 用户或进程具有由连接资源提供的至少一个分层文件系统组成的名称空间。 分布式计算环境允许第一处理器调用远程处理器执行处理任务。 第一个处理器将其当前名称空间的表示传输到远程处理器。 远程处理器将在根据从第一处理器接收的名称空间表示修改的名称空间上执行处理任务。 与第一处理器相关联的名称空间的传输表示包括至少一个动态名称空间修改命令,例如由用户在登录到分布式计算系统之后执行的那些。 提供多个数据结构用于存储路径信息,该路径信息允许确定代表文件的给定通道的路径名。 存储的路径信息允许生成连接文件系统的分层文件树。

标题: Apparatus for searching compressed data file
摘要: A data processing system in which a sequence of records, each record containing data items of various types, is processed. The system is operable in a "remember" mode in which, if a data item of a particular type is not present in a particular record, the result of the last time that type of data item was processed is used as the result for the current record. This permits data files to be stored in a compressed form in which repeated data items are omitted.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种数据处理系统,其中处理一系列记录,每个记录包含各种类型的数据项。 该系统可在“记忆”模式下运行,在该模式下,如果特定类型的数据项不存在于特定记录中,则上次处理该类型数据项的结果将用作当前的结果 记录。 这允许数据文件以省略重复数据项的压缩形式存储。

标题: Knowledge engineering tool
摘要: A tool is used for knowledge engineers for building and interpreting a knowledge base having separate portions encoding control knowledge, factual knowledge, and judgmental rules. The tool has an inference engine applying the judgmental rules according to a built-in control procedure defining discrete states or control steps during a consultation with a user. The control knowledge is encoded in an applicative and imperative language defining control actions to be executed during interruption of the built-in control procedure at specified control steps. Since the control knowledge is explicit and results in the modification of data only in a precisely defined fashion, the tool can be used to build knowledge systems that can always explain their conclusions and reasoning, and that are intelligible and modifiable. To provide transparent representation of control knowledge as well as factual knowledge, the knowledge base is preferably organized into distinct frames which include the rules; control blocks separately encoding the control knowledge; and classes which become instantiated, attributes which take on values describing the class instances, class types, legal value hierarchies, and user-defined functions, which all encode factual knowledge. The knowledge engineer may provide control blocks to be executed at the start of the consultation, after the instantiation of specified classes, when a value for a specified attribute is to be determined, after a specified attribute is determined, and upon explicit invocation by another control block. The tool can also implicitly determine subsumed attributes.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 知识工程师使用一种工具来构建和解释知识库,该知识库具有编码控制知识、事实知识和判断规则的单独部分。 该工具有一个推理引擎,根据在与用户协商期间定义离散状态或控制步骤的内置控制程序应用判断规则。 控制知识以应用性和命令性语言编码,定义在指定控制步骤中断内置控制过程期间要执行的控制动作。 由于控制知识是明确的,并且只能以精确定义的方式对数据进行修改,因此该工具可用于构建始终能够解释其结论和推理、可理解和可修改的知识系统。 为了提供控制知识和事实知识的透明表示,最好将知识库组织成包含规则的不同框架; 控制块分别编码控制知识; 以及实例化的类、具有描述类实例的值的属性、类类型、合法值层次结构和用户定义的函数,它们都对事实知识进行编码。 知识工程师可以提供要在咨询开始时执行的控制块,在指定类的实例化之后,当要确定指定属性的值时,在确定指定属性之后,以及在由另一个控件显式调用时 堵塞。 该工具还可以隐式确定包含的属性。
发明人: ERMAN, LEE D. | CLANCEY, WILLIAM J. | LONDON, PHILIP E. | SCOTT, A. CARLISLE | BENNETT, JAMES S. | LARK, JAY S.

标题: Query-based electronic program guide
摘要: An electronic programme guide (EPG) presents programming information to the viewer and allows for the composition of queries for searching the information. Queries relating to channel number, network name or programme name may be entered using a 10-key keypad. The viewer sequentially enters digits or letters in the number or name and the EPG interprets the data as representing all possible choices which include the numbers and letters associated with the sequence of selected keys. For example, when the key labelled "5" is selected, the EPG interprets that data to mean "5" or "J" or "K" or "L". The EPG identifies all programmes, channels or networks which begin with the number or letters, and as the viewer enters further data the list narrows so that the viewer is quickly presented with a short list of possible choices.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 电子节目指南 (EPG) 向观众呈现节目信息,并允许组合查询以搜索信息。 可以使用 10 键键盘输入有关频道号、网络名称或节目名称的查询。 观众在数字或名称中顺序输入数字或字母,EPG 将数据解释为代表所有可能的选择,包括与所选键序列相关的数字和字母。  For example, when the key labelled "5" is selected, the EPG interprets that data to mean "5" or "J" or "K" or "L".  EPG 识别所有以数字或字母开头的节目、频道或网络,并且随着观众输入更多数据,列表缩小,以便观众快速看到可能选择的简短列表。
发明人: JAMES, O, ROBARTS | DAVID, S, BYRNE | STEVE, FLUEGEL | GABE, NEWELL | DAN, NEWELL | KENNETH, ABBOTT

标题: Method of and device for decoding block-coded messages affected by symbol substitutions, insertions and deletions
摘要: ABSTRACT A method for decoding messages coded as blocks of a fixed number of symbols and affected by symbol substitu- tions, deletions and insertions. For each message received which has a length within selected limits, a sequence of words is generated which comprises all the possible error combinations which can be corrected in the message. By using the sequence of words, a decoded word is generated for each frame. Then the probability that a decoded word actually is the transmitted word is calculated and the decoded word, whose probability value satisfies predeter- mined criteria, is emitted as a decoded message.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 摘要 一种解码消息的方法,该消息编码为固定数量的符号块,并受符号替换、删除和插入的影响。 对于长度在选定限制内的每条接收到的消息,生成一个单词序列,其中包括可以在消息中纠正的所有可能的错误组合。 通过使用单词序列,为每一帧生成一个解码的单词。 然后计算解码字实际上是传输字的概率,并将其概率值满足预定标准的解码字作为解码消息发送。

标题: Method and apparatus for word counting in continuous speech recognition useful for reliable barge-in and early end of speech detection
摘要: Speech recognition technology has attained maturity such that the most likely speech recognition result has been reached and is available before an energy based termination of speech has been made. The present invention innovatively uses the rapidly available speech recognition results to provide intelligent barge-in for voice-response systems, to count words to output sub-sequences to provide paralleling and/or pipelining of tasks related to the entire word sequence, and to count words to provide rapid, speech recognition based termination of speech processing and outputting of the recognized word sequence.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 语音识别技术已经成熟,使得最可能的语音识别结果已经达到并且在基于能量的语音终止之前可用。 本发明创新性地使用快速可用的语音识别结果为语音响应系统提供智能插入,对输出子序列的单词进行计数,以提供与整个单词序列相关的任务的并行化和/或流水线化,并计数 词提供快速的、基于语音识别的语音处理终止和识别的词序列的输出。
发明人: SETLUR, ANAND RANGASWAMY | SUKKAR, RAFID ANTOON

标题: Blood cell identification and classification system
摘要: There is provided a blood cell identification and classification system including a photographing means for producing magnified images of cells in blood smears and generating video signals and an automatic analytical means for analyzing cells based on said video signals, characterized in that said system comprises: a video recording means for recording on a collective basis the magnified images of unknown cells which could not be analyzed by said automatic analytical means in conjunction with identification data for smears to which said unknown cells pertain, a video reproduction means for reproducing the magnified images of unknown cells and identification data so recorded, and an input means for entering analytical data derived from the magnified images of unknown cells so reproduced.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 提供了一种血细胞识别和分类系统,包括用于对血涂片中的细胞进行放大图像并产生视频信号的拍摄装置和用于根据所述视频信号对细胞进行分析的自动分析装置,其特征在于,所述系统包括:视频 将自动分析装置无法分析的未知细胞的放大图像与该未知细胞所属的涂片的识别数据一起集中记录的记录装置,用于再现未知细胞的放大图像的视频再现装置 和如此记录的识别数据,以及用于输入从如此再现的未知细胞的放大图像得到的分析数据的输入装置。

标题: System and method for using a global translator to synchronize workspace elements across a network
摘要: A system uses a global translator to automatically synchronize multiple copies of a workspace element across different formats between multiple sites in a secure network environment, independent of whether the sites are protected by site firewalls. The secure network environment includes a global server connected to multiple clients. The system includes a first store for storing a first workspace element in a first format, a second store for storing a second workspace element which is an independently modifiable copy of the first workspace element in a second format, a communications channel coupling the first store to the second store, synchronization means for synchronizing the first workspace element and the second workspace element, and a translator for translating between the first format and the second format.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 系统使用全局转换器在安全网络环境中的多个站点之间跨不同格式自动同步工作区元素的多个副本,而不管这些站点是否受站点防火墙保护。 安全网络环境包括连接到多个客户端的全局服务器。 该系统包括用于以第一格式存储第一工作区元素的第一存储、用于以第二格式存储作为第一工作区元素的独立可修改副本的第二工作区元素的第二存储、将第一存储耦合到 第二存储,用于同步第一工作空间元素和第二工作空间元素的同步装置,以及用于在第一格式和第二格式之间进行转换的转换器。

标题: Method for oscillometric blood pressure determination employing curve fitting
摘要: A method of measuring blood pressure where a plurality of oscillometric data values are measured from a subject at a plurality pressure levels, a function curve having the shape of an oscillometric envelope is selected and computational model fit to the data, using the Gauss-Marquardt method of model fitting. Once the curve is model fit, blood pressure is measured using the oscillometric method. Included in the step of model fitting is the step of computing the parameter of the function curve that minimizes the error between the function curve and the data values at the respective pressure levels thereby approximating the oscillometric envelope based upon data values.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种测量血压的方法,其中在多个压力水平下从对象测量多个示波数据值,选择具有示波包络形状的函数曲线并使用高斯-马夸特方法拟合数据的计算模型 的模型拟合。 一旦曲线拟合模型,就使用示波法测量血压。 模型拟合步骤中包括计算函数曲线参数的步骤,该参数使函数曲线与相应压力水平的数据值之间的误差最小化,从而基于数据值近似示波包络。

标题: Arrangemang för lastbalansering i datornät
摘要: The invention relates to an arrangement for load sharing in computer networks and, more exactly, an arrangement for distribution of traffic, for instance via Internet, from clients (1) to service suppliers who provide services from many servers. The invention makes possible distribution to one of a number of replicated servers. Suitable server is selected for instance on basis of available resources at the interface of the server, or less delay in the transmission. The invention results in better performance and reduced traffic by distribution of the traffic geographically and from a resource point of view. According to the invention, a number of replicated servers (5A-5E) belong to an anycast-group and each anycast-group is connected to a domain name server (2) which has the ability to select one of the replicated servers, so that a router (4) can establish a connection between the selected server and the service-requesting client computer. Each replicated server (5A-5E) can transmit a resource advertisement which contains information about available resources at the server in question, and about the link parameters of the server.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 本发明涉及一种用于在计算机网络中进行负载共享的装置,并且更准确地说,涉及一种用于例如通过因特网将流量从客户端(1)分配到从许多服务器提供服务的服务供应商的装置。 本发明使得分发到多个复制服务器之一成为可能。 例如基于服务器接口处的可用资源或传输中的较少延迟来选择合适的服务器。 本发明通过在地理上和从资源的角度分配流量而导致更好的性能和减少的流量。 根据本发明,多个复制服务器(5A-5E)属于一个任播组,并且每个任播组连接到具有选择复制服务器之一的能力的域名服务器(2),使得 路由器(4)可以在选择的服务器和请求服务的客户端计算机之间建立连接。 每个复制的服务器(5A-5E)可以发送资源广告,该广告包含关于在所讨论的服务器处的可用资源以及关于服务器的链接参数的信息。

标题: System and method for providing remote automatic speech recognition services via a packet network
摘要: A system and method of operating an automatic speech recognition service using a client-server architecture is used to make ASR services accessible at a client location remote from the location of the main ASR engine. The present invention utilizes client-server communications over a packet network, such as the Internet, where the ASR server receives a grammar from the client, receives information representing speech from the client, performs speech recognition, and returns information based upon the recognized speech to the client.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 使用客户端-服务器架构操作自动语音识别服务的系统和方法用于使 ASR 服务在远离主 ASR 引擎位置的客户端位置可访问。 本发明利用诸如因特网之类的分组网络上的客户端-服务器通信,其中ASR服务器从客户端接收语法,从客户端接收表示语音的信息,执行语音识别,并基于识别的语音返回信息给 客户端。
发明人: DRAGOSH, PAMELA LEIGH | ROE, DAVID BJORN | SHARP, ROBERT DOUGLAS
法律状态/事件: 期限届满 | 权利转移

标题: 通信装置
摘要: PURPOSE:To enable to securely communicate by setting one call by detecting a special sound signal of an operator which is sent from a terminal at the opponent side and indicating with the sound signal to an opponent operator at the time of automatic transmission. CONSTITUTION:A network control unit 2 inputs a signal of a signal line 40a, and when the signal line 40a is a high level, a telephone circuit 2a is connected to an input signal line 2c of a hybrid circuit 10. The hydrid circuit 10 is a circuit which separates a receiving signal from the signal line 2 and the transmitting signal from a signal line 30a, and the receiving signal is inputted through a signal line 10a to a sound recognition circuit 16-a signal detecting circuit 22. When the opponent responds manually, the circuit 16 detects a sound signal of an operator, and a special sound detecting circuit 18 detects special sounds of ''Facsimile'' or ''Fax.'' in the sound signal of the operator and also indicates to the control circuit. By receiving this sound, a control circuit 40 operates a sound generating circuit 26 and gives necessary commands by means of the sound signal to the opponent.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 目的:通过检测从对方终端发送的操作员的特殊声音信号,并在自动传输时将声音信号指示给对方操作员,通过设置一个呼叫来实现安全通信。 组成:网络控制单元 2 输入信号线 40a 的信号,当信号线 40a 为高电平时,电话电路 2a 连接到混合电路 10 的输入信号线 2c。混合电路 10 是 将来自信号线2的接收信号和来自信号线30a的发送信号分离的电路,并且接收信号通过信号线10a输入到声音识别电路16-信号检测电路22。当对手响应时 电路16手动检测操作者的声音信号,特殊声音检测电路18检测操作者声音信号中的“传真”或“传真”等特殊声音,同时向控制电路指示 . 通过接收该声音,控制电路40操作声音产生电路26并通过声音信号向对手发出必要的命令。

标题: Steganographisches Einbetten von Zusatzdaten und Kalibrierdaten in Bilddaten
摘要: A method of recognising content signals in a network of computing devices, the method comprising at a first network device in the network, obtaining a content signal distributed to the first network device transforming at least a portion of the content signal into a domain for recognition analysis processing the transformed signal to compute a pattern from the content signal determining an action authorised for the content signal by matching the pattern with a set of stored patterns with corresponding authorised actions and executing the authorised action at the first network.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种识别计算设备网络中的内容信号的方法,该方法包括在网络中的第一网络设备处获得分发到第一网络设备的内容信号,将内容信号的至少一部分变换到域中以用于识别分析 处理变换后的信号以根据内容信号计算模式,通过将模式与具有相应授权动作的一组存储模式相匹配来确定对内容信号授权的动作并在第一网络处执行授权动作。

标题: 実装部品検査用データ生成方法およびその方法の実施に用いられる実装部品検査装置
摘要:
【目的】実装部品検査装置への教示データを手入力操作を必要とせずに効率的に生成することを可能とする。
【構成】ST1において、基板上の実装部品の実装位置,実装方向,部品型式をCAMデータより入手し、ランドの位置や形状をCADデータより入手する。ST2でこれら外部データに対し、変換テーブルを参照して部品型式に対応するライブラリ名を得て検査情報(ライブラリデータ)を割り付け合成する。同様の手順をすべての実装部品につき繰り返し実行する。
摘要(译)(简体中文):
本发明的目的在于,无需手动输入操作,能够高效地生成安装部件检查装置的示教数据。 
 [构造] 在ST1中,电路板上的安装元件的安装位置、安装方向和零件类型是从CAM数据中获得的,而焊盘位置和形状是从CAD数据中获得的。 在ST2中,针对这些外部数据参照转换表,得到与部件种类对应的库名,分配并合成检查信息(库数据)。 对所有安装的组件重复类似的过程。

标题: Chinese/Kanji on-line recognition system
摘要: A Chinese/Kanji on-line recognition system consisting of four main sections, these being tablet electronics, a signal filter and segment integration unit, a base stroke classification unit and a symbol element recognition unit, and a symbol recognition output table. The tablet electronics provides pen coordinate signals and pen up/down signals which are applied to the signal filter and segment integration unit to define segments of strokes which correspond to continuous motion of a pen on a tablet in a fixed direction. The base stroke classification unit classifies the motion of the pen between pen down and pen up occurrences into one of 42 categories and also indicates if the stroke has crossed a prior stroke. This is then analyzed by the symbol element recognition unit which interprets the base strokes that have been recorded for the word and generates a sequence of symbol elements, referred to as "alphabet" components, that occur in this symbol. The sequence of symbol elements are interpreted in the symbol recognition output table which provides a form of a simple table look-up to determine the word that had been written. Only 72 basic symbol elements (alphabet) are required to synthesize all of the Chinese/Kanji vocabulary.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 中文/汉字在线识别系统由四个主要部分组成,分别是平板电子、信号滤波器和段集成单元、基本笔划分类单元和符号元素识别单元,以及符号识别输出表。 数位板电子设备提供笔坐标信号和笔向上/向下信号,这些信号被应用到信号滤波器和段积分单元以定义笔划段,这些笔划段对应于笔在数位板上沿固定方向的连续运动。 基本笔划分类单元将笔在落笔和抬起笔之间的运动分类为 42 个类别之一,并且还指示笔划是否已经越过先前的笔划。 这然后由符号元素识别单元进行分析,该单元解释已经为单词记录的基本笔划并生成出现在该符号中的符号元素序列,称为“字母表”组件。 符号元素的序列在符号识别输出表中进行解释,该表提供了一种简单的表查找形式来确定已写入的单词。 仅需要 72 个基本符号元素(字母)即可合成所有中文/汉字词汇。

标题: Hämatologisches Diagnosegerät unter Verwendung der Expertensystemtechnologie.
摘要: The present invention relates to an apparatus for the automatic interpretation of hematology results comprising: data processing means; memory means for storing data and data-processing instructions to be executed by the data processing means; means for entering data which represent the valves of hematology parameters derived from a patient's blood; and means for outputting messages of hematology-diagnostic significance, applicable to said patient, wherein the memory means stores a data base and execution-instructions of an automatically interpreting hematology-diagnostic system which is suitable for operation upon the mentioned hematology parameters and their patient-derived values; said data base including: a relatively large number of messages of hematologic-diagnostic significance, each message being associated with a range of values for each of said hematology parameters; said stored execution-instructions including directions to the processor to retrieve from the memory means the one or more messages whose range combinations apply to the patient's parametric values, wherein one or more messages are provided in a form to permit the interpretation of the hematologic condition of said patient.
摘要(译)(简体中文): [0001] 本发明涉及一种用于自动解释血液学结果的装置,包括:数据处理装置; 用于存储数据和由数据处理装置执行的数据处理指令的存储器装置; 用于输入表示源自患者血液的血液学参数的阀的数据的装置; 以及用于输出适用于所述患者的具有血液学诊断意义的消息的装置,其中所述存储器装置存储数据库和自动解释血液学诊断系统的执行指令,所述自动解释血液学诊断系统适合于对所提到的血液学参数及其患者进行操作。 派生值; 所述数据库包括:相对大量的具有血液学诊断意义的消息,每个消息与每个所述血液学参数的值范围相关联; 所述存储的执行指令包括对处理器从存储器检索的指示表示其范围组合适用于患者的参数值的一个或多个消息,其中以允许解释患者的血液学状况的形式提供一个或多个消息。 病人说。
发明人: ADRION ROBERT F. CARY NORTH CAROLINA 27511 US | CURRY JOAN W. DURHAM NORTH CAROLINA 27705 US | LEVINE ROBERT A. GUILFORD CONNECTICUT 06437 US

标题: Speech recognizing method and apparatus
摘要: Speech including a speech portion and a non-speech portion is inputted, a Cepstrum long time mean of the speech portion is obtained from the speech portion of the input speech, a Cepstrum long time mean of the non-speech portion is obtained from the non-speech portion of the input speech, each Cepstrum long time mean is converted from a Cepstrum region to a linear region, and after that, it is subtracted on a linear spectrum dimension, the subtracted mean is converted into a Cepstrum dimension, a Cepstrum long time mean of a speech portion in a speech database for learning is subtracted from the converted result, and the subtracted result is added to a speech model expressed by Cepstrum. Thus, even when a noise is large, a presuming precision of a line fluctuation is raised and a recognition rate can be improved.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 输入包含语音部分和非语音部分的语音,从输入语音的语音部分得到语音部分的倒谱长时间均值,从非语音部分得到非语音部分的倒谱长时间均值 - 输入语音的语音部分,每个Cepstrum long time mean从Cepstrum区域转换为线性区域,之后在线性谱维度上进行减法,减去的均值转换为Cepstrum维度,一个Cepstrum long 从转换后的结果中减去用于学习的语音数据库中的语音部分的时间均值,并将减去的结果添加到由倒谱表示的语音模型中。 由此,即使在噪声大的情况下,也能够提高线变动的推定精度,提高识别率。

标题: Parallel processing qualitative reasoning system
摘要: A parallel processing qualitative reasoning system uses a control processor and a plurality of server processors to evaluate a plurality of hypotheses simultaneously. The control processor provides hypotheses and user observations to the server processors and the server processors return evaluated hypotheses to the control processor. The server processors can be interrupted after a predetermined amount of time to return a partially evaluated hypothesis.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 并行处理定性推理系统使用一个控制处理器和多个服务器处理器同时评估多个假设。 控制处理器向服务器处理器提供假设和用户观察,并且服务器处理器将评估的假设返回给控制处理器。 服务器处理器可以在预定的时间量之后被中断以返回部分评估的假设。

标题: Analysis of colour tone in images for use in animal breeding
摘要: The present invention relates to a method and a device in animal breeding for recording information on individual animals and/or collectives of animals which are within a defined area of residence, one or more video cameras being used to record video signals including image information from the animal or animals, and monitoring, position and/or positioning data being extracted from the recorded image information, comprising: analysing the recorded image information in respect of this pixel related content of one or more colour tones being characteristic of one or more animals and/or one or more defined portions and/or states thereof; examining, in said analysis, the colour content of said pixels in respect of its pertinent to one or more predefined colour tone volumes; and calculating said data on the basis of pixels whose colour content falls within said one or more predefined colour tone volumes.
摘要(译)(简体中文): [0001] 本发明涉及一种在动物育种中用于记录在规定的居住区域内的个体动物和/或动物群体的信息的方法和设备,一个或多个摄像机用于记录包括来自动物的图像信息的视频信号。 一种或多种动物,以及从记录的图像信息中提取的监测、位置和/或定位数据,包括:针对作为一种或多种动物特征的一种或多种色调的该像素相关内容分析记录的图像信息和/ 或其一个或多个定义的部分和/或状态; 在所述分析中,检查所述像素的与一个或多个预定义色调体积相关的颜色内容; 以及基于颜色内容落入所述一个或多个预定义色调体积内的像素计算所述数据。

标题: Vorrichtung zum Verarbeiten von Bildisgnalen einer Monitorkamera
摘要: Die Erfindung bezieht sich auf eine Vorrichtung zur Trennung von Farbsignalen mit Multiplizierern (2, 2') zur Multiplikation eines Luminanzsignals mit zwei jeweils vorbestimmten Verstärkungsfaktoren und zur Ausgabe von zwei Referenzwerten, Vergleichsschaltungen (3, 3') für den Vergleich vonzwei Farbsignalen mit den jeweiligen Referenzwerten und zur Ausgabe von zwei binären Farbsignalen und einer Torschaltung (4) zur Ausführungeiner logischen Operation mit den beiden binären Farbsignalen und zur Ausgabe von binären Signalen entsprechend den speziellen durch dieVerstärkungsfaktoren bestimmten Farben.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 本发明涉及一种用于分离颜色信号的装置,其具有用于将亮度信号乘以两个分别预定的放大因子并用于输出两个参考值的乘法器(2、2')、用于比较两个颜色信号的比较电路(3、3')各自的参考值和用于输出两个二进制颜色信号和门电路(4)用于对两个二进制颜色信号进行逻辑运算并输出与由增益因子确定的特定颜色对应的二进制信号。
发明人: HAYASHI, MASAHIKO, SAKAI | FUJII, YASUO, SAKAI | OKUYAMA, SHIGEAKI, SAKAI

标题: 필드 및 프레임 움직임 추정 장치
摘要: 본 발명은 필드 움직임 추정 연산과 프레임 움직임 추정을 동시에 수행하여 하드웨어의 양 또는 움직임 추정시간을 반으로 절감시킬 수 있는 필드 및 프레임 움직임 추정 장치에 관한 것으로서, 탐색 영역 데이터를 입력받아 지연시켜 출력하는 제1지연 수단(1); 기준 블럭 데이터와 움직임 추정을 수행한 피드백된 데이터를 지연시킨 데이터를 입력받아 선택하여 출력하는 선택 수단(3); 상기 선택 수단(3)의 출력과 상기 제1지연 수단(1)의 출력을 입력받아 평균 절대 오차를 계산하여 출력하는 움직임 추정 수단(4); 상기 움직임 추정 수단(4)의 피드백된 기준 블럭 데이터를 입력받아 지연시켜 출력하는 제2지연 수단(2); 및 상기 움직임 추정 수단(4)의 출력을 입력받아 각 필드에 대한 평균 절대 오차를 이용하여, 기준 top 필드와 기준 bottom 필드 각각에 대한 최소 평균 절대 오차와 움직임 벡터, 예측 방향을 출력하고, 그리고 기준 블럭 전체에 대한 최소 평균절대 오차와 움직임 벡터를 출력하는 비교 수단(5)을 구비하여 하나의 움직임 추정 장치를 이용하여 필드와 프레임 움직임 추정을 동시에 수행하므로써 기존의 움직임 추정 장치를 사용하는 것에 비해 2배의 향상된 성능을갖는 효과가 있다.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 本发明涉及一种通过同时执行场运动估计和帧运动估计能够将硬件量或运动估计时间减少一半的场和帧运动估计设备,并且接收搜索区域数据并延迟并输出它们。 (1); 选择装置(3),用于接收、选择并输出延迟参考块数据和反馈的用于运动估计的数据; 运动估计装置(4),用于接收选择装置(3)的输出和第一延迟装置(1)的输出,计算并输出平均绝对误差; 第二延迟装置(2),用于延迟输出运动估计装置(4)反馈的参考块数据; 并且接收运动估计单元4的输出,使用每个场的平均绝对误差输出每个标准顶场和标准底场的最小平均绝对误差、运动矢量和预测方向,并且比较装置5用于提供了输出整个块的最小平均绝对误差和运动矢量,与使用现有运动估计装置相比,使用一个运动估计装置同时进行场和帧运动估计。具有提高性能的效果船。

标题: Character recognition
摘要: This invention relates to a method and apparatus for recognizing a script written character. The character is entered using character entering means and digitised by appropriate means. The digitised character is then stored in, for example, a memory. Codes representing topological vector features of the character are extracted from the character, then the topological and vector features of the character are compared with a set of reference topological and vector features stored in a memory. Each of the set of reference characters corresponding with a specific script written character. A logic process is then performed to determine which of the set of reference features most closely corresponds to the topological features of the digitized character thereby identifying the script written character. The relative weighting of the topological effect and the vector effect can be varied for different types of script to enable still more accurate recognition.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 本发明涉及一种用于识别手写字符的方法和设备。 使用字符输入装置输入字符并通过适当的装置数字化。 然后将数字化字符存储在例如存储器中。 从字符中提取表示字符的拓扑矢量特征的代码,然后将字符的拓扑和矢量特征与存储在存储器中的一组参考拓扑和矢量特征进行比较。 每组参考字符对应一个特定的脚本书写字符。 然后执行逻辑过程以确定参考特征组中的哪一个最接近地对应于数字化字符的拓扑特征,从而识别手写字符。 拓扑效应和矢量效应的相对权重可以针对不同类型的脚本而变化,以实现更准确的识别。
发明人: GALLO, GIROLAMO | LUCENTINI, FLAVIO | LATTARO, CRISTINA | MAROTTA, GIULIO | SAVARESE, GIUSEPPE

标题: System zum speichern der visuellen form von information aus einer anwendung in eine datenbank und zum wiederauffinden
摘要: The visual form of data from a computer program is received and stored in a database. The visual form of the data may be received, for example, in response to a print operation by the computer program or by some other operation such as a cut and paste sequence of operations or by sending the data to another application. The visual form of the data may be stored as a vector image that permits scalability. The visual form of the data may be stored with other identifying information or tags in the database to facilitate searching of the database. The data in the database may be encoded in a manner that ensures data integrity and that permits detection of when data has been compromised. In one embodiment, a service layer application is provided to control access to the database by performing encoding and decoding of the data in the database. The service layer may have an application programming interface that permits many applications to have access to the database. Another application may be provided for accessing the visual form of the data from the database and for providing this data to another computer program. Such an application permits a user to create compound documents from data in the database using the other computer program.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 来自计算机程序的视觉形式的数据被接收并存储在数据库中。 数据的视觉形式可以例如响应于计算机程序的打印操作或通过诸如剪切和粘贴操作序列的一些其他操作或通过将数据发送到另一个应用程序来接收。 数据的视觉形式可以存储为允许可缩放的矢量图像。 数据的可视化形式可以与其他识别信息或标签一起存储在数据库中,以方便数据库的搜索。 数据库中的数据可以以确保数据完整性并允许检测数据何时被破坏的方式编码。 在一个实施例中,提供一种服务层应用程序以通过对数据库中的数据执行编码和解码来控制对数据库的访问。 服务层可能有一个应用程序编程接口,允许许多应用程序访问数据库。 可以提供另一个应用程序来访问数据库中数据的可视化形式并将该数据提供给另一个计算机程序。 这样的应用程序允许用户使用其他计算机程序从数据库中的数据创建复合文档。
发明人: NAGRAL, AJIT S. | BAYIATES, EDWARD LAWRENCE | BUSH, FITZHUGH GORDON, III | KAULGUD, MILIND M. | GREGORY, CARY EDWIN | DOS SANTOS, CARL
发明人地址: 5 FAULKNER ROAD, SHREWSBURY,MASSACHUSETTS 01545 (US) | 195 BELMONT STREET, APT.# 2, WORCESTER, MASSACHUSETTS 06019 (US) | 33 ROLLING MEADOW DRIVE, HOLLISTON, MA 01746 (US) | 63 KENDALL ROAD, BOXBOROUGH, MA 01719 (US) | 23 COUNTRY LANE, COLLINSVILLE, CT 06022 (US) | 34 PIEDMONT AVENUE, LUNENBURG, MA 01462 (US)

标题: Method for resolving redundant identifications of an object
摘要: When identifying an object in an image, very often redundant identifications of the object may occur. The present invention relates to methods of image analysis for resolving such redundant identifications of an object. More specifically, the present invention relates to object identification schemes which obtain multiple representations of the same object. In addition, such identification schemes may identify void, or donut-shaped objects when a single search, or multiples searches, of the image are performed. Further, the present invention is useful in resolving several distinct objects where other identification schemes employing either single or multiple searching have identified these distinct objects as a single clumped object. The present invention may be used, for instance, to determine whether a smaller object is contained within another, larger object.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 在识别图像中的对象时,经常会出现对象的冗余标识。 本发明涉及用于解决对象的这种冗余标识的图像分析方法。 更具体地,本发明涉及获得同一对象的多个表示的对象识别方案。 此外,当执行图像的单次搜索或多次搜索时,此类识别方案可以识别空心或环形对象。 此外,本发明可用于解决几个不同的对象,其中采用单个或多个搜索的其他识别方案已将这些不同的对象识别为单个成群的对象。 例如,可以使用本发明来确定较小的对象是否包含在另一个较大的对象中。

标题: Method and apparatus for mapping multiple-byte characters to unique strings of ASCII characters for use in text retrieval
摘要: An apparatus and method for converting a non-English language document text or search and retrieval argument into a form which can be processed by an existing ASCII based automated text processing system, even though the non-English language may have thousands of characters in it, thereby allowing the use of existing text processing systems and existing text data bases without the need to convert these text processing systems to handle multi-byte character languages.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种用于将非英语语言文档文本或搜索和检索参数转换为可以由现有的基于 ASCII 的自动文本处理系统处理的形式的设备和方法,即使非英语语言中可能有数千个字符, 从而允许使用现有的文本处理系统和现有的文本数据库,而不需要将这些文本处理系统转换为处理多字节字符语言。

标题: Durch Stimm-Eingabe gesteuerter Computer
摘要: Ein durch Stimm-Eingabe gesteuerter Computer hat einen Spracherkennungs-Abschnitt zum Umwandeln eines Schlüsselwortes für ein Programm, das durch Stimm-Eingabe eingegeben worden ist, und das einer Start-Nummer entspricht, um auf diese Weise einen digitalen Code zu erhalten. Diedigitalen Code-Daten, die das Schlüsselwort bezeichnen, wählen eine Startnummer aus, die dem Speicherinhalt einer in einem Programmspeichergespeicherten Tabelle entspricht. Die Startnummer-Daten werden verwendet, um auf eine Startadresse des entsprechenden Programmes zuzugreifenund um dadurch das Programm zu starten und das Programm auszuführen.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 语音控制计算机具有语音识别部分,用于转换已通过语音输入并对应于起始编号的节目的关键字,从而获得数字代码。 指定关键字的数字代码数据选择对应于存储在程序存储器中的表的存储器内容的起始编号。 起始编号数据用于访问相应程序的起始地址,从而启动程序并运行程序。

标题: Information providing method and system using information modification rules
摘要: An information providing method and system is provided, in which information suitable for a user can be provided without any change for information stored in information providing servers. The method comprises the steps of: preparing information modification rules in which plural classes indicating characteristics of users are determined; regarding at least one information item, identification information with respect to the information item and a server which stores the information item is assigned to one of the classes; a more suitable information item is determined as a modified information item with respect to the assigned information item, the modified information item being used when the assigned information item is chosen by a user who belongs to the relevant class; and identification information with respect to the modified information item and a server which stores the modified information item are registered; providing an information modifying/providing server which performs information provision control with reference to the modification rules; and in the information modifying/providing server, when a first server provides a first information item to an information terminal and the information terminal request a second information item relating to the first information item, judging whether or not the modified information item with respect to the second information item exists in the information modification rules; if the modified information item does not exist, sending an information request to a server which stores the second information item; if the modified information item exists, sending an information request to a server which stores the modified information item; and providing the sent-back information item to the information terminal.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 提供了一种信息提供方法和系统,其中可以提供适合于用户的信息,而无需对存储在信息提供服务器中的信息进行任何改变。 该方法包括以下步骤:准备信息修改规则,其中确定多个表示用户特征的类别; 关于至少一个信息项,关于该信息项的标识信息和存储该信息项的服务器被分配给其中一个类别; 更合适的信息项被确定为关于分配的信息项的修改的信息项,当属于相关类别的用户选择分配的信息项时使用修改的信息项; 注册修改后的信息项的标识信息和存储修改后的信息项的服务器; 提供信息修改/提供服务器,参照修改规则进行信息提供控制; 在信息修改/提供服务器中,当第一服务器向信息终端提供第一信息项并且信息终端请求与第一信息项相关的第二信息项时,判断修改后的信息项是否相对于 信息修改规则中存在第二信息项; 如果修改后的信息项不存在,则向存储有第二信息项的服务器发送信息请求; 如果修改后的信息项存在,则向存储修改后的信息项的服务器发送信息请求; 将返回的信息项提供给信息终端。

标题: Apparatus for verifying a signature
摘要: Method and apparatus are disclosed for verifying a sample signature based on comparison of the dynamics of a reference and a sample signature. More particularly, second derivative values of pen displacements (i.e. acceleration) and continuous pressure pattern signals are periodically sampled for both a reference and sample signature and a comparison of these second derivative values and pressure patterns is made. To effect the comparisons the two groups (reference and sample) of both second derivative and pressure pattern signals are segmented and corresponding segments are individually correlated. Successive comparisons of the same segment pairs are performed utilizing successive shifting of the phases between the two segments being correlated to find regions of highest possible correlation. A running account of the maximum cross correlation values for all of the segment pairs of the two signatures are kept. Finally, these maximum values obtained for each segment pair comparison are combined and this resultant correlation value is utilized as a verification indicator.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 公开了用于基于参考和样本签名的动态比较来验证样本签名的方法和设备。 更具体地,笔位移(即加速度)和连续压力模式信号的二阶导数值被周期性地采样以用于参考和样本签名,并且对这些二阶导数值和压力模式进行比较。 为了进行比较,对二阶导数和压力模式信号的两组(参考和样本)进行分段,并分别关联相应的分段。 利用被相关的两个段之间的相位的连续移位来执行相同段对的连续比较,以找到最高可能相关的区域。 保留两个签名的所有片段对的最大互相关值的流水账。 最后,将每个片段对比较获得的这些最大值组合起来,并将该结果相关值用作验证指标。

标题: 配置最適化方法及び配置最適化装置と回路設計装置
摘要: PURPOSE:To obtain an optimum arrangement by calculating a constraint condition variable value until a circuit evaluation function value comes to an optimum value, and also, the constraint condition variable value converges to a constraint condition, then determining an arrangement position of an operation object circuit allocated to a process from a coordinate of the processor. CONSTITUTION:A constraing condition variable value when an i-th (i=1-n) circuit is placed in a k-th (k=1-n) place is calculated by processor of coordinates (i, k) until a circuit evaluation function value comes to an optimum value, and also, the constraint condition variable value converges to a constraint condition, and an arrangement position of an operation object circuit allocated to the processor is determined from the processor by which an output value is converged to the constraint condition and its coordinate. When an output of the processor of the coordinates (i, k) comes to '1' by a fact that the processor of coordinates (i, 1-n) executes this operation, an output of the other processor [i, 1-n (except k)] comes to '0'. In such a way, when an i-th circuit is placed in a place (k), an optimum arrangement is obtained.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 目的:通过计算约束条件变量值,直到电路评价函数值达到最优值,并且约束条件变量值收敛到约束条件,从而确定操作对象电路的布置位置,从而获得最优布置。 从处理器的坐标分配给进程。 组成:当第 i (i=1-n) 电路放置在第 k (k=1-n) 位置时,约束条件变量值由坐标 (i, k) 处理器计算,直到电路评估 函数值达到最优值,并且约束条件变量值收敛到约束条件,分配给处理器的运算对象电路的布置位置由输出值收敛到约束的处理器确定 条件及其坐标。 当坐标 (i, k) 的处理器的输出由于坐标 (i, 1-n) 的处理器执行此操作而变为“1”时,另一个处理器的输出 [i, 1-n  (k 除外)] 为 0。 以这种方式,当第i个电路放置在位置(k)时,获得了最佳布置。

标题: Method and apparatus for segmenting character images
摘要: METHOD AND APPARATUS FOR SEGMENTING CHARACTER IMAGES Abstract A method and apparatus are disclosed for seg- menting character images in an optical image system where the character images have a predetermined pitch. The optical image system generates character information in the form of a successive series of scan lines of data. Profiles of the character images being scanned are generated, and a profile segment meeting certain criteria is selected. The center of the selected profile segment is located, and segmentation points between the character images are established as a linear function of the character image pitch and located center. The segmen- tation points are integer multiples of the pitch.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 用于分割字符图像的方法和设备 摘要 公开了一种用于在字符图像具有预定间距的光学图像系统中分割字符图像的方法和设备。 光学图像系统以连续的一系列数据扫描线的形式生成字符信息。 生成正在扫描的字符图像的轮廓,并选择满足特定标准的轮廓段。 选定轮廓段的中心被定位,字符图像之间的分割点被建立为字符图像间距和定位中心的线性函数。 分割点是音高的整数倍。

标题: プログラム作成装置
摘要: PURPOSE:To generate a program which a machine can automatically process and which is encoded by separating the picture of the processing procedure of the program into a character area picture and a linear graphic area picture and recognition- processing them to combine recognition results. CONSTITUTION:A picture input device digital-inputs a flow chart where a character and a graphic are mixed and stores it in a picture memory 2. The picture stored in the memory 2 is separated into the character area image composed only by the character and the graphic area picture composed only by the graphic by a character/ graphic separation device 3. When an outline extraction part 43 takes AND between an original picture and a picture obtained by shifting the original picture to left by one picture element and takes AND between the picture of a processed result and the picture obtained by shifting the original picture to left by one picture element and takes AND of pictures obtained by shifting the original picture upward and downward by one picture element, a picture reduced in four directions by one picture element is formed, and an outline is extracted by taking exclusive OR between the picture and the original picture. A chain encoding part 44 raster-scans the picture whose outline is extracted in the extraction part 43 and a black picture element is substituted with a white picture element. When there is the black picture element, chain encoding is executed.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 目的:生成一个机器可以自动处理的程序,并通过将程序的处理过程的图片分离为字符区域图片和线性图形区域图片并识别-处理它们以结合识别结果进行编码。 组成:图片输入设备数字输入流程图,其中字符和图形混合在一起,并将其存储在图片存储器 2 中。存储在存储器 2 中的图片被分成仅由字符和图形组成的字符区域图像 仅由字符/图形分离装置3的图形组成的图形区域图片。当轮廓提取部分43在原始图片和通过将原始图片向左移动一个像素而获得的图片之间进行AND并且在图片之间进行AND时 将处理后的结果与原图左移1个像素的图像进行“与”运算,将原图上下偏移1个像素的图像进行“与”,形成四个方向缩小1个像素的图像 ,并通过图片与原始图片的异或提取轮廓。 链编码部44对在提取部43中提取出轮廓的图像进行光栅扫描,将黑色像素替换为白色像素。 当存在黑色像素时,执行链式编码。

The restoration information generating means is supplied also with the original character string <CUSTOM-CHARACTER FILE="US06469643-20021022-P00001.TIF" ALT="custom character" HE="20" WI="20" ID="CUSTOM-CHARACTER-00003"/>, besides the normalized character string <CUSTOM-CHARACTER FILE="US06469643-20021022-P00002.TIF" ALT="custom character" HE="20" WI="20" ID="CUSTOM-CHARACTER-00004"/>, and generates restoration information "F@&" consisting of ASCII characters, which is supplied to storing means. 标题: Vorrichtung und Verfahren zur Fehlerinspektion in befestigten Bauteilen, unterVerwendung eines Lichtschlitzes.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 狭缝光用投光器被配置成至少两条狭缝线(72)通过将狭缝光倾斜地投射到芯片元件(9)等上而形成,彼此交叉,并且从上方成像狭缝线(72) 组件(9)等通过电视摄像机(1)在相应的图像中水平延伸。 通过图像处理器(8、53、71)分析图像中的狭缝线(72)的形状,以检测芯片元件(9)等的状态变化,例如其错位。 此外,如果需要,为了增强狭缝线(72)的图案的对比度,狭缝光在电视摄像机(1)的曝光时间内由频闪灯(52)投射,时间很短。 间隔不超过曝光时间。

标题: Method and apparatus for non-contact signature imaging
摘要: A portable, hand-held apparatus for capturing a gray scale image of a signature within a box having fiducial marks in the corners. Portions of the image outside the box are trimmed away and the box is oriented and scaled to a standard size and shape. Signature storage requirements are minimized and signature recognition is facilitated by thresholding the gray scale image and thinning the strokes of the signature to an image width of one pixel.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种便携式手持设备,用于在角部具有基准标记的盒子内捕捉签名的灰度图像。 框外的图像部分被修剪掉,框被定向并缩放为标准尺寸和形状。 通过对灰度图像进行阈值化并将签名的笔划细化为一个像素的图像宽度,签名存储要求被最小化并且签名识别被促进。

标题: Plural neural network system having a successive approximation learning method
摘要: A neural network structure includes input units for receiving input data, and a plurality of neural networks connected in parallel and connected to the input units. The plurality of neural networks learn in turn correspondence between the input data and teacher data so that the difference between the input data and the teacher becomes small. The neural network structure further includes output units connected to the plurality of neural networks, for outputting a result of learning on the basis of the results of learning in the plurality of neural networks.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种神经网络结构,包括用于接收输入数据的输入单元,以及与输入单元并联连接的多个神经网络。 多个神经网络依次学习输入数据与教师数据的对应关系,使得输入数据与教师数据的差异变小。 神经网络结构还包括与多个神经网络连接的输出单元,用于根据多个神经网络中的学习结果输出学习结果。

标题: Automatic extraction process of a contrasted object in a digital image
摘要: Procédé d'extraction automatique d'un objet con­trasté dans une image numérique, consistant d'une part, à es­timer en (i,j) une valeur du fond [f(i,j)], cette estimation faisant intervenir un premier seuil (S₁), permettant d'af­fecter à (i,j) un fond [f(i,j)] estimé de façon différente selon le résultat de la comparaison au premier seuil (S₁) d'une fonction de contraste local [GR(i,j)] calculée pour l'élément d'image considéré (i,j), et, d'autre part, à compa­rer en (i,j) la différence [d(i,j)] entre le signal vidéo s(i,j) et le fond estimé [f(i,j)] à un deuxième seuil (S₂), afin de décider si l'élément d'image (i,j) appartient à l'ob­jet à extraire. Selon l'invention, la fonction de contraste local [GR(i,j)] est un gradient récursif, proportionnel à la valeur absolue de la différence d'une moyenne [MV(j)] des si­gnaux vidéo d'éléments d'image situés sur la ligne (j) et d'une fonction [MF(j;j-1)] de moyennes [MF(j);MF(j-1)] des fonds estimés en des éléments d'image situés sur au moins la ligne (j) ou la ligne (j-1). Application à l'extraction d'objets dans une image numérique.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 自动提取数字图像中对比对象的过程,一方面包括在 (i,j) 中估计背景值 [f(i,j)],该估计涉及第一阈值 (S1) , 从而可以根据与局部对比度函数 [GR(i,j) 的第一阈值 (S1) 的比较结果为 (i,j) 分配不同估计的背景 [f(i,j)] ] 为考虑的图像元素 (i,j) 计算,另一方面,在 (i,j) 中比较视频信号 s(i,j) 和视频信号之间的差异 [d(i,j)]在第二阈值 (S2) 处估计背景 [f(i,j)],以确定图像元素 (i,j) 是否属于要提取的对象。 根据本发明,局部对比度函数[GR(i,j)]是递归梯度,与位于行(j)上的像素视频信号的平均值[MV(j)]的差的绝对值成比例。 ) 和函数 [MF(j;j-1)] 的平均值 [MF(j);MF(j-1)] 在位于至少行 (j) 或行 (j-1) 的图像元素中估计的资金)。 应用于数字图像中对象的提取。
