发明人地址: Oceanside, CA | San Diego, CA | Cardiff, CA | Carlsbad, CA | Chapel Hill, NC | Carksbad, CA

标题: Alphabetic character word upper/lower case print convention apparatus and method
摘要: The print convention apparatus and method disclosed herein effects a decision making process with respect to a determination as to whether an alphabetic character field output from an optical character reader (OCR) is related to the OCR scan of an upper case or a lower case inscription on the document scanned. The alphabetic character field (e.g., a word) is comprised of one or a series of alphabetic characters which represent the OCR's interpretation of characters printed on the scanned document. Each word output by the OCR corresponds to a field (i.e., word) of characters imprinted on the scanned document. The electrical signals representative of the upper and lower case alphabetic characters and rejects including conflicts outputted from the OCR are applied to a character occurrence probability storage apparatus which contains precomputed empirical probabilities therein that: (1) a given character recognition is the result of the scan of an upper case character; and (2) a given character recognition is the result of the scan of a lower case character. In addition, the storage apparatus includes probability values for character conflicts and rejects. As the series of alphabetic character signals from the OCR output are applied character-by-character to the character occurrence probability storage apparatus (e.g., a read-only store), a running sum of the respective probabilities for the upper case and lower case print conventions is developed so that, following the input of the final character, reject or conflict within a word to the aforesaid apparatus, an appropriate upper or lower case determination can be made for all of the characters within the word. This determination corresponds with the print convention of the word inscribed on the scanned document. A corresponding upper or lower case flag is correspondingly generated with the print convention determination, and associated with the alphabetic character word output from the print convention apparatus for further text processing. In one embodiment of the invention the probability for each OCR output alphabetic character being an upper or lower case character is stored in respective upper and lower case character occurrence probability storage devices after having been precomputed as the product of two probability factors; i.e., (1) a first probability factor with respect to the likelihood that the OCR recognition resulted from the scan of an upper or lower case character, and (2) a second probability factor with respect to the likelihood of a given character occurring in a specified language (e.g., English) document. In another embodiment of the invention, the character occurrence probability storage devices are functionally replaced by a read-only store having an address position for each upper and lower case alphabetic character outputted by the OCR including conflicts and rejects, and a precomputed numerical probability value associated with each address position to represent the quotient of: (1) the probability that a given character is related to an upper case print convention; and (2) the probability that the same character is related to a lower case print convention.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 在此公开的印刷约定设备和方法实现了关于确定从光学字符阅读器(OCR)输出的字母字符字段是否与大写或小写铭文的OCR扫描相关的决策过程。 扫描的文档。 字母字符字段(例如,单词)由一个或一系列字母字符组成,代表 OCR 对打印在扫描文档上的字符的解释。  OCR 输出的每个单词对应于打印在扫描文档上的字符字段(即单词)。 代表大写字母和小写字母字符的电信号和拒绝包括从 OCR 输出的冲突被应用到字符出现概率存储设备,其中包含预先计算的经验概率:(1)给定的字符识别是扫描的结果 大写字符;  (2)给定的字符识别是对小写字符的扫描结果。 另外,存储装置包括字符冲突和拒绝的概率值。 当来自 OCR 输出的一系列字母字符信号逐个字符地应用于字符出现概率存储设备(例如,只读存储器)时,大写字母和小写字母打印的各自概率的运行总和 conventions被开发成在输入最后一个字符、拒绝或冲突一个词到上述装置后,可以对该词中的所有字符做出适当的大写或小写判断。 此确定对应于扫描文档上所刻文字的打印约定。 对应的大写或小写标志随着打印规则的确定而生成,并与打印规则装置输出的字母字符词相关联,以供进一步的文本处理。 在本发明的一个实施例中,每个OCR输出的字母字符为大写或小写字符的概率在预先计算为两个概率因子的乘积后存储在各自的大写和小写字符出现概率存储装置中; 即,(1)关于 OCR 识别由大写或小写字符扫描产生的可能性的第一概率因子,以及(2)关于给定字符出现在 指定语言(例如英语)的文件。 在本发明的另一个实施例中,字符出现概率存储设备在功能上被只读存储器代替,该只读存储器具有用于 OCR 输出的每个大写和小写字母字符的地址位置,包括冲突和拒绝,以及相关的预计算数值概率值 每个地址位置表示商:(1)给定字符与大写打印约定相关的概率;  (2) 同一字符与小写打印约定相关的概率。
发明人: HILLIARD, JOHN JOSEPH | MULLAN, PHILIP JOSEPH | ROSENBAUM, WALTER STEVEN
发明人地址: Potomac, MD | Rockville, MD | Silver Spring, MD

标题: Variable length data processing apparatus
摘要: Variable length data stored in a RAM (3) are sequentially read out by designating their addresses. It is detected whether or not the readout data is a code indicating a delimitation of, e.g., a word block, record block, file block, or the like. If it is detected that the readout data is a code indicating a delimitation, an address at that time is latched, thus forming an address table based on the latched address. The address table thus formed is utilized upon retrieval of data in the RAM, thus allowing high-speed data access.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 通过指定它们的地址顺序读出存储在RAM(3)中的可变长度数据。 检测读出的数据是否是表示例如字块、记录块、文件块等的定界的代码。 如果检测到读出的数据是表示定界的代码,则锁存当时的地址,从而根据锁存的地址形成地址表。 这样形成的地址表在RAM中的数据检索时使用,从而允许高速数据访问。

标题: Apparatus for image processing in accordance with a locally determined type of image region
摘要: An image processing apparatus inputs an image signal obtained by scanning a document in which a character region, a photographic region and a dot region are mixed and stores image data in a local block composed of a target picture element and plural picture elements surrounding the target picture element. The image processing apparatus computes first and second feature parameters P₀ and P₁ representing the features of each region based on the image data in the local block, and inputs the resulting first and second feature parameters P₀ and P₁ to an identification circuit adopting a neural network. The identification circuit outputs the region identification information O₀ and O₁ of the target picture element, and the filter processing circuit performs a spatial filtering process according to the region identification information O₀ and O₁. As described, in the image processing apparatus, since a multi-dimensional identification process is performed using the neural circuit which receives inputs of plural feature parameters, an image identification with very high precision is permitted, and an optimum spatial-filtering process can be applied according to the feature of each picture element, thereby achieving a high quality image.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 图像处理装置输入通过扫描混合了字符区域、摄影区域和点区域的文档而获得的图像信号,并将图像数据存储在由目标像素和围绕目标图片的多个像素组成的局部块中 元素。 图像处理装置基于局部块中的图像数据计算表示每个区域的特征的第一和第二特征参数P 0 和P 1 ,并将得到的第一和第二特征参数P 0 和P 1 输入到采用神经网络的识别电路。 识别电路输出目标像素的区域识别信息O 0 和O 1 ,滤波处理电路根据区域识别信息O 0 和O 1 进行空间滤波处理。 如上所述,在图像处理装置中,由于使用接收多个特征参数的输入的神经电路来执行多维识别处理,所以允许非常高精度的图像识别,并且可以应用最优空间滤波处理。 根据每个像素的特征,从而获得高质量的图像。

标题: Business information repository system and method of operation
摘要: A business information repository system (10) is provided that is coupled to a distributed network (12). The business information repository system (10) includes a user interface that is coupled to a control system (28). The control system (28) accesses a business information database (65) using a search engine (26). The business information database (65) includes business information including glossaries, graphics, resumes, skills inventories, citations, proposals, customer information and internal corporate profiles, vendor information, standard solutions, and forecasted deal information. Utility functions (56) are provided including a data access manager (32), a forecasting engine (58), a graphics utility (60) and a population engine (62).
摘要(译)(简体中文): 提供了一种耦合到分布式网络(12)的商业信息储存库系统(10)。 商业信息储存库系统(10)包括耦合到控制系统(28)的用户界面。 控制系统(28)使用搜索引擎(26)访问商业信息数据库(65)。 商业信息数据库(65)包括商业信息,包括词汇表、图形、简历、技能清单、引文、建议、客户信息和内部公司简介、供应商信息、标准解决方案和预测交易信息。 提供的实用功能(56)包括数据访问管理器(32)、预测引擎(58)、图形实用程序(60)和人口引擎(62)。

标题: Image data coding and decoding system for efficiently compressing information using the shape and position of the image content
摘要: An image data coding system comprises a screen-area determining means for determining the area of a screen reproduced on the basis of an input image data; a code-amount assigning control means for controlling regions to which data on the screen are to be assigned and the code amount assigned to each of the regions, on the basis of the results determined on the area of the reproduced screen; and a coding means for coding the image data signal inputted in accordance with the code amount assigned to each of the regions. In an image data coding and/or decoding system, a coding system performs the two-dimensional orthogonal transform of picture signals of all the pixels with respect to inside blocks and of only picture signals of pixels contained in a content with respect to edge blocks, in accordance with a map signal indicative of the position and shape of the content, and it codes the map signal. A decoding system selects an orthogonal transform coefficient necessary to reproduce an image of a desired resolution from coded orthogonal coefficients on the basis of a coded and resolution-transformed map signal. It performs the two-dimensional inverse orthogonal transform of all the coefficients with respect to the inside blocks and of only the coefficients contained in the content with respect to the edge blocks thereby deriving a resolution-transformed regenerative signal.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 图像数据编码系统包括屏幕区域确定装置,用于根据输入图像数据确定再现的屏幕区域; 代码量分配控制装置,用于根据在再现屏幕的区域上确定的结果控制屏幕上的数据将被分配到的区域和分配给每个区域的代码量; 以及编码装置,用于根据分配给每个区域的码量对输入的图像数据信号进行编码。 在图像数据编码和/或解码系统中,编码系统针对内部块执行所有像素的图像信号的二维正交变换,以及关于边缘块的内容中包含的仅像素的图像信号的二维正交变换, 根据表示内容的位置和形状的地图信号,对地图信号进行编码。 解码系统基于编码和分辨率变换的映射信号从编码的正交系数中选择再现期望分辨率的图像所必需的正交变换系数。 它执行关于内部块的所有系数的二维逆正交变换以及关于边缘块的仅内容中包含的系数的二维逆正交变换,从而导出分辨率变换的再生信号。
发明人: YAMAGUCHI, NOBORU | WATANABE, TOSHIAKI | DACHIKU, KENSHI | KIKUCHI, YOSHIHIRO | IDA, TAKASHI | CHUJOH, TAKESHI
发明人地址: Yashio, JP | Yokohama, JP | Kawasaki, JP | Tokyo-To, JP

标题: Monitoring of load situation in a service database system
摘要: The invention relates to a method for monitoring the load situation in a service database system. The system generates a list which includes a desired number of measurement objects which are largest in respect to counter values. In order to obtain measurement data more efficiently in real-time, (a) the recording and zeroing of counter values is performed during each recording interval one measurement object at a time, (b) list is generated by the recording interval so that it is checked within a recording interval during the processing of each individual object whether the counter value of the object in question is greater than that of the object with the smallest counter value included in the list at the time and if this is the case, the object with the smallest counter value included in the list is replaced with the object corresponding to the row in question.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 本发明涉及一种监测服务数据库系统中负载情况的方法。 系统生成一个列表,该列表包括相对于计数器值最大的所需数量的测量对象。 为了更有效地实时获取测量数据,(a)在每个记录间隔期间,每次一个测量对象执行计数器值的记录和归零,(b)按记录间隔生成列表,以便 在处理每个单独对象期间的记录间隔内检查所讨论对象的计数器值是否大于当时列表中包含的具有最小计数器值的对象的值,如果是这种情况,则该对象具有 列表中包含的最小计数器值将替换为与相关行对应的对象。
法律状态/事件: 期限届满 | 质押 | 权利转移

标题: ディジタル符号化記号列の記憶方法および記憶装置
摘要:
【課題】 高速で、容易に実装可能であり、効率的な破棄判断基準を利用する、有限な順次パターンメモリを実現する。
【解決手段】 ディジタル信号ストリームから以前に形成されたディジタル信号列に応答してトークンが出力される。各ディジタル信号列が以前に形成されたかどうかの判断には、メモリロケーションのサブセットの内容の検査が含まれる。形成されたディジタル信号列を表す情報がサブセット内に見つからない場合、そのような情報を記憶するためにサブセット内のロケーションが選択される。この選択プロセスは、サブセット内のすべてのロケーションから1つのロケーションを選択する。親ロケーションの情報の上書きから生じる従来技術の問題点を回避するために、それぞれの記憶されるエントリの作成の時刻の指示子を利用して、以前に捨てられた親の子から情報が出力されないようにする。
摘要(译)(简体中文):
一种快速、易于实现并利用有效丢弃标准的有限顺序模式存储器。 
 响应于先前由数字信号流形成的数字信号串输出令牌。 确定每个数字信号序列是否先前已形成涉及检查存储位置子集的内容。 如果在子集中没有找到表示形成的数字信号序列的信息,则选择子集中的一个位置来存储这样的信息。 该选择过程从子集中的所有位置中选择一个位置。 为了避免现有技术由于覆盖父位置中的信息而导致的问题,使用每个存储条目的创建时间的指示器,不从先前丢弃的父的子输出任何信息。

标题: System and method for assisting exact Garbage collection by segregating the contents of a stack into sub stacks
摘要: In a program data stack in a computer system, every stack is implemented as two substacks, one to contain references and one to contain primitive data. In this manner, whether a piece of information on a stack is a reference or a primitive value is easily determined according to which substack it resides in. Each substack is itself a full-fledged stack data structure with a stack base, a stack pointer, and a stack limit. In the preferred embodiment, there is also a frame pointer for each substack. The normal instruction set is modified so that instructions that operate with references use the reference stack whereas instructions that operate with data use the primitive data stack. Specifically, during compilation, or loading, all instructions which can operate indiscriminately with either references or data are replaced by equivalent, but reference-specific or data-specific instructions. With this arrangement, garbage collection algorithms can locate all references stored within a stack, since the references are all in a more or less contiguous region of memory without interspersed primitive data.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 在计算机系统的程序数据栈中,每个栈被实现为两个子栈,一个包含引用,一个包含原始数据。 以这种方式,堆栈上的一条信息是引用还是原始值很容易根据它所在的子堆栈来确定。每个子堆栈本身就是一个完整的堆栈数据结构,具有堆栈基础,堆栈指针, 和堆栈限制。 在优选实施例中,每个子堆栈也有一个帧指针。 修改了普通指令集,以便对引用进行操作的指令使用引用堆栈,而对数据进行操作的指令使用原始数据堆栈。 具体来说,在编译或加载期间,所有可以不加区别地与引用或数据一起操作的指令都被等效的但特定于引用或特定于数据的指令替换。 通过这种安排,垃圾收集算法可以找到存储在堆栈中的所有引用,因为这些引用都在或多或少连续的内存区域中,没有散布的原始数据。

标题: Aufzeichnungsträger und Aufzeichnungsgerät dafür
摘要: In a PVD table of a management region on the disc, a disc identifier 1 that represents the type of the data recording format of the disc, a number-of-disc-sides identifier 2 that represents whether the disc is a single-sided disc or a double-sided disc, and a disc side identifier 3 that represents whether the reproducing disc is side A or side B of a double-sided disc. A disc identifier 4 that represents the type of the data recording format of the file is recorded in a file (n) table including management information of the file. The reproducing apparatus reads the disc identifiers 1 and 4 from the PVD table and the file (n) table and determines whether or not the disc and the file are reproducible. In addition, the reproducing apparatus reads the number-of-disc-sides identifier 2 from the PVD table and determines whether or not the disc is a double-sided disc or a single-sided disc. When the disc is a double-sided disc, the reproducing apparatus determines whether the reproducing side is side A or side B.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 在盘片管理区域的PVD表中,盘片标识符1表示盘片的数据记录格式的类型,盘片面数标识符2表示盘片是否为单面盘片 或双面盘,以及表示再现盘是双面盘的A面还是B面的盘面标识符3。 表示文件的数据记录格式的类型的盘标识符4被记录在包括文件的管理信息的文件(n)表中。 再现装置从PVD表和文件(n)表中读取盘标识符1和4,并确定盘和文件是否可再现。 此外,再现装置从PVD表中读取盘面数标识符2,并确定盘是双面盘还是单面盘。 当盘是双面盘时,再现装置确定再现面是A面还是B面。

标题: Automatic optical inspection system having a weighted transition database
摘要: A method and apparatus used with a printed circuit board (PCB) defect detection system generates a reference database image of the PCB having tolerances for each individual PCB feature wherein a tolerance database of at least three states in which each color is weighted and adjacent pixels are grouped into arrays or "bins". An error signal is generated when the sum of the pixel weights in a bin exceeds a preselected threshold.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种与印刷电路板 (PCB) 缺陷检测系统一起使用的方法和设备,生成具有每个单独 PCB 特征的公差的 PCB 参考数据库图像,其中每个颜色被加权并且相邻像素被加权的至少三个状态的公差数据库 分组为数组或“箱”。 当 bin 中的像素权重之和超过预选阈值时,将生成错误信号。
发明人: GERBER, H. JOSEPH | STRAAYER, RONALD J. | DAVIDSON, BRUCE L. | SNIETKA, SCOTT P. | WALSH, PETER M. | SENIFF, DANA W. | KOHLER, JAMES P.
发明人地址: West Hartford, CT | South Windsor, CT | East Hartford, CT | Andover, CT | South Glastonbury, CT | Southbury, CT

标题: Method and apparatus for detecting objects based upon color signal separation
摘要: A chroma keying generator apparatus is disclosed having a monitor camera transmitting color signals to multipliers for separating a luminance signal from an image signal and amplifying same by selected gain levels, comparison circuits for comparing two color signals with pre-selected reference levels therefor having upper and lower limits and producing outputs denoting that the ratio of the color signal to the luminance signal for a given color falls within a pre-selected reference range, and a gate circuit which evaluates the outputs from the comparison circuits to produce pulses representing a logical "1" when the output is within the reference range and a logical "0" when the output is not within the reference range.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 公开了一种色度键生成器设备,它具有一个监视器摄像机,它向乘法器发送颜色信号,用于从图像信号中分离亮度信号并通过选定的增益电平将其放大,用于将两个颜色信号与预选的参考电平进行比较的比较电路具有较高和 下限并产生输出,表示给定颜色的颜色信号与亮度信号的比率落在预先选择的参考范围内,以及一个门电路,它评估比较电路的输出以产生代表逻辑“1”的脉冲 " 表示输出在参考范围内,逻辑“0”表示输出不在参考范围内。
发明人: HAYASHI, MASAHIKO | FUJII, YASUO | OKUYAMA, SHIGEAKI
发明人地址: Toyonaka, JP | Sakai, JP | Kawachi-nagano, JP

标题: Image processing apparatus
摘要: An image processing apparatus includes a designating section for designating an arbitrary region or an arbitrary position of an image; a specifying section for specifying an object region which is present in the designated region or position, and which can additionally be in a vicinity of the designated region or position, from pixel information in the designated region or position; a determining section for determining an image region to be cut out from the image, based on the specified object region; and a cutting section for cutting out the determined image region from the image.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 图像处理装置具有指定图像的任意区域或任意位置的指定部。 指定部分,用于根据指定区域或位置中的像素信息指定对象区域,该对象区域存在于指定区域或位置中,并且可以附加在指定区域或位置附近; 确定部分,用于根据指定的对象区域确定要从图像中切出的图像区域; 切割部分,用于从图像中切割出确定的图像区域。
发明人: FUNAYAMA RYUJI | TAKEZAWA HAJIME | KONYA MINEHIRO | HAKARIDANI MITSUHIRO

标题: Identifying apparatus and method, position detecting apparatus and method, robot apparatus and color extracting apparatus
摘要: An identifying apparatus and method and a robot apparatus capable of reliably identifying other moving objects or other objects, a position detecting apparatus and method and a robot apparatus capable of accurately detecting the position of a moving object or itself within a region, and a color extracting apparatus capable of accurately extracting a desired color are difficult to be realized. Objects are provided with identifiers having different color patterns such that the color patterns are detected and identified through image processing. Also, the objects of interest are given color patterns different from each other, such that the position of the object can be detected by identifying the color pattern through image processing. Further, a plurality of wall surfaces having different colors are provided along the periphery of the region, such that the position of an object is detected on the basis of the colors of the wall surfaces through image processing. Further, a luminance level and color difference levels are sequentially detected for each of pixels to extract a color by determining whether or not the color difference levels are within a predetermined range.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 能够可靠地识别其他移动物体或其他物体的识别装置和方法以及机器人装置、位置检测装置和方法以及能够准确地检测区域内的移动物体或其自身的位置以及颜色提取的机器人装置 难以实现能够准确提取所需颜色的设备。 为对象提供具有不同颜色图案的标识符,从而通过图像处理来检测和识别颜色图案。 此外,对感兴趣的对象赋予彼此不同的颜色图案,从而可以通过图像处理识别颜色图案来检测对象的位置。 此外,沿着该区域的周边设置具有不同颜色的多个壁面,从而通过图像处理基于壁面的颜色来检测物体的位置。 此外,通过确定色差水平是否在预定范围内,依次检测每个像素的亮度水平和色差水平以提取颜色。
发明人: FUKUMURA, NAOHIRO | HANAGATA, OSAMU | SABE, KOTARO | INOUE, MAKOTO

标题: Optical vector multiplier for neural networks
摘要: PCT No. PCT/AT95/00039 Sec. 371 Date Sep. 25, 1996 Sec. 102(e) Date Sep. 25, 1996 PCT Filed Mar. 1, 1995 PCT Pub. No. WO95/24006 PCT Pub. Date Sep. 8, 1995An optical vector multiplier can perform linear algebra calculations by using electro-optical modulators of sandwich-type construction or in liquid crystal fields such as occur, inter alia, in the case of neural networks. It can calculate linear algebra operations as rapidly as possible, although the matrix is represented by slow liquid crystal fields. In addition, it can also use the transposed matrix, can calculate the vector product of two vectors and store the resultant matrix of the vector product directly in the region of the matrix modulator cells. To this end, two rapid electro-optical modulators of sandwich-type construction, representing a vector, are disposed offset by 90 DEG and a matrix-shaped optical modulator that represents the matrix follows this arrangement. The vector modulator arrangement that is offset by 90 DEG can form the vector product of two vectors, the result being determined by a detector matrix whose detectors are located on the matrix modulator of each modulator cell. Thus the information can be stored locally there and processed.
摘要(译)(简体中文): PCT 编号 PCT/AT95/00039 秒。  371 日期 1996 年 9 月 25 日 102(e) 日期 1996 年 9 月 25 日 PCT 1995 年 3 月 1 日提交 PCT Pub. 编号 WO95/24006 PCT 公布。 日期 1995 年 9 月 8 日 光矢量乘法器可以通过使用夹层型结构的电光调制器或在液晶领域中执行线性代数计算,例如在神经网络的情况下。 它可以尽可能快地计算线性代数运算,尽管矩阵由慢速液晶场表示。 此外,它还可以使用转置矩阵,可以计算两个向量的向量积,并将向量积的结果矩阵直接存储在矩阵调制器单元的区域中。 为此,将表示矢量的两个夹层型结构的快速电光调制器错开90°设置,并且表示矩阵的矩阵形光调制器遵循这种布置。 偏移90°的矢量调制器排列可以形成两个矢量的矢量积,结果由检测器矩阵确定,该检测器矩阵的检测器位于每个调制器单元的矩阵调制器上。 因此,信息可以在本地存储和处理。

标题: Method and apparatus for sorting and acquiring image data for documents
摘要: An apparatus is provided for sorting a group of documents contained with an envelope into selected batches of documents. An envelope feeder feeds a group of envelopes containing documents onto a document transport. A document extractor positioned along the path of movement extracts the documents from the envelopes. A system controller identifies the documents extracted from each respective envelope along with the respective envelope as a single transaction along the path of movement. An orientation detector including a magnetic image reader and an optical image reader determines the orientation of selected documents along the path of movement. A document orientor changes the orientation of documents along the path of movement into a desired orientation. An image acquisition device acquires an image of the envelopes and selected documents conveyed along the path of movement to enable the system controller to assign documents and the envelope from which it was extracted into selected transactions and batches. A non-volatile image storage medium stores the acquired images of the envelopes. A document sorter sorts the documents and envelopes of respective batches into selected output areas.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 提供了一种用于将包含在信封中的一组文档分类成选定的文档批次的设备。 信封进纸器将一组包含文档的信封送入文档传输装置。 沿移动路径定位的文档提取器从信封中提取文档。 系统控制器将与相应信封一起从每个相应信封中提取的文档识别为沿着移动路径的单个事务。 包括磁性图像读取器和光学图像读取器的定向检测器确定所选文档沿移动路径的定向。 文档定向器将文档沿移动路径的方向更改为所需的方向。 图像采集设备采集沿移动路径传送的信封和选定文件的图像,以使系统控制器能够将文件和从中提取文件的信封分配到选定的交易和批次中。 非易失性图像存储介质存储获取的信封图像。 文档分类器将各个批次的文档和信封分类到选定的输出区域。
发明人: HAYDUCHOK, GEORGE L. | DEWITT, ROBERT R. | STEVENS, ALBERT F.
发明人地址: Mount Holly, NJ | Marlton, NJ | Moorestown, NJ

标题: Real time histo-gram modification system for image contrast enhancement
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种用于图像处理的迭代实时直方图修改系统，例如场景，射线照片和热谱图的图像对比度增强。在所描述的系统中，输入要修改的模拟视频信号被数字化并应用于包括代码RAM的编码模块，代码RAM根据应用于代码RAM的重新编码策略将输入灰度级压缩为较少数量的输出灰度级。使用预定的场景自适应算子迭代地确定重新编码策略。这是通过在相应的输出灰度级中形成像素的直方图来完成的。此后，将每个灰度级中的计数与该灰度级的预定总体数据进行比较，如果计数和总体数字之间的差异在可接受的范围之外，称为窗口，则在下一帧期间使用的重新编码策略。改变输入信号，以便适当地调整压缩到特定输出灰度级的输入灰度级的数量。可以将重新编码策略应用于帧的局部区域，该区域被随意选择，或者应用于整个帧，在这种情况下，直方图由所有像素的子集形成。场景自适应算子包括直方图均衡，高斯分布，双曲线和指数。通过使用适当编程的微处理器，可以随意选择不同的场景自适应算子，并且可以提供“缩放”设施，其中改变局部区域的大小并且对窗口和一组人口数字进行相应的改变。
[标]当前申请(专利权)人: 皇家飞利浦电子股份有限公司
发明人: BAILEY, PETER KENNETH | GUILDFORD, LESLIE HENRY

标题: PROCEDE D'EVALUATION D'IMAGES CODEES, DISPOSITIF METTANT EN OEUVRE LE PROCEDE ET UTILISATION DU DISPOSITIF ET PROCEDE
摘要: La présente invention concerne un procédé d'évaluation de la qualité d'images codées caractérisé en ce qu'il comporte :a) une étape de traitement du signal représentatif de l'image pour obtenir un signal traité,b) une étape de construction à partir du signal représentatif de l'image codée, d'un signal représentatif de l'image champ de mouvement à partir de la séquence source,c) une étape de constitution d'un signal représentatif de la segmentation du champ de mouvement et de stockage des pixels d'images représentatifs de chaque région ayant un champ de mouvement différent à une adresse définie par rapport aux vecteurs vitesse estimés dans l'étape de construction du champ de mouvement permettant de déterminer les pixels ayant des vecteurs vitesse différents,d) une étape de détermination ou de calcul d'un filtre humain psychovisuel à appliquer en fonction de la vitesse estimée de la région,e) une étape de filtrage du signal traité, etf) une étape de construction de la carte des disparités entre les signaux représentatifs de l'image obtenus après l'étape de filtrage et les signaux représentatifs de l'image décodée obtenus après l'étape de filtrage.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 本发明涉及一种评估编码图像质量的方法,其特征在于它包括:a)处理代表图像的信号以获得处理后的信号的步骤,b)从代表图像的信号构建的步骤编码图像,来自表示来自源序列的运动场图像的信号,c) 构成表示运动场分割的信号和存储表示具有不同运动场的每个区域的图像像素的步骤。相对于在构造运动场的步骤中估计的速度向量定义的地址,使得可以确定具有不同速度向量的像素,d) 确定或计算作为估计的函数应用的心理视觉人类滤波器的步骤区域的速度,e) 对处理后的信号进行滤波的步骤,以及 f) 构建视差图的步骤 表示在滤波步骤之后获得的图像的信号与表示在滤波步骤之后获得的解码图像的信号之间的s。
发明人地址: CO THOMSON MULTIMEDIA 46 QUAI ALPHONSE LE GALLO, 92648 BOULOGNE CEDEX, FR | 46 QUAI ALPHONSE LE GALLO, 92100 BOULOGNE CEDEX, FR

标题: Digital information processing apparatus for pattern recognition
摘要: A digital information processing apparatus for pattern recognition comprising a memory unit for storing information consisting of a plurality of words representing an unknown character and a plurality of pieces of information representing a plurality of standard characters each of which consists of the same number of words as the information representing the unknown character and which are stored in series so that the words of the corresponding orders in the respective information are sequentially stored, means for reading out of the memory unit the information representing the unknown character every each word and each piece of information representing one of the standard characters every each word, means for comparing these information thus read by means of each bit of the word and detecting the number in which the compared bits agree with each other, and means for adding a correlation constant predetermined in accordance with the standard character under the comparison by the number of agreements, so that similarity of the unknown character with each standard character is determined by means of a single instruction.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种用于模式识别的数字信息处理设备,包括存储单元,用于存储由表示未知字符的多个单词和表示多个标准字符的多个信息片段组成的信息,每个标准字符由相同数量的单词组成。 表示未知字符的信息,并顺序存储,以便依次存储相应信息中相应顺序的单词,用于从存储单元中读出表示未知字符的信息的装置,每个单词和每条信息表示 每个字一个标准字符, 用于比较通过字的每个位读取的这些信息并检测比较的位彼此一致的数量的装置, 以及用于添加根据预定的相关常数的装置 按数字比较下的标准字符 协议,以便通过单个指令确定未知字符与每个标准字符的相似性。
发明人: FUJIMOTO, YOSHIJI | HANANOI, TOSHIHIRO | YASUDA, MICHIO | MAKIHARA, HIROSHI | KURAMIZU, MASARU | OTA, MINORU | KOKIDO, HIROSHI | KADOTA, SHOZO
发明人地址: Hachioji, JA | Matsudo, JA | Koganei, JA | Kokubunji, JA | Odawara, JA

标题: System und Verfahren zur Darstellung komprimierter Videografikbilder
摘要(译)(简体中文): 已经实现了用于从动态3-D模型合成压缩视频比特流的混合系统。视频比特流表示由多个图像帧组成的图像序列，这些图像帧在时间上是连续的，并且其中每个图像帧被划分成一组区域。为当前图像帧内的每个区域生成运动矢量，其表示动态3-D模型。基于所生成的运动矢量为每个区域计算预测误差。基于预测误差的值确定要对后续图像帧中的每个区域执行的编码类型。如所确定的编码类型所指示的，对后续图像帧中的每个区域进行编码。 <IMAGE>
发明人: NAYLOR BRUCE F. | PETAJAN ERIC DAVID

标题: 음성신호처리장치
摘要: 내용 없음
摘要(译)(简体中文): 无内容

标题: Selectively processing plurality of transactions using transaction identifiers that including committing, aborting updating and continuous updating content in a plurality of shared data
摘要: An information processing apparatus manages the correspondence between identification information, which is for identifying a plurality of transactions within one process, and the transactions. To this end, the information processing apparatus operates on the identification information by operations including creation, cancellation and switching of the identification information. The creation, cancellation and switching of the identification information then results in the corresponding operation on the respective transaction.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 信息处理装置管理用于识别一个进程内的多个交易的识别信息与交易之间的对应关系。 为此,信息处理装置通过标识信息的创建、取消和切换等操作对标识信息进行操作。 标识信息的创建、取消和切换则导致对相应交易的相应操作。

标题: Method for file management on a read-only information carrier
摘要: Procédé de gestion de fichiers et de documents numérisés sur un support d'information non-effaçable. Le procédé consiste à mémoriser des objets de type en-tête (ET), fichiers (F) et répertoires (R) et une table (TAP, ETAP) pour convertir une adresse logique en une adresse physique. Selon l'invention, une partition en plusieurs segments est définie sur l'espace de mémorisation, chaque segment étant destiné à mémoriser un seul type d'objet. La structure choisie pour les objets permet de mémoriser les informations suivant une architecture arborescente dont les répertoires forment les noeuds, et les fichiers les noeuds terminaux. La partition est modifiable et est mémorisée dans l'en-tête. Chaque type d'objet comprend des moyens de type champ de chaînage permettant une mise à jour de son contenu.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 管理不可擦除信息介质上的文件和数字化文档的过程。 该方法包括存储头(ET)、文件(F)和目录(R)类型对象和表(TAP、ETAP)以将逻辑地址转换为物理地址。 根据本发明,在存储空间上定义了划分为多个段的分区,每个段旨在存储单一类型的对象。 为对象选择的结构使得可以按照树形结构存储信息,其中目录形成节点,文件形成终端节点。 该分区是可修改的并存储在标头中。 每种类型的对象都包括允许更新其内容的链接字段类型装置。

标题: Internet system for connecting client-travelers with geographically-associated data
摘要: A system for delivering position-related information from a data repository to a user includes a computerized appliance for receiving and reporting the position-related information to the user, a data repository remote from the appliance for storing information related to the position of the computerized appliance, a system for determining the position of the appliance, and a wireless communication link between the data repository and the appliance. The position-determining system tracks the position of the appliance, and in the information is selected and provided to the appliance from the data repository based on the determined position. In one embodiment position is determined by a GPS system integrated with the appliance, aid information is selected by an Internet service and sent to the appliance based on the reported position, via a cellular telephone Internet link between the server and the appliance. In other embodiments position is determined by a local indoor system.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种用于将位置相关信息从数据储存库传递给用户的系统,包括用于接收和报告位置相关信息给用户的计算机化设备,远离设备的数据储存库,用于存储与计算机化设备的位置相关的信息 、用于确定设备位置的系统,以及数据存储库和设备之间的无线通信链路。 位置确定系统跟踪设备的位置,并根据确定的位置从数据存储库中选择信息并将其提供给设备。 在一个实施例中,位置由与设备集成的GPS系统确定,帮助信息由互联网服务选择,并基于报告的位置,通过服务器和设备之间的蜂窝电话互联网链路发送到设备。 在其他实施例中,位置由本地室内系统确定。
法律状态/事件: 期限届满 | 质押 | 权利转移

标题: Hand-held WWW access device with GUI-based www browser program integrated with bar code symbol reader for automatically accessing and displaying HTML-encoded documents by reading bar code symbols
摘要: A portable hand-held WWW access terminal for accessing HTML encoded documents located on the WWW. The terminal includes a bar code symbol reader in a hand-supportable housing for reading bar code symbols encoded with information, such as URLs, for use in accessing HTML-encoded documents stored in information servers connected to the Internet and supporting the TCP/IP standard. A computing platform is provided for supporting a GUI-based WWW browser program integrated with the bar code symbol reader, in the hand-supportable housing. A telecommunication modem is operably connected to the computing platform in order to establish a two-way telecommunication link between the GUI-based WWW browser and an Internet service provider (ISP) connected to the Internet. In response to reading a URL-encoded bar code symbol, the WWW browser program automatically accesses a corresponding HTML-encoded document on the Internet, for display on a visual display panel integrated with the hand-supportable housing. A keypad is also integrated with the hand-supportable housing for manually providing information to the WWW browser program.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 用于访问位于 WWW 上的 HTML 编码文档的便携式手持 WWW 访问终端。 该终端包括一个位于手持外壳中的条码符号阅读器,用于读取用诸如 URL 等信息编码的条码符号,用于访问存储在连接到 Internet 并支持 TCP/IP 标准的信息服务器中的 HTML 编码文档 . 提供了一个计算平台,用于在手持式外壳中支持与条形码符号阅读器集成的基于 GUI 的 WWW 浏览器程序。 电信调制解调器可操作地连接到计算平台,以便在基于 GUI 的 WWW 浏览器和连接到互联网的互联网服务提供商 (ISP) 之间建立双向电信链路。 为响应读取 URL 编码的条形码符号,WWW 浏览器程序自动访问 Internet 上相应的 HTML 编码文档,以显示在与手持式外壳集成的可视显示面板上。 小键盘也与可手支撑的外壳集成,用于手动向 WWW 浏览器程序提供信息。

标题: Virtual documents generated via combined documents or portions of documents retrieved from data repositories
摘要: A virtual document generated within the environment of a document management system. The document management system provides for the separation of the document content from properties which describe the content. Bit providers are implemented to retrieve the content for a document in a manner such that the document is unaware of the location of the content which is retrieved. Generation of a virtual document recognizes that a one-to-one correlation between a document and the contents which make up that document are not required. Therefore, content for a single DMS document may be dispersed across numerous storage repositories. Alternatively, a virtual document may be a sub-portion of a file on a single repository, or a combination of such contents.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 在文档管理系统环境中生成的虚拟文档。 文档管理系统提供了文档内容与描述内容的属性的分离。 位提供者被实现为以这样的方式检索文档的内容,使得文档不知道被检索的内容的位置。 虚拟文档的生成认识到不需要文档与构成该文档的内容之间的一对一关联。 因此,单个 DMS 文档的内容可能分散在多个存储库中。 或者,虚拟文档可以是单个存储库上文件的子部分,或这些内容的组合。
发明人: SALISBURY, MICHAEL P. | DOURISH, JAMES P. | EDWARDS, WARREN K. | LAMARCA, ANTHONY G. | LAMPING, JOHN O. | PETERSEN, KARIN | TERRY, DOUGLAS B. | THORNTON, JAMES D.
发明人地址: Mountain View, CA | San Francisco, CA | Redwood City, CA | Los Altos, CA | Palo Alto, CA | San Carlos, CA
法律状态/事件: 期限届满 | 质押 | 权利转移

标题: Storing trees in navigable form
摘要: A compact representation of a tree data structure and techniques for navigating the compact representation. The compact representation is a list. Each element of the list represents a node of the tree and the list is organized according to a preorder traversal of the tree. Each list element contains only the index of a data dictionary entry for the kind of item represented by the node corresponding to the list element. The navigation techniques permit the location of the list element for the sibling of the node corresponding to the given list element, the location of the list element for that node's parent, and in the case of a parent node, the location of the list element for any child of the parent. The navigation techniques work by finding the listelements for subtrees. The subtrees are found by techniques based on the fact that the number of children of all of the nodes in a subtree minus the number of nodes in the subtree always equals -1. The number of children of a given node is determined by a valence function which takes the index of the data dictionary entry as iitsargument.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 树数据结构的紧凑表示和用于导航紧凑表示的技术。 紧凑的表示是一个列表。 列表的每个元素代表树的一个节点,并且列表是根据树的前序遍历组织的。 每个列表元素只包含对应于列表元素的节点所表示的项目种类的数据字典条目的索引。 导航技术允许与给定列表元素对应的节点的兄弟节点的列表元素的位置,该节点的父节点的列表元素的位置,以及在父节点的情况下,列表元素的位置 父母的任何孩子。 导航技术通过查找子树的列表元素来工作。 子树是通过基于以下事实的技术找到的:子树中所有节点的子节点数减去子树中的节点数总是等于-1。 给定节点的子节点数由以数据字典条目的索引作为参数的化合价函数确定。

标题: Object management and delivery system having multi-resolution capability
摘要: Abstract A method and apparatus which allows an object management and delivery system to perform capture, prefetch, display, print and/or modify operations with only a modicum of interaction between the operations of a host computer system and the object management and delivery system. Host computer/object-management system interaction is typically limited to: operation requests transferred from the host computer to the object management system; record registration data transferred from the object management system to notify the host computer that an object record has been stored; and/or error data transferred from the object management system to notify the host computer when the object management system encounters an error in trying to perform an operation requested by the host computer.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 摘要 一种方法和装置允许对象管理和传送系统执行捕获、预取、显示、打印和/或修改操作,而主机系统和对象管理和传送系统的操作之间只有少量交互。 主机/对象管理系统交互通常限于:从主机传送到对象管理系统的操作请求; 对象管理系统传来的记录登记数据,通知上位机对象记录已存储; 和/或从对象管理系统传输的错误数据,以在对象管理系统在尝试执行主机请求的操作时遇到错误时通知主机。
发明人: MORRIS HUGH MACDONALD | PARKS CAROL A. | RAJAGOPAL DORAISWAMY | YOUNGS GARY LEWIS

标题: 處理樣品及使樣品顯影之系統
摘要: 本發明是以處理樣品的系統為特徵，包括：(a)一儲存及傳輸樣品的容器；(b)將樣品滲透及包埋以在容器中形成一基塊的裝置；(c)在基塊中將樣品切片的裝置；(d)將在基塊中的樣品顯影的裝置；以及(e)在樣品處理期間鑑定樣品的裝置。
摘要(译)(简体中文): 本发明是以处理样品的系统为特征,包括:(a)一储存及传输样品的容器;(b)将样品渗透及包埋以在容器中形成一基块的装置;(c)在基块 中将样品切片的装置;(d)将在基块中的样品显影的装置;以及(e)在样品处理期间鉴定样品的装置。

标题: Knowledge base system for setting attribute value derivation data independently from attribute value derivation procedure and shared data management apparatus for selectively locking attribute
摘要: A method-to-derive-attribute-value is set of a procedure inherent to an attribute for deriving an attribute value at each attribute defined in each class in knowledge base. A data-for-value-derivation referred by the set method-to-derive-attribute-value is set at each class defined or inherited by the attribute independently from the method-to-derive-attribute-value. The attribute value is derived by referring to the data-for-value-derivation to be input as the specification of the instance by executing the method-to-derive-attribute-value when the instance is prepared as novel or altered, to thereby set the attribute value of each attribute of the instance.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 导出属性值的方法是一组属性固有的过程,用于在知识库中的每个类中定义的每个属性处导出属性值。 由set method-to-derive-attribute-value 引用的data-for-value-derivation 被设置在由属性独立于method-to-derive-attribute-value 定义或继承的每个类。 当实例准备为新的或改变的时,通过执行导出属性值的方法,参照作为实例的规范输入的导出值的数据导出属性值,从而设置 实例的每个属性的属性值。
发明人: GOTOH, KAZUYUKI | SASAKI, KOUICHI | TSUTSUMITAKE, YASUKO

标题: 정보관리방법,데이터기록매체,데이터기록방법,정보검색방법및정보검색장치
摘要: 액세스가 신속히 행해지도록 하는 것이며, 광자기디스크의 데이터 트랙을 볼륨 매니지먼트 영역과 익스텐트 영역으로 구분해서 익스텐트 영역에 파일 데이터를 기록하며, 볼륨 매니지먼트 영역에 디렉토리 관리 정보와 파일 관리 정보를 기록한다. 볼륨 매니지먼트 영역은 16 클러스터로 구성하고, 볼륨 매니지먼트 영역의 데이터 할당 단위는 2 킬로바이트로 하며, 익스텐트 영역에 있어서의 할당 단위는 4 킬로바이트로 한다.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 这是为了保证快速访问,磁光盘的数据磁道分为卷管理区和扩展区,扩展区记录文件数据,卷记录目录管理信息和文件管理信息管理区。 卷管理区由16个簇组成,卷管理区的数据分配单位为2KB,extent区的分配单位为4KB。

标题: Intelligent text-to-speech synthesis
摘要: A method and an apparatus of synthesizing speech from a piece of input text 104. In one embodiment, the method includes the steps of retrieving the input text 104 entered into a computing system, and transforming the input text 104 based on the semantics 152 of at least one word of the input text 104 to generate a formatted text 108 for speech synthesis. The transforming includes adding an audio rendering effect tot he input text based on the semantics of at least one work, the audio rendering effect comprising background music, special effect sounds, and context-sensitive sounds. In another embodiment, the transformation also depends on at least one characteristic of the person listening to the speech output 118. In yet another embodiment, the transformation further depends on at least one characteristic of the hardware employed by the user to listen to the speech output 118. The transformed text can be further modified to fit a text-to-speech engine to generate the speech output 118.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种从一段输入文本104合成语音的方法和装置。在一个实施例中,该方法包括检索输入到计算系统中的输入文本104,以及基于语义152转换输入文本104的步骤。 输入文本104中的至少一个词以生成格式化文本108用于语音合成。 所述转换包括基于至少一个作品的语义向输入文本添加音频渲染效果,音频渲染效果包括背景音乐、特效声音和上下文相关声音。 在另一实施例中,变换还取决于收听语音输出118的人的至少一个特性。在又一实施例中,变换还取决于用户用来收听语音输出的硬件的至少一个特性 118. 可以进一步修改转换后的文本以适合文本到语音引擎以生成语音输出 118。
发明人: SOCHER, GUDRUN | VISHWANATH, MOHAN | MENDHEKAR, ANURAG
发明人地址: Mountain View, CA | San Jose, CA | Sunnyvale, CA
法律状态/事件: 期限届满 | 权利转移

标题: Gesteneingabeverfahren und Gerät
摘要(译)(简体中文): 手势输入装置包括：分别用于检测多轴角速度或多轴加速度的多个多轴角速度传感器或多轴加速度传感器； 差分采样电路，用于将来自所述检测装置的输出之一与另一检测装置的输出之差作为基准值输出。 手势字典，用于预存储特征相对值输出的样本值； 一种算术运算控制器，通过基于来自所述差分采样电路的表示经过时间的变化的输出，将来自所述差分采样电路的输出值与所述手势词典装置内的值进行比较，来识别手势，作为一组数据； 距离传感器，用于通过声波或光来检测固定构件和可动构件之间的相对距离。  <图像>
发明人: TOKIOKA MASAKI | YOSHIMURA YUICHIRO | KOBAYASHI KATSUYUKI | SATO HAJIME | TANAKA ATSUSHI | YANAGISAWA RYOZO

标题: Electronic learning machine
摘要: An electronic language learning apparatus includes a word memory for storing a plurality of words in one language and another memory for storing information for suppressing display of selected words of the plurality of words in the one language stored in the word memory. A designation control designates any one of the plurality of words in one language stored in the word memory and a discriminator, coupled to the designation control and to the memory, discriminates whether any one of the plurality of words stored in the word memory and designated by the designation control is to be displayed on the basis of the suppression information stored in the word memory.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种电子语言学习装置包括用于存储一种语言的多个单词的单词存储器和用于存储用于抑制显示存储在单词存储器中的一种语言的多个单词中的所选单词的信息的另一个存储器。 指定控制器指定存储在单词存储器中的一种语言的多个单词中的任何一个,并且鉴别器耦合到指定控制器和存储器,鉴别存储在单词存储器中并由以下人员指定的多个单词中的任何一个 指定控件将根据存储在单词存储器中的抑制信息显示。

标题: Einrichtung zum Registrieren eines Sprachbezugsmusters in Form eines Sprachlautes oder Sprachwortes
摘要: A voice or sound recognition system including a microphone for converting a voice into an electrical voice signal, a frequency analyzer for generating a voice pattern in the form of a time-frequency distribution, and a matching unit for matching the voice pattern with registered voice patterns. A voice pattern sometimes contains a bass bar section starting from the beginning of the voice pattern over a time period. In one form of the present invention, the bass bar section is detected and/or eliminated before processing the voice pattern for the purpose of registration or matching. The voice level is sometimes too strong or too weak for appropriate processing. In another form of the present invention, a voice recognition system including a voice input cancelling function is provided. In addition, a system for detecting a voice interval for use in voice data processing, including a device for determining a start point of the voice interval is provided.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种语音或声音识别系统,包括用于将语音转换为电语音信号的麦克风、用于生成时频分布形式的语音模式的频率分析器以及用于将语音模式与已注册的语音模式进行匹配的匹配单元 . 语音模式有时包含从一段时间内语音模式的开头开始的低音小节部分。 在本发明的一种形式中,为了注册或匹配的目的,在处理语音模式之前检测和/或消除低音小节部分。 语音电平有时太强或太弱而无法进行适当的处​​理。 在本发明的另一种形式中,提供了一种包括语音输入取消功能的语音识别系统。 此外,还提供了一种用于语音数据处理的语音区间检测系统,包括语音区间起点确定装置。
发明人: MUROI, TETSUYA, YOKOHAMA | YASUDA, SEIGOU, YOKOSUKA | KAWAMOTO, TOSHIKI, YOKOHAMA | FUJIMOTO, JUNICHIRO, YOKOHAMA

标题: 문자인식방법 및 장치
摘要: In the candidate character obtained about the character image of transfer of the recognizing subject character image the object performing the comparison of the feature amount is predicted in the character of the previous and the number is decreased the extent nots be dropped down and perform the character recognition at high speed, next the character having with possibility of coming is predicted. It puts out as the difference candidate character in advance. If it has that the distance between the feature amount with the recognizing subject character image and these difference candidate characters is determined and any kind of threshold is satisfied those is to the candidate character of the recognizing subject character image. The character recognition is performed in case with the feature amount. The decision result any kind of threshold is satisfied.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 在识别对象字符图像的迁移字符图像中获得的候选字符中,在前一个字符中预测进行特征量比较的对象,并且数量减少到不下降的程度并执行字符识别 在高速下,预测下一个有可能出现的字符。 作为差异候补字符预先输出。 如果确定了识别对象字符图像的特征量与这些差异候选字符之间的距离,并且满足任何一种阈值,则为识别对象字符图像的候选字符。 字符识别是在有特征量的情况下进行的。 满足任何一种阈值的决策结果。
[标]当前申请(专利权)人: 富士胶片商业创新有限公司

标题: CONTROLADOR DE RED PARA SISTEMAS DE DISTRIBUCION DE PROGRAMAS DE TELEVISION POR CABLE.
摘要: UN CONTROLADOR DE RED NUEVO (214) PARA UTILIZAR CON UN SISTEMA CABEZAL DE ANTENA POR CABLE DIGITAL (208), CAPAZ DE REALIZAR LAS FUNCIONES DE MONITOR Y CONTROL DE TERMINALES DE EQUIPO AVANZADO (220) EN UN SISTEMA DE ENVIO DE PROGRAMAS DE TELEVISION (200). EL INVENTO SE REFIERE A METODOS Y APARATO PARA UN CONTROLADOR DE RED (214) QUE DIRIGE UNA CONFIGURACION DE TERMINALES DE EQUIPO AVANZADO EN UN SISTEMA DE ENVIO DE PROGRAMAS (200). EL INVENTO ES PARTICULARMENTE UTIL EN SISTEMAS DE ENVIO DE PROGRAMAS (200) CON CIENTOS DE CANALES DE PROGRAMACION, CON UN SISTEMA DE SELECCION DE PROGRAMAS MEDIANTE MENU, Y UNA SEÑAL DE INFORMACION DE CONTROL DE PROGRAMAS QUE CONTIENE DATOS E IDENTIFICA SELECCIONES DE PROGRAMA DISPONIBLES. ESPECIFICAMENTE, EL INVENTO MODIFICA UNA SEÑAL DE INFORMACION DE CONTROL DE PROGRAMAS EN EL SISTEMA CABEZAL DE ANTENA POR CABLE (208), ANTES DE QUE LA SEÑAL MODIFICADA SEA TRANSMITIDA A CADA TERMINAL DE EQUIPO AVANZADO (220). ESTA SEÑAL ES UTILIZADA CON METODOS DE BARRIDO DE LASESTACIONES, PARA RECIBIR DATOS ENTRANTES DE LAS TERMINALES DE EQUIPO AVANZADO (220). EL INVENTO INICIA ESTA RECUPERACION DE DATOS ENTRANTES, ACUMULA LA INFORMACION RECIBIDA Y COMPILA LA INFORMACION DEMOGRAFICA SOBRE LOS TELESPECTADORES Y PROGRAMAS QUE VEN. EL INVENTO PROCESA ESTOS DATOS E INFORMACION PARA GENERAR CAMPAÑAS PUBLICITARIAS, ADEMAS DE INFORMES DE FACTURACION Y CONTABILIDAD, SOBRE CADA TERMINAL DE EQUIPO AVANZADO (220). EL INVENTO UTILIZA HARDWARE DE RECEPCION DE DATOS ENTRANTES, BASES DE DATOS Y PROCESAMIENTO DE HARDWARE Y SOFTWARE PARA CONSEGUIR ESTAS FUNCIONES.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 描述了一种新颖的网络控制器(214),用于与能够监视和控制电视节目传送系统(200)中的机顶终端(220)的数字有线头端(208)一起使用。 本发明涉及用于管理节目传送系统(200)中机顶终端(220)的配置的网络控制器(214)的方法和装置。 本发明在具有数百个节目频道的节目传送系统(200)、菜单驱动的节目选择系统和携带数据并识别可用节目选择的节目控制信息信号中特别有用。 具体而言,本发明在将修改后的信号发送到每个机顶终端(220)之前,在电缆头端(208)修改节目控制信息信号。 该信号与轮询方法一起使用以从机顶终端(220)接收上行数据。 本发明启动这样的上游数据检索,收集所有接收到的数据并编译观众人口统计信息和节目观看信息。 本发明处理该数据和信息以生成针对每个机顶终端(220)的广告包以及帐户和计费报告。 本发明使用上游数据接收硬件、数据库和处理硬件和软件来完成这些功能。
发明人: HENDRICKS, JOHN, S. | BONNER, ALFRED, E.

标题: Threshold switching machine
摘要(译)(简体中文): 本发明涉及一种形成具有负微分电阻的阈值开关器件的方法以及由此形成的器件。该方法包括在至少两个电极之间沉积源自氢倍半硅氧烷树脂的二氧化硅膜，然后在电极上施加高于阈值电压的电压。 <IMAGE>
发明人: MICHAEL, KEITH WINTON | PERNISZ, UDO C. | UDO C. PERNISZ | KEITH WINTON MICHAEL

标题: Database system
摘要(译)(简体中文): 数据库系统以记录序列的形式保存数据，每个记录包括一个或多个字段。可以通过搜索查询来查询数据库，该搜索查询指定要在每个记录的指定字段上执行的比较的特定逻辑组合。在搜索开始之前，编译搜索查询以产生优化的搜索代码序列。为每个比较操作分配成本，反映检索所需字段和执行比较的时间成本，并且还分配概率，指示比较将产生真实结果的概率。然后处理搜索查询中的每个逻辑操作，以找到处理其给出最小预期成本的参数的顺序，并且将参数重新排列成该顺序。
发明人: BROWN, ANTHONY PETER GRAHAM | ANTHONY PETER GRAHAM BROWN

标题: SISTEMA DE TOMOGRAFIA COMPUTORIZADA (TC) DE RAIOS X E METODO PARA A DETECCAO DE OBJECTOS
摘要: A technique to ascertain the presence or absence of an object in a three-dimensional volume, such as explosives in the side walls of luggage. The technique involves radiation scanning the three-dimensional volume to determine a property of each of a plurality of voxels representing the three-dimensional volume and to identify voxels having similar values of the property to identify a contiguous group of voxels having the similar values. Then, the contiguous group of voxels is identified as containing the object if a characteristic (such as mass and/or volume) of the contiguous group has a predetermined value.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种确定三维体积中是否存在物体(例如行李侧壁中的爆炸物)的技术。 该技术涉及辐射扫描三维体积以确定表示三维体积的多个体素中的每一个的属性并识别具有相似属性值的体素以识别具有相似值的连续体素组。 然后,如果连续体素组的特征(例如质量和/或体积)具有预定值,则将连续体素组识别为包含对象。

标题: 基於神經網絡之自動化細胞學樣本分類系統及方法
摘要: An automated screening system and method for cytological specimen classification in which a neural network is utilized in performance of the classification function. Also included is an automated microscope and associated image processing circuitry.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种用于细胞学样本分类的自动筛选系统和方法,其中神经网络用于执行分类功能。 还包括一个自动显微镜和相关的图像处理电路。

标题: Speech recognition method and apparatus
摘要: A reference speech pattern is described as a time series of a fixed number of states. Each of states is described with one feature vector (centroid) which represents a feature quantity of a speech portion contained in the state, and a duration time of that state. Pattern matching is carried out between the time series of feature vectors of the input speech pattern and the time series of the states which describe the reference pattern. A weighting function modifies the pattern matching distance depending on differences in duration times between the input speech and the reference pattern.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 参考语音模式被描述为具有固定数量状态的时间序列。 每个状态用一个特征向量(质心)来描述,该特征向量表示包含在该状态中的语音部分的特征量,以及该状态的持续时间。 在输入语音模式的特征向量的时间序列和描述参考模式的状态的时间序列之间进行模式匹配。 加权函数根据输入语音和参考模式之间的持续时间差异来修改模式匹配距离。

标题: System for delivering and simultaneously displaying primary and secondary information, and for displaying only the secondary information during interstitial space
摘要: A system is provided of displaying information at a display of a local user computer. The information includes primary information representing information requested by a user and secondary information representing additional information. The primary information is retrieved from a first information memory device, wherein there is a delay period between the request time and the time in which the primary information is available for display. The secondary information is retrieved from a second information memory device. The primary and secondary information are stored in a local storage device of the user's computer, such as the cache memory. A display controller causes the primary information to be displayed simultaneously with a portion of the secondary information on the user's display. When the user requests retrieval of subsequent primary information, a full display of the secondary information replaces the primary information in at least a portion of the delay time which occurs during retrieval of the subsequent primary information. The subsequently requested primary information is displayed after receipt thereof. The full display of secondary information is shown for a predetermined period of time, or may be held on the display by a user command. The user may also directly request a display of the full secondary information without requiring retrieval of subsequent primary information. The system may be implemented in an Internet environment wherein the primary and secondary information are retrieved from one or more remote websites. The portion of secondary information displayed which is simultaneously displayed with the primary information may be a thumbnail, keyhole or banner image of the full secondary information. The secondary information may be static, dynamic or user interactive.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 提供了一种在本地用户计算机的显示器上显示信息的系统。 该信息包括表示用户请求的信息的主要信息和表示附加信息的次要信息。 从第一信息存储设备中检索主要信息,其中在请求时间和主要信息可用于显示的时间之间存在延迟时段。 从第二信息存储设备中检索第二信息。 主要信息和次要信息存储在用户计算机的本地存储设备中,例如高速缓存。 显示控制器使主要信息与部分次要信息同时显示在用户的显示器上。 当用户请求检索后续主要信息时,在检索后续主要信息期间出现的延迟时间的至少一部分中,次要信息的完整显示替代主要信息。 随后请求的主要信息在收到后显示。 次要信息的完整显示被显示一段预定的时间,或者可以通过用户命令在显示器上保持。 用户还可以直接请求显示完整的次要信息,而不需要检索后续的主要信息。 该系统可以在互联网环境中实现,其中从一个或多个远程网站检索主要和次要信息。 与主要信息同时显示的次要信息部分可以是完整次要信息的缩略图、锁孔或横幅图像。 次要信息可以是静态的、动态的或用户交互的。
法律状态/事件: 期限届满 | 权利转移

标题: Apparatus for detecting motion vectors
摘要: 57 By expanding technique of detection of motion vector of time-space differential method, (1) repetitive calculations are not needed, (2) different motion vectors near boundary of object can be detected, and (3) coupling of region segmentation and framework is enabled. For this, a horizontal direction differentiating filter (104), a vertical direction differentiating filter (105), and a time direction differentiating filter (106) calculate the time-space differential (∂l/∂x, ∂l/∂y, ∂l/∂t) in formula (2) necessary for motion vector estimation in every pixel. A feature vector combining part (110) generates a sample vector coupling the time-space differential value and position for random imageposition (x, y), and clusters from pairs of samples and classes to minimize the difference in a maximum likelihood class determining part (112) and a maximum likelihood class data changing part (113). The motion vector is obtained from the third eigen vector of covariance matrix of the time-space differential value.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 57 通过扩展时空差分法的运动矢量检测技术,(1)不需要重复计算,(2)可以检测物体边界附近的不同运动矢量,(3)区域分割与框架的耦合 启用。 为此,水平方向微分滤波器(104)、垂直方向微分滤波器(105)和时间方向微分滤波器(106)计算时空微分(∂l/∂x,∂l/∂y,∂ 公式(2)中的 l/∂t)是每个像素中运动矢量估计所必需的。 特征向量组合部分 (110) 生成耦合随机图像位置 (x, y) 的时空差分值和位置的样本向量,以及来自样本和类对的聚类以最小化最大似然类确定部分 (  112)和最大似然类数据改变部分(113)。 运动向量由时空微分值的协方差矩阵的第三个特征向量得到。
[标]当前申请(专利权)人: 松下电器产业株式会社

标题: Spaltensuchverfahren für tabellenförmige Dokumente
摘要: Tabular documents have column structures (32; Fig.4) that can be determined without decoding the bitmap. The method searches (102) for separation intervals (I₁-I₅; Fig.4) that separate word fragments (30; Fig.4) in the table. These separation intervals are processed by intersecting (116) them with other intervals and ranking (120) the resulting intervals. A structured closure of separation intervals (I₁-I₅) are maintained in bins. The intervals in the bins are sorted and used to determine new intersections when the next separation interval is processed. The intervals with the highest ranking are selected (122) as the column separation intervals. The columns are easily identified with the method without first decoding the bitmap.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 表格文档具有列结构(32;图 4),无需解码位图即可确定。 该方法在表中搜索(102)分隔单词片段(30;图4)的分隔区间(I 1 -I 5 ;图4)。 通过将这些分离区间与其他区间相交(116)并对结果区间进行排序(120)来处理这些分离区间。 分隔间隔(I 1 -I 5 )的结构化闭合保持在箱中。 在处理下一个分隔间隔时,对 bin 中的间隔进行排序并用于确定新的交叉点。 选择排名最高的区间 (122) 作为列分离区间。 使用该方法可以轻松识别列,而无需先对位图进行解码。

标题: Learning method for a neural network
摘要: In a learning method for training a recurrent neural network having a number of inputs and a number of outputs with at least one output being connected via a return line to an input, the return line is separated during training of the neural network, thereby freeing the input connected to the return line for use as an additional input during training, together with the other inputs. The additional input values, which must be estimated or predicted for supply to the thus-produced additional training inputs, are generated by treating each additional input value to be generated as a missing value in the time series of input quantities. Error distribution densities for the additional input values are calculated on the basis of the known values from the time series and their known or predetermined error distribution density, and samples are taken from this error distribution density according to the Monte Carlo method. These each lead to an estimated or predicted value whose average is introduced for the additional input value to be predicted. The method can be employed for the operation as well as for the training of the neural network, and is suitable for use in all known fields of utilization of neural networks.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 在一种用于训练具有多个输入和多个输出的循环神经网络的学习方法中,其中至少一个输出通过返回线路连接到输入,在神经网络的训练期间分离返回线路,从而释放 连接到返回线路的输入与其他输入一起用作训练期间的附加输入。 通过将要生成的每个附加输入值视为输入量的时间序列中的缺失值来生成附加输入值,这些附加输入值必须被估计或预测以提供给由此产生的附加训练输入。 基于来自时间序列的已知值及其已知或预定的误差分布密度计算附加输入值的误差分布密度,并根据蒙特卡罗方法从该误差分布密度中抽取样本。 这些每个都导致一个估计或预测值,其平均值被引入要预测的附加输入值。 该方法可用于神经网络的操作和训练,适用于所有已知的神经网络应用领域。

标题: Relation structured data processing apparatus
摘要: A data processing apparatus comprises key input means having a plurality of function keys and character input keys; display means for displaying inputted data; card data group storage means for storing a plurality of card data including numerical data, said card data being in a capacity being able to display at one picture of said display means at one time and being grouped with a link data of content thereof; readout means for reading out a card data group specified by said key input means from said card data group storage means; calculation means for calculating said numerical data contained in said card data of said card data group read out in con­formity with a variety of instructions given from said key input means; judging/readout means for reading out other card data groups associated with said readout card data group from said card data group storage means by making a judgement on the basis of said link data attached to each of said card data groups; and calculation instruc­tion means for causing said calculation means to calculate said numerical data of said card data of said other card data groups judged to have a connection herewith by said judging/readout means subsequently after calculating said numerical data contained in said card data of said readout card data group.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种数据处理装置包括具有多个功能键和字符输入键的键输入装置; 用于显示输入数据的显示装置; 卡片数据组存储装置,用于存储包括数字数据在内的多个卡片数据,所述卡片数据的容量能够一次显示在所述显示装置的一个画面上,并与其内容的链接数据分组; 读出装置,用于从所述卡数据组存储装置中读出由所述键输入装置指定的卡数据组; 计算装置,用于计算包含在根据从所述键输入装置给出的各种指令读出的所述卡数据组的所述卡数据中的所述数值数据; 判断/读出装置,根据附在每个所述卡数据组上的所述链接数据进行判断,从所述卡数据组存储装置中读出与所述读出卡数据组相关联的其他卡数据组; 以及计算指令装置,用于使所述计算装置在计算所述读出的所述卡数据中包含的所述数值数据之后,随后计算由所述判断/读出装置判断为与其有关联的所述其他卡数据组的所述卡数据的所述数值数据 卡数据组。
发明人地址: 57-301 go 1, Tsurumai-Higashicho,Nara-shi Nara-ken,JP | 403 Goshitsu, 25-to Heijyo Dai 2 Danchi,2-3 Ukyo Nara-shi Nara-ken,JP

标题: Navigation system with feature for reporting errors
摘要: A feature whereby an end user of a navigation system that uses geographic data can easily report perceived errors or inaccuracies in the geographic data or other problems such as poor quality route calculation or guidance. The end user uses a user interface of the navigation system to indicate the perceived error, inaccuracy, or other problem. The navigation system includes a report program that operates in response to the end user's indication. The report program collects information indicating the error, inaccuracy, or other problem and sends a report including the collected information to a geographic database developer. The geographic database developer can use the information in the report to update a geographic database.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 使用地理数据的导航系统的最终用户可以轻松报告地理数据中感知到的错误或不准确或其他问题(例如质量较差的路线计算或引导)的功能。 最终用户使用导航系统的用户界面来指示感知到的错误、不准确或其他问题。 导航系统包括响应最终用户的指示而操作的报告程序。 报告程序收集指示错误、不准确或其他问题的信息,并将包括收集到的信息的报告发送给地理数据库开发者。 地理数据库开发人员可以使用报告中的信息来更新地理数据库。
发明人: OHLER, JEAN | BARTON, MARK | CASINO, ROY | KAPLAN, LAWRENCE M.
发明人地址: Bloomingdale, IL | Schaumburg, IL | Mundelein, IL | Northbrook, IL

标题: 俏像數據傳送
摘要: Structured graphical data is reorganised. The data, which may be defined in accordance with portable document format (PDF) includes graphical object definitions and references to said definitions. The data is reorganised so that the graphical object references are preceded by their respective object definitions, thereby enabling a page of data to be displayed as it is being received, rather than having to wait to the end of reception of the entire file.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 结构化图形数据被重新组织。 可以根据便携式文档格式(PDF)定义的数据包括图形对象定义和对所述定义的引用。 数据被重新组织,以便图形对象引用之前有它们各自的对象定义,从而使一页数据能够在接收时显示,而不必等待整个文件的接收结束。

标题: Speech recognition manager
摘要: A speech recognition manager receives representations of one or more words from a speech decoding system and interprets the received words based upon the current context state so as to provide extremely accurate, flexible, extendable and scalable speech recognition and interpretation. The speech recognition manager limits the number of words that the speech decoding system can recognize in a given context state in order to increase the speed and accuracy of the speech recognition process. Whenever the context state changes, the manager loads a new list of words that can be recognized for the new context state into the speech decoding system so that while the speed and accuracy of the speech recognition process is increased, the total grammatical structure recognized can be easily increased as well.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 语音识别管理器从语音解码系统接收一个或多个单词的表示,并基于当前上下文状态解释接收到的单词,以提供极其准确、灵活、可扩展和可扩展的语音识别和解释。 语音识别管理器限制语音解码系统在给定上下文状态下可以识别的单词数量,以提高语音识别过程的速度和准确性。 每当上下文状态发生变化时,管理器就会将新的上下文状态的可识别单词列表加载到语音解码系统中,从而在提高语音识别过程的速度和准确性的同时,识别出的总语法结构可以是 也很容易增加。
发明人: CATALLO, LEO R. | MALLEY, JOHN A.

标题: Neuronalprozessor mit Norm- oder Distanzrechnungsmittel
摘要(译)(简体中文): 神经处理器包括计算神经类型（30，NQ，RQ）的装置，其提取数量X的根Q，所述根构成数据项的范数或数据项之间的距离。计算装置被编程为通过递归计算（30）一系列贡献ΔTi，其被用于（NQ，RQ）以更新在计算结束时变为根Q的部分根QP。计算可以在任何算术基础上进行，该算术基础确定所采用的神经元的数量和计算的精度。可以实现（NR，RR）部分余数的计算。介绍了几种编程模式。

标题: SISTEMA DE AUTENTICACION PERSONAL BIOMETRICA.
摘要: SE DESCRIBE UN SISTEMA DE AUTENTICACION BIOMETRICO, PERSONAL. EL SISTEMA PUEDE UTILIZARSE PARA CONTROLAR UN ACCESO A UN EQUIPO O A INSTALACIONES FISICAS. EL SISTEMA EMPLEA LA COMBINACION DE UN PARAMETRO BIOMETRICO INHERENTEMENTE ESPECIFICO, UNICO RECONOCIDO Y COMPARADO CON DATOS ALMACENADOS Y AL MENOS UN PARAMETRO BIOMETRICO NO ESPECIFICO DE UNA CARACTERISTICA FISIOLOGICA RECONOCIDO Y COMPARADO CON NORMAS FISIOLOGICAS. LA COMPARACION POSITIVA DA COMO RESULTADO UNA AUTENTICACION DE UN INDIVIDUO QUE NO ESTA INCAPACITADO, DESMEMBRADO O DISMINUIDO.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 公开了一种个人生物特征认证系统。 该系统可用于控制对设备或物理设施的访问。 该系统采用识别并与存储的数据比较的独特的、固有的特定生物特征参数和识别并与生理标准进行比较的生理特征的至少一个非特定生物特征参数的组合。 正面比较导致对没有丧失能力、被肢解或死亡的个人进行身份验证。
发明人: OSTEN, DAVID W. | CARIM, HATIM M. | BLAN, BRADFORD L. | ARNESON, MICHAEL R.

标题: パターン欠陥検査方法
摘要: PURPOSE:To remarkably improve the processing ability of pattern inspection by setting areas to be inspected by a comparative inspecting method and a feature extracting method individually in a pattern area wherein defect inspection is required. CONSTITUTION:An inspection area 24' and an inhibition area 25' shown by, for example, area patterns 26' and 27' are set in an area memory A and an area memory B. Then, when the optical scanning point of a pattern 5' to be inspected is at a point P1, data at points A1 and B1 are read out of the memories A and B at the same time. The point A1 indicates the inspection area and the point B1 indicates the inhibition area, so a comparative inspection part 13 functions at this point and a feature extracting inspection part 14 does not function. Similarly, both functions operate at a scanning point P2 and do not operate at a scanning point P3. The inspection part 13 does not function at a scanning point P4 and the extracting inspection part 14 functions. Consequently, defect inspection signals detected by both inspecting methods are read by a CPU 15 and displayed out on an output part 18 as necessary information.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 目的:通过在需要进行缺陷检查的图案区域中分别设置要通过比较检查方法和特征提取方法检查的区域,显着提高图案检查的处理能力。 组成:检查区 24 和抑制区 25 所示,例如,区域模式 26 和 27 设置在区域内存 A 和区域内存 B。然后,当模式 5 的光学扫描点 要检查的点是P1点,A1点和B1点的数据同时从存储器A和B中读出。 点A1表示检查区域,点B1表示禁止区域,因此比较检查部13在该点起作用,而特征提取检查部14不起作用。 类似地,这两个功能都在扫描点P2处操作并且不在扫描点P3处操作。 检查部13在扫描点P4不工作,提取检查部14工作。 因此,通过两种检查方法检测到的缺陷检查信号被CPU 15读取并作为必要信息显示在输出部分18上。

标题: Method for determining boundaries of words in text
摘要: A method for determining the boundaries of a symbol or word string within an image, including the steps of determining page orientation, isolating symbol strings from adjacent symbol strings, establishing a set of boundaries or references with respect to which measurements about, or further processing of, the symbol string may be made.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种用于确定图像内符号或字串边界的方法,包括确定页面方向、将符号串与相邻符号串隔离、建立一组边界或参考的步骤,这些测量涉及的边界或参考,或进一步处理 ,可以制作符号串。

标题: Incorporating invariances by preprocessing for kernel-based methods
摘要: A kernel-based method and apparatus includes a preprocessor, which operates on an input data in such a way as to provide invariance under some symmetry transformation.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 基于核的方法和装置包括预处理器,其以在某种对称变换下提供不变性的方式对输入数据进行操作。

标题: Multi-objective decision-support methodology
摘要: A method for effecting computer implemented decision support. The method can improve on a candidate solution by allowing problem solving methods to cooperate towards the creation of a more desirable solution. The method can realize an enhanced understanding of tradeoffs inherent in competing objectives, and can incorporate factors or special considerations not easily specified, by enabling the decision maker to actively participate in the creation of a more desirable solution.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种实现计算机实施决策支持的方法。 该方法可以通过允许问题解决方法合作创建更理想的解决方案来改进候选解决方案。 通过使决策者能够积极参与创建更理想的解决方案,该方法可以增强对竞争目标中固有的权衡的理解,并且可以结合不容易指定的因素或特殊考虑。

标题: Context-dependent speech recognizer using estimated next word context
摘要: A speech recognition apparatus and method estimates the next word context for each current candidate word in a speech hypothesis. An initial model of each speech hypothesis comprises a model of a partial hypothesis of zero or more words followed by a model of a candidate word. An initial hypothesis score for each speech hypothesis comprises an estimate of the closeness of a match between the initial model of the speech hypothesis and a sequence of coded representations of the utterance. The speech hypotheses having the best initial hypothesis scores form an initial subset. For each speech hypothesis in the initial subset, the word which is most likely to follow the speech hypothesis is estimated. A revised model of each speech hypothesis in the initial subset comprises a model of the partial hypothesis followed by a revised model of the candidate word. The revised candidate word model is dependent at least on the word which is estimated to be most likely to follow the speech hypothesis. A revised hypothesis score for each speech hypothesis in the initial subset comprises an estimate of the closeness of a match between the revised model of the speech hypothesis and the sequence of coded representations of the utterance. The speech hypotheses from the initial subset which have the best revised match scores are stored as a reduced subset. At least one word of one or more of the speech hypotheses in the reduced subset is output as a speech recognition result.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种语音识别装置和方法估计语音假设中每个当前候选词的下一个词上下文。 每个语音假设的初始模型包括一个零个或多个词的部分假设模型,后面是一个候选词模型。 每个语音假设的初始假设分数包括语音假设的初始模型与话语的编码表示序列之间的匹配接近程度的估计。 具有最佳初始假设分数的语音假设形成初始子集。 对于初始子集中的每个语音假设,估计最有可能遵循语音假设的词。 初始子集中每个语音假设的修正模型包括部分假设的模型,后面是候选词的修正模型。 修改后的候选词模型至少依赖于估计最有可能遵循语音假设的词。 初始子集中每个语音假设的修正假设分数包括语音假设的修正模型与话语的编码表示序列之间的匹配接近程度的估计。 来自初始子集的具有最佳修订匹配分数的语音假设被存储为缩减子集。 将缩减子集中的一个或多个语音假设中的至少一个词作为语音识别结果输出。

标题: Entity-relation database
摘要: An entity-relation database is disclosed to include a plurality of entity fields containing arrays of data elements, the data elements being related to each other in predefined sets, with each predefined set including data elements in at least two of the entity fields. At least one linked list defines the relationship between data elements between each of the predefined sets and provides a means for retrieving all of the elements of any selected predefined set from the two entity fields. The linked list consists of two distinct portions, namely, a head portion associated with each member of one entity field and a continuation portion associated with each member of another entity field, while each entry consists of a pair of addresses thereby forming a doubly linked list.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 公开了一种实体关系数据库,包括多个实体字段,该多个实体字段包含数据元素的数组,这些数据元素在预定义集合中彼此相关,每个预定义集合包括至少两个实体字段中的数据元素。 至少一个链表定义了每个预定义集合之间的数据元素之间的关系,并提供了一种从两个实体字段中检索任何选定预定义集合的所有元素的方法。 链表由两个不同的部分组成,即与一个实体字段的每个成员相关联的头部和与另一个实体字段的每个成员相关联的延续部分,而每个条目由一对地址组成,从而形成一个双向链表 .
发明人: LAYDEN, JOHN E. | PEARSON, THOMAS A. | LAYDEN, DAVID J.
发明人地址: 8829 Green Branch Lane,Indianapolis, Indiana 46256,US | 9818 Gulfstream Court,Fishers, Indiana 46038,US | 10410 East 79th Street,Indianapolis, Indiana 46236,US

标题: 知識抽出方法およびプロセス運転支援システム
摘要: PURPOSE:To support an operation at a normal time or a non-normal/abnormal time by effectively using past history. CONSTITUTION:The history patterns of various measurement information are learnt from a pattern file by a neural processor 70 in a learning process and the operation is supported based on a learnt result in a supporting process. Knowledge and a knowledge candidate are extracted from the learnt result in a knowledge extraction process, and whether the knowledge candidate is appropriate or not is diagnosed in a knowledge diagnosis process. Then, the operation is supported based on a knowledge group obtained in this learning and that which is previously inputted in an operation supporting process. A system processor 42 executes these processes, operates a keyboard 44 and a display 46 as necessary and accesses to a knowledge base 60A and a knowledge candidate base 60B. Thus, a highly precise operation supporting system can comparatively easily be constituted.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 目的:通过有效地使用过去的历史支持正常时间或非正常/异常时间的操作。 组成:各种测量信息的历史模式是由一个神经处理器70在学习过程中从模式文件中学习的,并且根据在支持过程中学习的结果支持操作。 在知识抽取过程中从学习结果中抽取知识和知识候选,在知识诊断过程中诊断知识候选是否合适。 然后,基于在本次学习中获得的知识组和先前在操作支持过程中输入的知识组来支持操作。 系统处理器42执行这些过程,根据需要操作键盘44和显示器46并访问知识库60A和知识候选库60B。 因此,可以比较容易地构成高精度的手术支持系统。

标题: Programmable computer with automatic translation between source and object code with version control
摘要: A computer which executes rules which are defined according to a language having a valid grammar. The computer comprises input means for receiving and temporarily storing a first source code representation of a rule; object code translation means for translating the first source code representation into a first object code representation executable by the computer; storage means for storing the object code representations of rules; discard means for automatically discarding from the input means the first source code representation upon the storing of the first object code representation in the storage means; source code translation means for translating the first object code representation into a second source code representation where the second source code representation has lines of text; edit means for editing the second source code representation by deleting, adding, or changing one or more of the lines of text of the second source code representation; second object code translation means for translating the second source code representation, as edited, into a new object code representation of the edited rule for storage in the storage means; and the discard means discarding the first object code and second source code representations automatically upon the storing of the new object code representation of the edited rule in the storage means. The computer thereby minimizes the storage required in the storage means for storing rules and maintains version control over the object code representations of rules stored in the storage means.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 执行根据具有有效语法的语言定义的规则的计算机。 该计算机包括用于接收和临时存储规则的第一源代码表示的输入装置; 目标代码翻译装置,用于将第一源代码表示翻译成计算机可执行的第一目标代码表示; 用于存储规则的目标代码表示的存储装置; 丢弃装置,用于在将第一目标代码表示存储在存储装置中时自动从输入装置丢弃第一源代码表示; 源代码翻译装置,用于将第一目标代码表示翻译成第二源代码表示,其中第二源代码表示具有文本行; 编辑装置,用于通过删除、添加或改变第二源代码表示的一行或多行文本来编辑第二源代码表示; 第二目标代码转换装置,用于将编辑后的第二源代码表示转换为已编辑规则的新目标代码表示,以存储在存储装置中; 丢弃装置在将编辑规则的新目标代码表示存储在存储装置中时,自动丢弃第一目标代码和第二源代码表示。 计算机由此使存储装置中用于存储规则所需的存储最小化并且维持对存储装置中存储的规则的目标代码表示的版本控制。

标题: 半導體裝置之外觀檢查裝置及檢查方法
摘要:
本發明之目的是提供一種半導體裝置之外觀檢查裝置及其檢查方法，可以利用簡單之構造，很容易的進行是否良好之判別。

本發明之構造是該外觀檢查裝置1之構成包含有；反射裝置2，被配置在半導體裝置10之至少之一側面，和光學式讀取機構3，用來一起讀取經由該反射裝置2被反射之半導體裝置10之側面之影像和平面側之影像；該外觀檢查方法是在將反射裝置2配置於半導體裝置10之至少一側面之後，利用一個之光學式讀取機構3一起讀取經由該反射裝置2反射之半導體裝置10之側面之影像和平面側之影像，根據該讀取到之影像進行半導體裝置10之引線12之彎曲之檢查。
摘要(译)(简体中文):
本发明之目的是提供一种半导体装置之外观检查装置及其检查方法,可以利用简单之构造,很容易的进行是否良好之判别。 
 
 本发明之构造是该外观检查装置1之构成包含有;反射装置2,被配置在半导体装置10之至少之一侧面,和光学式读取机构3,用来一起读取经由该反射装置2被 反射之半导体装置10之侧面之影像和平面侧之影像;该外观检查方法是在将反射装置2配置于半导体装置10之至少一侧面之后,利用一个之光学式读取机构3一起读取经由该 反射装置2反射之半导体装置10之侧面之影像和平面侧之影像,根据该读取到之影像进行半导体装置10之引线12之弯曲之检查。

标题: Process for detecting surface defects on a textured surface
摘要: A process for detecting defects in a textured suface, particularly on a highway. The process consists in displacing with respect to the surface a camera presenting an inclination and in processing by processing systems the successive images taken by the camera. A mathematical processing is effected on sub-images, corresponding to the same spatial portion of the surface, taken at different consecutive instants.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种检测纹理表面缺陷的过程,特别是在高速公路上。 该过程包括相对于表面移动呈现倾斜度的相机,以及由处理系统处理由相机拍摄的连续图像。 对对应于在不同连续时刻拍摄的表面的相同空间部分的子图像进行数学处理。

标题: Linear prädiktive Cepstral-Merkmale in hierarchische Subbänder organisiert für die HMM-basierte Spracherkennung
Neural network
摘要: A neural network computation apparatus is disclosed wherein the apparatus comprises a plurality of layers, each of the plurality of layers has at least an input layer and an output layer, each layer having a plurality of units, a plurality of links, each of the plurality of links connecting units on the plurality of layers, and changing means for changing input and output characteristics of a particular unit of the plurality of units and/or the weight of a particular link of the plurality of links in accordance with an output of the output layer after learning an example and with a particular rule. After the neural network computation apparatus learns an example, the changing means changes input and output characteristics of units and weights of links in accordance with outputs of the output layer and a particular rule. Thus, a mutual operation between a logical knowledge and a pattern recognizing performance can be accomplished and thereby a determination close to that of a specialist can be accomplished. In other words, a proper determination in accordance with an experience can be made so as to deal with unknown patterns with high flexibility.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 公开了一种神经网络计算装置,其中该装置包括多个层,多个层中的每个层至少具有输入层和输出层,每个层具有多个单元、多个链接、多个中的每个 连接多个层上的单元的链路,以及用于根据输出的输出改变多个单元中的特定单元的输入和输出特性和/或多个链路中的特定链路的权重的改变装置 在学习示例并使用特定规则后分层。 在神经网络计算装置学习到一个例子后,改变装置根据输出层的输出和特定规则改变单元的输入和输出特性以及链路的权重。 因此,可以实现逻辑知识和模式识别性能之间的相互运算,从而可以实现接近于专家的判断。 换句话说,可以根据经验做出适当的判断,以高度灵活地处理未知模式。
发明人: NISHIMURA, KAZUO C/O INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY DIV.

标题: Method and apparatus for scheduling the availability of movies-on-demand and interactive services
摘要: Service items at a central authority are scheduled as to their selective availability upon user request at remote stations. These are bidirectionally connected to the central authority. Each service item is assigned to one or more structures of items. Each structure of items is assigned to one or more of a set of navigation contexts. One unique start instant in absolute time is assigned to each respective navigation context. Upon attaining of any such start instant, all service items assigned to the associated navigation context are rendered available unto a detected request.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 根据用户在远程站的请求,对中央机构的服务项目进行调度,使其选择性可用性。 它们与中央机构双向连接。 每个服务项目都分配给一个或多个项目结构。 每个项目结构都分配给一组导航上下文中的一个或多个。 将绝对时间中的一个唯一开始时刻分配给每个相应的导航上下文。 在达到任何这样的开始时刻时,分配给相关联的导航上下文的所有服务项目都对检测到的请求可用。
