标题: Chaos-Neuronen-Schaltung und diese verwendendes Neuronales Chaos-Netzwerk
摘要: Eine Abbildungsschaltung enthält eine lineare Schaltung zum Ausgeben eines Signals, das mit Bezug auf das Eingangssignal linear geändert wird, eine nichtlineare Schaltung zum Ausgeben eines Signals, das mit Bezug auf das Eingangssignal nichtlinear geändert wird, und einen Addierer zum Addieren der Ausgangssignale der linearen und der nichtlinearen Schaltung sowie eines externen Eingangssignals. Eine die Abbildungsschaltung verwendende Neuronale Chaos-Schaltung hat einen einfachen Aufbau und, genauer, zeigt Chaos-Charakteristiken. Ein Neuronales Chaos-Netzwerk kann somit durch eine Reihen- und/oder Parallel-Schaltung einer Vielzahl Neuronaler Chaos-Schaltungen gebildet werden, wobei das Gewicht jedes Neurons gesteuert ist.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 神经混沌电路具有通过线性电路(60)和并联非线性电路(70)耦合的采样和保持级(10、30)。 两个阶段的输出相加 (80)。 线性放大由运算放大器提供,而非线性功能由两个CMOS反相器提供。

标题: Method of clustering multi-dimensional related data in a computer database by combining the two vertices of a graph connected by an edge having the highest score
摘要: A method of clustering multi-dimensional related data performed by identifying features from a collection of data, each of said features being represented by a vertex, selecting pairs of features that it is desirable to cluster together, connecting the pair of vertices representing every selected pair of features by an edge, assigning a score to every edge according to a predetermined formula, selecting an edge having the highest score, creating a new vertex by merging the vertices connected by the selected edge, creating new edges between the new vertex and the vertices previously connected to the merged vertices, and repeating this procedure until every edge has a predetermined score.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种聚类多维相关数据的方法,通过从数据集合中识别特征来执行,每个所述特征由一个顶点表示,选择希望聚类在一起的特征对,连接代表每个选定对的顶点对 边的特征,根据预定公式为每条边分配分数,选择具有最高分数的边,通过合并由所选边连接的顶点创建新顶点,在新顶点和顶点之间创建新边 以前连接到合并的顶点,并重复此过程,直到每条边都具有预定分数。
发明人: POPPEN, RICHARD F. | SMARTT, BRIAN E. | DUNN, LINNEA A. | DEROSE, FRANK J.
发明人地址: San Jose, CA | Sunnyvale, CA | Menlo Park, CA | Fremont, CA

标题: Character-recognition systems and methods with means to measure endpoint features in character bit-maps
摘要: Character recognition method and system that identifies an input character as being a unique member of a defined character set. Specifically, a character bit-map of an input character is first generated. Thereafter, a character recognition procedure processes the character bit-map to generate a set of confidence measures one for each of the members of the character set. The confidence measures represent the degree of confidence that the input character corresponds to the members of the character set. A test is then made to determine if the confidence measure with the highest degree of confidence is acceptable. If there is an acceptable confidence measure, the member of the character set with the acceptable confidence measure is reported as the output character. If there is no acceptable confidence measure, a number of characters with the highest confidence measures are identified as candidates. Also, the character bit-map is analyzed further to obtain stroke-endpoint information which is then compared to a learned endpoint database having a number of character string-signature pairs. If there is a match between a database string and a candidate character, the match is used to report an output character. Endpoint location and orientation are obtained by modeling the bit-map as a charge distribution. A potential profile is constructed and thresholded and the results clustered into regions to obtain endpoint location information- The gradient of the potential profile is used to obtain endpoint orientation information.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 将输入字符识别为已定义字符集的唯一成员的字符识别方法和系统。 具体来说,首先生成输入字符的字符位图。 此后,字符识别过程处理字符位图以生成一组置信度度量,该置信度度量用于字符集的每个成员。 置信度度量表示输入字符对应于字符集成员的置信度。 然后进行测试以确定具有最高置信度的置信度度量是否可以接受。 如果存在可接受的置信度度量,则将具有可接受的置信度度量的字符集成员报告为输出字符。 如果没有可接受的置信度度量,则将具有最高置信度度量的多个字符标识为候选。 此外,进一步分析字符位图以获得笔划端点信息,然后将其与具有多个字符串-签名对的学习端点数据库进行比较。 如果数据库字符串和候选字符之间存在匹配,则该匹配用于报告输出字符。 通过将位图建模为电荷分布来获得端点位置和方向。 构建潜在轮廓并对其进行阈值化,并将结果聚类为区域以获得端点位置信息 - 潜在轮廓的梯度用于获得端点方向信息。
当前第一申请(专利权)人: EASTMAN KODAK COMPANY A NEW JERSEY CORPORATION

标题: Modeling of object-oriented database structures, translation to relational database structures, and dynamic searches thereon
摘要: A method and system for modeling of object-oriented database structures, translation to relational database structures, and dynamic searches thereon. The user may create, edit and manipulate a user's object database (dynamically translated into a set of relational database structures), to create, edit and manipulate objects for that object database (dynamically translated into data for those relational database structures), and to create, edit and manipulate queries to be applied to that object database (dynamically translated into queries to be applied to those relational database structures). A meta-model of the user's object database, which is itself an object database, and which has itself been translated into a set of relational database structures for manipulation by a relational database engine. The meta-model comprises a set of classes, objects, and relationships between classes which model the classes and relationships between classes of the system. Each of these classes may comprise a set of searchable properties, and each of these relationships may comprise an inheritance relationship (between a base class and a derived class) or a data-model relationship (such as a one-to-one, one-to-many, or many-to-many relationship). The data model of the user's object database is modeled by actual objects in the meta-model, and editing or manipulating the user's object database is modeled by creating, modifying, or deleting objects in the meta-model. The meta-model also models itself, in the same manner as it models the user's object database, and may be manipulated in the same manner as the user's object database.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种用于建模面向对象的数据库结构、转换为关系数据库结构以及在其上进行动态搜索的方法和系统。 用户可以创建、编辑和操作用户的对象数据库(动态转换为一组关系数据库结构),为该对象数据库创建、编辑和操作对象(动态转换为那些关系数据库结构的数据),并创建 ,编辑和操作要应用于该对象数据库的查询(动态转换为要应用于那些关系数据库结构的查询)。 用户对象数据库的元模型,它本身就是一个对象数据库,并且它本身已被转换为一组关系数据库结构,以供关系数据库引擎操作。 元模型包括一组类、对象和类之间的关系,它们对系统的类和类之间的关系进行建模。 这些类中的每一个可以包括一组可搜索的属性,并且这些关系中的每一个可以包括继承关系(在基类和派生类之间)或数据模型关系(例如一对一、一对一 多对多或多对多关系)。 用户对象数据库的数据模型由元模型中的实际对象建模,编辑或操作用户对象数据库通过创建、修改或删除元模型中的对象来建模。 元模型也以与它对用户的对象数据库建模相同的方式对其自身进行建模,并且可以以与用户的对象数据库相同的方式进行操作。
发明人: ALTHOFF, JAMES | LEE, SEUNG | BELANGER, KEN | PRASAD, NAGENDRA | MCGINNIS, BRIAN | MCWILLIAMS, FLOYD | ZHANG, YONG | KOUSHIK, RAVI

标题: A method for adjusting current clock counts in a distributed computer system
摘要: A method for adjusting current clock counts in a distributed database apparatus is accomplished. Each processor assigns a timestamp to a transaction according to its clock when the transaction is generated, and transaction are executed by accessing the database according to timestamp order. A processor in at least a first one of the computer sites accesses an abort count corresponding to a second computer site ; compares an abort count corresponding to the first computer site which the abort count corresponding to the second compute site ; and changes the current clock count corresponding to the first computer site to more closely match the current clock count corresponding to the second computer site, at times when the comparison between the abort counts in the first and second computer sites indicates that new transactions have been aborted more frequently in one of the two computer sites.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 实现了一种分布式数据库装置中调整当前时钟计数的方法。 每个处理器在事务产生时根据自己的时钟为事务分配一个时间戳,事务按照时间戳顺序访问数据库执行。 至少第一个计算机站点中的处理器访问对应于第二个计算机站点的中止计数; 比较对应于第一计算机站点的中止计数和对应于第二计算站点的中止计数; 并且改变对应于第一计算机站点的当前时钟计数以更接近地匹配对应于第二计算机站点的当前时钟计数,有时当第一和第二计算机站点中的中止计数之间的比较表明新事务已被中止时 更频繁地出现在两个计算机站点之一。
发明人: KATO, NOBUHIRO, C/O INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY DIV. | MORIMOTO, YOJIRO, C/O INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY DIV. | MURANAGA, MIHO, C/O INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY DIV. | SEKIGUCHI, KOICHI, C/O INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY DIV.

标题: Method for automatically recognizing line symmetry of a figure
摘要: In a line-symmetrical figure shaping system, the symmetry axis candidate pairs of an input figure are generated based on feature data extracted from the input figure. Pairs of points on the input figure on both sides of each of two symmetry axis candidates of a selected symmetry axis candidate are extracted, and a symmetry axis judgment segment is generated which connects the points of each pair. The distance between the middle point of the symmetry judgment segment and the symmetry axis candidate is calculated. The angle formed by the symmetry judgment segment and the symmetry axis candidate and the difference from 90 DEG are also calculated. Based on the distances and angular differences for the respective symmetry judgment segments, it is judged whether the input figure is symmetrical with respect to the symmetry axis candidate pair. The input figure is shaped into a figure that is completely line-symmetrical with respect to the symmetry axis candidate pair that has been judged to provide line symmetry.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 在线对称图形整形系统中,输入图形的对称轴候选对是基于从输入图形中提取的特征数据生成的。 提取所选对称轴候选的两个候选对称轴两侧的输入图形上的点对,生成连接每对点的对称轴判断段。 计算对称判断段的中点到对称轴候选的距离。 还计算了对称判断段与候选对称轴所成的角度以及与90°的差值。 根据各个对称判断段的距离和角度差,判断输入图形相对于对称轴候选对是否对称。 输入图形被成形为相对于已判断为提供线对称的对称轴候选对完全线对称的图形。

标题: ベクトル相関検出回路
摘要:
【目的】回路素子数が少なく演算時間の短いベクトル相関検出回路を提供する。
【構成】2組のN次元ベクトルデータ(X1 ,X2 ,…,XN )、(Y1 ,Y2 ,…,YN )に対して対応する成分毎に(Xi -Yi )の減算を減算器23で行う。排他的論理和回路24は、前記減算結果(Xi -Yi )が正の場合には(Xi -Yi )を選択し、負の場合には減算結果(Xi -Yi )をビット反転し、このビット反転データ^(Xi -Yi )を選択する。この選択は減算結果の最上位ビット27を制御信号として行う。この選択されたデータと前記減算結果の最上位ビット27の値を累算器25で累算する。従って、減算器は1個で済み、減算器の結果が負の場合にその減算データの反転データに1を加算する操作は、累算器で減算結果を累算する際に同時に行うことで済み、素子数が少なく演算時間の少ないベクトル相関検出回路が構成できる。
摘要(译)(简体中文):
本 发明提供一种电路元件少、动作时间短的矢量相关检测电路。 
 [配置] 减法器23对与两组N维矢量数据(X1,X2,...,XN)和(Y1,Y2,...,YN)相对应的每个分量执行(Xi-Yi)的减法。 ... 异或电路24在减法结果(Xi-Yi)为正时选择(Xi-Yi),在减法结果(Xi-Yi)为负时对减法结果(Xi-Yi)进行位反转,该位选择反转后的数据^(Xi -义 )。 该选择是使用减法结果的最高有效位 27 作为控制信号进行的。 累加器25累加选择的数据和减法结果的最高有效位27的值。 因此,只需要一个减法器,如果减法器的结果为负,则在累加器中累加减法结果时,可以同时进行减法数据的反转数据加1的操作。矢量相关检测电路元件数量少,运算时间短。

标题: Shared-data environment in which each file has independent security properties
摘要: A shared-data system, such as could be used with an intranet or internet, in which a large quantity of files available in a file system are each individually assigned an identification number. This identification number is then converted into a non-location-based URL, such as a simple scalar number, which can be retained in a user's network browser. Further, each file has associated therewith an individual data object, by which an owner of a particular file can specify read and write access to the file. The system enables new users to create their own accounts to access the file system, without causing a general security breach. The use of location-independent URLs to identify files enables individual users to organize the files independently, and also avoids "stale" web links which occur when websites are reorganized.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 共享数据系统,例如可以与内部网或互联网一起使用,其中文件系统中可用的大量文件每个都被单独分配一个标识号。 然后将该标识号转换为非基于位置的 URL,例如简单的标量数字,该 URL 可以保留在用户的网络浏览器中。 此外,每个文件都与一个单独的数据对象相关联,特定文件的所有者可以通过该数据对象指定对该文件的读和写访问。 该系统使新用户能够创建自己的帐户来访问文件系统,而不会造成一般的安全漏洞。 使用与位置无关的 URL 来识别文件使个人用户能够独立地组织文件,并且还避免了在重新组织网站时出现的“陈旧”网络链接。
法律状态/事件: 期限届满 | 质押 | 权利转移

标题: Feature extraction system for identifying text within a table image
摘要: In a feature extraction system for analyzing image data of an input document image, a feature extraction method identifies image data as a table image and identifies text image within the table image by performing the steps of inputting image data of a document page, performing block selection processing on the document page, the block selection process identifies and separates the image data into blocks having the same image type, identifying table image data based on the separated blocks of image data, identifying text blocks within the table image data, horizontally sorting all text blocks located in the table image data based on horizontal position information, vertically sorting all text blocks located in the table image data based on vertical position information, separating text blocks into rows and columns based on a result of the vertical and the horizontal sorting steps, assigning column and row address coordinates to each text block in the table image data based on the separating step, and storing the assigned address of each text block.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 在用于分析输入文档图像的图像数据的特征提取系统中,特征提取方法将图像数据识别为表格图像,并通过执行输入文档页面的图像数据、执行块选择的步骤来识别表格图像中的文本图像。 对文档页面进行处理,块选择过程将图像数据识别并分离成具有相同图像类型的块,根据分离的图像数据块识别表格图像数据,识别表格图像数据中的文本块,水平排序所有文本 基于水平位置信息位于表格图像数据中的块,基于垂直位置信息对位于表格图像数据中的所有文本块进行垂直排序,基于垂直和水平排序步骤的结果将文本块分成行和列, 根据 separ 为表格图像数据中的每个文本块分配列和行地址坐标 执行步骤,并存储每个文本块的分配地址。

标题: Method and apparatus for positioning microfiche card
摘要: A microfiche reader is provided with pulse motors which move a microfiche card in X and Y direction so as to position a required frame image on the microfiche card in an optical projection path. Using the symbol AF for the maximum number of frames recordable on the microfiche card, the symbol AS for the maximum number of pulse signals required to move the microfiche card from the datum position to the limit position, and the symbol PF for the location number of a required frame, the address number NS of a required frame can be calculated according to the equation NS=PFxAS/AF The number MS of pulse signals required to move the microfiche card from a present position to the required position is obtained from the difference between the address number NS of the required frame and the address number OS of the frame actually in the optical projection path. Pulse signals corresponding to the number MS are generated to control a pulse motor.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 缩微胶片阅读器设置有脉冲马达,该脉冲马达沿X和Y方向移动缩微胶片卡,以便在光学投影路径中将缩微胶片卡上所需的帧图像定位。 使用符号 AF 表示缩微胶片卡上可记录的最大帧数,符号 AS 表示将缩微胶片卡从基准位置移动到极限位置所需的最大脉冲信号数,符号 PF 表示位置编号 所需帧,所需帧的地址数 NS 可以根据公式 NS=PFxAS/AF 计算 将缩微卡从当前位置移动到所需位置所需的脉冲信号数 MS 由两者之差获得 所需帧的地址号NS和实际在光学投影路径中的帧的地址号OS。 产生对应于编号MS的脉冲信号以控制脉冲马达。
[标]当前申请(专利权)人: 富士胶片控股株式会社

标题: SPRACHGESTEUERTE BENUTZERSCHNITTSTELLE MIT PERSÖNLICHKEIT
摘要(译)(简体中文): 本发明提供一种具有个性的语音用户界面。在一个实施例中，一种方法包括执行语音用户界面，以及控制语音用户界面以向语音用户界面提供个性。该方法包括基于各种上下文情况选择提示，诸如先前选择的提示和用户使用语音用户界面的体验。
发明人: SURACE J. | WHITE M. | REEVES B. | NASS I. | CAMPBELL D. | ALBERT D.
法律状态/事件: 未缴年费 | 权利转移

标题: Motion dependent video signal processing
摘要: In, for example, a motion compensated video standards converter wherein blocks in a first field or frame of a video signal are each compared with a plurality of blocks in the next succeeding field or frame of the video signal for deriving motion vectors representing the motion of the content of respective blocks between the first field or frame and the next field or frame, the blocks (A; C; E) in a border region of each field or frame are assigned the same motion vectors as have been derived for the respective nearest block (B; D; F) which is not in the border region.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 例如,在运动补偿视频标准转换器中,视频信号的第一场或帧中的每个块都与视频信号的下一个连续场或帧中的多个块进行比较,以导出表示运动的运动矢量 在第一个场或帧和下一个场或帧之间的各个块的内容,每个场或帧的边界区域中的块(A;C;E)被分配相同的运动矢量,这些运动矢量已经为各自最近的场或帧导出 不在边界区域的块(B;D;F)。

标题: System for controlling group access to objects using group access control folder and group identification as individual user
摘要: A method and system for controlling access by groups of users to multiple objects stored within a data processing system implemented library wherein each object has an access list associated therewith explicitly listing individual users permitted access to that object. A group identification is established which encompasses all users within the data processing system, a selected subset of users with the data processing system, or a single selected user and his or her designated affinity users or proxies. The group identification is then listed within an associated access list for a particular object and upon an attempted access of the particular object by a user not listed explicitly within the associated access list, a determination is made as to whether or not that user is listed within a group identification which is permitted access. In one embodiment of the present invention selected objects and users each have associated therewith a clearance level and access to a selected object by a particular user listed within a group identification may be denied if that particular user's clearance level does not meet or exceed the clearance level of the selected object.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种用于控制用户组对存储在数据处理系统实现库中的多个对象的访问的方法和系统,其中每个对象具有与其相关联的访问列表,明确列出允许访问该对象的各个用户。 建立组标识,其包含数据处理系统内的所有用户、具有数据处理系统的选定用户子集、或单个选定用户和他或她指定的相似用户或代理。 然后,组标识列在特定对象的关联访问列表中,并且在未明确列在关联访问列表中的用户尝试访问特定对象时,确定该用户是否列在其中 允许访问的组标识。 在本发明的一个实施例中,所选对象和用户各自具有与其相关联的许可级别,并且如果特定用户的许可级别不满足或超过许可级别,则可以拒绝组标识中列出的特定用户对所选对象的访问 所选对象的。
发明人: HOWELL, WILLIAM E. | REDDY, HARI N. | WANG, DIANA S.
发明人地址: North Richland Hills, TX | Grapevine, TX | Trophy Club, TX

标题: Method for the determination of area coincidence of a master or printing plate for printing machines
摘要: Eine Meßeinrichtung, die mit einer Anzahl von Sensoren ausgerüstet ist, führt die Ermittlung der Flächendekkung einer Druckvorlage oder Druckplatte für Druckmaschinen durch. Die Eichung jedes einzelnen Sensors der Meßeinrichtung wird anhand von Eichstreifen vorgenommen. Über einen zusätzlichen Sensor der Meßeinrichtung erfolgt eine druckplatten- bzw. druckvorlagenspezifische Korrektureichung und eine Abstimmung auf gleiche Werte aller Sensoren. Die Korrektureichung- und abstimmung geschieht über ein Eichfeld und einen Eichbereich, die sich auf der Druckplatte bzw. Druckvorlage befinden.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 配备多个传感器的测量装置用于确定印刷机的印刷原件或印版的区域覆盖率。 使用校准条校准测量设备的每个单独的传感器。 测量设备的附加传感器执行特定于印版或印刷副本的校正校准,并调整到所有传感器的相同值。 校正校准和调整通过位于印版或印刷模板上的校准区域和校准区域进行。
[标]当前申请(专利权)人: 海德堡印刷机械股份公司

标题: Method and apparatus for analyzing ventricular function
摘要: A method for analyzing ventricular function comprises the steps for generating ED contour image data representing the contour of the heart in an end diastole (ED) phase and an ES contour image data representing the contour of the heart in an end systole (ES) phase, generating a graph of an average cardiac function of the normal heart, and generating a standard heart ES contour (or ED contour) image from the ED contour image or the S contour image of the subject heart, to be examined, by the graph of average cardiac function of the normal heart. The ED contour image data or ES contour image data of the heart of a subject to be examined is superimposed on the standard heart ES contour or the ED contour image data, to analyze the ventricular function of the subject from a state of superimposition between the contour image data of the subject's heart and the standard heart contour image data.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种分析心室功能的方法,包括生成表示心脏舒张末期(ED)期的心脏轮廓的ED轮廓图像数据和表示收缩末期(ES)期心脏轮廓的ES轮廓图像数据的步骤, 生成正常心脏的平均心功能图,并通过平均图从待检查的对象心脏的ED轮廓图像或S轮廓图像生成标准心脏ES轮廓(或ED轮廓)图像 正常心脏的心脏功能。 将被检者心脏的ED轮廓图像数据或ES轮廓图像数据叠加在标准心脏ES轮廓或ED轮廓图像数据上,从轮廓之间的叠加状态分析被检者的心室功能 对象心脏的图像数据和标准心脏轮廓图像数据。

标题: Motion vector detecting apparatus and method
摘要: A motion vector is detected between a base block of a present frame and an inspection block of a reference frame, which is moved in a predetermined search range of the reference frame, on the basis of constant and transient components extracted (31a,31b,32a,32b) from the base and inspection blocks. The constant (low frequency) component may be the mean value of the pixels of the block. The transient (high frequency) component may be the standard deviation of the pixels of the block. The base and inspection blocks may be respectively segmented into small blocks, and the constant and transient components of the small blocks obtained, compared (35a,35b) and summed (37).
摘要(译)(简体中文): 基于提取的恒定和瞬态分量(31a、31b、32a  ,32b) 来自底座和检查块。 恒定(低频)分量可以是块的像素的平均值。 瞬态(高频)分量可以是块的像素的标准偏差。 可以将基本块和检查块分别分割成小块,并且获得、比较(35a,35b)和求和(37)的小块的常数和瞬态分量。
发明人: KONDO, TETSUJIRO, C/O INT. PROP. DIV. SONY CORP.

标题: 自然画表現方式
摘要: PURPOSE:To improve processing speed at the time of printing by superimposing a hard copy picture to one part of a soft copy picture in advance and displaying the superimposed picture when storing, displaying and printing a natural picture in a progressive system. CONSTITUTION:When displaying the soft copy picture, the hard copy picture is displayed in one part of the soft copy picture and when displaying the hard copy picture, an area excepting for the part already displayed in the soft copy picture is displayed. In this case, for example, the information of the soft copy picture is transmitted from a storing means 1 and afterwards, one part of the hard copy picture is automatically transmitted so as to display the hard copy picture in one part of the soft copy picture. Therefore, when the soft copy picture is completely restored, a printer 3 can be activated and afterwards, it is enough only to restore the remaining hard copy picture and to transfer it to the printer 3. Thus, when displaying the soft copy picture before printing, the speed for the processing in the case of printing can be improved.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 目的:通过将硬拷贝图片预先叠加到软拷贝图片的一部分上,并在逐行系统中存储、显示和打印自然图片时显示叠加的图片来提高打印时的处理速度。 组成:显示软拷贝图片时,硬拷贝图片显示在软拷贝图片的一部分中,当显示硬拷贝图片时,显示软拷贝图片中已显示部分以外的区域。 在这种情况下,例如,从存储装置1传输软拷贝图片的信息,然后,自动传输硬拷贝图片的一部分,以便在软拷贝图片的一部分中显示硬拷贝图片 . 因此,当软拷贝图片完全恢复时,可以启动打印机3,之后,只需恢复剩余的硬拷贝图片并将其传送到打印机3就足够了。因此,当在打印前显示软拷贝图片时 ,可以提高打印情况下的处理速度。
发明人地址: 神奈川県川崎市中原区上小田中1015番地  富士通株式会社内

标题: 半導体装置
摘要:
(修正有)
【目的】消費電力が小さく、かつ少数の素子でシナプス結合が実現でき、高集積度、低消費電力のニューロンコンピュータチップを実現することのできる半導体装置を提供する。
【構成】ソース及びドレイン領域を隔てる領域に第1の絶縁膜を介して設けられた電位的にフローティング状態にある第1のゲート電極、第1のゲート電極と第2の絶縁膜を介して容量結合する複数の第2のゲート電極、第2のゲート電極の1つにソース電極が接続された第1のMOS型トランジスタ、MOS型トランジスタのゲート電極もしくはドレイン電極が、高レベルもしくは低レベルの2つの電位レベルの信号を伝達する第1の配線に接続されている。
摘要(译)(简体中文):
(有修正) 
 本发明提供了一种功耗低、能以较少的元件实现突触连接、能实现高集成度、低功耗的神经元计算机芯片的半导体器件。 
 [构成] 电势浮动状态的第一栅电极通过第一绝缘膜设置在分隔源区和漏区的区域中,以及电容器通过第一栅电极和第二绝缘膜设置。多个耦合的第二栅电极,第一MOS晶体管的源极连接到第二栅电极之一,MOS晶体管的栅电极或漏电极连接到高电平或低电平。连接到传输两个电位信号的第一布线水平。

法律状态/事件: 未缴年费 | 权利转移

标题: 切抜きマスク作成方法及び装置
摘要: PURPOSE:To form a cutout mask with high accuracy at high speed by using a threshold level object of a color in which an evaluation function is maximized as a threshold level and binarizing a picture element data of the color based on the threshold level. CONSTITUTION:The method is provided with a discriminated analysis means 18 deciding a threshold object of a color whose evaluation function is maximized of a picture element data of C, M, Y colors as to picture elements in a training area according to a command of a digitizer 16 as a threshold level, with a binarizing means 20 binarizing the picture element data and a control CPU 22 generating a mask data from a background picture element data commanded by a digitizer 16 among the binarized picture data. Then a threshold object is obtained by an evaluation function of an optimum threshold level and a threshold object of a color maximizing the evaluation function is used as a threshold level among color threshold objects, a color picture element data is binarized based on the threshold level and a cutout mask is generated based on the background of the picture element data to be binarized. Thus, a desired cutout mask is generated with high accuracy at a high speed with less calculation.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 目的:通过使用评估函数最大化的颜色的阈值水平对象作为阈值水平并基于阈值水平对颜色的像素数据进行二值化,以高速形成高精度的剪切掩模。 组成:该方法提供了一个判别分析装置 18 决定一个颜色的阈值对象,其评估函数是 C、M、Y 颜色的像素数据根据一个命令在训练区域中的像素数据最大化 数字转换器16作为阈值电平,二值化装置20将像素数据二值化,并且控制CPU 22从二值化的图像数据中的由数字化器16命令的背景像素数据生成掩码数据。 然后通过最佳阈值水平的评价函数得到阈值对象,将评价函数最大化的颜色的阈值对象作为颜色阈值对象中的阈值水平,基于该阈值水平对彩色像素数据进行二值化, 根据要二值化的像素数据的背景生成剪切掩码。 因此,以高精度、高速、较少的计算生成期望的剪切掩模。
发明人地址: 東京都新宿区市谷加賀町1丁目1番1号  大日本印刷株式会社内

标题: Method for verifying spelling of compound words
摘要: This invention describes a method for automatically verifying spelling of compound words in many natural languages such as German, Danish, Swedish, Norwegian, Dutch, Icelandic, Afrikaans, Swiss German, etc. The basic technology of looking up words in a dictionary is supplemented by the association of component flags with each word and by the application of powerful tree-scanning techniques that isolate the components of compound words and determine their correctness in isolation and in association with each other. The technique can be used in word processing systems to support spelling verification, to hyphenate text, and to unhyphenate text.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 本发明描述了一种自动验证多种自然语言中复合词拼写的方法,例如德语、丹麦语、瑞典语、挪威语、荷兰语、冰岛语、南非荷兰语、瑞士德语等。 组件标记与每个单词的关联,并通过应用强大的树扫描技术来隔离复合词的组件,并在隔离和相互关联的情况下确定它们的正确性。 该技术可用于文字处理系统,以支持拼写验证、连字符文本和取消连字符文本。

标题: VERFAHREN ZUR BESTIMMUNG EINER WAHRSCHEINLICHKEIT FÜR DAS AUFTRETEN EINER FOLGE VON MINDESTENS ZWEI WÖRTERN BEI EINER SPRACHERKENNUNG
摘要: Statistical speech models are used to improve the recognition rate of automatic speech recognition systems. The inventive method makes it possible to construct speech models with small volumes of text or without a text. Linguistic classes are formed and the speech model, i.e. an a-priori probability of word sequences, is determined based on the grammatical structure of the text and depending on the vocabulary of the text. Set probabilities for words and for linguistic classes are determined for this purpose. In addition to creating a new speech model for a predetermined area of application, the inventive method also provides a means of adapting a pre-existing speech model to a new area of application.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 统计语音模型用于提高自动语音识别系统的识别率。 本发明的方法使得构建具有少量文本或没有文本的语音模型成为可能。 形成语言类别,并根据文本的语法结构和文本的词汇来确定语音模型,即单词序列的先验概率。 为此目的确定单词和语言类别的集合概率。 除了为预定的应用领域创建新的语音模型之外,本发明的方法还提供了一种使预先存在的语音模型适应新的应用领域的手段。

标题: Background referencing
摘要: Thresholding and background referencing apparatus are disclosed for use with apparatus for scanning documents having images with object and background regions. The background referencing apparatus receives, from the scanning apparatus, a video signal representing the document image and generation a signal having a value representative of an estimate of the background density level of the document being scanned. The apparatus produces a difference signal representative of the difference between the estimated background level signal and the received video signal. The estimated background level signal is stored, and updated in response to (1) the difference signal being of a first sign associated with transition from object to background, and (2) only small difference signals of a second sign associated with transition from background to object, whereby large difference signals of the second sign result in substantially no change in the stored estimated background level signal.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 阈值和背景参考装置被公开用于与用于扫描具有对象和背景区域的图像的文档的装置一起使用。 背景参考装置从扫描装置接收表示文件图像的视频信号并产生具有代表被扫描文件的背景密度水平的估计值的信号。 该装置产生表示估计的背景电平信号和接收的视频信号之间的差值的差值信号。 估计的背景水平信号被存储,并且响应于(1)具有与从对象到背景的转变相关联的第一符号的差异信号,和(2)仅与从背景到背景的转变相关联的第二符号的小差异信号而被更新。 目的,由此第二符号的大差异信号导致所存储的估计背景水平信号基本上没有变化。
当前第一申请(专利权)人: EASTMAN KODAK COMPANY, A CORP OF NJ
发明人: MORTON, ROGER A. | WETZEL, THOMAS J.

标题: 用以翻譯語言之方法及裝置
摘要: 這是提供在不同語言之間執行翻譯用的方法與裝置。本發明包含一套翻譯系統，此系統所執行的翻譯藉由提供了三維的主題式雙語資料庫(three-dimensional topical dual- language database)而增加了其正確性。主題式資料庫包含一套對於每個已使用該資料庫主題所構成之原始－目標的語言翻譯。具體言之，使用者先選擇交談的主題，然後透過電話所講的字會被翻譯出來，並自電話的另一端產生合成的聲音訊號，如此一來，一種近乎即時的交談可在二人分別採用不同語言間發生。本發明另一項附加的特色是，外加的電腦終端機可顯示輸入及輸出的片語以便使用者可以編輯其輸入的片語，或是指出翻譯不清楚的地方而需重新翻譯該內容。
摘要(译)(简体中文): 这是提供在不同语言之间执行翻译用的方法与装置。 本发明包含一套翻译系统,此系统所执行的翻译藉由提供了三维的主题式双语资料库(three-dimensional topical dual- language database)而增加了其正确性。 主题式资料库包含一套对于每个已使用该资料库主题所构成之原始-目标的语言翻译。 具体言之,使用者先选择交谈的主题,然后透过电话所讲的字会被翻译出来,并自电话的另一端产生合成的声音讯号,如此一来,一种近乎即时的交谈可在二人分别 采用不同语言间发生。 本发明另一项附加的特色是,外加的电脑终端机可显示输入及输出的片语以便使用者可以编辑其输入的片语,或是指出翻译不清楚的地方而需重新翻译该内容。

标题: Method and arrangement for sound analysis
摘要: For sound analysis, especially for speaker identification, a long-term spectrum is often formed from the recorded signal and compared to a long-term spectrum of a previously recorded signal. When the signal is, for example, received over telephone lines the transfer function thereof may distort the received signal to such an extent that identification is impossible. It is now proposed not to use the long-term spectrum for identification but rather its change, that is to say to accumulate the difference between two consecutive short-term spectra or the difference between such short-term spectrum and the long-term spectrum and to divide this accumulated value by the long-term spectrum in a Divider. Since the numerator and denominator each contain the frequency-weighting factor (aJ) of the telephone line transfer function, this factor is effectively cancelled out by virtue of the division operation performed in the Divider thereby eliminating the effect of the unknown transfer function. As a result the influence of the transfer function of the transmission path disappears almost completely.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 对于声音分析,尤其是说话人识别,通常由记录的信号形成长期频谱,并与之前记录的信号的长期频谱进行比较。 例如,当信号通过电话线接收时,其传递函数可能会使接收到​​的信号失真到无法识别的程度。 现在建议不要用长期光谱来识别,而是用它的变化来识别,即将两个连续的短期光谱之间的差异或这种短期光谱与长期光谱之间的差异进行累加,然后 将这个累积值除以 Divider 中的长期频谱。 由于分子和分母中的每一个都包含电话线传递函数的频率加权因子(aJ),因此该因子通过在除法器中执行的除法运算而被有效地抵消,从而消除了未知传递函数的影响。 结果,传输路径的传递函数的影响几乎完全消失。

标题: Information processing apparatus with discriminating communication and distinguishing display functions
摘要: A data processing apparatus capable of distinguishing the data entered from the keyboard from those received through a communication line, thus facilitating the use by the operator.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种数据处理装置,能够区分从键盘输入的数据和通过通信线路接收的数据,从而便于操作者使用。
发明人: TAKASE, SUSUMU | FUKUNAGA, KOJI | NAKAMURA, KAZUHIRO
发明人地址: Yokohama, JP | Tokyo, JP | Tanashi, JP

标题: Object detecting system based on multiple-eye images
摘要: An object detecting system based on multiple-eye images, comprises an image sharpening unit receiving a plurality of images having substantially the same optical axis and different focus positions, for generating one sharpened image, a focus information and a cluster information, a mask generating unit receiving the focus information for generating a first objection detecting information, a region integrating unit receiving the cluster information for generating an integrated cluster information, a region selecting unit receiving the first objection detecting information and the integrated cluster information for generating a second objection detecting information, and an object extracting unit receiving the sharpened image and the second objection detecting information for extracting an object image from the sharpened image in accordance with the second objection detecting information.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种基于多眼图像的物体检测系统,包括:图像锐化单元,接收光轴基本相同但聚焦位置不同的多幅图像,用于生成一幅锐化图像、聚焦信息和聚类信息;掩模生成单元 接收焦点信息以产生第一物体检测信息, 区域整合单元接收聚类信息以产生整合聚类信息, 区域选择单元接收第一物体检测信息和整合聚类信息以产生第二物体检测信息, 对象提取单元接收锐化图像和第二对象检测信息,用于根据第二对象检测信息从锐化图像中提取对象图像。

标题: Information providing system
摘要: To provide detailed information with large amount of data without changing the information to be provided by considering environment of users on information server side providing information and without increasing data amount of the information sent to an information terminal from the information server, and also to facilitate referring, setting and updating of the information of a portable storage medium when the portable storage medium is used as local information storage means. Information is provided to the users by referring to conversion information, which indicates a conversion object address expressing storage status of a given information, which is to be a conversion object, and a conversion candidate address expressing storage status of an information corresponding to said given information, which is to be a conversion candidate, and conversion relationship between said two addresses.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 考虑到信息服务器端的用户提供信息的环境,在不增加从信息服务器发送到信息终端的信息的数据量的情况下,在不改变要提供的信息的情况下提供具有大量数据的详细信息,并便于查阅 ,当便携式存储介质用作本地信息存储装置时,设置和更新便携式存储介质的信息。 通过参考转换信息向用户提供信息,转换信息指示表示将成为转换对象的给定信息的存储状态的转换对象地址,以及表示与所述给定信息对应的信息的存储状态的转换候选地址 ,即为转换候选者,以及所述两个地址之间的转换关系。
[标]当前申请(专利权)人: 松下电器产业株式会社

标题: Metod för rörelsekompensering och elastisk deformation i bildsekvenser
摘要: The invention relates to a method of motion compensation and elastic deformation in picture sequences in transmission of moving pictures between a transmitter and a receiver, that is a picture coding method in which the pixel values of the picture are determined using a previous picture. In the transmitter, each picture in the picture sequence is divided into triangles by suitably choosing corner points, and the motion between two successive pictures is estimated such that the motion vectors of all the corner points can be established. Information about the corner points and/or the motion vectors is transmitted from the transmitter to the receiver, in which the motion vectors of the internal points of the triangles are calculated using the three transmitted motion vectors belonging to the respective triangle. The pixel values in the corner points of the triangles and in the internal points of the triangles are calculated using the trasmitted and the calculated motion vectors, respectively. Preferably, the motion vectors of the internal points of the triangles are calculated by interpolation.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 本发明涉及一种在发送器和接收器之间传输运动图像中的图像序列中的运动补偿和弹性变形的方法,即使用先前图像确定图像的像素值的图像编码方法。  In the transmitter, each picture in the picture sequence is divided into triangles by suitably choosing corner points, and the motion between two successive pictures is estimated such that the motion vectors of all the corner points can be established. 关于角点和/或运动矢量的信息从发送器发送到接收器,其中使用属于相应三角形的三个发送的运动矢量来计算三角形内部点的运动矢量。 分别使用传输和计算的运动矢量计算三角形角点和三角形内部点的像素值。 优选地,三角形内部点的运动矢量通过插值计算。

标题: Printer with command system selection
摘要: A printer has a collective mode for searching a print control program adapted to the processing of print data from a number of print control programs stored in a printer and a combination mode for searching an adapted print control program from combinations of predetermined print control programs. The modes are selected by a key of a switch panel. From the print data, the control code for determining the print control command system is analyzed, and a print control program adapted to the analyzed control code is searched from the print control programs of each mode. This system enables the accurate determination of a print control program adapted to a print data processing a number of print control programs having different command systems for print control.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 打印机具有用于从存储在打印机中的多个打印控制程序中搜索适合于处理打印数据的打印控制程序的集合模式和用于从预定打印控制程序的组合中搜索适合的打印控制程序的组合模式。 通过开关面板的按键选择模式。 从打印数据中,分析用于确定打印控制命令系统的控制代码,并从每个模式的打印控制程序中搜索适合于所分析的控制代码的打印控制程序。 该系统能够准确地确定适合于打印数据的打印控制程序,该打印控制程序处理具有用于打印控制的不同命令系统的多个打印控制程序。

标题: Neural network system for image processing
摘要: A visual information processing device has a pair of neural networks which respectively comprise an upper layer and a lower layer of the device. Each of the pair of neural networks comprises a semiconductor integrated circuit having a plurality of neuron circuit regions which are disposed in a matrix form, each of the neuron circuit regions performing a neuron function; a molecule film having a photoelectric function and provided on the semiconductor integrated circuit, the molecule film having (i) a plurality of T.sub.ij signal input sections each performing a wiring function among the plurality of neuron circuit regions, in each of which a T.sub.ij signal representing the bonding strength among the plurality of neuron circuit regions is optically written, and (ii) a plurality of video input sections each performing a sensor function of sensing a visual image in which one pixel corresponds to one neuron circuit region; and a wiring for electrically connecting the semiconductor integrated circuit and the molecule film. Each of the plurality of neuron circuit regions is bonded with the neighboring neuron circuit regions in each of the pair of neural networks comprising the upper and lower layers, and each of the plurality of neuron circuit regions is bonded with the corresponding one between the pair of neural networks.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种视觉信息处理设备,具有一对神经网络,分别包括设备的上层和下层。 该对神经网络中的每一个包括具有以矩阵形式设置的多个神经元电路区域的半导体集成电路,每个神经元电路区域执行神经元功能; 具有光电功能并设置在半导体集成电路上的分子膜,该分子膜具有 (i) 多个 T.sub.ij 信号输入部分,每个 T.sub.ij 信号输入部分在多个神经元电路区域之间执行布线功能,在每个神经元电路区域中 表示多个神经元电路区域之间的结合强度的 T.sub.ij 信号被光学写入,以及 (ii) 多个视频输入部分,每个视频输入部分执行传感视觉图像的传感器功能,其中一个像素对应一个神经元 电路区; 以及用于电连接半导体集成电路和分子膜的布线。 多个神经元电路区域中的每一个与包括上层和下层的神经网络对中的每一个中的相邻神经元电路区域结合,并且多个神经元电路区域中的每一个与在这对神经元之间的对应的神经元电路区域结合。 神经网络。
法律状态/事件: 未缴年费 | 权利转移

标题: Inspecting apparatus of mounted component
摘要: A mounting state of a component mounted on a printed circuit board with adhesive is inspected by an apparatus which includes an image pick-up unit for picking up in colors an image of the board after the component is mounted, a color extracting part for discriminating an adhesive portion of the image based on a predetermined color distribution of the adhesive and then extracting the adhesive portion as extracted data, a cutting part for setting a window frame for a to-be-inspected portion in the image of the board relative to the extracted data so as to detect bulging of the adhesive, and cutting out data within the window frame, and a deciding part for deciding, based on the cut data, a presence/absence of the bulging of the adhesive from a size or an area of a portion in the window frame which shows a color within the color distribution of the adhesive.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 用粘合剂安装在印刷电路板上的元件的安装状态由一种装置检查,该装置包括一个图像拾取单元,用于在元件安装后对电路板的图像进行彩色拾取;颜色提取部分,用于识别元件的颜色。 基于粘合剂的预定颜色分布然后提取粘合剂部分作为提取数据的图像的粘合剂部分,切割部分用于相对于提取的板的图像中的待检查部分设置窗口框架 用于检测粘合剂的鼓起的数据,以及窗框内的切出数据,以及用于根据切出的数据从窗框的尺寸或面积判断粘合剂有无鼓起的判断部分。 窗口框架中的一部分,它显示了粘合剂的颜色分布范围内的颜色。

标题: Speech coding apparatus
摘要: In speech recognition and speech coding, the values of at least two features of an utterance are measured during a series of time intervals to produce a series of feature vector signals. A plurality of single-dimension prototype vector signals having only one parameter value are stored. At least two single-dimension prototype vector signals having parameter values representing first feature values, and at least two other single-dimension prototype vector signals have parameter values representing second feature values. A plurality of compound-dimension prototype vector signals have unique identification values and comprise one first-dimension and one second-dimension prototype vector signal. At least two compound-dimension prototype vector signals comprise the same first-dimension prototype vector signal. The feature values of each feature vector signal are compared to the parameter values of the compound-dimension prototype vector signals to obtain prototype match scores. The identification values of the compound-dimension prototype vector signals having the best prototype match scores for the feature vectors signals are output as a sequence of coded representations of an utterance to be recognized. A match score, comprising an estimate of the closeness of a match between a speech unit and the sequence of coded representations of the utterance, is generated for each of a plurality of speech units. At least one speech subunit, of one or more best candidate speech units having the best match scores, is displayed.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 在语音识别和语音编码中,在一系列时间间隔期间测量话语的至少两个特征的值以产生一系列特征向量信号。 存储多个仅具有一个参数值的一维原型向量信号。 至少两个具有代表第一特征值的参数值的一维原型向量信号,以及至少两个其他一维原型向量信号具有代表第二特征值的参数值。 多个复合维原型向量信号具有唯一的标识值,包括一个第一维和一个第二维原型向量信号。 至少两个复合维度原型向量信号包括相同的第一维度原型向量信号。 将每个特征向量信号的特征值与复合维度原型向量信号的参数值进行比较,以获得原型匹配分数。 对特征向量信号具有最佳原型匹配分数的复合维原型向量信号的识别值作为待识别话语的编码表示序列输出。 为多个语音单元中的每一个生成匹配分数,包括对语音单元与话语的编码表示序列之间的匹配的接近程度的估计。 显示具有最佳匹配分数的一个或多个最佳候选语音单元中的至少一个语音子单元。
发明人: BAHL, LALIT R. | BELLEGARDA, JEROME R. | EPSTEIN, EDWARD ADAM | LUCASSEN, JOHN M. | NAHAMOO, DAVID | PICHENY, MICHAEL ALAN

标题: 編碼通訊系統及編碼通訊方法
摘要: 本發明之目的在於造成高安全度之可實現，其係由使用指紋資料及一比較程式而產生一多級編碼鑰。在發送器中，一第一編碼鑰是根據來自一指紋掃描器111之指紋影像與起始登記指紋資料間之相關決定而產生，藉以編碼並自輸入/輸出設備113發送一訊息。而在接收側中，搜尋由使用人預先登記之起始登記特徵，產生一根據對檢驗特徵之比較結果之一第二編碼鑰，使用此第二編碼鑰將檢驗特徵解碼，及使用根據這些檢驗特徵與起始登記特徵之比較結果所獲得之第一編碼鑰將編碼訊息予以解碼。
摘要(译)(简体中文): 本发明之目的在于造成高安全度之可实现,其系由使用指纹资料及一比较程式而产生一多级编码钥。 在发送器中,一第一编码钥是根据来自一指纹扫描器111之指纹影像与起始登记指纹资料间之相关决定而产生,借以编码并自输入/输出设备113发送一讯息。 而在接收侧中,搜寻由使用人预先登记之起始登记特征,产生一根据对检验特征之比较结果之一第二编码钥,使用此第二编码钥将检验特征解码,及使用根据这些检验 特征与起始登记特征之比较结果所获得之第一编码钥将编码讯息予以解码。
当前第一申请(专利权)人: 日本電氣股份有限公司

标题: Character recognition system indentification of scanned and real time handwritten characters
摘要: A handwritten character recognition system that includes a document scanner for generating scanned images of a previously created document containing handwritten characters, and a pen and digitizing tablet for real time entry of handwritten characters by a user. The handwritten character recognition system includes an image processor connected from the document scanner for receiving the scanned image of a previously created document and generating one or more ordered cluster arrays. The ordered cluster arrays contain spatially ordered coordinate arrays of skeletal image arcs representing and corresponding to the strokes of the handwritten characters wherein the spatial order represents an induced time ordered sequence of creation of the strokes of the handwritten characters that emulates the sequence of creation of the character strokes. A low level recognition processor is connected from the time order induction processor for receiving the ordered cluster arrays and generating a sequential character array wherein the sequential character array contains a character list for each ordered cluster array and wherein each character list contains at least one character identification representing a possible interpretation of the corresponding ordered cluster array. A linguistic post processor may be connected from the low level recognition processor for receiving the sequential character array and generating an output string representing the most probable interpretation of the handwritten characters of the document.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种手写字符识别系统,包括用于生成先前创建的包含手写字符的文档的扫描图像的文档扫描仪,以及用于用户实时输入手写字符的笔和数字化输入板。 手写字符识别系统包括与文档扫描仪连接的图像处理器,用于接收先前创建的文档的扫描图像并生成一个或多个有序簇阵列。 有序簇阵列包含骨骼图像弧的空间有序坐标阵列,表示并对应于手写字符的笔划,其中空间顺序表示手写字符笔划的诱导时间顺序创建序列,其模拟手写字符的创建顺序。 字符笔画。 一个低级识别处理器与时间顺序感应处理器相连,用于接收有序簇数组并生成顺序字符数组,其中顺序字符数组包含每个有序簇数组的字符列表,其中每个字符列表包含至少一个字符标识 表示相应有序簇数组的可能解释。 可以从低级识别处理器连接语言后处理器,用于接收顺序字符阵列并生成表示文档的手写字符的最可能解释的输出串。
发明人: KADASHEVICH, A. JULIE | HARVEY, MARY F. | KNOWLTON, KENNETH C. | JOURJINE, ALEXANDER N.

标题: Transmitter-receiver of three-dimensional skeleton structure motions and method thereof
摘要: A transmitter-receiver of three-dimensional skeleton structure motions in which motion data of a skeleton structure in three-dimensional computer graphics (CG) is transmitted from a transmitting end to a receiving end and, based on the transmitted skeleton structure motion data, to create animation at the receiving end, the transmitter-receiver comprises (1) transmitting means for deciding either of transmitting formats: (a) the motion data of the skeleton structure is added to an initial information and then transmitted as time series data; and (b) the motion data of the skeleton structure is disassembled into element data characterizing the motions in three-dimensional virtual space and then transmitted as data in which the disassembled element data is accompanied by connection methods thereto, and then transmitting the initial information to which the motion data of the skeleton structure is added based on the decided transmission format, as CG animation data, the initial information including hierarchy data for defining hierarchical relationship of the skeleton structure, the initial state of the hierarchy data, constraint of the joints of skeletons, shape data to be attached to the skeletons, and data relative to the attachment to the skeleton structure; (2) transferring means for transferring the CC animation data from the transmitting end computer to the receiving end computer, using a transmitting program on the transmitting end computer and a receiving program on the receiving end computer; and (3) receiving means in which the CG animation data from the transferring means is received, the transmitting format of the received CG animation data is discriminated and, for the format (a), the initial information and the time series data is interpreted to decide the posture of the skeleton structure according to kinematics and, for the format (b), the initial information and the data in which the disassembled element data is accompanied by the connection methods thereto is interpreted to decide the posture of the skeleton structure according to kinematics.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种三维骨架结构运动的发送器-接收器,其中三维计算机图形(CG)中的骨架结构的运动数据从发送端传输到接收端,并基于发送的骨架结构运动数据,以 在接收端创建动画,发送器-接收器包括: (1)发送装置,用于决定任一发送格式: (a)将骨架结构的运动数据添加到初始信息中,然后作为时间序列数据发送;  (b)将骨架结构的运动数据分解为表征三维虚拟空间中运动的元素数据,然后作为数据传输,其中分解的元素数据带有连接方法,然后将初始信息传输到 根据决定的传输格式添加骨架结构的运动数据,作为CG动画数据,初始信息包括用于定义骨架结构的层级关系的层级数据、层级数据的初始状态、关节的约束。 骨架,要附加到骨架的形状数据,以及与骨架结构的附件相关的数据;  (2)使用发送端计算机上的发送程序和接收端计算机上的接收程序,将CC动画数据从发送端计算机传送到接收端计算机的传送装置;  (3)接收装置,其中接收来自传送装置的CG动画数据,判别接收到的CG动画数据的传输格式,并且对于格式(a),初始信息和时间序列数据被解释为 根据运动学决定骨架结构的姿态,对于格式(b),解释初始信息和分解后的元素数据及其连接方法的数据,以根据下式决定骨架结构的姿态 运动学。
[标]当前申请(专利权)人: 松下电器产业株式会社
发明人地址: Oosakafu Oosakashi Jyoutou-ku,Furuichi 3-11-2-403, 536,JP | Oosakafu Oosakashi Higashiyodogawaku,Hoshin 3-19-9-602, 533,JP

标题: Electrically reprogrammable nonvolatile memory device
摘要: An electrically plastic device comprising an amorphous silicon semiconductor layer including movable dopant formed between a pair of electrodes and; at least one gate electrode formed on said amorphous silicon semiconductor layer through an insulation layer or a high resistance layer; whereby the operation of said gate electrode controls the dopant distribution of said amorphous semiconductor layer, thereby varying the electrical conductivity thereof.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种电塑料器件,包括非晶硅半导体层,该非晶硅半导体层包括形成在一对电极之间的可移动掺杂剂;以及 至少一个栅电极通过绝缘层或高阻层形成在所述非晶硅半导体层上; 从而所述栅电极的操作控制所述非晶半导体层的掺杂剂分布,从而改变其导电性。
[标]当前申请(专利权)人: 松下电器产业株式会社

标题: Method and device for identifying objects
摘要: In a method and a device for identifying an object with one of a plurality of reference objects, an image B of the object is scanned in an optoelectric converter V and the scanning data is stored in a store BSp. The store BSp is scanned under the control of a scan control circuit DSt and the output is fed into a parameter generator K which produces parameters capable of distinguishing between different objects. The parameters may be, for example, the total image area, the radius of the largest circle centred on the of the image centroid passing through the image, the number of intersections of the image perimeter with the scanning lines and the ratio of the part lengths of the scanning lines lying within the image to the total part length. The parameters are compared with corresponding parameters of reference objects stored in stores RSp1...; RSpn by means of a comparator C1 until identity between the parameters is found.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 在用于利用多个参考物体之一识别物体的方法和装置中,物体的图像B在光电转换器V中被扫描并且扫描数据被存储在存储器BSp中。 存储 BSp 在扫描控制电路 DSt 的控制下被扫描,并且输出被馈送到参数发生器 K,该参数发生器 K 产生能够区分不同对象的参数。 这些参数例如可以是图像总面积、以图像质心为中心通过图像的最大圆的半径、图像周长与扫描线的交点数、部分长度的比值等。 位于图像内的扫描线的总长度。 将参数与存储在存储 RSp1... 中的参考对象的相应参数进行比较;  RSpn 通过比较器 C1,直到找到参数之间的同一性。
发明人: DR., ROLF, KARG | DIPL.-ING., OTTO, LANZ

标题: Clustering mechanism for identifying and grouping of classes in manufacturing process behavior
摘要: A clustering technique groups manufacturing data in clusters of similar parametric behavior. Each cluster groups data points which satisfy a given criterion of process behavior similarity. These data may be widely separated in time and thus need not form time ordered clusters. The technique operates in multi-dimensional parameter space and can represent process data that is characterized with multiple performance measures. The technique produces a partition of the data into the minimum number of clusters which satisfy the criterion that all data in the grouping are within a given threshold distance from a cluster nucleus. In addition, the clustering mechanism according the invention is computationally rapid.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 聚类技术将制造数据分组到具有相似参数行为的聚类中。 每个集群对满足给定过程行为相似性标准的数据点进行分组。 这些数据可能在时间上广泛分离,因此不需要形成时间有序的集群。 该技术在多维参数空间中运行,并且可以表示具有多种性能测量特征的过程数据。 该技术将数据划分为最小数量的簇,这些簇满足分组中的所有数据都在距簇核的给定阈值距离内的标准。 此外,根据本发明的聚类机制在计算上是快速的。

标题: Method and apparatus for detecting defects of printed circuit patterns
摘要: A printed circuit pattern inspection system, in which the optical image of circuit patterns is transformed into an electrical signal, the signal is converted into a binary digital signal, the connectivity relationship between selected two points of pattern in the form of binary signal is examined, connection data representative of the connectivity relationship and expressed by a pair of numbers given to the points is generated, and the connection data is compared with design data which is produced from design information and expressed in the form of a circulation list of numbers given to points in linkage relationship, whereby determination of defectiveness of patterns is made basing on the result of comparison.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种印制电路图形检测系统,将电路图形的光学图像转化为电信号,再将信号转换为二进制数字信号,以二进制信号的形式检测选定图形两点之间的连通关系, 生成代表连接关系并由赋予给点的一对数字表示的连接数据,并将该连接数据与根据设计信息产生并以赋予给点的数字循环列表的形式表示的设计数据进行比较 在连锁关系中,根据比较结果确定模式的缺陷。
当前第一申请(专利权)人: HITACHI, LTD., A CORP. OF JAPAN
发明人: NINOMIYA, TAKANORI | NAKAGAWA, YASUO | SAITO, KEIYA

标题: 피사체의전후위치관계판정방법및2차원영상을3차원영상으로변환하는방법
摘要:
본 발명은 피사체의 전후 관계 판정 방법에 관한 것이다. 2차원 영상의 화상 영역 내에 설정된 각 검출 영역마다 검출된 피사체의 수평 방향의 이동량의 크기를 이동 방향에 따라 정부 중 어느 하나의 부호를 병기하여 비교함으로써, 비교적 큰 이동량이 검출된 각 검출 영역을 제1 검출 영역으로 하고, 비교적 작은 이동량이 검출된 검출 영역을 제2 검출 영역으로 하여 전체 검출 영역을 2 종류의 검출 영역으로 분류한다. 상기 화상 영역 내의 단부분에 주목 영역을 설정하고,  - 1 -
 
주목 영역내에 존재하는 제1 검출 영역의 총 수와 주목 영역 내에 존재하는 제2 검출 영역의 총 수 중 어느 것이 많은지를 판정한다. 총 수가 많다고 판정된 쪽의 영역에 속하는 전체 영역의 피사체가 총 수가 적다고 판정된 쪽의 영역에 속하는 전체 영역의 피사체보다 후방에 위치하고 있다고 판정한다.
摘要(译)(简体中文):
本发明涉及一种用于确定对象的上下文的方法。 通过比较在2D图像的图像区域中设置的每个检测区域检测到的对象在水平方向上的移动量的大小来确定检测到相对大移动量的每个检测区域,写正或负号和运动方向,整个检测区域分为两类检测区域,一种检测区域作为第二检测区域,检测到运动量较小的检测区域作为第二检测区域。 在图像区域内的边缘设置感兴趣区域,并且 - 1 - 
 
 确定存在于关注区域中的第一检测区域的总数和存在于关注区域中的第二检测区域的总数中哪个更大。 确定属于被确定为具有较大总数的区域的整个区域中的对象位于被确定为具有较小总数的区域中包括的整个区域中的对象的后面。
发明人: 무라따히루히꼬 | 오끼노도시유끼 | 야마시따수고 | 다나세스스무 | 이이누마도시야 | 우찌다히데까즈

标题: Anordnung zur Mustererkennung
摘要(译)(简体中文): 根据光强度对实时获得的视频信息进行计时和数字化。自适应地确定改变光强度以改变用于确定黑色和白色信号的阈值水平。用作参考的场景首先以精细格式记录，然后以粗略格式记录。在搜索模式中，粗略存储的信息与来自视场的粗略信息实时比较并卷积以产生指示匹配百分比的相关数。在最高相关数的位置处确定用于最佳匹配的X和Y维度中的位置坐标。然后围绕先前确定的粗略位置进行精细搜索，该粗略位置通过将二维先前存储的信息与来自所研究的场景的实时信息进行卷积来再次确定最高相关性，作为可以确定最佳可能匹配的位置的度量。 。
发明人: HUBACH, RICHARD ALAN, SANTA BARBARA | DEZOTELL, GARY LEE, CHATSWORTH | SACKS, JACK, THOUSAND OAKS

标题: Data collection and retrieval system governed by a pay-off meter
摘要: Self-organizing data-base that charges users who find data in it and pays users who supply the data found. Has a built in feedback mechanism, called the Pay-off Meter (POM), that tells users what data needs supplying based on the number of request for that data over time. The POM outputs an expected Pay-off for supplying a piece of data. A sensitive and potent feedback loop is created insuring that the more a piece of data is requested during a period of time, the more likely the data will be supplied by a requestor or by someone a requestor tells of the pay-off.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 自组织数据库,向在其中查找数据的用户收费,并向提供找到的数据的用户付费。 有一个内置的反馈机制,称为支付计(POM),它根据一段时间内对该数据的请求数量告诉用户需要提供哪些数据。  POM 输出提供一条数据的预期回报。 创建了一个敏感且有效的反馈循环,确保在一段时间内请求的数据越多,请求者或请求者告诉回报的人提供该数据的可能性就越大。

标题: System for providing easy access to the world wide web
摘要: A system for quickly and easily accessing preselected desired addresses or URLs on the Internet is disclosed in which a published list (110) of Internet or World Wide Web sites (112, 114, 116, 118, 120, and 122) together with their unique jump codes (124, 126, 128, 130, 132, and 134) is utilized in connection with a corresponding specialized Web site (108) which is accessed by a user using either a personal computer (100) or a TV Internet Terminal and remote control, after which access a jump code corresponding to the preselected desired URL is entered by the user and software contained in the specialized Web site immediately and automatically accesses the desired Web site.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 公开了一种用于在因特网上快速且容易地访问预选的期望地址或 URL 的系统,其中因特网或万维网站点 (112、114、116、118、120 和 122) 的已发布列表 (110) 及其唯一的 跳转代码(124、126、128、130、132和134)与相应的专用网站(108)结合使用,用户使用个人计算机(100)或电视互联网终端和遥控器访问该网站 控制,然后由用户输入对应于预选的期望URL的跳转代码,并且包含在专门网站中的软件立即自动访问期望的网站。

标题: Automatically determining an optimal content image search algorithm by choosing the algorithm based on color
摘要: A method for designating a local representative color value and automatically determining image searching algorithm for a color based image searching system is disclosed. A method for designating a local representative color values generally includes the steps of dividing a color image area; and obtaining a color histogram for each block, obtaining a color group from hue histograms of each block, or obtaining a maximum color group value to designate the representative color value. Also, a method determining a search algorithm generally includes the steps of detecting the number of color blocks CB having color information from the blocked information of a reference image; comparing the number of the color blocks with a determined reference value and assigning different weights to at least two search algorithm according to the comparison results; and performing a comparison search of an image by the search algorithm based on the determined weight.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 公开了一种用于为基于颜色的图像搜索系统指定局部代表颜色值并自动确定图像搜索算法的方法。 一种局部代表色值的指定方法,一般包括划分彩色图像区域的步骤; 获得每个块的颜色直方图,从每个块的色调直方图中获得颜色组,或者获得最大颜色组值以指定代表颜色值。 此外,确定搜索算法的方法通常包括从参考图像的分块信息中检测具有颜色信息的颜色块CB的数量的步骤。 将色块的数量与确定的参考值进行比较,并根据比较结果为至少两种搜索算法分配不同的权重; 根据确定的权重,通过搜索算法对图像进行比较搜索。
发明人: KIM, HYEON JUN | LEE, JIN SOO

标题: Improved method for checking banknotes and apparatus for realizing said method

标题: Foldable article
摘要: A foldable article comprises a sheet of material (20) having a first plurality of concertina folds (22) and a second plurality of concertina folds (24). The second plurality of concertina folds (24) are oriented transverse to the first plurality of concertina folds (22). A first tab (30) is disposed at a first edge of the sheet of material.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种可折叠物品,包括具有第一多个手风琴式折叠 (22) 和第二多个手风琴式折叠 (24) 的材料片 (20)。 第二组多个手风琴式褶皱(24)横向于第一组手风琴式褶皱(22)定向。 第一翼片(30)设置在片材的第一边缘处。
[标]当前申请(专利权)人: HANGER SOLUTIONS LLC | ADVENTURE GALLERY SOFTWARE LIMITED LIABILITY

法律状态/事件: 未缴年费 | 权利转移

标题: Communications system for transferring information between memories according to processes transferred with the information
摘要: An automated communications system operates to transfer data, metadata and methods from a provider computer to a consumer computer through a communications network. The transferred information controls the communications relationship, including responses by the consumer computer, updating of information, and processes for future communications. Information which changes in the provider computer is automatically updated in the consumer computer through the communications system in order to maintain continuity of the relationship. Transfer of metadata and methods permits intelligent processing of information by the consumer computer and combined control by the provider and consumer of the types and content of information subsequently transferred. Object oriented processing is used for storage and transfer of information. Method servers provide specialized data, metadata, and methods to providers and consumers to automate many common communications services and transactions useful to both providers and consumers.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 自动化通信系统用于通过通信网络将数据、元数据和方法从提供者计算机传输到消费者计算机。 传输的信息控制通信关系,包括消费者计算机的响应、信息的更新以及未来通信的处理。 在供应商计算机中发生变化的信息通过通信系统在消费者计算机中自动更新,以保持关系的连续性。 元数据和方法的传输允许消费者计算机对信息进行智能处理,并允许提供者和消费者对随后传输的信息的类型和内容进行联合控制。 面向对象的处理用于信息的存储和传输。 方法服务器向提供者和消费者提供专门的数据、元数据和方法,以自动化对提供者和消费者都有用的许多常见通信服务和交易。
发明人: REED, DRUMMOND SHATTUCK | HEYMAN, PETER EARNSHAW | MUSHERO, STEVEN MARK | JONES, KEVIN BENARD | OBERLANDER, JEFFREY TODD | BANAY, DAN
法律状态/事件: 期限届满 | 诉讼 | 质押

标题: Rotary-anode X-ray tube provided with a hydrodynamic sleeve bearing
摘要: The invention relates to a rotary-anode X-ray tube which includes a sleeve bearing which is composed of an inner and an outer bearing segment, the outer bearing segment including intermediate pieces and a holder on which the intermediate pieces bear so as to transfer the bearing forces. Suitable shaping of the external surfaces of the intermediate pieces and the inner surfaces of the holder which contact these outer surfaces ensures that the intermediate pieces become aligned with the bearing surfaces on the inner bearing segment. This strongly reduces the complexity of manufacture.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 本发明涉及一种旋转阳极X射线管,包括由内轴承段和外轴承段组成的套筒轴承,外轴承段包括中间件和承载中间件的保持架,以传递中间件。 承载力。 中间件的外表面和接触这些外表面的保持器的内表面的适当成形确保中间件与内轴承段上的轴承表面对齐。 这大大降低了制造的复杂性。

标题: Linear image information processing device of generatrices of a piece with a revolution axe
摘要: The images being picked up by a linear image sensor having photosensitive points, the device comprises a memory (24) and a computer (23) suitable for calculating, for each point of the linear image sensor, image information values originating from this point in the course of a first processing period corresponding to a complete rotation of the part and for storing the said mean value in the memory (24). The device also comprises a memory (21) suitable for keeping all the image information originating from the linear image sensor in the course of a complete rotation of the part and for restoring it in the course of a second processing period succeeding the first processing period. Finally, it comprises a threshold memory (26) which keeps at least one threshold information item for each point of the photosensitive sensor. The invention applies to the inspection of parts having an axis of revolution. <IMAGE>
摘要(译)(简体中文): 由具有光敏点的线性图像传感器拾取的图像,该装置包括存储器(24)和计算机(23),适合于为线性图像传感器的每个点计算源自该点的图像信息值在 第一处理周期的过程对应于零件的完整旋转并且用于将所述平均值存储在存储器(24)中。 该设备还包括存储器(21),其适合于在部件的完整旋转过程中保存源自线性图像传感器的所有图像信息,并用于在第一处理周期之后的第二处理周期的过程中恢复它。 最后,它包括阈值存储器(26),其为光敏传感器的每个点保存至少一个阈值信息项。 本发明适用于具有回转轴的零件的检测。

标题: Learning method of non-linear network for non-linear function approximation
摘要: A function approximation method is provided which is based on nonparametric estimation by using a network of three layers, such as an input layer, an output layer and a hidden layer. The input and the output layers have linear activation units while the hidden layer has nonlinear activation units which have the characteristics of bounds and locality. The whole learning sequence is divided to two phases. The first phase estimates the number of kernel functions based on a user's requirement on the desired level of accuracy of the network, and the second phase is related to parameter estimation. In the second phase, a linear learning rule is applied between output and hidden layers and a non-linear (piecewise-linear) learning rule is applied between hidden and input layers. Accordingly, an efficient way of function approximation is provided from the view point of the number of kernel functions as well as increased learning speed.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 提供了一种基于非参数估计的函数逼近方法,该方法使用输入层、输出层和隐藏层三层网络。 输入层和输出层具有线性激活单元,而隐藏层具有具有边界和局部性特征的非线性激活单元。 整个学习序列分为两个阶段。 第一阶段根据用户对网络所需精度水平的要求估计核函数的数量,第二阶段与参数估计有关。 在第二阶段,在输出层和隐藏层之间应用线性学习规则,在隐藏层和输入层之间应用非线性(分段线性)学习规则。 因此,从核函数的数量以及提高的学习速度的角度来看,提供了一种有效的函数逼近方法。

标题: 情報共有支援システム
摘要:
【課題】公開情報を有効利用を図るとともに、無駄な情報の増加を防ぎ共有される情報の質の向上が図れる情報共有支援システムを提供する。
【解決手段】公開情報を登録する登録手段1と、登録手段で登録された公開情報をユーザの要求に応じて検索する情報検索手段2と、検索手段で検索された公開情報をユーザの要求に応じて提示する情報提示手段2と、情報提示手段でユーザに提示される公開情報に関連する付加情報を入力する入力手段3と、前記公開情報と前記入力手段で入力された付加情報をこれらの意味関係と対応づけて蓄積する付加情報蓄積手段9、10と、前記情報提供手段で情報を提示する際に、前記付加情報と公開情報との意味関係に基づいて前記付加情報の提示制御を行う付加情報提示制御手段4とを具備する。
摘要(译)(简体中文):
本发明提供一种信息共享支持系统,能够有效地利用公共信息,防止无用信息的增加,并提高共享信息的质量。 
 [解决方案] 用于登记公共信息的登记装置1、用于根据用户请求检索由登记装置登记的公共信息的信息检索装置2、以及响应于用户请求由检索装置检索的公共信息。输入装置3,用于输入与信息呈现装置呈现给用户的公共信息有关的附加信息; 附加信息存储装置9和10,用于存储与语义关系相关联的信息,并且当信息提供装置呈现信息时,呈现附加信息的控制是基于附加信息和公共信息之间的语义关系进行的。附加信息呈现控制装置4。

标题: ニューロコンピュータの非同期制御方式
摘要: PURPOSE:To realize asynchronous control with small area by selecting a means in which a neuron to perform signal processing in one processing cycle is limited to only one at random. CONSTITUTION:A selector 8 which selects the neuron to perform the signal processing in one processing cycle out of the neurons is provided. Initial values x1(0), x2(0), and x3(0) supplied to initial value input terminals 4, 5 and 6 are inputted to each neuron, and the neurons 1-3 by which the signal processing are performed are selected by the selector 8, and it is assumed that the neuron 1, for example, is selected. In the neuron 1, the inner product of x1(0), x2(0), and x3(0) and weight w11, w12, and w13 that is the output of weight memory 9 is calculated, and a value x1(1) to which the result of above calculation is converted by a nonlinear function is outputted. Such cycle is a first arithmetic cycle, and a stable solution can be surely obtained by repeating the cycle. Thereby, the asynchronous control small in capacity can be realized.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 目的:通过选择一种神经元在一个处理周期内执行信号处理的方式被限制为随机一个,来实现小面积的异步控制。 组成:提供了一个选择器 8,它选择神经元在一个处理周期中执行信号处理的神经元。 提供给初始值输入端子4、5和6的初始值x1(0)、x2(0)和x3(0)被输入到每个神经元,并且执行信号处理的神经元1-3由下式选择 选择器8,并且假设例如选择了神经元1。 在神经元1中,计算x1(0)、x2(0)和x3(0)与作为权重存储器9的输出的权重w11、w12和w13的内积,并且值x1(1) 输出通过非线性函数将上述计算的结果转换成的。 这样的循环是第一个算术循环,通过重复循环肯定可以得到稳定的解。 因此,可以实现小容量的异步控制。

标题: Method and apparatus for multi-optional processing, storing, transmitting and retrieving graphical and tabular data in a mobile transportation distributable and/or networkable communications and/or data processing system
摘要: A method and apparatus for rapid search and co-display of graphics and tabular data for both local and distributed computer dsystems on a mobile station. The method rapidly selects and displays related graphical and text information via a Graphical User Interface (GUI) from both a Graphical Relational Database (GRDB) and large tabular database. An operator on a mobile station such as a plane or car enters a query where previously encoded and stored graphics elements are selected, via a control program on a host computer located on the mobile system, from a mass storage device and displayed with related text information on a local display. This method provides intelligent selection and display of graphics data based on an analysis by the system as to what graphics elements or images are required to satisfy the operator query, and how these elements are to be displayed in conjunction with related tabular (text) data.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种用于移动台上的本地和分布式计算机系统的图形和表格数据的快速搜索和共同显示的方法和设备。 该方法通过图形用户界面 (GUI) 从图形关系数据库 (GRDB) 和大型表格数据库中快速选择和显示相关的图形和文本信息。 移动站(例如飞机或汽车)上的操作员输入查询,其中通过位于移动系统上的主机上的控制程序从大容量存储设备中选择先前编码和存储的图形元素并显示相关的文本信息 在本地显示器上。 该方法基于系统对需要哪些图形元素或图像来满足操作员查询以及如何结合相关表格(文本)数据显示这些元素的分析来提供图形数据的智能选择和显示。

标题: Vector relational characteristical object
摘要: This invention relates to a method of identifying attributes when documents are grouped to form document relationships within a document management system. Document groupings frequently require the identification of all documents within the relationship with a particular attribute. However, when individual documents store attributes along with document contents, individual querying of each document is required when the information is sought later. This invention provides a Vector Relational Characteristical Object, available to access mechanisms, and containing fields to identify a particular attribute. Each field in the Vector Relational Characteristical Object is followed by an identifier which uniquely identifies the document which possess the particular attribute.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 本发明涉及一种在文档被分组以在文档管理系统内形成文档关系时识别属性的方法。 文档分组经常需要识别具有特定属性的关系中的所有文档。 然而,当单个文档与文档内容一起存储属性时,在以后查找信息时需要对每个文档进行单独查询。 本发明提供了一种向量关系特征对象,可用于访问机制,并包含用于识别特定属性的字段。 向量关系特征对象中的每个字段后跟一个标识符,该标识符唯一地标识具有特定属性的文档。

标题: Method and apparatus for detecting error strings in a text
摘要: A system for checking the spelling of words and character strings without the need for a stored dictionary of words and the memory required thereby. The system selects an error-free string and modifies it according to one or more rules which change the error-free string to a possible error string. The rules creating the possible error string can modify the error-free string by predictable character manipulation to yield usual and common errors of the character string. The frequency of occurrence of both the error and error-free strings within the text are determined. These frequencies are compared to each other and, based upon the comparison, the system decides whether the possible error string is an actual error string. The system can use modifying rules which are psychological or technically related to the computer system or operator, and rules which correspond to errors common with specialized input methods, such as character and speech recognition.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种用于检查单词和字符串的拼写而不需要存储的单词字典和所需内存的系统。 系统选择一个无错误字符串并根据一个或多个规则修改它,将无错误字符串更改为可能的错误字符串。 创建可能错误字符串的规则可以通过可预测的字符操作来修改无错误字符串,以产生字符串的常见和常见错误。 确定文本中错误字符串和无错误字符串的出现频率。 这些频率相互比较,并且基于比较,系统决定可能的错误字符串是否是实际的错误字符串。 该系统可以使用与计算机系统或操作员心理或技术相关的修改规则,以及与特殊输入方法常见的错误相对应的规则,例如字符和语音识别。

标题: 基板実装検査装置
摘要: PURPOSE:To improve the accuracy in inspection for the mounting state of a board by providing a constitution wherein a plurality of feature quantities extracted from input image data are used, and the mounted state of the board is inspected by a plurality of methods having the different principles. CONSTITUTION:Analog image signals in R (red), G (green) and B (blue) colors which are picked up through a CCD camera 101 are stored in frame memories 105 - 107 through A/D converters 102 - 104. The image data pass through an interface 108, an averaging circuit 109 and a noise removing part 110, and a region is extracted with a region extracting part 111. Feature quantities such as position data, shape data and the like are extracted from the extracted region in a feature-quantity extracting parts 112. Pattern matching between the feature quantity of the position data and the reference pattern from a reference-pattern generating part 115 is performed by a reverse-truth-value limiting method in a reverse-truth-value-limiting-method operating part 113. The feature quantity of the shape data and the like are matched with a reference pattern by fuzzy clustering in a fuzzy-clustering operation part 114. The results of two operations are synthesized in a Dempster combining part 116. The result of judgement is outputted from a judged-result outputting part 117.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 目的:通过提供一种结构,其中使用从输入图像数据中提取的多个特征量,并通过具有不同的多种方法检查电路板的安装状态,从而提高检查电路板安装状态的准确性。 原则。 组成:通过 CCD 摄像机 101 拾取的 R(红色)、G(绿色)和 B(蓝色)颜色的模拟图像信号通过 A/D 转换器 102-104 存储在帧存储器 105-107 中。图像数据 通过接口108、平均电路109和噪声去除部110,由区域提取部111提取区域。从提取的区域中提取位置数据、形状数据等特征量。  -数量提取部分112。位置数据的特征量与来自参考图案生成部分115的参考图案之间的图案匹配是通过逆真值限制方法中的逆真值限制方法执行的 运算部113。在模糊聚类运算部114中通过模糊聚类将形状数据等的特征量与参考图案匹配。在Dempster组合部116中合成两个运算的结果。结果 判断的t从判断结果输出部117输出。

标题: VERFAHREN ZUR BESTIMMUNG DER LOKALEN ORIENTIERUNG EINES KONTURSEGMENTES UND ZUR BESTIMMUNG VON LINIEN UND ECKEN
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种确定二进制轮廓图像的局部区域中轮廓的分段的方向的方法。确定具有预定值并且存在于多个径向方向上的像素的数量，所述多个径向方向的中心是具有预定值的局部区域中的像素之一，并且判断该片段存在于像素数量的方向上更伟大。此外，当在一个方向上存在的预定值的像素数比在两个相邻方向上存在的预定值的像素数之和大预定值时，判断该段存在于该方向上。针对轮廓点的每个像素检测两个方向，其中像素数量更大。这两个方向是构成一个或多个构成一条准线方向上的一个点的点还是一个角附近的点取决于它们是否在180°方向或它们与180°方向有多大来确定。构成彼此相邻且具有相同方向的区段的点被检测为区段。从拐角附近的每个点确定位置和方向，并确定拐角附近的相邻点的位置和方向的代表值。 <IMAGE>

标题: 指紋検知装置
摘要:
【課題】 指の状態に依存せず、常に良好に、指紋の正面から見た指紋パターンを得る。
【解決手段】 平行平板からなる透明基体1の表面1S上に、気体または流動体からなる中間層11と、この中間層11を形成する気体または流動体を密閉する薄膜状の表面フィルム層12とを設けるとともに、透明基体表面1Sに細かな凹凸からなる散乱面を設けて、指紋3Aの押圧により、この表面フィルム層12を介して、指紋3Aの稜線部(凸部)および谷間部(凹部)を中間層11に転写させ、透明基体表面1Sと表面フィルム層12とが接するか否かによる光の振る舞いの違いを、指紋パターンとして指紋正面から検出する。
摘要(译)(简体中文):
无论手指的状态如何,从指纹正面看到的指纹图案总是很好地获得。 
 解决方案: 由气体或流体制成的中间层 11 和密封形成中间层 11 的气体或流体的薄膜表面层 12 设置在由平行板制成的透明基板 1 的表面 1S 上。透明基材表面1S,在透明基板1S的表面上设置由微细凹凸构成的散射面,转印到中间层11上,根据透明基板表面1S和透明基板表面1S的有无,光行为的差异。与表面薄膜层12接触的指纹从正面检测为指纹图案。

标题: 線上文字識別裝置
摘要: 【課題】提供一種線上文字識別裝置，防止由輸入的文字圖型中之未預期之成分所引之識別率之降低，而且提高對連續字等之識別率。【解決手段】一種線上文字識別裝置，包括抽出關於藉著以折線近似來自輸入部l之輸入的文字圖型上之座標點所得到之各片段(Segment)之方向、長度及特徵點之特徵抽出部2、將辭典內文字之片段和自輸入的文字圖型所得到之片段對應後計算片段對應距離之特徵點對應部3、將由和辭典所指定之字跡線(Stroke)上之特徵點組對應之輸入的文字圖型之字跡線上之特徵點組所決定區間之特徵資料作為對應字跡線特徵抽出之指定區間特徵抽出部4以及併用所計算之對應字跡線特徵之距離和片段對應之距離後計算候選文字之特徵比對部5。
摘要(译)(简体中文): 【课题】提供一种线上文字识别装置,防止由输入的文字图型中之未预期之成分所引之识别率之降低,而且提高对连续字等之识别率。  【解决手段】一种线上文字识别装置,包括抽出关于借着以折线近似来自输入部l之输入的文字图型上之座标点所得到之各片段(Segment)之方向、长度及特征点之特征抽出 部2、将辞典内文字之片段和自输入的文字图型所得到之片段对应后计算片段对应距离之特征点对应部3、将由和辞典所指定之字迹线(Stroke)上之特征点组对应 之输入的文字图型之字迹线上之特征点组所决定区间之特征资料作为对应字迹线特征抽出之指定区间特征抽出部4以及并用所计算之对应字迹线特征之距离和片段对应之距离后计算 候选文字之特征比对部5。

标题: 多値ニューラルネットワーク学習方式
摘要:
(修正有)
【課題】 不正解の出力ユニットにおける誤差の絶対値の最小値から、最適な重み係数更新誤差信号を生成して、重み係数を更新する学習方式により、高速且つ安定に所望の出力信号を得る。
【解決手段】 2値教師信号を用いて学習する2値ニューラルネットワークにおいて、該2値教師信号に等しい2値出力ユニット信号を送出する出力ユニットに対し、該2値教師信号から出力ユニット信号を差し引いて得た誤差信号の絶対値が第1のスレショルドより小さいときは、該誤差信号と逆極性の、誤差信号に反比例する重み係数更新誤差信号を生成し、一方該誤差信号の絶対値が該第1のスレショルドよりも大きいときは、該誤差信号より小さい振幅の同極性の重み係数更新誤差信号を生成する重み係数更新誤差信号生成器10と、該振幅あるいは更に該第1のスレショルドを制御する為のローカルミニマム捕獲状態検出器15とを少なくとも用いて、重み係数更新誤差信号を元に重み係数を更新する。
摘要(译)(简体中文):
(有更正) 
 通过根据错误输出单元中的误差的最小绝对值生成最佳加权因子更新误差信号并更新加权因子的学习方法,可以快速稳定地获得期望的输出信号。 
 解决方案:在使用二进制教师信号学习的二进制神经网络中,对于输出二进制输出单元信号等于二进制教师信号的输出单元,从二进制教师信号中减去输出单元信号。当绝对值本方法得到的误差信号小于第一阈值,产生与误差信号极性相反、与误差信号成反比的加权因子更新误差信号,误差信号的绝对值小于第一阈值;加权因子更新误差信号发生器10,当大于阈值1时,产生与所述误差信号相同极性且幅值更小的加权因子更新误差信号;以及局部最小值捕获状态检测器15用于根据加权因子更新误差信号更新加权因子。

标题: Data processing system
摘要: A data processing apparatus in which data of a book edited by the use of various element data of one page such as documents, illustrations, and photographs are decomposed into those concerning layout and those concerning elements to be stored. The data processing apparatus is provided with data retrieval means which comprises data retrieval table memory means having titles and indexes memorized in the hierarchical structure therein, n'th rank index input means for admitting n'th rank data indexes, data selection means for selecting (n+1)'th rank data corresponding to the n'th rank index from the data retrieval table memory means, data existence discrimination means for performing the decision as to whether or not the (n+1)'th rank data are present in the data retrieval table memory means, and element data reading means for reading data out of the element data memory means when the presence of the (n+1)'th rank data is confirmed.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种数据处理设备,其中通过使用诸如文档、插图和照片等一页的各种元素数据编辑的书籍数据被分解为与布局有关的那些和与要存储的元素有关的那些。 数据处理装置配备有数据检索装置,该装置包括数据检索表存储装置,其中具有存储在分层结构中的标题和索引,用于接纳第n级数据索引的第n级索引输入装置,用于选择( 与来自数据检索表存储器的第n个等级索引相对应的第n+1个等级数据,用于执行关于第(n+1)个等级数据是否存在于其中的判定的数据存在判断装置。 数据检索表存储装置,以及元素数据读取装置,用于当确认存在第(n+1)级数据时从元素数据存储装置中读取数据。

标题: Converting documents, with links to other electronic information, between hardcopy and electronic formats
摘要: A conversion method and apparatus that allows for converting a hardcopy document into a hyperdocument and vice versa. During hardcopy to hyperdocument conversion, hypertext information stored on the hardcopy document is used to set up links to other documents. During hyperdocument to hardcopy document conversion, hypertext link information is encoded and stored on the hardcopy document.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种允许将硬拷贝文档转换为超文档并且反之亦然的转换方法和装置。 在硬拷贝到超文档的转换过程中,存储在硬拷贝文档上的超文本信息用于建立到其他文档的链接。 在超文档到硬拷贝文档的转换过程中,超文本链接信息被编码并存储在硬拷贝文档中。

标题: Adaptive dictionary for a fingerprint recognizer
摘要: A method and apparatus for fingerprint recognition is provided in accordance with the present invention to achieve a higher rate of recognition by subsequently storing fingerprint patterns with higher rates of correspondence in place of fingerprint patterns already stored having low rates of correspondence.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 根据本发明提供了一种用于指纹识别的方法和设备,以通过随后存储具有较高对应率的指纹图案代替已经存储的具有低对应率的指纹图案来实现较高的识别率。

标题: Apparat zum Untersuchen einer bestückten elektronischen Vorrichtung.
摘要: A packaged substrate inspecting apparatus, in which image data of a packaged substrate (2b) under inspection obtained by picking up the image of the substrate (2b) are processed through predetermined processing procedure for examining packaged states of parts (1b) mounted on the packaged substrate (2b). The apparatus comprises an imaging unit (3) for picking up the image of a packaged substrate (2b), a decision unit (5) for deciding the state of the parts (1b) mounted on the packaged substrate (2b), and a visualizing unit (6) for displaying visibly the result of the decision and position of the relevant part in correspondence with each other. The apparatus can further include a land extracting unit (4) for extracting lands from the image obtained through the imaging of the packaged substrate (2b) under inspection, an alarm condition setting unit for setting the condition for generating an alarm, and an alarm generating unit for generating the alarm when the alarm condition is met by the result of decision made by the decision unit (5).
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种封装体基板检查装置,通过规定的处理顺序对拍摄基板(2b)而得到的被检查的封装体基板(2b)的图像数据进行处理,以检查安装在封装体上的部件(1b)的封装状态。 底物(2b)。 该装置包括用于拾取封装基板(2b)的图像的成像单元(3)、用于判定安装在封装基板(2b)上的部件(1b)的状态的判定单元(5)、以及可视化单元(5)。 单元(6),用于可视地显示彼此对应的决策结果和相关部分的位置。 该装置还可以包括:凸台提取单元(4),用于从通过对被检查的封装基板(2b)成像而获得的图像中提取凸台;警报条件设置单元,用于设置产生警报的条件;以及警报产生单元 用于当判决单元(5)的判决结果满足报警条件时,产生报警的单元。

标题: 情報検索装置
摘要:
【課題】 仮想三次元空間に対して設定されるアンカーから検索を行う情報検索装置であって、広範な検索範囲を使いやすいユーザインターフェースにて検索できる情報検索装置を得る。
【解決手段】 視点情報の変化に対応した移動アンカーを生成する移動アンカー生成部180を設ける。三次元空間生成部184は、通常の物体だけでなく、移動アンカーを表す物体も三次元画像に生成する。利用者はマウス等で移動アンカーである仮想的な物体を画像上にて選択する。リンクデータ記憶部74には移動アンカーに関するリンクデータの登録されている。検索部192は、通常の物体をアンカーとするだけでなく移動アンカーによっても検索を行うことができる。検索結果を表示処理する応用プログラム実行部70には任意のものを用いることができ、幅広い関連情報を取り扱うことができる。
摘要(译)(简体中文):
种类代码:A1 摘要:一种信息检索设备,可以从设置在虚拟三维空间中的锚点执行检索,并且可以通过易于使用的用户界面检索广泛的检索范围。 
 解决方案:提供运动锚点生成单元 180,用于生成对应于视点信息变化的运动锚点。  3D空间生成器184不仅生成正常对象而且生成表示3D图像中的移动锚点的对象。 用户用鼠标等在图像上选择一个虚拟对象,它是一个移动的锚点。 链接数据存储单元74登记与移动锚有关的链接数据。 搜索单元192不仅可以使用普通对象作为锚点进行搜索,还可以使用移动的锚点进行搜索。 任何程序都可以用作显示搜索结果的应用程序执行单元70,并且可以处理范围广泛的相关信息。
发明人地址: 東京都千代田区丸の内二丁目2番3号  三菱電機株式会社内

标题: A system and method for automatic optical inspection
摘要: An optical inspection system for inspecting faults on circuit boards like printed circuit boards and wire scribed circuit boards is disclosed. A video camera for receiving desired images of hole sites on a wire circuit board is provided. The camera converts each image to electrical video signals. A frame grabber converts electrical video signals to a plurality of pixels and stores information representing color element values contained in each of the pixels. A panel feature detector receives the color element values of the pixel that has to be analyzed and provides a wire indication when the color element value of the pixel corresponds to the wire feature. A fault detector circuit receives the wire indication from the panel feature detector corresponding to predetermined pixels associated with the hole site for determining faults on the circuit board.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 公开了一种用于检查诸如印刷电路板和划线电路板之类的电路板上的故障的光学检查系统。 提供了一种用于接收线路电路板上的孔位点的所需图像的摄像机。 摄像机将每个图像转换为电子视频信号。 帧抓取器将电视频信号转换为多个像素并存储表示包含在每个像素中的颜色元素值的信息。 面板特征检测器接收必须分析的像素的颜色元素值,并在像素的颜色元素值对应于线特征时提供线指示。 故障检测器电路接收来自面板特征检测器的对应于与孔位相关联的预定像素的导线指示,用于确定电路板上的故障。

标题: IC card having fingerprint sensor designed to withstand bending
摘要: A chip card comprising a card made from a plastics material (1) capable of elastically withstanding a relative bending and in which a microelectronic data processing chip (4) is encased, a thin microelectronic wafer (5) made from a semiconductor material, such as a finger print sensor, additionally being joined to the card (1). Said wafer (5) is sub-divided into a small number of juxtaposed chips (7) disposed in a given pattern and separated from one another by a predetermined distance (d) which is sufficient for each separating strip (8) of plastics material to be slightly bent without causing adjacent chips (7) to become unstuck and/or rupture; electrical links are established between the chips to provide electrical continuity.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种芯片卡,包括由塑料材料(1)制成的卡,该塑料材料(1)能够弹性地承受相对弯曲并且其中封装了微电子数据处理芯片(4),由半导体材料制成的薄微电子晶片(5),例如 指纹传感器,另外与卡片 (1) 相连。 所述晶片(5)被细分为以给定图案布置的少量并列芯片(7),并且彼此分开预定距离(d),该预定距离(d)足以使每个塑料材料分隔条(8) 轻微弯曲而不会导致相邻芯片 (7) 脱开和/或破裂; 芯片之间建立电连接以提供电连续性。
法律状态/事件: 未缴年费 | 权利转移

标题: Backup, restoration, migration systems of a database
摘要: This invention provides an easy backup, restoration and migration method of a database system. The command interpreter receives a backup request and the controller identifies the backup object in the backup request by referring to the definition. The backup-migrate-restore-procedure generator generates a backup procedure of the backup object identified by the controller by referring to the definition. The controller converts the backup object to a command form of SQL in accordance with the procedure generated by the backup-migrate-restore-procedure generator and stores in the storage medium. The stored data are the replace information, definition, dependence information, data, journal and program. Restoration of the system and migration of the database to another system is enable by inputting such data. Backup, migration and restoration of a system is able to be made in an identical apparatus. Furthermore, since a command form of SQL is used, a special means is unnecessary for migration and restoration.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 本发明提供了一种简便的数据库系统备份、恢复和迁移方法。 命令解释器接收备份请求,控制器通过参考定义识别备份请求中的备份对象。  backup-migrate-restore-procedure生成器参照定义生成控制器标识的备份对象的备份过程。 控制器按照备份-迁移-恢复-过程生成器生成的过程将备份对象转换为SQL的命令形式并存储在存储介质中。 存储的数据是替换信息、定义、依赖信息、数据、日志和程序。 通过输入这些数据,可以实现系统的恢复和数据库向另一个系统的迁移。 系统的备份、迁移和恢复可以在同一台设备中进行。 此外,由于使用SQL的命令形式,迁移和恢复不需要特殊的手段。

标题: Methods and apparatus for unknown speaker labeling using concurrent speech recognition, segmentation, classification and clustering
摘要: A method and apparatus are disclosed for identifying speakers participating in an audio-video source, whether or not such speakers have been previously registered or enrolled. The speaker identification system uses an enrolled speaker database that includes background models for unenrolled speakers, such as "unenrolled male" or "unenrolled female," to assign a speaker label to each identified segment. Speaker labels are identified for each speech segment by comparing the segment utterances to the enrolled speaker database and finding the "closest" speaker, if any. A speech segment having an unknown speaker is initially assigned a general speaker label from the set of background models. The "unenrolled" segment is assigned a segment number and receives a cluster identifier assigned by the clustering system. If a given segment is assigned a temporary speaker label associated with an unenrolled speaker, the user can be prompted by the present invention to identify the speaker. Once the user assigns a speaker label to an audio segment having an unknown speaker, the same speaker name can be automatically assigned to any segments that are assigned to the same cluster and the enrolled speaker database can be automatically updated to enroll the previously unknown speaker.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 公开了一种用于识别参与音频-视频源的说话者的方法和装置,无论这些说话者之前是否已经注册或登记。 说话人识别系统使用一个已登记的说话人数据库,其中包括未登记的说话人的背景模型,例如“未登记的男性”或“未登记的女性”,以将说话人标签分配给每个识别的片段。 通过将片段话语与登记的说话者数据库进行比较并找到“最接近”的说话者(如果有的话),为每个语音片段识别说话者标签。 具有未知说话人的语音段最初被分配来自背景模型集合的一般说话人标签。  “未注册”段被分配一个段号并接收由集群系统分配的集群标识符。 如果给定的片段被分配了与未登记的说话者相关联的临时说话者标签,则本发明可以提示用户识别说话者。 一旦用户将说话者标签分配给具有未知说话者的音频段,相同的说话者名称可以自动分配给分配给同一集群的任何段并且登记的说话者数据库可以自动更新以登记先前未知的说话者。
