标题: Fingerprint detection apparatus with partial fingerprint images
摘要: A fingerprint detection apparatus which includes a detection array having a detection surface, and a fingerprint platform configured to supply a plurality of partial fingerprint images of a fingerprint to the detection surface as the fingerprint is moved relative to the detection surface. The fingerprint detection apparatus also includes a processing device that is configured to construct a final fingerprint image from the plurality of partial fingerprint images supplied to the detection surface. A method of detecting a fingerprint image comprising the steps of: (1) supplying a plurality of partial fingerprint images of a fingerprint to a detection surface of a detection array as the fingerprint is moved relative to the detection surface; and (2) constructing a final fingerprint image from the plurality of partial fingerprint images.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种指纹检测装置,其包括具有检测表面的检测阵列,以及被配置为当指纹相对于检测表面移动时将指纹的多个部分指纹图像提供给检测表面的指纹平台。 指纹检测设备还包括处理装置,其被配置为从提供给检测表面的多个部分指纹图像构建最终指纹图像。 一种检测指纹图像的方法,包括以下步骤: (1)当指纹相对于检测表面移动时,将指纹的多个部分指纹图像提供给检测阵列的检测表面;  (2)从多个部分指纹图像中构建最终的指纹图像。
发明人: BELONGIE, SERGE J. | BJORN, VANCE C.

标题: Personal computer diary
摘要: A computer diary archives a diary entry by creating, time stamping, authenticating and permanently storing a reference data block along with each diary entry. An archived diary entry can only be modified by placing original text within compartment codes, such as cross-out or tear-out codes, and by placing inserted text within insertion codes so that the original diary entry can be recreated from the modified diary entry. The reference data block, which can be the original diary entry, a canonical version of the original diary entry, or a one way fixed length encryption (hash) of the original diary entry, cannot be modified and is used to authenticate the original diary entry. The diary program also monitors text entry for aliases and relative date phrases, and upon detection, prompts the user for entry or enters a specific identifier for each detected alias in an alias compartment or an absolute date for each relative date phrase in an implied date compartment in the diary entry.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 计算机日记通过创建、时间戳、验证和永久存储参考数据块以及每个日记条目来归档日记条目。 存档的日记条目只能通过将原始文本放置在隔间代码(例如划掉或撕掉代码)中以及通过将插入文本放置在插入代码中以便可以从修改后的日记条目中重新创建原始日记条目来进行修改。 参考数据块,可以是原始日记条目,原始日记条目的规范版本,或原始日记条目的单向固定长度加密(散列),不能修改,用于验证原始日记条目 . 日记程序还监视别名和相对日期短语的文本输入,并在检测到时提示用户输入或为别名隔间中的每个检测到的别名输入特定标识符或为隐含日期隔间中的每个相对日期短语输入绝对日期 在日记条目中。

标题: Network-based authentication of computer user
摘要: A network-based authentication scheme is provided that performs authentication in a centralized manner for the stand-alone computers of a particular organization. Since authentication is centralized, the individual computers do not need to store authentication information, and control over all of the computers rests in a single location, enabling the system administrator to manage access and utilization of the computers from this location. The network-based authentication scheme includes an authentication manager, remotely located with respect to a local computer, that performs authentication for the local computer. The authentication manager receives login information from the local computer, verifies this information against an authentication file, and returns indications of the services on the local computer that the user is able to utilize. The local computer receives these indications and displays icons representing the services available to that user. The user may then select an icon, causing an applet to be downloaded from the authentication manager onto the local computer to facilitate the user's utilization of the corresponding service.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 提供了一种基于网络的身份验证方案,该方案以集中方式对特定组织的独立计算机执行身份验证。 由于身份验证是集中式的,因此各个计算机不需要存储身份验证信息,并且对所有计算机的控制都集中在一个位置,从而使系统管理员能够从该位置管理计算机的访问和使用。 基于网络的认证方案包括相对于本地计算机远程定位的认证管理器,其为本地计算机执行认证。 身份验证管理器从本地计算机接收登录信息,对照身份验证文件验证此信息,并返回用户能够使用的本地计算机上的服务的指示。 本地计算机接收这些指示并显示代表该用户可用的服务的图标。 然后,用户可以选择一个图标,从而将一个小应用程序从认证管理器下载到本地计算机上,以方便用户使用相应的服务。
发明人: RADUCHEL, WILLIAM J. | GUPTA, ABHAY | WILSON, YVONNE
发明人地址: Palo Alto, CA | Milipitas, CA | Mountain View, CA

标题: Word spotting in bitmap images using context-sensitive character models without baselines
摘要: Font-independent spotting of user-defined keywords in a scanned image. Word identification is based on features of the entire word without the need for segmentation or OCR, and without the need to recognize non-keywords. Font-independent character models are created using hidden Markov models (HMMs) and arbitrary keyword models are built from the character HMM components. Word or text line bounding boxes are extracted from the image, a set of features based on the word shape, (and preferably also the word internal structure) within each bounding box is extracted, this set of features is applied to a network that includes one or more keyword HMMs, and a determination is made. The identification of word bounding boxes for potential keywords includes the steps of reducing the image (say by 2x) and subjecting the reduced image to vertical and horizontal morphological closing operations. The bounding boxes of connected components in the resulting image are then used to hypothesize word or text line bounding boxes, and the original bitmaps within the boxes are used to hypothesize words. In a particular embodiment, a range of structuring elements is used for the closing operations to accommodate the variation of inter- and intra-character spacing with font and font size.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 扫描图像中用户定义的关键字与字体无关的定位。 词识别是基于整个词的特征,不需要分词或OCR,也不需要识别非关键词。 与字体无关的字符模型是使用隐马尔可夫模型 (HMM) 创建的,并且任意关键字模型是从字符 HMM 组件构建的。 从图像中提取单词或文本行边界框,提取每个边界框内基于单词形状(最好还包括单词内部结构)的一组特征,将这组特征应用于包括一个 或多个关键字HMM,并做出判断。 潜在关键字的词边界框的识别包括缩小图像(例如 2 倍)和对缩小的图像进行垂直和水平形态学闭合操作的步骤。 然后使用结果图像中连接组件的边界框来假设单词或文本行边界框,并且框内的原始位图用于假设单词。 在特定实施例中,一系列结构元素用于闭合操作以适应字符间和字符内间距随字体和字体大小的变化。
发明人: WILCOX, LYNN D. | CHEN, FRANCINE R.
发明人地址: Portola Valley, CA | Menlo Park, CA

标题: 画像の動き測定方法および装置
摘要: PURPOSE: To simply measure the movement of a picture by comparing a size difference between a sampled (SP) point having maximum correlation value and an SP point having a maximum steep degree between plural SP points surrounding the SP point of the maximum correlation value with a size difference between the opposite points of the SP points. CONSTITUTION: A luminance signal inputted to an input terminal 1 in each frame is delayed only by one frame period in a picture memory 2 and secondary Fourier transformation(SFT) for the delayed signal is executed by a signal processing stage(ST) 3. On the other hand, the luminance signal from the terminal 1 is processed by SFT on an ST 4. A phase subtractor 5 finds out a phase difference of information outputted from the STs 3, 4 and inverted FT is executed by an ST 6 to obtain a correlation function. A maximum sample(SP) locator 7 finds out SP points having prescribed size or more from the correlation SPs, a peak locator 8 retrieves a maximum SP related to different peaks and sends the position P of the maximum SP to a steep locator 9 together with the correlation SP from the ST 6 and the locator 9 finds out steepest SP point D from eight SPs surrounding the position P and a selector 10 finds out a size difference d1 between the SPs of the points P, D and a difference d2 , between the point D and its opposite point. A comparator 11 mutually compares these differences d2 , d1 and a calculator 12 finds out a moving vector.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 目的:通过比较具有最大相关值的采样 (SP) 点与具有最大相关值的 SP 点周围的多个 SP 点之间具有最大陡度的 SP 点之间的大小差异,来简单地测量图片的运动。  SP 点的相对点之间的大小差异。 组成:在每一帧中输入到输入端 1 的亮度信号仅在图像存储器 2 中延迟一个帧周期,延迟信号的二次傅里叶变换 (SFT) 由信号处理阶段 (ST) 3 执行。 另一方面,来自终端1的亮度信号由ST 4上的SFT处理。相位减法器5找出从ST 3、4输出的信息的相位差,并由ST 6执行反相FT以获得a 相关函数。 最大样本(SP)定位器7从相关SP中找出具有规定大小或更大的SP点,峰值定位器8检索与不同峰值相关的最大SP,并将最大SP的位置P与陡峭定位器9一起发送到陡峭定位器9。 来自ST 6的相关性SP和定位器9从围绕位置P的八个SP中找出最陡的SP点D,并且选择器10找出点P、D的SP之间的大小差d1和点P、D之间的差d2。  D点和它的对立点。 比较器11相互比较这些差d2、d1并且计算器12找出移动矢量。

标题: Information reproducing device for reproducing multimedia information recorded in the form of optically readable code pattern, and information recording medium storing multimedia information in the same form
摘要: A code pattern of an information recording medium contains processing information necessary for editing data according to a restoration processing procedure for restoring multimedia information. The restoration processing procedure has a hierarchical structure of layers 1 to 5. The layer 5 has a file management function. The layer 4 has a function of collecting subset elements to create a subset and converting the same to create a data transfer unit or sector which the layer 5 deals with. The layer 3 or lower layer has a function of reading the code pattern from the information recording medium, subjecting the code pattern to a preset restoration process and outputting the subset elements.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 信息记录介质的代码图案包含根据用于恢复多媒体信息的恢复处理过程来编辑数据所必需的处理信息。 恢复处理过程具有层1至5的层次结构。层5具有文件管理功能。 第 4 层具有收集子集元素以创建子集并将其转换以创建第 5 层处理的数据传输单元或扇区的功能。 第3层或更低层具有从信息记录介质读取代码模式、对代码模式进行预设恢复处理并输出子集元素的功能。
[标]当前申请(专利权)人: SASAKI HIROSHI | FUJIMORI HIROYOSHI | IMADE SHINICHI | MATSUI SHINZO | MORI TAKESHI
发明人: SASAKI, HIROSHI | FUJIMORI, HIROYOSHI | IMADE, SHINICHI | MATSUI, SHINZO | MORI, TAKESHI
发明人地址: 96-4 Ishikawacho, Hachioji-shi, Tokyo, JP | Hachioji-shi, Tokyo, JP | Iruma-shi, Saitama-ken, JP | Kitatsuru-gun, Yamanashi-ken, JP | Machida-shi, Tokyo, JP

标题: Method for storing and retrieving sequential information
摘要: A method and design is provided for distributing and storing sets of temporally ordered information in a systematic and sequential fashion. This method is based on a model of how the brain functions in the distribution and storage of temporally ordered memories, but it can also be applied to the design of new biological, electronic or optical devices. These devices may be used in the testing and development of new therapeutic drugs, in the detection of toxic agents or impaired performance, or in the development of new industrial and consumer devices in which the orderly storage of sequential information is important.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 提供了一种方法和设计,用于以系统和顺序的方式分发和存储按时间排序的信息集。 这种方法基于大脑如何在时间有序记忆的分布和存储中发挥作用的模型,但它也可以应用于新的生物、电子或光学设备的设计。 这些设备可用于测试和开发新的治疗药物,检测有毒物质或性能受损,或开发新的工业和消费设备,其中有序存储顺序信息很重要。
[标]当前申请(专利权)人: 肯塔基大学研究基金会

标题: Dual channel advertising referencing vehicle location
摘要: A vehicle information device collects information concerning specific geographic points of interest. The operator recalls for display such information, including a display showing direction and distance of travel to a designated geographic point of interest relative to a then-current vehicle location. Dual channel advertising is transmitted by voice broadcast and by data broadcast. Upon hearing in the voice broadcast an advertisement of interest, the operator captures the associated data broadcast including, among other detailed text message information, the location of the advertiser. Distance and relative direction of travel from the current vehicle location to the geographic point of interest is thereby presented. Multiple geographic points of interest are stored for selective review whereby the user constructs a database containing locations of particular interest to a particular person.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 车辆信息设备收集有关特定地理兴趣点的信息。 操作员调用以显示这样的信息,包括显示相对于当时的当前车辆位置到指定地理兴趣点的行驶方向和距离的显示。 双频道广告通过语音广播和数据广播传输。 在听到语音广播中感兴趣的广告时,操作员捕获相关的数据广播,其中包括广告商的位置等详细的文本消息信息。 从而呈现从当前车辆位置到地理兴趣点的距离和相对行驶方向。 存储多个感兴趣的地理点以供选择性查看,由此用户构建包含特定人特别感兴趣的位置的数据库。

标题: Apparatus and method for cytometry using a capillary of defined volume
摘要: The apparatus and method of the present invention disclose a scanning imaging cytometer wherein an unprocessed biological fluid sample is reacted with a fluorescently-labeled binding agent. The reacted sample undergoes minimal processing before it is placed into a capillary tube. The sample is optically scanned and fluorescence excitation is recorded from a plurality of columnar regions of the capillary tube, each columnar region generally defined by the spot size of the excitation beam and the depth dimension of the capillary tube. A spatial filter of a sufficient pinhole diameter is selected to allow simultaneous volumetric detection of all fluorescent targets in each columnar region.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 本发明的设备和方法公开了一种扫描成像细胞仪,其中未处理的生物流体样品与荧光标记的结合剂反应。 反应后的样品在放入毛细管之前经过最少的处理。 对样本进行光学扫描,并从毛细管的多个柱状区域记录荧光激发,每个柱状区域通常由激发光束的光斑尺寸和毛细管的深度尺寸限定。 选择具有足够针孔直径的空间过滤器,以允许同时对每个柱状区域中的所有荧光目标进行体积检测。
发明人: BAER, THOMAS M. | DIETZ, LOUIS J. | DUBROW, ROBERT S. | HAYTER, PAUL G. | HODGES, MICHAEL | MANIAN, BALA S. | SHARTLE, ROBERT J.
发明人地址: 537 Drucilla Drive,Mountain View, California 94040,US | 759C Villa Street,Mountain View, California 94041,US | 37 Fay Avenue,San Carlos, California 94070,US | 1340 Concord Avenue,Los Altos, California 94024,US | 2778 Gaspar Court,Palo Alto, California 94306,US | 14240 Berry Hill Court,Los Altos, California 94022,US | 982 Madrone Way,Livermore, California 94550,US

标题: Method for segmenting features in an image
摘要: A dual echo magnetic resonance imaging system produces two registered images of a patient in which the images have different contrast relationships between different tissue types. A two dimensional feature space histogram of the two images is produced and a separate centroid is located in the feature space histogram for each one of a pair of tissue types. A Cartesian coordinate system is defined in the feature space so that one axis of the system passes through the two centroids. Vector decomposition is employed to project each image element data point in the feature space onto a point on the one axis. The fractional quantity of each tissue type present in the image element is determined based upon the Euclidean distances from that axis point to the respective centroids. The fractional quantity is calculated for each element in the original images to form a pair of tissue images. The elements of a tissue image are processed to measure the amount of that tissue type in the imaged portion of the patient.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 双回波磁共振成像系统产生患者的两个配准图像,其中图像在不同组织类型之间具有不同的对比度关系。 生成两个图像的二维特征空间直方图,并且对于一对组织类型中的每一个,一个单独的质心位于特征空间直方图中。 在特征空间中定义了笛卡尔坐标系,使得系统的一个轴穿过两个质心。 向量分解用于将特征空间中的每个图像元素数据点投影到一个轴上的一个点上。 基于从该轴点到相应质心的欧几里得距离来确定图像元素中存在的每种组织类型的分数。 对原始图像中的每个元素计算分数以形成一对组织图像。 处理组织图像的元素以测量患者的成像部分中该组织类型的数量。
[标]当前申请(专利权)人: 威斯康星校友研究基金会
发明人: KAO, YI-HSUAN | SORENSON, JAMES A. | BAHN, MARK M.

标题: Data to access files in an optical disk are copied to a hard drive where the data are maintained even upon removal of the disk
摘要: A data management method and apparatus used for a filing system in which management data is copied from an optical disk to a hard disk to manage image data stored in the optical disk. Hereupon, the optical disk has a storage capacity larger than that of the hard disk, but has an access time longer than that of the hard disk. Whenever new image data is recorded on the optical disk, new management data corresponding to the new image data is recorded on the hard disk, accordingly. The new image data is not copied from the hard disk to the optical disk until the management data on the hard disk satisfies a predetermined condition. That is, the new image data is not copied whenever the optical disk is ejected from an optical disk storage in the filing system. The new image data is to be recorded on the optical disk for many times. In addition, there occurs a case where it is necessary to use the optical disk for another filing system before all the image data is recorded thereon. Accordingly, the new image data is put together (accumulated) and then copied to the optical disk. Thus, the filing system can serve the average time for recording the new image data on the optical disk.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种用于文件系统的数据管理方法和设备,其中管理数据从光盘复制到硬盘以管理存储在光盘中的图像数据。 因此,光盘的存储容量比硬盘大,但存取时间比硬盘长。 每当在光盘上记录新的图像数据时,对应于新的图像数据的新的管理数据就相应地记录在硬盘上。 直到硬盘上的管理数据满足预定条件,新的图像数据才从硬盘复制到光盘。 即,无论何时从归档系统中的光盘存储器中弹出光盘,都不会复制新的图像数据。 新的图像数据将多次记录在光盘上。 此外,还发生在记录所有图像数据之前需要将光盘用于另一个文件系统的情况。 因此,新的图像数据被放在一起(累积),然后复制到光盘。 因此,归档系统可以为在光盘上记录新的图像数据提供平均时间。
当前第一申请(专利权)人: RICOH COMPANY, LTD., A JAPANESE CORP.

标题: System and method for providing structured tours of hypertext files
摘要: A system and method for providing structured tours of hypertext files. A server controls the presentation of hypertext files to a user. Accompanying information to the hypertext files in the form of an automated tour guide is presented and synchronized with the hypertext files by the tour server. A user may depart from the structured tour to explore linked files for a predetermined period of time, and may effect the content and order of the tour by indicating preferences at predetermined points along the tour. More than one user may take a tour, and the users on a tour may communicate with each other. Items may be purchased on a tour, and the user may send postcards based upon visited hypertext files to other users.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种用于提供超文本文件的结构化游览的系统和方法。 服务器控制向用户显示超文本文件。 自动导游形式的超文本文件的附加信息由旅游服务器呈现并与超文本文件同步。 用户可以在预定的时间段内离开结构化漫游去浏览链接的文件,并且可以通过在漫游的预定点指示偏好来影响漫游的内容和顺序。 可以有多个用户进行游览,并且游览中的用户可以相互交流。 可以在旅行中购买物品,并且用户可以将基于访问过的超文本文件的明信片发送给其他用户。
发明人: BLONDER GREG E. | MILEWSKI ALLEN E.

标题: Artificial neural network-based system for the autonomous generation of useful information
摘要: A device (20) for simulating human creativity employing a neural network (22) trained to produce input-output maps within some predetermined knowledge domain, an apparatus for subjecting the neural network to perturbations that produce changes in the predetermined knowledge domain, the neural network (22) having an optional output (26) for feeding the outputs of the neural network (22) to a second neural network (24) that evaluates and selects outputs based on training within the second neural network (24). The device may also include a reciprocal feed back connection (28) from the output of the second neural network (24) to the first neural network (22) to further influence and change what takes place in the aforesaid neural network.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种用于模拟人类创造力的设备 (20),该设备 (20) 使用受过训练以在某个预定知识域内产生输入-输出图的神经网络 (22), 一种用于使神经网络经受在预定知识域中产生变化的扰动的装置, 神经网络 (22)具有用于将神经网络(22)的输出馈送到第二神经网络(24)的可选输出(26),第二神经网络(24)基于第二神经网络(24)内的训练来评估和选择输出。 该装置还可以包括从第二神经网络(24)的输出到第一神经网络(22)的互惠反馈连接(28),以进一步影响和改变上述神经网络中发生的情况。

标题: Method of managing data structure containing both persistent data and transient data
摘要: According to a data management method of managing shared data which is shared by a plurality of processes and data inherent in a process which exists during execution of one particular process and disappears when the process is finished, when each process fetches shared data from a data base into a memory, whether the shared data requires data inherent in the process is checked. Any inherent data of the process is determined, if necessity for that data is determined. The determined inherent data of the process is stored in the memory. A pointer for the inherent data of the process, which is stored in the memory, is stored into the fetched shared data in accordance with attributes inherent in the process requiring the inherent data of the process.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 根据一种数据管理方法,当每个进程从数据库中获取共享数据时,管理由多个进程共享的共享数据和在一个特定进程的执行期间存在并在进程完成时消失的进程中固有的数据 到内存中,检查共享数据是否需要进程中固有的数据。 如果确定了该数据的必要性,则确定该过程的任何固有数据。 确定的过程固有数据存储在存储器中。 根据需要进程的固有数据的进程的固有属性,将存储在存储器中的进程固有数据的指针存储到取出的共享数据中。
发明人: KUROSAWA, TAKAHIRO | YOSHIMOTO, MASAHIKO | SHIBAYAMA, SHIGEKI | UEHARA, RYUHEI

标题: Digital adaptive receiver employing maximum-likelihood sequence estimation with neural networks
摘要: A maximum-likelihood sequence estimator receiver includes a matched filter connected to a digital transmission channel and a sampler for providing sampled signals output by the matched filter. The sampled signals are input to an analog neural network to provide high-speed outputs representative of the transmission channel signals. The neural network outputs are also provided as inputs to a coefficient estimator which produces coefficients for feedback to the matched filter. For time-varying transmission channel characteristics, the coefficient estimator provides a second coefficient output which is utilized for changing the interconnection strengths of the neural network connection matrix to offset the varying transmission channel characteristics.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 最大似然序列估计接收器包括连接到数字传输信道的匹配滤波器和用于提供由匹配滤波器输出的采样信号的采样器。 采样信号输入到模拟神经网络,以提供代表传输通道信号的高速输出。 神经网络输出也作为输入提供给系数估计器,该系数估计器产生用于反馈给匹配滤波器的系数。 对于时变传输通道特性,系数估计器提供第二系数输出,用于改变神经网络连接矩阵的互连强度以抵消变化的传输通道特性。
当前第一申请(专利权)人: TEXAS INSTRUMENTS INCORPORATED, A CORP. OF DE.

标题: 制御シーケンスソフトウェアの自動生成方法とその装置
摘要:
【目的】コンピュータによって制御される機械システムに必要な制御シーケンスソフトウェアを自動生成すること。
【構成】制御シーケンスプログラム自動生成手法の流れは、「制御シーケンス仕様の導出」→「定性的制御シーケンスの導出」→「定量情報の付加(定量的制御シーケンスの導出)」→「Cプログラムの生成」という4つのアルゴリズムからなる。定性的制御シーケンスとは、時間順序に従った状態遷移列である。この定性的制御シーケンスは、定性推論システムを活用することにより導出する。定量的制御シーケンスは、定性的制御シーケンスに状態間の定量的な時間を付加したものである。時間情報は、設計情報データベース5にストアされた機械部分の設計情報に基づいて算出する。
【効果】ソフトウェア開発にかかる人的な負担を軽減することができる。
摘要(译)(简体中文):
【目的】自动生成计算机控制的机械系统所需的控制序列软件。 
 【结构】控制序列程序自动化方法的流程是“推导控制序列规范”->“推导定性控制序列”->“添加定量信息(推导定量控制序列)”->“生成C程序”。它由四个算法组成。 定性控制序列是根据时间顺序的状态转换序列。 该定性控制序列是通过利用定性推理系统得出的。 定量控制序列是定性控制序列加上状态之间的定量时间。 时间信息是根据设计信息数据库5中存储的机械零件的设计信息计算得出的。 
 [效果] 可以减轻软件开发的人为负担。

标题: Sentence generating system
摘要: A system and method for generating a sentence from an inputted semantic representation includes a memory for storing a limitation which a generated sentence should satisfy generator, a generating sentence from the inputted semantic representation based upon the stored limitation, an evaluator for evaluation the generated results, and an altering device for altering the stored limitation based upon the evaluation. A cycle composed of sentence generation, evaluation of the generated sentence and alteration of the limitation is repeated until the evaluation satisfies a predetermined criterion.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种用于从输入的语义表示生成句子的系统和方法,包括用于存储生成的句子应该满足生成器的限制的存储器、基于存储的限制从输入的语义表示生成句子、用于评估生成的结果的评估器, 以及用于根据评估改变存储的限制的改变装置。 重复由句子生成、生成句子的评估和限制的改变组成的循环,直到评估满足预定标准。
当前第一申请(专利权)人: CANON KABUSHIKI KAISHA, A CORP.OF JAPAN

标题: Image clustering apparatus
摘要: For determining class mean and covariance in class so as to make distribution parameters of pixel express statistical properties of the object , and for clustering the image stably at high speed , the apparatus has: (a) frame memory storing image composed of coded pixels, (b) reading device reading out values of pixels randomly about horizonta land vertical positions from frame memory, and generating a sample vecto r containing coupling of read out pixels values and corresponding horizontal and vertical positions,(c) memory for holding plurality of sets of covariance matrix and mean vector of sample vector as class data,(d) likelihood calculating circuit calculating likelihood of sample vector to plural sets of class data as distance between sample classes which is sum of; a distance obtaied by normalizing difference of sample vector and mean vector by covariance matrix , and a magnitude of covariance matrix,(e) maximum likelihood class selecting device selecting set minimizing distance between sample classes among combinations of class data, and(f) class data changing device sequentially changing mean vector and covariance matrix composing class data in direction of reducing distance between sample classes, by using difference vector of sample vector and mean vector.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 为了确定类中的类均值和协方差,使像素的分布参数表达对象的统计特性,并为了高速稳定地对图像进行聚类,该装置具有:(a)帧存储器存储由编码像素组成的图像,(  b) 读取设备从帧存储器中随机读取水平和垂直位置的像素值,并生成包含读出像素值与相应水平和垂直位置耦合的样本向量,(c) 用于保存多组协方差的存储器 作为类数据的样本向量的矩阵和均值向量,(d)似然度计算电路计算样本向量对多组类数据的似然度,作为样本类之间的距离,该距离是总和; 通过协方差矩阵对样本向量和均值向量的差异进行归一化获得的距离,以及协方差矩阵的大小,(e) 最大似然类选择设备选择集最小化类数据组合中样本类之间的距离,以及 (f) 类数据 变换器利用样本向量和均值向量的差向量,依次改变组成类数据的均值向量和协方差矩阵,使样本类之间的距离减小。
[标]当前申请(专利权)人: 松下电器产业株式会社

标题: 資訊檢索裝置及方法
摘要: 一格式分析單元接收到代表一被選擇的格式之資料及一選擇指示經由傳真傳送或影像讀取被附加至一空白格式，及分析該資料以產生需要的資料以供檢索。一檢索單元開始從該用以檢索的需求資料標示之一檢索起始位置開始檢索因而存取一個或多個資訊標的。一格式產生單元產生一新空白格式在該一個或多個資訊標的基礎上以被供給至一使用者。使用該一個或多個新空白格式，該使用者指示繼續檢索更多詳細層級，因而獲得一希望的文件。
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一格式分析单元接收到代表一被选择的格式之资料及一选择指示经由传真传送或影像读取被附加至一空白格式,及分析该资料以产生需要的资料以供检索。 一检索单元开始从该用以检索的需求资料标示之一检索起始位置开始检索因而存取一个或多个资讯标的。 一格式产生单元产生一新空白格式在该一个或多个资讯标的基础上以被供给至一使用者。 使用该一个或多个新空白格式,该使用者指示继续检索更多详细层级,因而获得一希望的文件。

标题: Pattern recognition system
摘要: An improved pattern recognition system is disclosed which converts rows and columns of digitized video signal elements indicative of light intensity falling on a camera into integrated signatures, one for each of two orthogonal directions. Signatures corresponding to effectively rotated images may also be provided. Portions of the signatures having the most useful information contained therein are selected by comparison with subsets of the total signatures in a teach mode. In a run mode, the thus selected sub signatures are compared with snapshot signatures of a target object, such as integrated circuit dice, for precise location of corresponding portions of the target object.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 公开了一种改进的模式识别系统,该系统将指示落在相机上的光强度的数字化视频信号元素的行和列转换成集成签名,一个用于两个正交方向中的每一个。 还可以提供对应于有效旋转图像的签名。 通过与示教模式中的全部签名的子集进行比较来选择其中包含最有用信息的签名部分。 在运行模式中,将如此选择的子签名与目标对象(例如集成电路管芯)的快照签名进行比较,以精确定位目标对象的对应部分。
[标]当前申请(专利权)人: 库利克和索夫工业公司

标题: Method and apparatus for testing LCD panel array prior to shorting bar removal
摘要: Final testing of an LCD panel or the like is performed after preliminary testing for short circuit defects. During final testing, the panel is exposed to signals at the shorting bars and the resulting display pattern is imaged. The resulting image data then is processed at a computer system to determine whether the resulting display pattern differs from an expected display pattern. If differences are present then an open circuit or pixel defect is present. The applied test signals and the pattern or differences determine the type of defect present. For an open circuit defect along a gate line, a partial row (column) of the resulting display pattern does not activate. For an open circuit along a drive line, a partial column (row) of the resulting display does not activate. Pixel shorts are identified by applying test signals to the shorting bars during a first test cycle, then imaging the display during a second test cycle after at least one of the test signals is removed. Pixels which remain active that should be inactive have short circuit defects.
摘要(译)(简体中文): LCD面板等的最终测试是在短路缺陷的初步测试之后进行的。 在最终测试期间,面板会暴露在短路条处的信号中,并对由此产生的显示图案进行成像。 然后在计算机系统处处理所得图像数据以确定所得显示图案是否不同于预期显示图案。 如果存在差异,则存在开路或像素缺陷。 应用的测试信号和模式或差异决定了存在的缺陷类型。 对于沿栅极线的开路缺陷,所得显示图案的部分行(列)不激活。 对于沿驱动线的开路,所产生的显示器的部分列(行)不会激活。 通过在第一测试周期期间将测试信号施加到短路棒,然后在移除至少一个测试信号之后在第二测试周期期间对显示器成像来识别像素短路。 应处于非活动状态的保持活动状态的像素具有短路缺陷。
发明人地址: Los Gatos, CA | Los Altos, CA

标题: Transmission of multimedia objects in a digital broadcasting system
摘要: PCT No. PCT/FI96/00348 Sec. 371 Date Jan. 26, 1998 Sec. 102(e) Date Jan. 26, 1998 PCT Filed Jun. 12, 1996 PCT Pub. No. WO96/42144 PCT Pub. Date Dec. 27, 1996The invention relates to the transmission of multimedia objects in a digital broadcasting system and particularly to the transmission of a reference system and the start-up procedure of a multimedia presentation according to the MHEG standard via a broadcasting system according to the DAB standard. According to the invention, the DAB ensemble according to the DAB standard and the service channel and fast information channel comprised by the DAB ensemble are handled as virtual, multiplexed MHEG objects, whereby they and the real MHEG objects positioned below them are referred to in a manner specified in the standard ISO/IEC 13522. In addition, information about start-up procedures relating to a multimedia program or a corresponding series of operations is transmitted in a special file, and a parameter in the file descriptor associated with said file indicates that said file contains instructions for said procedures.
摘要(译)(简体中文): PCT 编号 PCT/FI96/00348 秒。  371 日期 1998 年 1 月 26 日 102(e) 日期 1998 年 1 月 26 日 PCT 1996 年 6 月 12 日提交 PCT Pub. 编号 WO96/42144 PCT 公布。 日期 1996 年 12 月 27 日本发明涉及数字广播系统中多媒体对象的传输,特别是根据 MHEG 标准通过根据 民建联标准。 根据本发明,根据DAB标准的DAB集合以及由DAB集合包括的服务信道和快速信息信道被作为虚拟的、多路复用的MHEG对象来处理,由此它们和位于它们之下的真实MHEG对象在一个 方式在标准 ISO/IEC 13522 中规定。此外,与多媒体程序相关的启动过程或相应的一系列操作的信息在一个特殊文件中传输,并且与该文件相关联的文件描述符中的参数表明: 所述文件包含所述程序的说明。

标题: 온라인 문자 인식 장치
摘要: 본 발명에서는 입력된 문자 기호등의 인식 결과의 후보 문자에 부수하는 문자를 문자 그룹 테이블을 참조하여 출력하는 기능을 갖게 한다. 이에 의해 사전 메모리에는 후보로 될 수 있는 문자 기호등만을 등록하여 두면 되므로, 사전 용량이 적어져, 그만큼 인식 시간도 단락되어, 또한, 문자 기호등의 기술도 그룹 대표 문자만으로 되므로 기술이 간소화된다. 또한 문자 그룹 테이블의 내용을 변경하는 기능을 갖게 한다. 이에 따라, 쓰는 사람 자신이 사용하는 문자 그룹 테이블을 독자적으로 만들 수가 있고, 이용 범위를 확대할 수 있다.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 在本发明中,通过参考字符组表来提供输出伴随输入字符符号等的识别结果的候选字符的字符的功能。 这样,由于只需要将能够作为候补的文字符号登录到词典存储器中,因此词典容量减少,识别时间相应地缩短,文字符号等的记述也变得简单,因为只有组使用代表性字符。 它还具有更改字符组表内容的能力。 这样就可以独立创建作者自己使用的字组表,扩大使用范围。

标题: DISPOSITIF DE TRAITEMENT DE DONNEES DE HAUTE SECURITE A DEUX ETATS DE FONCTIONNEMENT.
摘要: The invention relates to a data processing device comprising a user unit (UUS) for the acquisition (CL) and/or the visual display (VS) of data; and a main unit for processing (UTP) data according to a predetermined processing algorithm (AT). According to the invention, the device further comprises an auxiliary, high-security processing unit (UTA), connected in order to carry out all of the data exchanges between the user unit (UUS) and the main processing unit (UTP). The auxiliary processing unit (UTA) comprises means for making data secure (MC); means of data transfer (B2) having a normal state, and a security state in which at least the data transferred in one direction are made secure, the processing algorithm (AT) of the main unit (UTP) determining the operational state of these means of data transfer (B2); means (MA) suitable for monitoring the authenticity of the said processing algorithm (AT) and acting autonomously; and means (MI) suitable for totally inhibiting the means of data transfer (B2) in the case where authenticity is not confirmed by the said monitoring.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 本发明涉及一种数据处理设备,包括用于获取(CL)和/或可视化显示(VS)数据的用户单元(UUS); 以及用于根据预定处理算法(AT)处理(UTP)数据的主要单元。 根据本发明,该设备还包括辅助的、高安全性处理单元(UTA),其被连接以执行用户单元(UUS)和主处理单元(UTP)之间的所有数据交换。 辅助处理单元(UTA)包括用于使数据安全的装置(MC); 具有正常状态和安全状态的数据传输装置(B2),其中至少在一个方向上传输的数据是安全的,主单元(UTP)的处理算法(AT)确定这些装置的操作状态 数据传输(B2); 适用于监控所述处理算法(AT)的真实性并自主行动的装置(MA); 以及装置(MI),其适用于在所述监控未确认真实性的情况下完全禁止数据传输装置(B2)。
法律状态/事件: 期限届满 | 权利转移

标题: Fingerprint identification system with rotatable grating
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种非相干光学处理器指纹识别装置，采用可旋转光栅来检查指纹的多个预选有限样本区域中的线方向。设置包括多个检测器的检测器阵列，每个检测器与离散的样本区域相关，以接收通过光栅过滤的指纹的图像。非相干光源和透镜以及逆向反射棱镜组件与光栅配合起作用以产生叠加在光栅上的图像，使得在棱镜处没有输入指纹的情况下最小光传播到探测器阵列，而在存在时因此衍射指纹光，以通过光栅过滤到检测器。在光栅线与相关样品区域的脊线的空间对准的条件下，在每个检测器处发生最大光，由此光栅的参考取向与每个检测器处的​​最大光瞬间之间的时间间隔可以转换为等效物。唯一代表特定指纹的电信号。

标题: EINKAPSELUNG, DATENDARSTELLUNG UND ÜBERTRAGUNG VON INHALTSADDRESSIERBAREN DATEN
摘要: Representing a number of assets on an originating computer begins with selecting the assets to be represented (102). Cryptographic hash asset identifiers are generated (104); each of the asset identifiers is computed using the contents of a particular asset. The asset identifier is a content-based or content-addressable asset name for the asset and is location independent. An asset list is generated that includes the asset identifiers computed from the assets (106). A cryptographic hash asset list identifier is generated that is computed from the asset list (108). The asset list identifier is stored for later retrieval. The assets selected are also stored for safekeeping either locally or on a computer network. In the event of loss of the files from the originating computer, the asset list identifier is retrieved (302). Using the asset list identifier, the original asset list is found and retrieved from its safe location (306). The asset identifiers from the retrieved asset list are used to find and retrieve the individual assets from their backup locations (314, 316). The assets are verified by recomputing the cryptographic hash asset identifier for each asset retrieved and comparing it to the asset identifier from the asset list (316). The MD5 algorithm is used for the cryptographic hash function. Assets are retrieved using a multicast protocol (402). A series of importer programs (702-710) searches for assets to retrieve in progressively more remote locations. Assets are retrieved whole or in segments (606).
摘要(译)(简体中文): 在原始计算机上表示多个资产开始于选择要表示的资产(102)。 生成密码散列资产标识符(104); 每个资产标识符都是使用特定资产的内容计算的。 资产标识符是资产的基于内容或内容可寻址的资产名称,并且与位置无关。 生成包括根据资产计算的资产标识符的资产列表(106)。 生成根据资产列表计算的密码散列资产列表标识符(108)。 存储资产列表标识符以供以后检索。 所选资产也会存储在本地或计算机网络上以供妥善保管。 如果来自始发计算机的文件丢失,则检索资产列表标识符(302)。 使用资产列表标识符,从其安全位置找到并检索原始资产列表(306)。 来自检索到的资产列表的资产标识符用于从其备份位置查找和检索各个资产(314、316)。 通过重新计算检索到的每个资产的密码散列资产标识符并将其与来自资产列表的资产标识符进行比较来验证资产(316)。  MD5 算法用于加密哈希函数。 使用多播协议来检索资产(402)。 一系列导入程序(702-710)搜索资产以在逐渐更偏远的位置检索。 资产被整体或分段检索(606)。
发明人: CARPENTIER R. | VAN RIEL F. | TEUGELS TOM

标题: Method of generating print production tasks using information extracted from enterprise databases
摘要: Information stored in a corporate database is monitored and used to determine when certain business-related events have occurred. Event information is transmitted over the Internet to a print production facility, where it is used to fire one or more event rules, which in turn automatically generate print requisitions or print production orders. In one variation, print requisitions are routed through an existing and commercially available procurement system before a print production order is generated. The system can monitor and handle events from multiple corporations, each having its own business-related event rules, and each potentially having its own procurement approval system.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 存储在公司数据库中的信息受到监视并用于确定某些与业务相关的事件何时发生。 事件信息通过 Internet 传输到印刷生产设施,在那里它被用来触发一个或多个事件规则,这些规则又自动生成印刷申请或印刷生产订单。 在一种变体中,在生成印刷生产订单之前,印刷申请通过现有的和商业上可用的采购系统进行路由。 该系统可以监控和处理来自多个公司的事件,每个公司都有自己的业务相关事件规则,并且每个公司都可能有自己的采购审批系统。

标题: Pattern counting system using line scanning
摘要: A system for counting patterns in which each pattern in a scanning field is scanned along successive scanning lines and is sampled at successive points along each line to produce binary signals indicative of the presence or absence of the pattern at each sampling point. In order to avoid the problem of pores (holes or voids) in the patterns and the problem of concave pattern portions as seen in a given viewing direction perpendicular to the scanning direction, the digitized signals representing the original patterns are employed to produce mask signals which effectively eliminate the pores and concave pattern portions and which permit each pattern to be counted by counting a portion of the pattern that is convex as seen in the said viewing direction.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种用于计算图案的系统,其中扫描场中的每个图案都沿连续的扫描线进行扫描,并在沿每条线的连续点处进行采样,以产生指示每个采样点处图案存在或不存在的二进制信号。 为了避免图案中的孔隙(孔或空隙)问题和在垂直于扫描方向的给定观察方向上看到的凹图案部分的问题,代表原始图案的数字化信号被用来产生掩模信号,其 有效地消除了孔隙和凹形图案部分,并允许通过计算在所述观察方向上看到的凸起的图案部分来对每个图案进行计数。

标题: Daten-Schalteinrichtung für ein Sichtgerät mit Tastatur
法律状态/事件: 撤回-未指定类型 | 异议

标题: Method and apparatus for storing images of documents having magnetic ink code line
摘要: A method and apparatus for storing and retrieving images of documents, e.g. checks. The method comprises placing a plurality of documents in a document imaging machine and forming an electronic image of each document, storing each electronic image in an electronic storage device, providing at least one user interface device in communication on a communication link with the electronic storage device, placing a request for at least one document image on the user interface device, transmitting the request by the communication link to the electronic storage device, searching the electronic storage device for the requested electronic image of the document, retrieving the at least one electronic image or providing an indication that the image was not found, storing the electronic image, if found, in an electronic file, for transmission to the user interface device at user option, providing the electronic image to the user interface device at command of a user at the user interface device for storage at the user interface device and displaying the requested electronic image on a display of the user interface device. Preferably, the electronic, images are stored with embedded identifying information in a TIFF TM (trademark of Aldus Corp.) file format and the check images can be displayed on a display device which permits the user to view both sides of the checks simultaneously and perform functions such as zooming and rotation of the images.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种用于存储和检索文档图像的方法和设备,例如 检查。 该方法包括将多个文件放置在文件成像机中并形成每个文件的电子图像,将每个电子图像存储在电子存储设备中,提供至少一个在与电子存储设备的通信链路上进行通信的用户接口设备 ,在用户接口设备上放置对至少一个文档图像的请求,通过通信链路将请求发送到电子存储设备,在电子存储设备中搜索所请求的文档的电子图像,检索至少一个电子图像 或提供未找到图像的指示,如果找到,则将电子图像存储在电子文件中,以便根据用户选择传输到用户接口设备,根据用户的命令将电子图像提供给用户接口设备 用户接口设备,用于存储在用户接口设备上并显示请求的电子图像 在用户界面设备的显示器上。 优选地,电子图像以TIFF TM (Aldus Corp.的商标)文件格式与嵌入的识别信息一起存储,支票图像可以显示在允许用户同时查看支票的两面并执行的显示设备上。 图像缩放和旋转等功能。

标题: Method and apparatus for document classification from degraded images
摘要: A word shape token-based document classification system prepares a plurality of sets of training data degraded by image quality and selects the optimum training data set by examining scores from a relevance measurement. The system achieves high accuracy from a wide range of image quality.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种基于词形标记的文档分类系统,准备多组因图像质量下降的训练数据集,并通过检查相关性测量的分数来选择最佳训练数据集。 该系统可从广泛的图像质量范围内实现高精度。

标题: Back projection transparency viewer with overlapping pixels
摘要: A method of transparency viewing, including, placing the transparency at a viewing surface, forming a light pattern and projecting the light pattern to back-illuminate the transparency. Preferably, the light pattern is formed by spatially modulating a beam of light using a plurality of light-valves.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种透明体观看方法,包括:将透明体置于观看面,形成光图案,投射光图案,对透明体进行背照。 优选地,通过使用多个光阀对光束进行空间调制来形成光图案。

标题: Rangefinding/autofocusing device of joint transform correlation type and driving method thereof
摘要: A rangefinding/autofocusing apparatus utilizes a joint transform correlator of a Fourier correlation optical system. A pair of imaging lens systems form a pair of object input images. A lens driving mechanism drives the imaging lens systems in a parallel manner. The pair of object input images are recorded for display. A reference input image is displayed concurrently along with the recorded object input images in an offset relation relative to each other. A photodetector disposed on the correlation plane of the Fourier correlation optical system detects correlation peaks corresponding to a correlation coefficient of the pair of displayed object input images to measure an interval between the detected correlation peaks. The photodetector also detects correlation peaks corresponding to a correlation coefficient of the reference input image and the object input images to determine a correlation between the reference image and the object. A calculation unit calculates a distance between the object and the imaging lens systems to determine a just-focused state of the object depending on the measured interval. The lens driving mechanism shifts the imaging lens systems to thereby establish the just-focused state of the object. A target object is recognized depending on the correlation between the reference image and the object after the just-focused state is established.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 测距/自动聚焦装置利用傅里叶相关光学系统的联合变换相关器。 一对成像透镜系统形成一对物体输入图像。 透镜驱动机构以并行方式驱动成像透镜系统。 记录该对对象输入图像以供显示。 参考输入图像与记录的对象输入图像以相对于彼此的偏移关系同时显示。 设置在傅立叶相关光学系统的相关平面上的光检测器检测与一对显示对象输入图像的相关系数相对应的相关峰值,以测量检测到的相关峰值之间的间隔。 光电检测器还检测与参考输入图像和对象输入图像的相关系数相对应的相关峰值,以确定参考图像和对象之间的相关性。 计算单元计算物体与成像透镜系统之间的距离,以根据测量的间隔确定物体的刚聚焦状态。 镜头驱动机构移动成像镜头系统,从而建立物体的刚刚对焦状态。 根据参考图像与刚对焦状态建立后的对象之间的相关性来识别目标对象。
发明人: IWAKI, TADAO | MITSUOKA, YASUYKI | KASAMA, NOBUYUKI

标题: Gerät und Verfahren zum Verfügbarstellen eines Teiles eines Namensraumes als ein Teil eines anderen Namensraumes
摘要(译)(简体中文): 用于将第一名称空间（115（b））的一部分（1401）（包括所有）并入第二名称空间（115（a））的装置和方法。在第一个名称空间中运行的代理接收第一个操作说明符，它使用名称，因为它们在第一个名称空间中运行的实体的第二个名称空间中使用，并将第一个操作说明符转换为指定相同操作和使用的第二个操作说明符。它们在名字空间中使用的名称。该装置和方法在Plan 9操作系统中实现。第一和第二名称空间被组织为树并且属于在第一处理器上操作的第一进程和在第二处理器上操作的第二进程。第一个操作说明符是Plan 9文件协议，第一个进程从第二个进程接收。第二个操作说明符是第一个进程进行的Plan 9文件系统调用。文件协议和系统调用之间的转换是使用数据结构进行的，该数据结构允许在第二个名称空间中使用的部分中的名称映射到名称，因为它们在第一个名称空间中使用。

标题: Method and apparatus for creating a customized summary of text by selection of sub-sections thereof ranked by comparison to target data items
摘要: A system for summarizing data sets stores target data items and divides the data set into sections. Each section is compared against the target data items and a ranking value is calculated for each section dependent on the outcome of the comparisons. A summary of the data set is then compiled from sections having a ranking value past a pre-determined threshold value.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 用于汇总数据集的系统存储目标数据项并将数据集划分为部分。 将每个部分与目标数据项进行比较,并根据比较结果为每个部分计算排名值。 然后从排名值超过预定阈值的部分编译数据集的摘要。
法律状态/事件: 期限届满 | 诉讼 | 复审 | 权利转移

标题: Character recognition method and apparatus
摘要: A character recognition circuit is provided with the image of unknown characters, in an accessible memory. A microprocessor directs a microcontroller to access the memory and to perform pixel counting, transition recognition and pattern finding. The microprocessor directs such operations and effectively locates lines of unknown characters, deskews those lines if necessary, roughly identifies each unknown character by forming a window around the character and counting pixels inwardly from the top and bottom and from each side until a transition is reached from white (0) to black (1), and from that information as weighted and combined, categorizing the unknown character to be of a particular set of known characters. By comparing the unknown character with the possible known characters, the unknown character is positively identified and stored in a random access memory until the entire message is assembled. Then the message is sent to a buffer unit for ultimate transmission.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 字符识别电路在可访问存储器中提供有未知字符的图像。 微处理器指示微控制器访问存储器并执行像素计数、转换识别和模式查找。 微处理器指导此类操作并有效地定位未知字符的行,必要时对这些行进行校正,通过在字符周围形成一个窗口并从顶部和底部以及从每一侧向内计算像素直到从 白色 (0) 到黑色 (1),并根据加权和组合的信息,将未知字符分类为一组特定的已知字符。 通过将未知字符与可能的已知字符进行比较,未知字符被肯定地识别并存储在随机存取存储器中,直到组合出整个消息。 然后将消息发送到缓冲单元进行最终传输。

标题: Image reader
摘要: An image reader has an image sensor for sensing an image, as a series of pixel signals, by exposing the sensor to light rays. The sensor exhibits a characteristic curve, having at least a partial linear section, describing a relationship between a level-value of a pixel signal and an exposure period over which the sensor is exposed to the light rays. First and second effective maximum level-values are determined from first and second series of pixel signals, obtained by exposing the sensor to the light rays, over first and second exposure periods, respectively. The second exposure period is longer than the first exposure period. The exposure periods are encompassed within the partial linear section of the characteristic curve, and an optimal exposure period of the image is determined based on the first and second effective maximum level-values corresponding to the first and second exposure periods, and an effective maximum level-value corresponding to the optimal exposure period.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 图像读取器具有图像传感器,用于通过将传感器暴露于光线来感测作为一系列像素信号的图像。 传感器呈现特征曲线,其至少具有部分线性部分,描述像素信号的电平值与传感器暴露于光线的曝光周期之间的关系。 第一和第二有效最大电平值由第一和第二系列像素信号确定,通过分别在第一和第二曝光周期内将传感器暴露于光线获得。 第二曝光期比第一曝光期长。 曝光周期包含在特征曲线的部分线性段内,根据对应于第一和第二曝光周期的第一和第二有效最大电平值,以及有效最大电平来确定图像的最佳曝光时间。  -对应于最佳暴露期的值。

标题: Voice model learning data creation method and its apparatus
摘要: A voice model learning data creation method and apparatus makes possible the creation of an inexpensive voice model in a short period of time when creating a voice model for a new word not in a preexisting database. Verbal data from several persons is selected from among the verbal data held in the database. This selected verbal data is referred to as standard speaker data, and is stored in a standard speaker data storage component. The remaining verbal data in the preexisting database is designated as learning speaker data, as is stored in a learning speaker data storage component. A data conversion function from the standard speaker data space to the learning speaker data space is derived. Then, the learning data for the new word is created by the data conversion function. Thus, the data which is obtained from the standard speaker speaking the new word is converted to the learning speaker data space.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 语音模型学习数据创建方法和设备使得在为不在预先存在的数据库中的新词创建语音模型时,可以在短时间内创建廉价的语音模型。 从数据库中保存的口头数据中选择来自几个人的口头数据。 该选定的语言数据被称为标准说话人数据,并存储在标准说话人数据存储组件中。 预先存在的数据库中的剩余语言数据被指定为学习说话人数据,如存储在学习说话人数据存储组件中。 导出了从标准说话人数据空间到学习说话人数据空间的数据转换函数。 然后,通过数据转换功能创建新单词的学习数据。 因此,从说出新单词的标准说话人获得的数据被转换到学习说话人数据空间。
发明人: MIYAZAWA, YASUNAGA | HASEGAWA, HIROSHI | INAZUMI, MITSUHIRO | AIZAWA, TADASHI

标题: ファジ-制御による符号化方法及びその装置
摘要:
【目的】 バッファのデ-タ充満度、ブロックの複雑度/輝度/動きベクトル等情報に基づくファジ-制御により量子化ステップサイズを決定し、高い圧縮比でも高画質で安定した画像復元ができる符号化方法と装置を提供する。
【構成】 N×Nブロック単位で入力する画像信号の複雑さを判別する前方解釈部21、そのブロック単位で映像の輝度を検出する輝度解釈部22、バッファ充満度、画像の複雑程度、輝度及び動きベクトルを入力しファジ-化するファジ-化部23、ファジ-制御規則を貯蔵する制御規則貯蔵部25、ファジ-制御規則を用いて推論を実行するファジ-推論部24、重心COG法等を利用して、DCT処理された周波数領域の係数を量子化する量子化部の量子化ステップサイズを発生する非ファジ-化部26によって、本実施例の主要部分を構成し、これら構成により、高圧縮率の画像であっても復元画像の画質を高レベルに保つ。
摘要(译)(简体中文):
[目的] 根据缓冲数据的填充度、块复杂度/亮度/运动矢量等信息,通过模糊控制确定量化步长的代码,即使在高压缩下也能以高图像质量进行稳定的图像恢复提供了一种方法和设备。 
 [结构] 用于确定以N×N块为单位的输入图像信号的复杂度的正向解释器21、用于检测以块为单位的图像的亮度、缓冲器充满度、图像复杂度、亮度和模糊化单元的亮度解释器22运动矢量的输入和模糊化的控制规则存储单元23、使用模糊控制规则执行推理的模糊推理单元24、质心COG方法等构成本实施例的主要部分。去模糊化单元26生成使用这些配置对DCT处理的频域系数进行量化的量化单元的量化步长。
发明人地址: 大韓民国ソウル特別市瑞草區良才洞154-2番地宇成アパート108-1007

标题: Systems and methods for providing dynamic data referencing in a generic data exchange environment
摘要: For use with a computer system having a dynamic data referencing (DDR) module, a plurality of external data references accessible via the DDR module, the computer system capable of executing a user application that operates on a plurality of generic variables, a system and method for dynamically binding the external data references to the generic variables. The system includes a DDR routine within the user application that allows creation of an alias variable for at least some of the plurality of generic variables. The alias variable is adapted to identify a given external data reference. The user application employs the alias variable at runtime to request the DDR module to bind a given generic variable to the given external data reference to allow communication of data between the user application and the external references.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 为了与具有动态数据引用(DDR)模块的计算机系统一起使用,通过DDR模块可访问的多个外部数据引用,能够执行对多个通用变量进行操作的用户应用程序的计算机系统、系统和方法 用于将外部数据引用动态绑定到泛型变量。 该系统包括用户应用程序内的DDR例程,该例程允许为多个通用变量中的至少一些创建别名变量。 别名变量适用于识别给定的外部数据引用。 用户应用程序在运行时使用别名变量来请求 DDR 模块将给定的通用变量绑定到给定的外部数据引用,以允许用户应用程序和外部引用之间的数据通信。
发明人: BLAND, DENNIS L. | KOONTZ, SEAN C. | FOX, GARY L. | STRILICH, JAMES A.

标题: User interface for the specification of lock groups
摘要: A user interface permits a programmer or other person to manage lock groups for classes. The programmer enters information through the user interface to define new lock groups, update defined lock groups, and delete lock groups. The programmer manages the lock groups in the classes, and an optional mapping tool maps the defined lock groups when converting data between an object model and a relational model.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 用户界面允许程序员或其他人管理类的锁组。 程序员通过用户界面输入信息来定义新的锁组、更新定义的锁组和删除锁组。 程序员管理类中的锁组,并且可选的映射工具在对象模型和关系模型之间转换数据时映射定义的锁组。
[标]当前申请(专利权)人: BAAN DEV | BAAN DEV B V 50

标题: Low data transmission rate and intelligible speech communication
摘要: A method of processing speech representative of ideograms for speech communication using an asynchronous communication channel (21) is disclosed. The method includes the step of processing speech units of a speech and data indicative of the speech units. Each speech unit is representative of an ideogram or a plurality of semantically related ideograms (500-508). The data indicative of the speech units is discretely communicable on the asynchronous communication channel (21). By communicating the data indicative of the speech units, a substantially low data transmission rate and intelligible speech communication is achieved.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 公开了一种使用异步通信信道(21)处理表示用于语音通信的表意文字的语音的方法。 该方法包括处理语音的语音单元和指示语音单元的数据的步骤。 每个语音单元代表一个表意文字或多个语义相关的表意文字(500-508)。 表示语音单元的数据可在异步通信信道(21)上离散地通信。 通过传送表示语音单元的数据,实现了相当低的数据传输率和可理解的语音通信。
发明人: GUAN, CUNTAI | XU, JUN | LI, HAIZHOU

标题: 使用権限のない使用者の肉体的属性を記録することを含むクレジット/IDカードの使用を確認するためのシステム
摘要: 本発明はクレジット/IDカード(12)の正しい使用者を確認するための方法及び装置(10)に関する。この方法はバーコード(16)を走査する多数の走査装置を有する装置によってカード(12)を走査する工程、偽造の証拠を探すためにカード(12)を走査する工程、カード(12)上の少なくとも1つの指紋、及び他の探知できる情報を走査する工程、カード(12)上の走査された情報と装置(10)と通信している少なくとも1つのアクセス可能なデータベース(44)に記憶された所有者の情報と比較する工程を含む。装置(10)とデータベース(44)間のデータ送信は暗号化システムによって保護されている。カード(12)上の情報がデータベース(44)に記憶されたカード所有者と密接な関係のある情報にマッチしない場合、カード(12)は使用者から保留される。そうでなければ、カード(12)の使用者は所望の目的のためにカードを使用することができる。
摘要(译)(简体中文): 本发明涉及一种用于验证信用卡/身份证(12)的正确用户的方法和装置(10)。 该方法包括以下步骤:用具有多个扫描器扫描条形码(16)的设备扫描卡片(12),扫描卡片(12)以寻找伪造证据,以及扫描卡片(12)以寻找伪造证据。至少一个指纹和其他可检测的信息,卡(12)上的扫描信息并存储在至少一个与设备(10)通信的可访问数据库(44)中;它包括与所有者的信息进行比较的步骤。 设备(10)和数据库(44)之间的数据传输受到加密系统的保护。 如果卡12上的信息与存储在数据库44中的持卡人相关信息不匹配,则卡12被扣留给用户。 否则,卡(12)的用户可以将卡用于任何需要的目的。
[标]当前申请(专利权)人: ボゴシアンチャールズエージュニア
当前第一申请(专利权)人: ボゴシアン, チャールズ エー., ジュニア
发明人: ボゴシアン, チャールズ エー., ジュニア
发明人地址: 米国,  ロードアイランド  02886,  ワーウィック,  ハイランド  アヴェニュー  116

标题: ベクトル量子化装置
摘要:
【目的】 少ない学習用標本を用いて,ベクトル量子化におけるコードブックを話者に応じて適応化する,あるいは話者をコードブックに適合するように正規化する。
【構成】 各クラスタのセントロイドあるいは入力ベクトルに対して,移動ベクトルを設定し,前記セントロイドあるいは入力ベクトルをこの移動ベクトル分変移せしめたとき,別途定義した目的関数が,その最大化を目指すべく定義されているときは最大化,その最小化を目指すべく定義されているときは最小化の方向に向かうように,システムを使用する話者の学習標本を用いて,前記移動ベクトルを決定し,該移動ベクトルによって前記セントロイドあるいは入力ベクトルを変移させることによって,前者の場合であれば話者適応,後者の場合であれば話者正規化を行うものである。
摘要(译)(简体中文):
目的根据说话人对矢量量化中的码本进行适配或对说话人进行归一化处理,以适应训练样本较少的码本。 
 [构造] 为每个簇的质心或输入向量设置运动向量,当质心或输入向量被该运动向量位移时,单独定义的目标函数旨在最大化。使用说话人的学习样本确定运动向量谁使用系统以便在定义时最大化并在定义时最小化以达到最小化,在前一种情况下,执行说话人自适应,在后一种情况下,通过将质心或输入向量替换为运动矢量。
[标]当前申请(专利权)人: 松下电器产业株式会社
当前第一申请(专利权)人: 松下電器産業株式会社
发明人: 坪香 英一 | 中橋 順一
发明人地址: 大阪府門真市大字門真1006番地  松下電器産業株式会社内

标题: Process for recognizing patterns in time-varying measurement signals
摘要: In state-of-the-art automatic speech recognition systems, phonetically similar words (for example 'zwei' and 'drei', in German) are easily exchanged. In particular these recognition systems easily exchange words that differ by a single phoneme (for example 'dem' and 'den', in German). To solve this problem, a process is disclosed for recognizing patterns in time-varying measurement signals that makes it possible to better distinguish between such signals by means of a subsequent classification in pairs. This process combines the Viterbi decoding algorithm with the Hidden-Markov model process. The discrimination-relevant features are separately analyzed in a second step after the main classification. Different components of the feature vectors are differently weighted. On the contrary of known approaches, said weightings have a theoretical basis. The process is in particular useful for improving speech recognition systems.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 在最先进的自动语音识别系统中,语音相似的词(例如德语中的“zwei”和“drei”)很容易交换。 特别是,这些识别系统很容易交换只有一个音素不同的单词(例如德语中的“dem”和“den”)。 为了解决这个问题,公开了一种用于识别时变测量信号中的模式的过程,该过程使得可以通过随后的成对分类更好地区分这些信号。 这个过程结合了维特比译码算法和隐马尔可夫模型过程。 在主要分类之后的第二步中单独分析与歧视相关的特征。 特征向量的不同分量具有不同的权重。 与已知方法相反,所述权重具有理论基础。 该过程对于改进语音识别系统特别有用。

标题: 데이터 처리 시스템 라이브러리에 멀티플 더큐멘트 버젼의 생성 및 유지를 위한 방법 및 시
摘要: 도1
摘要(译)(简体中文): 图1

标题: 藉由數位影像處理決定一物件位置的方法
摘要: 有了藉由數位影像處理決定一物件位置的方法，而於學習階段中除開第一參考影像之外也記錄並儲存了各與造個參考影像偏移了幾分之一個CCD攝影機像素的數個參考影像。於工作階段中，記錄了物件的測試影像並執行測試影像與所有參考影像的比較以便找出測試影像的位置，其中存在有測試影像與任意一個參考影像的最佳適配。
摘要(译)(简体中文): 有了藉由数位影像处理决定一物件位置的方法,而于学习阶段中除开第一参考影像之外也记录并储存了各与造个参考影像偏移了几分之一个CCD摄影机像素的数个 参考影像。 于工作阶段中,记录了物件的测试影像并执行测试影像与所有参考影像的比较以便找出测试影像的位置,其中存在有测试影像与任意一个参考影像的最佳适配。
法律状态/事件: 未缴年费 | 权利转移

标题: パタンマツチング装置
摘要: This pattern matching system comprises a pattern matching control unit (3) for gathering an L number of time points i of the input pattern into a block, a distance computation unit (1) with an input pattern buffer (11) having its address specified by the signal of said control unit, and a reference pattern buffer (12) for temporarily storing the vector @n_j at the j-th frame of the reference pattern so that the input pattern @i and the reference pattern @n_j may be read out from the input pattern buffer and the reference pattern buffer to derive the inter-vector distance d(@i, @n_j). An asymptotic equation computation unit includes a difference memory. The asymptotic equation of a dynamic programming is computed for the time point of each reference pattern and for each time point in one block of the input pattern with reference to the distance d(@, @n_j) under the connecting condition of the dissimilarity Gn(j) at the time point (ii-1)-L for the block number ii of the time point of the input pattern, thereby to derive the dissimilarity Gn(j) at the time point ii-L of the input pattern.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 该模式匹配系统包括用于将输入模式的L个时间点i收集到块中的模式匹配控制单元(3)、具有输入模式缓冲器(11)的距离计算单元(1),其地址由 所述控制单元的信号,以及用于临时存储参考图案的第j帧处的矢量@n_j的参考图案缓冲器(12),以便可以从其中读出输入图案@i和参考图案@n_j 输入模式缓冲区和参考模式缓冲区以导出向量间距离 d(@i, @n_j)。 渐近方程计算单元包括差分存储器。 在相异度 Gn(  j)在时间点(ii-1)-L处,对于输入模式的时间点的块编号ii,从而导出在输入模式的时间点ii-L的相异度Gn(j)。

标题: Lease renewal service
摘要: In accordance with methods and systems consistent with the present invention, a lease manager is provided for managing leases between clients and other network services. To use the lease manager, a client enters into a management lease with the lease manager, specifying an amount of time during which the lease manager can manage preexisting leases between the client and network services on behalf of the client. This management includes renewing the preexisting leases with the other network services. Further, the lease manager notifies the client when a lease between the lease manager and the client is near expiration. The lease manager also notifies the client of failed attempts to renew the preexisting leases, as well as the management lease, either with a network service or with the lease manager.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 根据与本发明一致的方法和系统,提供租用管理器用于管理客户端和其他网络服务之间的租用。 为了使用租用管理器,客户端与租用管理器签订管理租用,指定租用管理器可以代表客户端管理客户端和网络服务之间预先存在的租用的时间量。 这种管理包括用其他网络服务更新预先存在的租约。 此外,当租赁管理器和客户之间的租约接近到期时,租赁管理器通知客户。 租约管理器还通过网络服务或租约管理器通知客户端更新预先存在的租约以及管理租约的失败尝试。
发明人: WALDO, JAMES H. | MCCLAIN, JOHN W. F.

标题: Spatial filtering process and system
摘要: PCT No. PCT/EP94/01752 Sec. 371 Date Mar. 18, 1996 Sec. 102(e) Date Mar. 18, 1996 PCT Filed May 27, 1994 PCT Pub. No. WO94/28500 PCT Pub. Date Dec. 8, 1994The invention relates to a method of spatial filtering a point distribution representing a structure buried in noise and each of the points of which are defined by n coordinate values of an n-dimensional space, wherein for each point the function representing the number of the points in an area around the point concerned as a function of a dimension of the area is established, and a scaling coefficient equal to the exponent (a) of a simple power function is determined which approximates as near as possible the function determined in step a) in a certain area having the dimension (d), furthermore the scaling coefficients of the points of a n-dimensional stochastic point distribution of a type equivalent to the point distribution to be filtered are determined, the difference between the scaling coefficients of the point distribution to be filtered and the scaling coefficients of the stochastic point distribution are determined, and the points, the scaling coefficients of which are contained in the difference and those more or less completely representing the structure free of noise are represented or further processed in at least a two-dimensional space.
摘要(译)(简体中文): PCT 号 PCT/EP94/01752 第二节 371 日期 1996 年 3 月 18 日 第 2 段 102(e) 日期 1996 年 3 月 18 日 PCT 提交 1994 年 5 月 27 日 PCT 公布。  WO94/28500 PCT 公布号。 日期 1994年12月8日 本发明涉及一种对表示埋在噪声中的结构的点分布进行空间滤波的方法,其中每个点由n维空间的n个坐标值定义,其中对于每个点,函数表示 建立有关点周围区域中的点的数量作为区域尺寸的函数,并确定等于简单幂函数的指数(a)的缩放系数,该系数尽可能接近该函数 在步骤a)中确定在具有维度(d)的某个区域中,此外确定与待滤波的点分布类型等效的n维随机点分布的点的缩放系数,缩放之间的差值 确定待滤波点分布的系数和随机点分布的缩放系数,并表示或进一步表示其缩放系数包含在差值中且或多或少完全代表无噪声结构的点 至少在二维空间中进行处理。
当前第一申请(专利权)人: MAX-PLANCK-GESELLSCHAFT ZUR FOERDERUNG DER WISSENSCHAFTEN E.V. BERLIN
发明人: MORFILL GREGOR EUGEN | SCHEINGRABER HERBERT | WIEDENMANN GERDA

标题: Method of using fuzzy logic processor in a network and fuzzy logic processor usable in a network
摘要: The method involves the processor (2) receiving messages from the network (R) through a multiplexer (14) and circuits (9) which read batches of correspondence tables and membership functions. Memories (3,4) store processing rules and membership functions and the initial output (8) from the processor produces a switching order to the multiplexer to guide data in a second part of the message to the appropriate entry (5). The fuzzy processor therefore functions in two stages. At first data is extracted from a message then it is introduced into the appropriate processor entry for fuzzy logic processing.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 该方法包括处理器(2)通过多路复用器(14)和电路(9)从网络(R)接收消息,电路(9)读取成批的对应表和成员函数。 存储器 (3,4) 存储处理规则和隶属函数,来自处理器的初始输出 (8) 产生到多路复用器的切换命令,以将消息的第二部分中的数据引导到适当的条目 (5)。 因此,模糊处理器分两个阶段运行。 首先从消息中提取数据,然后将其引入适当的处理器条目以进行模糊逻辑处理。
[标]当前申请(专利权)人: 意法半导体股份有限公司
发明人地址: Cabinet Ballot Schmit, 7, rue Le Sueur,75116 Paris,FR

标题: Method and apparatus for detection of unsuitable conditions for automated cytology scoring
摘要: A method and apparatus for determining whether a slide is suitable for processing. A suite of suitability tests (16) are performed by an automated microscope system (511). The tests (16) include magnification error flags, staining flags, main optical density flags, including detected intermediate cell nuclei, rings around detected intermediate cell nuclei, average texture measure of detected intermediate cell nuclei, average contrast to detected intermediate cell nuclei to cytoplasm, standard deviation of detected intermediate cell nuclei optical densities, detected intermediate cell ratios, average stripe area, measure of a saturated magnification of the image, measure of a grossly saturated magnification, and the percentage of images focused properly on a first try, including images never focused properly. The automated microscope (511) quantifies the measurements in a reliable and repeatable way.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种用于确定载玻片是否适合处理的方法和设备。 一套适用性测试 (16) 由自动显微镜系统 (511) 执行。 测试 (16) 包括放大错误标志、染色标志、主要光密度标志,包括检测到的中间细胞核、检测到的中间细胞核周围的环、检测到的中间细胞核的平均纹理测量、检测到的中间细胞核与细胞质的平均对比度、 检测到的中间细胞核光密度的标准偏差、检测到的中间细胞比率、平均条纹面积、图像饱和放大率的测量值、严重饱和放大率的测量值以及第一次尝试正确聚焦的图像百分比,包括从未拍摄过的图像 正确聚焦。 自动显微镜 (511) 以可靠和可重复的方式量化测量结果。
发明人: LEE, SHIH-JONG J | WILHELM, PAUL S

标题: 電子零件、熱頭、熱頭之製法及熱敏記錄裝置
摘要: 一種熱頭，包含有：一些加熱電阻器，形成串聯連接和被配置在一個基體之一邊緣部份之上；第一組變換元件，分別連接到該第一組電極圖型；第二組變換元件，分別連接到該第二組電極圖型；和一個選擇電路，用來選擇在該第二組變換元件之每隔一個之變換元件之一組或另外一組，和用來選擇該第一組變換元件之至少之一個，促成不需要使用二極體陣列就可以獲得高品質之印刷。
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种热头,包含有:一些加热电阻器,形成串联连接和被配置在一个基体之一边缘部份之上;第一组变换元件,分别连接到该第一组电极图型;第二组变换 元件,分别连接到该第二组电极图型;和一个选择电路,用来选择在该第二组变换元件之每隔一个之变换元件之一组或另外一组,和用来选择该第一 组变换元件之至少之一个,促成不需要使用二极体阵列就可以获得高品质之印刷。
当前第一申请(专利权)人: 三菱電機股份有限公司

标题: Automated DNA sequencing comparing predicted and actual measurements
摘要: PCT No. PCT/GB95/03026 Sec. 371 Date Aug. 28, 1997 Sec. 102(e) Date Aug. 28, 1997 PCT Filed Dec. 22, 1995 PCT Pub. No. WO96/20286 PCT Pub. Date Jul. 4, 1996A method of automatically sequencing DNA comprises repeatedly determining the next base in the sequence as a function not only of a physical measurement made at that position, but also as a function of previously-determined near-by bases in the same sequence. Typically, a computer algorithm is used which predicts the value of the expected measurement at a given position based upon a knowledge of the bases in previous and/or subsequent positions. The predicted measurement is then compared with the actual measurement, and the base chosen at that position is the base which minimizes the accumulated error measure for the entire sequence. The preferred algorithm, which may be parallel or sequential, preferably includes physical modelling of the replication effect and of the fluorescence effect.
摘要(译)(简体中文): PCT 编号 PCT/GB95/03026 秒。  371 日期 1997 年 8 月 28 日 102(e) 日期 1997 年 8 月 28 日 PCT 1995 年 12 月 22 日提交 PCT Pub. 编号 WO96/20286 PCT 公开。 日期 1996 年 7 月 4 日一种自动测序 DNA 的方法包括重复确定序列中的下一个碱基,不仅作为在该位置进行的物理测量的函数,而且作为先前确定的同一位置附近碱基的函数 序列。 通常,使用计算机算法,该算法基于对先前和/或随后位置的碱基的了解来预测给定位置处的预期测量值。 然后将预测的测量值与实际测量值进行比较,在该位置选择的碱基是使整个序列的累积误差测量最小化的碱基。 可以是并行或顺序的优选算法优选地包括复制效应和荧光效应的物理建模。
当前第一申请(专利权)人: IMPERIAL COLLEGE OF SCIENCE TECHNOLOGY AND MEDICINE

标题: Method and apparatus for screening or sensing bodily conditions using DC biopotentials
摘要: A method and apparatus for screening or sensing disease states, injury sites or bodily conditions in a human or animal subject by separately detecting the DC biopotential of the electromagnetic field at a plurality of test points in a test area. The DC biopotentials are converted by analog to digital converters connected to DC biopotential test sensors at the test points into digital test signals, and the DC biopotential test sensors and analog to digital converters form a biopotential sensing section which is separate from a processing section that receives and processes the digital test signals. Signals between the processing section and the bopotential sensing section are transmitted by a transmission network which electrically isolates the two sections. The conversions performed by the analog to digital converters are synchronized with the AC line frequency of the apparatus power supply, and the digital test signals are filtered in the processing section by digital filters, each of which is dedicated to an individual DC biopotential test sensor.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种通过在测试区域中的多个测试点分别检测电磁场的直流生物电势来筛选或感测人类或动物受试者的疾病状态、损伤部位或身体状况的方法和装置。 直流生物电势由连接在测试点的直流生物电势测试传感器的模数转换器转换为数字测试信号,直流生物电势测试传感器和模数转换器形成一个生物电势传感部分,该传感部分与接收信号的处理部分分开。 并处理数字测试信号。 处理部分和反向电位感测部分之间的信号由将两个部分电隔离的传输网络传输。 模数转换器执行的转换与设备电源的交流线路频率同步,数字测试信号在处理部分由数字滤波器过滤,每个滤波器专用于单独的直流生物电势测试传感器。
发明人: FAUPEL, MARK L. | GORDON, CHARLES LEONARD | STEPHENS, JOHN D. | NATHANSON, SETH D. | DOE, KENNETH E. | HAGSTROM, STEVEN ERIK
发明人地址: Conyers, GA | New York, NY | Alpharetta, GA | Kent, WA | Bothell, WA

标题: Signal conditioning apparatus
摘要: An signal conditioning apparatus and method to condition a human voice signal for input to a time-domain voice recognition system. The signal conditioner normalizes sampled human voice inputs so that all inputs result in an output with substantially the same pitch and frequency bandwidth characteristics. The signal conditioner includes a pitch altering circuit that alters the pitch of the input human voice signal and a frequency band limiting circuit that limits the range of spectral information contained in a signal. The pitch altering circuit converts the input into a digital signal at a first conversion rate and converts the digital signal back to an analog signal at a second rate which is unequal to the first rate. The frequency band limit circuit is a plurality of filters at different points in the frequency spectrum.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种信号调节装置和方法,用于调节人类语音信号以输入到时域语音识别系统。 信号调节器对采样的人声输入进行归一化,以便所有输入产生具有基本相同的音调和频率带宽特性的输出。 信号调节器包括一个改变输入人声信号音高的音高改变电路和一个限制信号中包含的频谱信息范围的频带限制电路。 音调改变电路以第一转换速率将输入转换为数字信号,并以不等于第一速率的第二速率将数字信号转换回模拟信号。 频带限制电路是频谱中不同点的多个滤波器。

发明人: MUNSELL, CLYDE STEPHAN | SCHAEFER, ALBERT RUSSELL | COHEN, RODNEY GUY | COVER, JOHN RICHARD

标题: Anordnung zur Dokumentkonvertierung
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种用于将一种语言或方言的文本转换为另一种语言或方言的文本而不丢失包含在文本中的标记符号的方法和文件转换设备。 该系统包括用于存储源文本的单元，用于存储显示源文本的显示属性以及属性附加到的位置的数据的单元，用于将源语言的文本主体转换为文本主体的单元。 目标语言，用于存储转换后的文本主体的单元，用于存储表示目标文本中的词与源文本中的词之间的关系的信息的单元，处理目标文本主体并准备表示数据的单元 显示目标文本的属性和附加属性的位置，用于通过将标签符号附加到目标文本来准备目标文本的单元以及用于显示文本的显示单元。

标题: 電子書籍內容,記錄電子書籍內容之記錄媒體,電子書籍傳送裝置及電子書籍顯示器
摘要: 本發明係關於電子書籍內容，記錄電子書籍內容之記錄媒體，電子書籍傳送裝置及電子書籍顯示器，其電子書籍資料，包含有文字資料部(12)與零件資料部(13)。又，文字資料部(12)包含有事件資料(124)，而該事件(event)資料(124)係包含有用以指定顯示區域的描述、及用以指定顯示於顯示區域上之內容的第一識別元件；零件資料部(13)，包含有被分割成複數個區域，且在被分割的區域上附加有第一識別元件的物件(object)資訊(133)。事件資料(124)，由於包含有用以指定顯示區域的描述、及用以指定顯示於顯示區域上之內容的第一識別元件，所以可參照附加在物件資訊(133)中之第一識別元件而取得物件實體(132)並顯示於顯示區域上。
摘要(译)(简体中文): 本发明系关于电子书籍内容,记录电子书籍内容之记录媒体,电子书籍传送装置及电子书籍显示器,其电子书籍资料,包含有文字资料部(12)与零件资料部(13)。 又,文字资料部(12)包含有事件资料(124),而该事件(event)资料(124)系包含有用以指定显示区域的描述、及用以指定显示于显示区域上之内容的第一 识别元件;零件资料部(13),包含有被分割成复数个区域,且在被分割的区域上附加有第一识别元件的物件(object)资讯(133)。 事件资料(124),由于包含有用以指定显示区域的描述、及用以指定显示于显示区域上之内容的第一识别元件,所以可参照附加在物件资讯(133)中之第一识别元件而 取得物件实体(132)并显示于显示区域上。

标题: Apparatus for analyzing blood
摘要: An apparatus for analyzing blood includes an image capturing device for capturing an image including at least one object blood cell and an analyzer for analyzing the captured image as an image F(x, y) in an x-y coordinate system. The analyzer includes an edge calculator for calculating an edge intensity distribution E(x, y) representing an outline of the image F(x, y); a weight memory for storing in advance a weight distribution W(i, j) corresponding to an average outline of the object cell; an assessment value calculator for obtaining an assessment value C (x, y) at each point (x, y) by calculating a degree of correspondence between the edge intensity distribution E (x, y) and the weight distribution W(i, j) for each point (x, y); and an extractor for extracting a point (x, y) at which the assessment value C(x, y) is larger than a predetermined value, thereby determining that the object blood cell is present at the point (x, y). The apparatus is useful as a device for identifying the object blood cell.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种用于分析血液的设备,包括用于捕获包括至少一个对象血细胞的图像的图像捕获装置和用于将捕获的图像分析为x-y坐标系中的图像F(x,y)的分析器。 该分析器包括边缘计算器,用于计算表示图像F(x,y)的轮廓的边缘强度分布E(x,y); 权重存储器,用于预先存储对应于目标单元的平均轮廓的权重分布W(i,j); 评估值计算器,用于通过计算边缘强度分布E(x,y)和权重分布W(i,j)之间的对应度来获得每个点(x,y)的评估值C(x,y) 对于每个点 (x, y); 提取器用于提取评估值C(x,y)大于预定值的点(x,y),从而确定目标血细胞存在于点(x,y)。 该装置作为识别对象血细胞的装置是有用的。
[标]当前申请(专利权)人: 东亜医用电子株式会社
发明人: KOUCHI, YASUHIRO | ASANO, KAORU | ISHIHARA, KEN

标题: Steuereinrichtung für ein Bildablagesystem
摘要: Eine Steuereinrichtung für ein Bildablagesystem hat einen Bildspeicher zum Speichern von Bildinformationen mit hoher und niedriger Auflösung, um ein Bild auf jeder Seite eines Manuskripts mit hoher bzw. niedriger Auflösung darzustellen, eine Anzahl Seitenpuffer, um vorübergehend dieBildinformation zu speichern, eine Seitensuch-Anzeigeeinrichtung, um die Bildinformation mit geringer Auflösung aus einem Bildspeicher auszulesen,um das Bild zu suchen, und um die ausgelesene Bildinformation mit geringer Auflösung in einem der Pufferspeicher zu speichern, und um das Bildauf einen Bildschirm mit Hilfe von Bildinformationen geringer Auflösung darzustellen, und eine Bildverarbeitungseinrichtung, um die Bildinformationmit hoher Auflösung aus der Bildplatte zu lesen, um verschiedene Arten von festgelegten Bildverarbeitungsvorgängen durchzuführen und um dieausgelesene Bildinformation mit hoher Auflösung in einen anderen der Pufferspeicher zu speichern, und um dann die verschiedenen Arten vonBildverarbeitungen bezüglich der Bildinformation mit hoher Auflösung durchzuführen. Die Steuereinrichtung hat ferner eine Funktionseinrichtung, umdie verschiedenen Arten von Bildverarbeitungen bezüglich der Bildinformation mit hoher Auflösung und die Bilddarstellung auf dem Bildschirm bei derBildinformation mit geringer Auflösung parallel durchzuführen.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种用于图像归档系统的控制器,具有用于存储高分辨率和低分辨率图像信息以分别以高分辨率和低分辨率在手稿的每一页上显示图像的图像存储器,用于临时存储图像信息的多个页面缓冲器,页面搜索指示器从图像存储器中读出低分辨率图像信息以搜索图像,并将读出的低分辨率图像信息存储在其中一个缓冲存储器中,并使用低分辨率在屏幕上显示图像-分辨率图像信息,图像处理是指从光盘中读取高分辨率图像信息以执行各种指定的图像处理操作,并将读取的高分辨率图像信息存储在另一个缓冲存储器中,然后读取各种图像ve 对高分辨率的图像信息进行处理。 控制装置还具有用于并行执行对高分辨率图像信息的各种图像处理和对低分辨率图像信息的屏幕上图像显示的功能装置。

标题: Speech recognition apparatus and methods
摘要: Speech recognition apparatus recognises several different spoken statements each comprising a plurality of words for controlling associated equipment 101 to 106. An acoustic recogniser compares speech sounds from a microphone 1 with signals stored in a reference vocabulary 3 and supplies signals representative of the identified words to a processing unit 5. The processing unit 5 has groups A to F of several storage locations 50. Each group A to F is associated with a different statement, each location 50 in that group being associated with an individual word. Signals representing the spoken words are used to mark those locations 50 is every group that has a location associated with that word.; An output unit 60 identifies which group A to F is most nearly filled with marked locations 50 and hence produces an output indicative of the spoken statement which is supplied to the equipment associated with that statement. Where a group includes two or more locations associated with the same word, they are arranged serially so that only one location at a time is marked with the spoken word each time it is spoken.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 语音识别设备识别几个不同的口语陈述,每一个都包括多个用于控制相关设备101至106的词。声学识别器将来自麦克风1的语音与存储在参考词汇表3中的信号进行比较,并将代表所识别词的信号提供给 处理单元5。处理单元5具有几个存储位置50的组A到F。每个组A到F与不同的语句相关联,该组中的每个位置50与单个词相关联。 代表口语单词的信号用于标记那些位置50是具有与该单词相关联的位置的每个组。 输出单元60识别哪个组A到F最接近被标记的位置50填充,并因此产生指示口语陈述的输出,该口语陈述被提供给与该陈述相关联的设备。 当一个组包括与同一个词相关的两个或多个位置时,它们按顺序排列,以便每次只用所说的词标记一个位置。

标题: Detection system
摘要: A detection system (10) utilising projected light (18, 20) viewed through an appropriately placed camera (22) detects variations in surface height (26). The system (10) is arranged to project light onto the surface (16) of interest. A camera with optical axis (24) oriented parallel to and offset from the direction of light projection is used to image the intersection (50, 66) of the projected light (18, 20) with the surface (16). The system (10) observes deflections (64) of this imaged intersection (66) and associates them with the movement of an object (26,124) through the projected light. The object can range from a surface irregularity (124) to a person (26) walking along a corridor.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 利用通过适当放置的照相机(22)观察的投射光(18、20)的检测系统(10)检测表面高度(26)的变化。 系统(10)被布置成将光投射到感兴趣的表面(16)上。 具有平行于光投射方向并偏离光投射方向定向的光轴(24)的照相机用于对投射光(18、20)与表面(16)的交点(50、66)进行成像。 系统(10)观察该成像交叉点(66)的偏转(64)并将它们与通过投射光的物体(26,124)的运动相关联。 对象的范围可以从不规则表面 (124) 到沿着走廊行走的人 (26)。
发明人: CHARLES, JOHN, , RADFORD | RAYMOND, GRAHAM, , WHITE | ROBERT, WILLIAM, MACLAUGHLIN, , SMITH | JOHN, TIMOTHY, , SAVAGE | JOHN, THOMAS, , O'CONNOR | PHILIP, JOHN, , KENT

标题: Object recognition method and apparatus for determining the presence and shape of an object
摘要: An object recognition apparatus for determining the presence and shape of an object in an image has a multiplier, an adder and a memory for obtaining histograms relative to densities for each of specified partial areas in the image. The histogram of each partial area is stored in the memory at addressed determined by adding an actual density of each of pixels in the partial area to a number indicating the partial area multiplied to be shifted to the left by the number of quantization bits. In a micro computer of the apparatus, the histogram for each partial area compared with a corresponding reference histogram which indicates that an object is present in an at least one part of the partial area. Based on a comparison result, the micro computer determines whether the object is present or not in each partial area. Then, based on the combination of partial areas where it is determined that the object is present, the shape of the object is evaluated.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种用于确定图像中对象的存在和形状的对象识别设备具有乘法器、加法器和用于获得与图像中每个指定部分区域的密度相关的直方图的存储器。 每个部分区域的直方图存储在存储器中,地址是通过将部分区域中的每个像素的实际密度加到一个数字上来确定的,该数字表示要向左移动的部分区域乘以量化比特的数量。 在该装置的微型计算机中,将每个部分区域的直方图与指示对象存在于该部分区域的至少一部分中的相应参考直方图进行比较。 基于比较结果,微型计算机确定对象是否存在于每个部分区域中。 然后,基于确定存在对象的部分区域的组合,评估对象的形状。
[标]当前申请(专利权)人: 松下电器产业株式会社

标题: Apparatus for detecting a cut in a video
摘要: Apparatus for detecting a cut in a video comprises arrangements for acquiring video images from a source, for deriving from the video images a pixel-based difference metric, for deriving from the video images a distribution-based difference metric, and for measuring video content of the video images to provide up-to-date test criteria. Arrangements are included for combining the pixel-based difference metric and the distribution-based difference metric, taking into account the up-to-date test criteria provided so as to derive a scene change candidate signal and for filtering the scene change candidate signal so as to generate a scene change frame list.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 用于检测视频中的剪辑的装置包括用于从源获取视频图像、用于从视频图像导出基于像素的差异度量、用于从视频图像导出基于分布的差异度量以及用于测量视频内容的装置。 视频图像以提供最新的测试标准。 包括用于组合基于像素的差异度量和基于分布的差异度量的布置,考虑到提供的最新测试标准以便导出场景改变候选信号和用于过滤场景改变候选信号以便 生成场景变化帧列表。

标题: Cascadable content addressable memory and system
摘要: A system for a pipeline cascaded content addressable memory CAM system for sequentially processing input data includes an input register, a CAM core, cascade logic and an output register. As the memory association functions produce matches in the CAM core, the cascade logic in parallel composites data associated with each matching CAM core. Each cascade processes a separate data input simultaneously then passes on the cumulative results to the next stage.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种用于顺序处理输入数据的流水线级联内容可寻址存储器CAM系统的系统包括输入寄存器、CAM核心、级联逻辑和输出寄存器。 由于存储器关联功能在 CAM 核心中产生匹配,并行合成与每个匹配 CAM 核心相关联的数据的级联逻辑。 每个级联同时处理一个单独的数据输入,然后将累积结果传递到下一个阶段。

标题: Neurocellular automation and optimizer
摘要: A number of cells each having a state storage mechanism and a state update mechanism are arranged in the form of a grid. The state storage mechanism includes parts opening and closing information to the remaining cells, and the state update mechanism includes open and closed update parts. The state update mechanism decides the next state on the basis of its own cell state and open states of neighboring cells.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 多个具有状态存储机制和状态更新机制的单元以网格的形式排列。 状态存储机制包括对剩余单元的部分打开和关闭信息,状态更新机制包括打开和关闭更新部分。 状态更新机制根据自己的小区状态和相邻小区的开放状态决定下一个状态。

标题: ニューラルネットワークの学習方法
摘要: PURPOSE:To converge learning within a short processing time by setting up the contents of a weight vector so as to be a representative vector of respective cluster obtained at the time of clustering a learning vector belonging to a category and executing a teacher existence learning. CONSTITUTION:Self-organization learning is executed in an optional category at first, a learning vector group belonging to the category is clustered and a weight vector relating to the category is initialized so as to become the representative vector of the obtained clusters. The initialization of weight vectors relating to all the categories including respective learning vectors constituting the learning data group has been completed, teacher existence learning is executed by using the initial values of the weight vectors, and when the value of similarity between the learning vector calculated at the time of teacher existence learning and the weight vector is included within a prescribed range and the learning is converted, the learning of the neural network is completed.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 目的:通过设置权重向量的内容,使其成为在对属于某个类别的学习向量进行聚类并执行教师存在学习时获得的各个集群的代表向量,从而在较短的处理时间内收敛学习。 组成:自组织学习首先在可选类别中执行,属于该类别的学习向量组被聚类,并且与该类别相关的权重向量被初始化,从而成为获得的集群的代表向量。 与包括构成学习数据组的各个学习向量在内的所有类别相关的权向量的初始化已经完成,使用权向量的初始值执行教师存在学习,当计算出的学习向量之间的相似度值在 教师存在学习的时间和权向量包含在规定的范围内并进行学习转换,神经网络的学习就完成了。

标题: Methods of scaling and displaying a server-provided image
摘要: A client-server system includes a client in communication with one or more servers. For example, the client server system may be for accessing the World Wide Web ("Web") in response to commands from the user. The client uses a display device to display a server-provided image to the user. The image is scaled down both horizontally and vertically, such that the entire horizontal dimension of the image is visible within the borders of the display device. Information corresponding to several Web pages may be maintained. Based on this information, images corresponding to these Web pages are displayed, each image including a reduced-size version of the corresponding Web page. A user inputted selection of one of these images is then accepted thereby accessing the corresponding Web page.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 客户端-服务器系统包括与一个或多个服务器通信的客户端。 例如,客户端服务器系统可以用于响应来自用户的命令访问万维网(“Web”)。 客户端使用显示设备向用户显示服务器提供的图像。 图像在水平和垂直方向上都按比例缩小,使得图像的整个水平尺寸在显示设备的边界内都是可见的。 可以维护对应于几个网页的信息。 基于该信息,显示与这些网页相对应的图像,每个图像包括相应网页的缩小版。 然后接受用户输入的对这些图像之一的选择,从而访问相应的网页。

标题: Tail compression of a log stream using a scratch pad of logically deleted entries
摘要: Managing a log stream of a computer system. An entry of a log stream, desired to be removed from the log stream, but not eligible for removal, is logically deleted. Logical deletion keeps the entry on the log stream and indicates that the entry can be removed from the log stream when it is eligible. When the entry is eligible, it is removed. If a desired entry remains at the tail of the log stream for a given period of time, thus not allowing the removal of one or more undesired entries, the desired entry is rewritten to the head of the log stream and deleted from the tail. Thereafter, other logically deleted entries eligible for deletion are removed from the log stream.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 管理计算机系统的日志流。 希望从日志流中删除但不符合删除条件的日志流条目在逻辑上被删除。 逻辑删除将条目保留在日志流中,并指示可以在符合条件时将条目从日志流中删除。 当条目符合条件时,将其删除。 如果所需条目在给定时间段内保留在日志流的尾部,因此不允许删除一个或多个不希望的条目,则将所需条目重写到日志流的头部并从尾部删除。 此后,从日志流中删除其他符合删除条件的逻辑删除条目。
发明人: CLARK, CARL EDWARD | GREENSPAN, STEVEN JAY | SHAH, HIREN RAMLAL
发明人地址: Poughkeepsie, NY | Hyde Park, NY | Highland, NY

标题: Currency note validator
摘要: CURRENCY NOTE VALIDATOR ABSTRACT OF THE DISCLOSURE A microprocessor controlled currency note validator includes a transport for propelling an inserted note longitudinally past an optical scanning station. Infrared and visible color reflectance readings and opacity readings are taken along several longitudinally extending tracks on the note. The microprocessor normalizes the reflectance readings to accommodate for variations in soiling and compares the normalized reflectance readings and the opacity readings against stored acceptance band data, correcting for pattern registration variations if necessary. The length of the note is also checked and a validation signal is provided if the note passes the optical tests and the length test. During the idle cycle, the microprocessor automatically adjusts the optical circuitry to compensate for component drift and dirt buildup. The microprocessor also provides a visual display of any detected malfunctions.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 纸币验证器 公开内容摘要 一种微处理器控制的纸币验证器包括用于推动插入的纸币纵向通过光学扫描站的传输装置。 红外和可见颜色反射率读数和不透明度读数是沿着钞票上的几个纵向延伸的轨道获取的。 微处理器将反射率读数归一化以适应污染的变化,并将归一化的反射率读数和不透明度读数与存储的验收带数据进行比较,必要时校正图案配准变化。 纸币的长度也会被检查,如果纸币通过了光学测试和长度测试,则会提供确认信号。 在空闲周期中,微处理器自动调整光学电路以补偿组件漂移和灰尘堆积。 微处理器还提供任何检测到的故障的可视化显示。

标题: Method for processing multi-dimensional data
摘要: In a multi-dimensional data management method in a database management system, a collection of members constituting each dimension is grouped and page indexes constituted by entries corresponding to combinations of member groups of each dimension are assigned to a memory unit. A set of member groups corresponding to input data is determined from a set of members of dimensions specifying the input data and an entry of page index corresponding to the set of member groups is obtained. When a page number is not registered in said obtained entry, a page is assigned in the memory unit and the page number of the page is registered in the entry. The input data and identification information of the data are paired to be stored in the page having the page number registered in the entry.
摘要(译)(简体中文): 一种数据库管理系统中的多维数据管理方法,将构成各个维度的成员集合进行分组,并将各个维度的成员组组合对应的表项构成的页索引分配给一个存储单元。 从指定输入数据的维度的一组成员中确定输入数据对应的一组成员组,并获得该组成员组对应的页面索引表项。 当在所述获得的条目中没有登记页码时,在存储单元中分配一个页面并且在条目中登记该页的页码。 输入数据和数据的识别信息成对存储在条目中登记有页码的页中。

标题: Discrimination circuit arrangements
資料庫之訊息鏈結傳輸方法及系統
摘要: 本發明包括一管理中心與地理上共享之複數個客戶資料庫間，資料庫更新訊息的鏈之一種方法及傳輸系統。每一訊息包括一鏈識別器(FM)及一鏈索引(FI)，允許進行該鏈中訊息的識別。若未接獲一在隨後的連接上帶有干擾的訊息，那麼後續的訊息將造成資料庫鎖定。為避免此缺點，解決之道包括在每一訊息中加入一條件區塊( CD)，其判斷該訊息是否將進行處理而無關乎該鏈的元件，或是其為該鏈元件相關之先前處理的狀況。
摘要(译)(简体中文): 本发明包括一管理中心与地理上共享之复数个客户资料库间,资料库更新讯息的链之一种方法及传输系统。 每一讯息包括一链识别器(FM)及一链索引(FI),允许进行该链中讯息的识别。 若未接获一在随后的连接上带有干扰的讯息,那么后续的讯息将造成资料库锁定。 为避免此缺点,解决之道包括在每一讯息中加入一条件区块( CD),其判断该讯息是否将进行处理而无关乎该链的元件,或是其为该链元件相关之先前处理 的状况。
